matches.title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning Infrastructure
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning Infrastructure
Company: Stripe
Location: Seattle, SF
Description: <h2>Who we are</h2> <h3>About Stripe</h3> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</span></p> <h3>About the team</h3> <p>Stripe processes over $1T in payments volume per year, which is roughly 1% of the world’s GDP. The tremendous amount of data makes Stripe one of the best places to do machine learning. The ML Infra team builds services and tools that power every step in the ML lifecycle, including data exploration, feature generation, experimentation, training, deploying, serving ML models, and building LLM applications. With the phenomenal developments happening in the field of AI, we are positioned to accelerate the adoption of AI/ML across all parts of the company by building highly scalable and reliable foundational infrastructure.</p> <h2>What you’ll do</h2> <p>You will work closely with machine learning engineers, data scientists, and product engineering teams to enable seamless end-to-end experience in building solutions across data, analytics, and AI/ML platforms. You will build the next generation of ML Infra services and major new capabilities that substantially improve ML development velocity and MLOps maturity across the company.</p> <h3>Responsibilities<span style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;</span></h3> <ul> <li>Designing and building scalable, reliable, and secure services for notebooks, ML model training, experimentation, serving, and LLM applications across multiple regions.&nbsp;</li> <li>Creating services and libraries that enable ML engineers at Stripe to seamlessly transition from experimentation to production across Stripe’s systems.&nbsp;</li> <li>Working directly with product teams and ML engineers to improve their day-to-day productivity.&nbsp;</li> <li>Taking ownership of and finding solutions for technical and product challenges by working with a diverse set of systems, processes, and technologies.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Who you are</strong></h2> <p>We’re looking for people with a strong background or interest in building successful products or systems; you’re passionate about solving business problems and making impact, you are comfortable in dealing with lots of moving pieces; and you’re comfortable learning new technologies and systems. You are comfortable working with other Stripe teams across the US and Canada.</p> <h3>Minimum requirements</h3> <ul> <li>2+ years of professional full time software development experience with a solid background on service oriented architecture and large-scale distributed systems</li> <li>Experience working through the full life cycle of software development, from talking to users, to design and implementation, to testing and deployment, to operations</li> <li>Experience working on production ML platforms, MLOps solutions, or building LLM applications</li> <li>Experience running operations for high availability, low latency systems</li> <li>Experience partnering with other teams to drive business outcomes</li> <li>A sense of pragmatism: you know when to aim for the ideal solution and when to adjust course</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred qualifications</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;</span></h3> <ul> <li>Experience building and shipping production AI agents</li> <li>Familiarity with the LLMs and LLM Frameworks</li> <li>Experience training and shipping machine learning models to production to solve critical business problems</li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong technical candidate whose skills in LLM, RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, MLOps tooling, and full-stack development align well with Stripe's ML Infrastructure role. However, the candidate's professional experience is limited to short internships (totaling ~5 months), falling short of the 2+ years of full-time professional software development required, and there is no demonstrated experience with large-scale distributed systems or high-availability production infrastructure at the scale Stripe operates. The education background is excellent, and the project work shows genuine depth in ML systems, which partially compensates for the experience gap.
strengths: Strong LLM and RAG pipeline expertise — built production-grade RAG systems using LangChain LCEL, BM25 + dense vector hybrid retrieval, FlashRank reranking, and RAGAS evaluation, directly matching Stripe's LLM application focus
Hands-on LangGraph AI agent experience — architected a 4-agent LangGraph pipeline with quality-gated routing, aligning with the preferred qualification of shipping production AI agents

Full ML lifecycle exposure — covers data pipelines, model training (YOLOv8, DBVM), deployment (Docker, FastAPI), serving (Redis caching, SSE streaming), and evaluation, matching the end-to-end MLOps requirement
Relevant tech stack overlap — FastAPI, Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis, WebSocket, REST APIs, AWS, Azure all appear in both the resume and the role's implied infrastructure needs
Academic publication — co-authored a paper at ACM MM '23, demonstrating research depth in video-language models and multimodal ML

Exceptional academic credentials — 3.9 GPA in MEng at University of Waterloo with specialization in Software Engineering, LLM, DevOps, and Performance Testing; 3.7 GPA at UBC with Dean's Honor List recognition
Multilingual programming proficiency — Python, JavaScript, C++, SQL, Java covering the breadth needed for infrastructure and ML engineering work
missing_skills: 2+ years of full-time professional software development experience — candidate has only ~5 months of internship experience, which is the most significant gap
Large-scale distributed systems design — no demonstrated experience building or operating systems at Stripe's scale (e.g., $1T payment volume, multi-region, high-availability)
MLOps platform engineering — no experience building shared ML platforms or tooling for other engineers (feature stores, experiment tracking, model registries like MLflow/Kubeflow/Vertex AI)
High-availability and low-latency systems operations — no evidence of on-call, SLO management, or reliability engineering experience
Service-oriented architecture at scale — no microservices or service mesh experience (e.g., Kubernetes, Istio, gRPC) mentioned
Data infrastructure tooling — no experience with Spark, Flink, or large-scale data pipelines beyond small-scale projects; Kafka is listed but not elaborated on
Ruby/Go/Java backend services — Stripe's backend is primarily Ruby and Go; candidate's backend experience is Python/Node.js focused
interview_talking_points: Lead with the production RAG system at Disanji — emphasize the architectural decisions (hybrid retrieval, reranking, streaming), the quantified 35% precision improvement, and the RAGAS evaluation pipeline as evidence of production ML thinking

Highlight the LangGraph multi-agent project as direct evidence for the preferred qualification of 'building and shipping production AI agents' — explain the quality-gated routing design and how it mirrors real MLOps reliability patterns

Frame the ACM MM '23 publication and DBVM research as experience collaborating cross-functionally (with Nanjing University researchers) to ship a complex ML system end-to-end, mirroring Stripe's cross-team collaboration requirement

Address the experience gap proactively — position the MEng at Waterloo (graduating Oct 2025) as structured, intensive engineering training with specializations in DevOps and Performance Testing, and emphasize the density and quality of project work over raw years

Connect Docker Compose deployment, Redis semantic caching, and FastAPI SSE streaming from the internship to Stripe's need for scalable, low-latency ML serving infrastructure — show you understand production reliability concerns

Mention AWS and Azure familiarity in the context of multi-region ML infrastructure, and express readiness to learn Stripe's specific cloud and internal tooling stack quickly given your track record of picking up new technologies

matches.title: Software Engineer, Full Stack
matches.location: San Francisco, CA • New York, NY • United States
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Figma is growing our team of passionate creatives and builders on a mission to make design accessible to all. Figma’s platform helps teams bring ideas to life—whether you're brainstorming, creating a prototype, translating designs into code, or iterating with AI. From idea to product, Figma empowers teams to streamline workflows, move faster, and work together in real time from anywhere in the world. If you're excited to shape the future of design and collaboration, join us!</p></div><div class="section page-centered"> <div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">As a Full Stack Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to build both the products and the platforms that empower millions of users—from startups to Fortune 500 companies—to create and collaborate in real time. Whether you’re designing core features, improving developer workflows, scaling enterprise infrastructure, or launching entirely new products, your work will directly shape the future of how teams bring ideas to life. You’ll take on complex technical challenges across the stack, building intuitive user experiences, optimizing performance in real-time collaborative systems, and designing secure, reliable, and scalable systems to support Figma’s rapid growth and global expansion.</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">&nbsp;</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">Our engineers are highly cross-functional, partnering closely with Product, Design, Research, and Data to deliver best-in-class experiences. If you’re excited to work across the stack, push the boundaries of product development, and help scale the systems that power Figma, we’d love for you to join us.</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">&nbsp;</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">This opportunity applies to openings at varying seniority levels across our teams, including but not limited to Figma Editor, FigJam, Figma Slides, Figma Sites, Figma Buzz, Growth &amp; Monetization, Internal Tools, and our cross-product Foundations team. We’ll discuss more specifics about open roles during the interview process.</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">&nbsp;</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">This is a full-time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">&nbsp;</div> <strong data-stringify-type="bold">What you’ll do at Figma:</strong> <ul class="p-rich_text_list p-rich_text_list__bullet p-rich_text_list--nested" data-stringify-type="unordered-list" data-list-tree="true" data-indent="0" data-border="0"> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Design, build, and ship high-quality features across the stack, from polished front-end experiences to scalable back-end systems</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Contribute to both new product development and improvements to established products, balancing user experience craft with performance and architecture quality</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Own projects end-to-end — ideation, technical design, implementation, testing, launch, and iteration</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Collaborate with cross-functional partners in Product, Design, Research, and Data to shape product direction and strategy</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Operate, monitor, and continuously improve the systems you build, with a strong focus on reliability, security, and scalability</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Mentor teammates, contribute to team culture, and share knowledge through code reviews, design critiques, and pairing</li> </ul> <strong data-stringify-type="bold">We’d love to hear from you if you have:</strong> <ul class="p-rich_text_list p-rich_text_list__bullet p-rich_text_list--nested" data-stringify-type="unordered-list" data-list-tree="true" data-indent="0" data-border="0"> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Proven experience in shipping and maintaining full-stack applications in production</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Strong proficiency in modern front-end frameworks (e.g., React/TypeScript) and back-end technologies (e.g., Ruby, Python, Go, C++, PostgreSQL)</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">A product mindset, with the ability to translate user needs into scalable technical solutions</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with experience working effectively across cross-functional teams</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Passion for engineering craft and building polished, maintainable, and scalable systems</li> </ul> <strong data-stringify-type="bold">While not required, it’s an added plus if you also have:</strong> <ul class="p-rich_text_list p-rich_text_list__bullet p-rich_text_list--nested" data-stringify-type="unordered-list" data-list-tree="true" data-indent="0" data-border="0"> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Experience leading large-scale projects or launching 0→1 products</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Familiarity with C++ and WebAssembly in user-facing applications</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Background in areas such as growth engineering, developer tooling, billing and payments infrastructure, or extensibility platforms (plugins, APIs, widgets)</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Exposure to technologies like Stripe, Salesforce, Snowflake, SCIM, SAML, or experimentation and observability tooling</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">A passion for mentoring peers and helping shape engineering culture</li> </ul> <div class="section page-centered"> <div> <div>At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</div> </div> </div> </div> </div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">Pay Transparency Disclosure</span></strong></p> <p>If based in Figma’s San Francisco or New York hub offices, this role has the annual base salary range stated below.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>Job level and actual compensation will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process (including skills and prior relevant experience, potential impact, and scope of role), market demands, and specific work location. The listed range is a guideline, and the range for this role may be modified. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, the pay range is localized according to employee work location by a factor of between 80% and 100% of range. Please discuss your specific work location with your recruiter for more information.&nbsp;</p> <p>Figma offers equity to employees, as well a competitive package of additional benefits, including health, dental &amp; vision, retirement with company contribution, parental leave &amp; reproductive or family planning support, mental health &amp; wellness benefits, generous PTO, company recharge days, a learning &amp; development stipend, a work from home stipend, and cell phone reimbursement.&nbsp; Figma also offers sales incentive pay for most sales roles and an annual bonus plan for eligible non-sales roles. Figma’s compensation and benefits are subject to change and may be modified in the future.</p></div><div class="title">Annual Base Salary Range:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$149,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$350,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p>At Figma we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our product and our community to flourish. Figma is an <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC_KnowYourRights_screen_reader_10_20.pdf">equal opportunity workplace</a> - we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity/expression, veteran status<strong>, </strong>or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.</p> <p>We will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to apply for a role, participate in the interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation, please reach out to <a href="mailto:accommodations-ext@figma.com">accommodations-ext@figma.com</a>. These modifications enable an individual with a disability to have an equal opportunity not only to get a job, but successfully perform their job tasks to the same extent as people without disabilities.&nbsp;</p> <p>Examples of accommodations include but are not limited to:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Holding interviews in an accessible location</li> <li>Enabling closed captioning on video conferencing</li> <li>Ensuring all written communication be compatible with screen readers</li> <li>Changing the mode or format of interviews&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>To ensure the integrity of our hiring process and facilitate a more personal connection, we require all candidates keep their cameras on during video interviews. Additionally, if hired you will be required to attend in person onboarding.</p> <p>By applying for this job, the candidate acknowledges and agrees that any personal data contained in their application or supporting materials will be processed in accordance with <a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Figma's Candidate Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi is a strong technical candidate with solid full-stack fundamentals — React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker, and Python all align well with Figma's stated stack preferences. However, the resume skews heavily toward AI/ML and RAG pipelines rather than the collaborative, real-time product engineering that defines Figma's core work, and professional experience is limited to short internships with no sustained production ownership. The education credentials are excellent (UWaterloo MEng + UBC BASc, both with high GPAs), and the role's remote-US eligibility is compatible with the candidate's preferences, though the salary ceiling of $200K falls below Figma's upper range for senior levels.
strengths: Strong React/TypeScript proficiency demonstrated in multiple projects, directly matching Figma's front-end stack
Python and FastAPI backend experience aligns with Figma's preferred back-end languages
PostgreSQL and Docker usage shows production-aware infrastructure thinking
WebSocket experience is relevant to Figma's real-time collaborative systems
C++ listed as a language skill, which is a bonus qualification for Figma's editor-layer work
High academic pedigree — UWaterloo MEng (GPA 3.9) + UBC BASc (GPA 3.7) with Dean's Honor List
End-to-end project ownership demonstrated (ideation → deployment → testing) in the Resume Generator project
Published ACM MM '23 paper shows research depth and ability to tackle complex technical problems
80%+ test coverage on personal project signals engineering craft and quality mindset
Remote-US work eligibility matches the job's remote-friendly policy
missing_skills: Ruby or Go — Figma lists these as preferred back-end languages and the candidate has neither
WebAssembly (Wasm) — a bonus skill for Figma's editor layer that is absent from the resume
Real-time collaborative systems experience (CRDTs, OT, multiplayer state sync) — core to Figma's product
Sustained production ownership — all professional experience is short-term internships (≤3 months each)
Enterprise/platform engineering exposure (SCIM, SAML, Stripe, Salesforce, Snowflake) — listed as Figma bonuses
Experimentation and observability tooling (feature flags, A/B testing, monitoring dashboards)
Mentorship and cross-functional collaboration at scale — limited evidence in resume
Growth engineering or billing/payments infrastructure background
interview_talking_points: Lead with the AI Agent Resume Generator project — it showcases full-stack ownership (FastAPI + React/TypeScript + PostgreSQL + Docker + WebSocket + 80% test coverage) end-to-end, which mirrors Figma's expectation of owning features across the stack
Highlight WebSocket usage and relate it directly to Figma's real-time collaboration challenges — express genuine curiosity about CRDTs/OT and frame it as an area you're actively learning
Leverage the C++ skill and Computer Graphics specialization to show affinity for Figma's editor-layer work (rendering, canvas performance), which is a rare and valued combination at Figma
Discuss the RAG system internship in terms of scalable system design (hybrid retrieval, Redis caching, Docker Compose deployment) rather than just AI — this demonstrates backend architecture thinking

Reference the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate the ability to tackle ambiguous, research-grade problems and communicate findings — relevant for Figma's cross-functional collaboration with Research teams

Address the internship-only experience gap proactively: emphasize the depth and production-grade quality of personal projects, and express eagerness to grow into sustained ownership at Figma under their 'Grow as you go' value

Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</span></p> <h3>About the team</h3> <p>Stripe processes over $1T in payments volume per year, which is roughly 1% of the world’s GDP. matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong technical candidate whose skills in LLM applications, RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, MLOps tooling, and full-stack development align well with Stripe's ML Infrastructure role. However, the role explicitly requires 2+ years of professional software development experience and hands-on production ML platform/MLOps work, whereas Ruiqi's professional experience totals only ~5 months of internships — a meaningful gap for a mid-level position at a company of Stripe's scale. The education credentials are excellent (UWaterloo MEng + UBC BASc), and the location/salary preferences are compatible with a Toronto-based or remote Canadian role.

Excellent academic pedigree: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specialization in Software Engineering, LLM, DevOps, and Performance Testing — top-tier Canadian institution
Cloud and distributed systems familiarity: AWS, Azure, Kafka, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis listed in skills — foundational for large-scale distributed ML infra

MLOps platform engineering: no experience building or maintaining ML platforms (e.g., feature stores, experiment tracking systems like MLflow/Kubeflow, model registries) at a company level
Service-oriented architecture: limited evidence of designing microservices or SOA beyond individual project APIs
Production operations experience: no on-call, SRE, or production incident management experience for critical systems
Ruby/Go/Java backend services: Stripe's backend is primarily Ruby and Go; candidate's backend experience is Python/Node.js focused
Cross-team collaboration at scale: internship experience is limited; no evidence of driving outcomes across multiple engineering teams in a large org
interview_talking_points: Lead with the RAG production system at Disanji: emphasize the end-to-end ownership — architecture decisions (hybrid retrieval), deployment (Docker + FastAPI), evaluation pipeline (RAGAS 0.84 recall), and the 35% precision improvement. This directly maps to Stripe's ML serving and LLM application work.

Highlight the LangGraph AI agent project: frame it as a production-minded system with quality-gated routing, dual-layer evaluation (ATS + LLM self-critique), and 80%+ test coverage — demonstrating engineering rigor beyond a prototype

Address the experience gap proactively: position the MEng at Waterloo (graduating Oct 2025) as equivalent to additional professional experience, and emphasize the breadth of production-oriented projects that mirror real-world ML infra challenges

Connect Kafka and Redis knowledge to Stripe's scale: mention familiarity with event streaming (Kafka) and caching (Redis) as building blocks for high-throughput ML feature pipelines and low-latency model serving

Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication: use it to demonstrate ability to work on novel, ambiguous ML problems and collaborate with research teams — relevant to Stripe's cross-functional ML engineer partnerships

Emphasize full software lifecycle ownership: across projects, show examples of talking to users (requirements), designing, implementing, testing (80%+ coverage), and deploying — directly matching Stripe's minimum requirement language

matches.title: Software Engineer, New Grad
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, New Grad
Company: Stripe
Location: Toronto
Description: <h2><strong>Who we are</strong></h2> <h3><strong>About Stripe</strong></h3> <p>Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</p> <h3><strong>About the team</strong></h3> <p>Stripe offers an interesting middle ground between joining a small startup and going to work for a multinational company. We have systems and processes optimized for early-career professionals. You will be in an environment that prizes rigor, discipline, and reliability—from our products, from our ways of working, and from our colleagues. You will learn how the best teams put together extremely reliable systems, and you will be responsible for operating these systems, with adequate backup when things get tough.</p> <h2><strong>What you’ll do</strong></h2> <p>As a company, we believe in end-to-end ownership of projects. For any given project, we have one person on point. While they don't necessarily have to do all the work themselves, it's their job to make sure all the work gets done. We launch betas and prototypes as early as we can. This helps ensure that we're building what users actually want. We contribute back to the community, often by building things we think are cool and by releasing <a href="https://github.com/stripe">open-source software</a>.</p> <h3><strong>Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Work on cross-functional projects, directly collaborating with other engineers</li> <li>Give meaningful feedback on code reviews and technical designs</li> <li>Ensure that the systems your team operates continue running well and can scale to meet the needs of our users</li> <li>Build the skills to own a project from beginning to end, learning project management and technical leadership skills</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Who you are</strong></h2> <p>We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.</p> <h3><strong>Minimum requirements</strong></h3> <ul> <li>A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science or a directly related field, obtained by summer 2026, or equivalent work experience</li> <li>New grad candidates should have no more than 18 months of professional experience (excluding internship experience)</li> <li>Some experience and familiarity with programming, either through side projects or classwork. We work mostly in Java, Ruby, JavaScript, Scala, and Go. We believe new programming languages can be learned if the fundamentals and general knowledge are present</li> <li>Experience from either previous internships or working collaboratively on multi-person coding projects (in a university or professional setting)</li> <li>Ability to learn unfamiliar systems and form an understanding of those systems, through independent research and working with a mentor and subject matter experts</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred qualifications</strong></h3> <ul> <li>One or more areas of specialized knowledge balanced with general skills and knowledge, such as knowing more frontend technologies and, at a high level, how a service handles an HTTP request</li> <li>Experience in code review practices, and an understanding of how to safely update production systems</li> <li>Familiarity with navigating and managing work in large code bases</li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with a 3.9 GPA Master's from University of Waterloo and solid internship experience, aligning well with Stripe's New Grad profile. Their full-stack development background (FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker) and collaborative project experience directly satisfy Stripe's minimum requirements, though their tech stack skews heavily toward Python/AI-ML rather than Stripe's core languages (Java, Ruby, Scala, Go). The Toronto job location is compatible with the candidate's Canadian base, but the role is listed as on-site in Toronto while the candidate prefers remote/hybrid, introducing a moderate friction point.
strengths: Strong academic credentials: M.Eng from University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) and B.A.Sc from UBC (GPA 3.7) with Dean's Honor List recognition — directly satisfies Stripe's degree requirement
Meets the New Grad eligibility window: graduating Oct 2025, with internship-only professional experience well within the 18-month cap
Demonstrated full-stack development across multiple projects: FastAPI, React/TypeScript, WebSocket, PostgreSQL, Docker — shows end-to-end ownership Stripe values
Internship experience at two tech companies (Disanji Technology, GuoLing Technology) plus a research role, satisfying Stripe's collaborative/professional coding experience requirement
JavaScript proficiency overlaps with one of Stripe's primary languages; Java is also listed in the candidate's skills
Published ACM MM '23 paper demonstrates ability to work on complex, multi-person technical projects with rigorous standards
80%+ test coverage on personal projects signals awareness of production-quality engineering and reliability
Experience with Docker, Redis, and distributed systems (Kafka listed in skills) shows familiarity with scalable infrastructure concepts Stripe cares about
missing_skills: Ruby — Stripe's primary backend language; no mention on resume
Scala — used at Stripe; not present in candidate's skill set
Go — used at Stripe; not present in candidate's skill set
Fintech/payments domain knowledge — no financial systems or payment processing experience
Explicit code review experience — preferred qualification not evidenced on resume
Large codebase navigation experience — preferred qualification not demonstrated
Production system operations/on-call experience — Stripe emphasizes reliability and operating live systems
interview_talking_points: Highlight language adaptability: emphasize that you've learned Python, JavaScript, C++, Java, and Verilog across different contexts, and frame Ruby/Go/Scala as the next natural step — Stripe explicitly states 'new programming languages can be learned if fundamentals are present'

Lead with end-to-end ownership examples: the RAG system at Disanji (architecture → deployment → evaluation) and the AI Agent Resume Generator project both demonstrate the full project lifecycle Stripe prizes
Emphasize production-grade engineering habits: Docker Compose deployments, Redis caching, 80%+ test coverage, and RAGAS evaluation pipelines show you think beyond just making things work
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate rigor, collaboration, and the ability to deliver in a high-standards environment — directly mirrors Stripe's culture of discipline and reliability
Address the location/work-style question proactively: confirm willingness to work from the Toronto office if required, or clarify hybrid expectations early in the process
Quantify impact in every answer: 35% retrieval precision improvement, 91% mAP@50, 0.84 context recall — Stripe values measurable outcomes

Connect AI/ML depth to Stripe's scale challenges: discuss how RAG pipelines and evaluation frameworks relate to building reliable, scalable systems — bridging your specialty to Stripe's infrastructure mindset

matches.title: Software Engineer, Intern (Summer)
matches.location: San Francisco, Seattle, New York City
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Intern (Summer)
Company: Stripe
Location: San Francisco, Seattle, New York City
Description: <h2><strong>Who we are</strong></h2> <h3><strong>About Stripe</strong></h3> <p>Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</p> <h3><strong>About the team</strong></h3> <p>Our internship program will provide an opportunity to work on meaningful products that will grow the GDP of the internet. Through the internship, you will work with many systems and technologies, gain experience in systems design and testing, and have opportunities to present your work to your team and the wider org. Each intern has a dedicated intern manager, and every project is part of the team’s roadmap and will directly help Stripe’s mission.</p> <h2><strong>What you’ll do</strong></h2> <p>Every internship at Stripe centers around a real, legitimate project that our customers urgently need, touching many parts of our operations and stack. We will support you in shipping it. Yes, you will actually ship it. Some recent projects include rebuilding our statistics aggregation service, building new service discovery systems, and many user facing projects like making it easy to understand error messages on Stripe Checkout. As a Stripe intern, you'll be tackling important projects to increase global commerce, while working alongside exceptional people who insist on doing their best work. You’ll learn from people with high standards who are great at inspiring others to do more and go further. We value technical and personal growth, and see our internship program as a vehicle to foster both.</p> <h3><strong>Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Write software that will be used in production, and has meaningful impact to Stripe</li> <li>Give and receive technical feedback through code reviews or design discussions</li> <li>Collaborate with other engineers and cross-functional stakeholders to proactively seek and incorporate feedback</li> <li>Learn quickly by asking great questions, by working with your intern manager and teammates effectively, and by communicating the status of your work clearly</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Who you are</strong></h2> <p>We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.</p> <h3><strong>Minimum requirements</strong></h3> <ul> <li>A strong fundamental understanding of computer science through pursuit of a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, math, or a related discipline</li> <li>Some experience and familiarity with programming, either through side projects or classwork. We work mostly in Java, Ruby, JavaScript, Scala, and Go. We believe new programming languages can be learned if the fundamentals and general knowledge are present</li> <li>Experience from previous internships or other multi-person projects, including open source contributions, that demonstrate evaluating and receiving feedback from mentors, peers, and stakeholders</li> <li>Ability to learn unfamiliar systems and form an understanding of those systems, through independent research and working with a mentor and subject matter experts</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred qualifications</strong></h3> <ul> <li>At least 2 years of university education, or equivalent work experience</li> <li>One or more areas of specialized knowledge balanced with general skills and knowledge, such as knowing more frontend technologies and, at a high level, how a service handles an HTTP request</li> <li>Understanding and some experience writing high quality pull requests, with good test coverage, and working knowledge to complete projects with minimal defects</li> <li>Familiarity with navigating and managing your work in new code bases, with multiple languages</li> <li>Ability to write clearly to explain your work to stakeholders, team members, and other Stripes</li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with a 3.9 GPA Master's in ECE from Waterloo and a solid CS/CE foundation from UBC, which aligns well with Stripe's educational requirements. His hands-on internship experience with production-grade systems (RAG pipelines, Docker, FastAPI, REST APIs) and multi-person collaborative projects demonstrates the practical engineering maturity Stripe seeks in an intern. However, the role is an on-site internship in San Francisco, Seattle, or New York City — none of which align with the candidate's remote/hybrid preference or Canadian base — and Stripe's core languages (Ruby, Scala, Go) are absent from the candidate's skill set, which is a notable gap despite the role's openness to language learning.
strengths: Strong academic credentials: 3.9 GPA MEng at University of Waterloo with specialization in Software Engineering and Full-stack Development
Proven production-grade internship experience: built and deployed a RAG system at Disanji Technology with measurable outcomes (35% retrieval precision improvement, 0.84 RAGAS context recall)
Proficiency in JavaScript and Java, two of Stripe's primary working languages
Full-stack project experience with FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, and WebSocket — demonstrating breadth across the stack
Experience with code quality practices: 80%+ test coverage in personal projects, multi-person collaborative work
Published research (ACM MM '23) demonstrating ability to work in team settings and communicate technical work to stakeholders
Familiarity with multiple codebases and languages (Python, JavaScript, C++, Java, SQL) showing adaptability to new systems
Experience with systems design: architected multi-agent LangGraph pipelines and end-to-end data pipelines
missing_skills: Ruby — one of Stripe's primary backend languages, not present on resume
Scala — used at Stripe, not listed in candidate's skill set
Go (Golang) — used at Stripe, not listed in candidate's skill set
Financial infrastructure or payments domain knowledge — no fintech or payments-related experience
Systems-level programming experience (e.g., service discovery, statistics aggregation) relevant to Stripe's internship project examples
Open source contributions — not mentioned on resume, listed as a preferred signal by Stripe
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production deployment at Disanji: emphasize that the RAG system was shipped to production with Docker Compose, FastAPI, and Redis — directly mirroring Stripe's expectation that interns 'actually ship it'

Emphasize language learning adaptability: point out that you've worked across Python, JavaScript, C++, Java, and SQL, and draw on Stripe's own statement that 'new programming languages can be learned if the fundamentals are present' to address the Ruby/Scala/Go gap
Showcase the AI Agent Resume Generator project's 80%+ test coverage and multi-layer evaluation system as evidence of writing high-quality, production-ready code with minimal defects

Reference the ACM MM '23 publication and Research Assistant role at Nanjing University to demonstrate experience giving and receiving technical feedback in a collaborative, multi-stakeholder environment
Address the location situation proactively: clarify willingness to relocate to San Francisco, Seattle, or New York City for the internship duration if applicable, since the role is explicitly on-site

Use the RAGAS evaluation pipeline (0.84 context recall, 35% precision improvement) as a concrete example of forming a deep understanding of an unfamiliar system through independent research — a key Stripe requirement

matches.title: Software Engineer, Growth
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Growth 
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Available Locations: </strong>Hybrid - Austin, Atlanta, Denver, Washington D.C., Toronto</p> <h4><strong>About the Department</strong></h4> <p>The Growth Engineering team is responsible for architecting and delivering world-class, cohesive product experiences that drive user activation, adoption, and scale for millions of Cloudflare self-service customers. We focus on continuous, thoughtful optimization of the customer journey, from initial acquisition and onboarding through product adoption. Our core mission is to empower users to get what they need faster and to provide a platform that enables the next level of growth for Cloudflare by allowing users to adopt and expand their product usage through fantastic in-product experiences.</p> <h4><strong>About the Role</strong></h4> <p>We are looking for an experienced, product-minded front-end or full-stack engineer to join our Product Growth team. This role is a hybrid of product engineering and growth focus, requiring deep technical expertise in building large-scale, high-performance applications, a strong foundation in system design, and a keen eye for crafting delightful user experiences. The ideal candidate will translate product vision into polished, performant code that directly impacts key business metrics. You must care deeply not only about the quality of your code and the system’s architecture but also about the end-to-end customer experience and enhancing developer productivity. You will be instrumental in evolving our self-service properties to better serve our customers and drive measurable growth.</p> <p>We are also strong believers in dog-fooding our own products. From cache configuration to Cloudflare Access, Cloudflare Workers, and Zaraz, these are all tools in our engineer's tool belt, so it is a plus if you have been a customer of ours, even as a free user.</p> <p>The Software Engineer, Growth will be responsible for the following:</p> <ul> <li>Technical delivery of customer-facing UI experiences intended to accelerate user acquisition, engagement, and retention through data-informed strategies.</li> <li>Collaborate closely with product, design, and stakeholders to define key outcome measurements, roadmaps, and feature specifications.</li> <li>Execute engineering projects across the product lifecycle, from conceptualization through production deployment.</li> <li>Architect scalable frontend solutions and build features end-to-end (front-end, back-end, IaC, system design, debugging, and testing).</li> <li>Contribute to increasing developer productivity, improving code quality, and enhancing application performance and security across our core properties.</li> <li>Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure all product experiences are compliant and adhere to our trust and safety principles.</li> </ul> <h4><strong>Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience</strong></h4> <ul> <li>Comfort with building reusable SDKs and high-quality UI components with TypeScript/JavaScript required. Comfort/familiarity with other languages (Go/Rust/Python) a plus.</li> <li>Experience building with high-scale serverless systems like Cloudflare Workers, AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, etc.</li> <li>Full stack expertise for backend-for-frontend and other similar applications to help keep the team moving with minimal cross-team dependencies is a big plus</li> <li>Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and modern JavaScript/TypeScript ecosystems.</li> <li>Experience in design and development of interfaces and features that optimize for business KPIs, including user onboarding, feature adoption, and overall product experience.</li> <li>Experience working with and/or designing RESTful APIs.</li> <li>Familiarity with commercial analytics systems (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, etc) a plus.</li> <li>Strong foundation in system design, balancing engineering excellence with visual aesthetics, and an ability to translate design vision into polished, performant code.</li> <li>Experience with building tools and frameworks to improve developer productivity.</li> <li>Experience with the responsible use of modern AI and LLM augmented workflows.</li> <li>Desire to work in a fast-paced environment.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Compensation</strong></p> <p>Compensation may be adjusted depending on work location.</p> <ul> <li>For Colorado-based hires: Estimated annual salary of $136<span </ul> <p><strong>Equity</strong></p> <p>This role is eligible to participate in Cloudflare’s equity plan.</p> <p><strong>Benefits</strong></p> <p>Cloudflare offers a complete package of benefits and programs to support you and your family.&nbsp; Our benefits programs can help you pay health care expenses, support caregiving, build capital for the future and make life a little easier and fun!&nbsp; The below is a description of our benefits for employees in the United States, and benefits may vary for employees based outside the U.S.</p> <p><strong>Health &amp; Welfare Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Medical/Rx Insurance</li> <li>Dental Insurance</li> <li>Vision Insurance</li> <li>Flexible Spending Accounts</li> <li>Commuter Spending Accounts</li> <li>Fertility &amp; Family Forming Benefits</li> <li>On-demand mental health support and Employee Assistance Program</li> <li>Global Travel Medical Insurance</li> </ul> <p><strong>Financial Benefits</strong></p> <ul> <li>Short and Long Term Disability Insurance</li> <li>Life &amp; Accident Insurance</li> <li>401(k) Retirement Savings Plan</li> <li>Employee Stock Participation Plan</li> </ul> <p><strong>Time Off</strong></p> <ul> <li>Flexible paid time off covering vacation and sick leave</li> <li>Leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical, and bereavement leave</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. matches.title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning
matches.location: San Francisco, CA • New York, NY • United States
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Figma is growing our team of passionate creatives and builders on a mission to make design accessible to all. Figma’s platform helps teams bring ideas to life—whether you're brainstorming, creating a prototype, translating designs into code, or iterating with AI. From idea to product, Figma empowers teams to streamline workflows, move faster, and work together in real time from anywhere in the world. If you're excited to shape the future of design and collaboration, join us!</p></div><div class="section page-centered"> <div> <p>Figma is seeking a versatile and experienced Machine Learning / AI Engineer to join our growing AI team, working at the intersection of applied machine learning, infrastructure, and product innovation. Whether you’re building intelligent search systems, crafting scalable data pipelines, or enhancing AI-powered creativity tools, your work will drive user productivity, shape new product experiences, and advance the state of AI at Figma.</p> <p>You’ll collaborate closely with engineers, researchers, designers, and product managers across multiple teams to deliver high-quality ML-driven features and infrastructure. This is a high-impact, cross-functional role where you’ll shape both foundational systems and user-facing capabilities.</p> <p>This is a full time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.</p> <h3><strong>What you’ll do at Figma:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Design, build, and productionize ML models for Search, Discovery, Ranking, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and generative AI features.</li> <li>Build and maintain scalable data pipelines to collect high-quality training and evaluation datasets, including annotation systems and human-in-the-loop workflows.</li> <li>Collaborate with AI researchers to iterate on datasets, evaluation metrics, and model architectures to improve quality and relevance.</li> <li>Work with product engineers to define and deliver impactful AI features across Figma’s platform.</li> <li>Partner with infrastructure engineers to develop and optimize systems for training, inference, monitoring, and deployment.</li> <li>Explore new ideas at the edge of what’s technically possible and help shape the long-term AI vision at Figma.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>We’d love to hear from you If you have:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>5+ years of industry experience in software engineering, with 3+ years focused on applied machine learning or AI.</li> <li>Strong experience with end-to-end ML model development, including training, evaluation, deployment, and monitoring.</li> <li>Proficiency in Python and familiarity with ML libraries like PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Spark MLlib, or XGBoost.</li> <li>Experience designing and building scalable data and annotation pipelines, as well as evaluation systems for AI model quality.</li> <li>Experience mentoring or leading others and contributing to a culture of technical excellence and innovation.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>While not required, It’s an added plus if you also have:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Familiarity with search relevance, ranking, NLP, or RAG systems.</li> <li>Experience with AI infrastructure and MLOps, including observability, CI/CD, and automation for ML workflows.</li> <li>Experience working on creative or design-focused ML applications.</li> <li>Knowledge of additional languages such as C++ or Go is a plus, but not required.</li> <li>A product mindset with the ability to tie technical work to user outcomes and business impact.</li> <li>Strong collaboration and communication skills, especially when working across functions (engineering, product, research).</li> </ul> <div class="section page-centered"> <div> <div>At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</div> </div> </div> </div> </div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">Pay Transparency Disclosure</span></strong></p> <p>If based in Figma’s San Francisco or New York hub offices, this role has the annual base salary range stated below.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>Job level and actual compensation will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process (including skills and prior relevant experience, potential impact, and scope of role), market demands, and specific work location. The listed range is a guideline, and the range for this role may be modified. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, the pay range is localized according to employee work location by a factor of between 80% and 100% of range. Please discuss your specific work location with your recruiter for more information.&nbsp;</p> <p>Figma offers equity to employees, as well a competitive package of additional benefits, including health, dental &amp; vision, retirement with company contribution, parental leave &amp; reproductive or family planning support, mental health &amp; wellness benefits, generous PTO, company recharge days, a learning &amp; development stipend, a work from home stipend, and cell phone reimbursement.&nbsp; Figma also offers sales incentive pay for most sales roles and an annual bonus plan for eligible non-sales roles. Figma’s compensation and benefits are subject to change and may be modified in the future.</p></div><div class="title">Annual Base Salary Range:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$149,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$350,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p>At Figma we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our product and our community to flourish. Figma is an <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC_KnowYourRights_screen_reader_10_20.pdf">equal opportunity workplace</a> - we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity/expression, veteran status<strong>, </strong>or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.</p> <p>We will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to apply for a role, participate in the interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation, please reach out to <a href="mailto:accommodations-ext@figma.com">accommodations-ext@figma.com</a>. These modifications enable an individual with a disability to have an equal opportunity not only to get a job, but successfully perform their job tasks to the same extent as people without disabilities.&nbsp;</p> <p>Examples of accommodations include but are not limited to:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Holding interviews in an accessible location</li> <li>Enabling closed captioning on video conferencing</li> <li>Ensuring all written communication be compatible with screen readers</li> <li>Changing the mode or format of interviews&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>To ensure the integrity of our hiring process and facilitate a more personal connection, we require all candidates keep their cameras on during video interviews. Additionally, if hired you will be required to attend in person onboarding.</p> <p>By applying for this job, the candidate acknowledges and agrees that any personal data contained in their application or supporting materials will be processed in accordance with <a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Figma's Candidate Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

Address the experience gap proactively by framing the MEng at Waterloo (graduating Oct 2025) as applied, project-intensive training equivalent to industry exposure, and highlight the ACM MM '23 publication as evidence of research-to-production capability
Highlight the cross-functional nature of your work — collaborating across ML, backend, and frontend — to demonstrate readiness for Figma's cross-functional team structure
Mention familiarity with AWS/Azure and Docker Compose deployments to signal awareness of ML infrastructure concerns, and express eagerness to deepen MLOps skills (CI/CD, monitoring) on the job
Tie your computer vision and multimodal AI background (YOLO, DBVM, drone footage detection) to Figma's creative/design AI use cases, showing product mindset around visual understanding

matches.title: Software Engineer, Trust
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Community You Will Join: </strong></span></p> <p><strong>Identity Team</strong>&nbsp;<br>Join our team at Airbnb and play a crucial role in enhancing transparency and trust within our global community! We pride ourselves on using identity verification as a powerful tool to build trust among our users. This team works with design, product, privacy/legal, operations, and other engineering teams to verify users are who they say they are and build trust on the platform. If you're passionate about developing cutting-edge solutions that drive positive impacts on a global scale, join us on this exciting journey to foster a safer and more trustworthy Airbnb community!</p> <p><br>What problems are we solving on Identity?</p> <p><strong>Business Verification&nbsp;</strong><br>Presently, our platform focuses on individual verification, but we recognize the importance of extending this process to businesses as well. That's where you come in! As part of our team, you'll be at the forefront of creating the next generation of business verification. Your innovative work will empower new user segments, such as businesses, co-travelers, and co-hosts, to showcase their legitimacy to end-users. By introducing business verification, you'll significantly contribute to establishing trust and enhancing security for guests during their booking experiences.</p> <p><br><strong>Identity Verification Expansion&nbsp;</strong><br>Presently, our platform focuses on individual verification, but we understand the importance of broadening this process. As part of our team, you'll be at the forefront of creating the next generation of identity verification. Your innovative work will empower new user segments, enabling them to showcase their legitimacy to end-users. By introducing these enhancements, you'll significantly contribute to establishing trust and enhancing security for guests during their booking experiences.</p> <p><br><strong>Identity Misuse </strong>&nbsp;<br>As part of our team, your primary mission will be to enhance our existing systems by identifying and incorporating new user signals to make sure we can stand behind every identity verification. You'll have the exciting opportunity to collaborate directly with our operations team, gaining valuable insights into emerging trends and facilitating the dynamic refinement of our detection strategies.Your expertise will be instrumental in reducing fraud and preventing safety incidents, ensuring that our platform remains a safe and trustworthy environment for all users. If you're driven by the challenge of combating online misconduct and creating a positive impact on user experiences, this is the perfect opportunity to make a real difference!"</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>Work on systems at scale with large data sets, build and continuously improve applications for Airbnb product, business and operational use cases.</li> <li>Work collaboratively with cross-functional partners including software engineers, product managers, operations and data scientists, identify opportunities for business impact, understand, refine, and prioritize requirements for engineering systems, drive engineering decisions, and quantify impact.</li> <li>Hands-on prototype, develop, productionize, and test solutions and defenses to existing and emerging fraud trends.</li> </ul> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>4+ years industry experience</li> <li>Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree, preferably in CS, or equivalent experience</li> <li>Experience in building and scaling high-quality and high-traffic products (or systems).</li> <li>Ability to evaluate technical approaches and design product solutions to solve real-world problems.</li> <li>Ability to drive alignment, manage projects and effectively collaborate with stakeholders.</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> . If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$160,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$180,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with a relevant dual-degree background and solid full-stack and AI/ML skills, but falls significantly short of Airbnb's 4+ year industry experience requirement — with only ~4 months of relevant internship experience. The role is focused on trust, identity verification, fraud detection, and large-scale systems, none of which appear directly in the candidate's resume, making the skills alignment moderate at best despite a technically capable profile.

Full-stack development proficiency demonstrated across multiple projects (FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, WebSocket)
