matches.title: Software Engineer, Money Movement
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Money Movement 
Company: Stripe
Location: London
Description: <p><strong>Note:</strong> If you are an intern, new grad, or staff applicant, please do not apply using this link and visit our jobs page for those specific postings.</p> <h2>Who we are</h2> <h3>About Stripe</h3> <p>Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.</p> <h3>About the Organization</h3> <p>Exact team matching for one of the subteams within the following orgs will begin during final stages. If you have a strong preference for a specific org, please flag this to your recruiter during your recruiter screen.</p> <h4>Money as a Service (MaaS)</h4> <p>Money as a Service is a new org within Stripe which is all about making money programmable: funding, FX’ing, sending, spending. The Money as a Service (MaaS) teams build the APIs and product experience that allow Stripe users to perform these money management capabilities on Stripe globally.</p> <p>You can see some of the recent products we’ve launched:</p> <ul> <li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d2B-58Hf9GU">Multicurrency balances</a></li> <li><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZSLx-lJGXeE">Global Payouts</a></li> </ul> <h4>Payments and Risk</h4> <p>The Payments organization focuses on developing products and platforms that enable users to accept payments from customers efficiently. This includes building APIs for processing payments, enabling regional, non-card payment options, and extending Stripe's capabilities to make it easy for businesses to accept in-person payments. Optimized Checkout and Link teams work to create best-in-class checkout experiences that enhance customer satisfaction and drive merchant conversion rates. The Risk Engineering team develops products that minimize financial and regulatory risks while ensuring a seamless user experience, thereby safeguarding Stripe’s brand and financial stability.</p> <h2>What you’ll do</h2> <p>We’re looking for backend, frontend leaning fullstack, and fullstack engineers who are interested in building software services and platforms that impact thousands of employees and millions of Stripe users, regardless of whether they’re an end user, developer, or partner.</p> <h3>Responsibilities</h3> <ul> <li>Scope, design, build, and maintain APIs, user experiences, services, and large-scale systems that reliably and efficiently handle billions of money movement requests.</li> <li>Debug and solve critical production issues across services and multiple levels of the stack.</li> <li>Mentor engineers to help them grow.</li> <li>Meet directly with our users to help shape product changes.</li> <li>Collaborate with stakeholders across the company to build new features at large-scale, while improving internal engineering standards, tooling, and processes.</li> <li>Collaborate effectively in a distributed and hybrid team, maintaining open communication and strong connections with colleagues.</li> </ul> <h2>Who you are</h2> <p>We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.</p> <h3>Minimum requirements</h3> <ul> <li>2-12+ years of industry software engineering experience (does not include internships nor include co-ops).</li> <li>Strong coding skills in any programming language (we understand new languages can be learned on the job so our interview process is language agnostic).</li> <li>Strong collaboration skills, can work across workstreams within your team and contribute to your peers’ success.</li> <li>Have the ability to thrive on a high level of autonomy, responsibility, and think of yourself as entrepreneurial.</li> <li>Interest in working as a generalist across varying technologies and stacks to solve problems and delight both internal and external users.</li> </ul> <h3>Preferred Qualifications</h3> <ul> <li>Experience building user interfaces.</li> <li>Experience with user research or interaction design.</li> <li>Experience designing and building APIs.</li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a technically strong candidate with a stellar academic background (UWaterloo MEng, UBC BASc, both with high GPAs) and solid full-stack and backend skills that align well with Stripe's generalist engineering expectations. However, the candidate's industry experience is limited to short internships and research roles — falling short of Stripe's minimum 2-year full-time industry requirement — and critically, the role is based in London while the candidate's preferred locations are Remote/US/Canada, creating a significant location mismatch. The candidate's AI/ML-heavy profile is impressive but not directly aligned with Stripe's fintech/payments/money-movement domain.
strengths: Strong full-stack engineering skills: FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, WebSocket — directly matching Stripe's backend and fullstack needs
Demonstrated API design and development experience (FastAPI REST APIs, streaming with SSE/WebSocket)
High academic pedigree: UWaterloo MEng (GPA 3.9) and UBC BASc (GPA 3.7) with Dean's Honor List recognition
Hands-on experience with production-grade system architecture (RAG pipeline, Docker Compose deployments, Redis caching)
Polyglot programmer: Python, JavaScript, C++, Java, SQL — aligns with Stripe's language-agnostic interview process
Experience building user-facing frontends (React) satisfying the preferred UI qualification
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates ability to work on complex, high-impact technical problems
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and distributed systems tooling (Kafka, Redis)
missing_skills: Fintech or payments domain knowledge (no experience with payment processing, FX, money movement, or financial APIs)
Insufficient full-time industry experience — Stripe requires 2–12+ years excluding internships/co-ops; candidate only has internship-level experience
No demonstrated experience with large-scale, high-throughput distributed systems handling billions of transactions
No experience with compliance, regulatory, or risk engineering contexts relevant to Stripe's Payments & Risk org
No evidence of mentoring engineers or cross-functional stakeholder collaboration at scale
No UK/EU work authorization mentioned, which is critical for a London-based role
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production-grade RAG system at Disanji: emphasize system design decisions (hybrid retrieval, Redis caching, Docker Compose), scalability thinking, and measurable outcomes (35% precision improvement, 0.84 context recall) — this mirrors the large-scale API/service design Stripe values

Emphasize the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a full-stack showcase: LangGraph orchestration, FastAPI backend, React/TypeScript frontend, PostgreSQL, WebSocket, and 80%+ test coverage — directly maps to Stripe's fullstack and API-building preferred qualifications

Frame the generalist engineering identity: across projects, you've worked across ML pipelines, backend APIs, frontend UIs, DevOps (Docker), and databases — position this as alignment with Stripe's 'interest in working as a generalist across varying technologies' requirement

Address the experience gap proactively: emphasize the depth and production-readiness of your internship and project work, and your rapid learning trajectory (MEng specialization breadth, ACM publication)
Acknowledge the London location and clarify work authorization status or willingness to relocate — this is a critical blocker that must be addressed upfront with the recruiter

matches.title: Software Engineer, AI Platforms
matches.location: San Francisco, CA • New York, NY • United States
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Figma is growing our team of passionate creatives and builders on a mission to make design accessible to all. Figma’s platform helps teams bring ideas to life—whether you're brainstorming, creating a prototype, translating designs into code, or iterating with AI. From idea to product, Figma empowers teams to streamline workflows, move faster, and work together in real time from anywhere in the world. If you're excited to shape the future of design and collaboration, join us!</p></div><div class="section page-centered"> <div class="section page-centered"> <p>Our AI Platform teams build the core frameworks and systems that support AI features across Figma, ranging from infrastructure for training cutting-edge models to platforms for developing agentic product functionality.</p> <p>We’re looking for engineers with a background in platform engineering or machine learning to strengthen our foundational AI systems and frameworks. As a member of our AI Platform teams, you’ll play a critical role in developing cutting-edge AI models and new product functionality, while improving the technical quality, performance, and reliability of our AI features. You’ll work alongside developers across the company and combine industry best practices with a first-principle approach to design and build the platforms that power Figma’s design and collaboration products.</p> <p>We’re hiring across several teams:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Modeling Platform:</strong>&nbsp;The Modeling Platform team develops infrastructure for training, evaluating, deploying, and serving the AI models used across Figma. Engineers on this team partner with our AI Research team to accelerate the end-to-end model development lifecycle, from experimentation to production.</li> <li><strong>Agent Platform:</strong>&nbsp;The Agent Platform team builds the frameworks and systems powering agentic AI features throughout Figma’s products. Engineers on this team partner with our product and infrastructure teams to unlock new AI capabilities, improve the development velocity of AI engineers, and ensure all of our AI features are reliable, performant, and high-quality.</li> <li><strong>Extensibility:</strong>&nbsp;The Extensibility team is responsible for our plugin, widget, and REST APIs that enable developers to build their own Figma integrations. Engineers on this team also partner with our product teams to develop our recently-launched MCP offerings and server platforms that integrate Figma into the wider AI ecosystem.</li> </ul> <p>This is a full time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.</p> <h4><strong>What you’ll do at Figma:</strong></h4> <ul> <li>Support end-to-end AI feature development by designing, building, and maintaining systems that are scalable, reliable, and performant</li> <li>Collaborate with product, research, and infrastructure engineers across AI initiatives</li> <li>Help shape our platform strategy, roadmaps, and engineering best practices throughout the organization</li> <li>Debug and resolve complex production issues that span services and layers of the stack</li> <li>Mentor engineers and foster a culture of collaboration, inclusivity, and technical excellence</li> </ul> <h4><strong>We'd love to hear from you if you have:</strong></h4> <ul> <li>5+ years of software engineering experience, especially in backend or infrastructure engineering</li> <li>3+ years of experience in one or more of: AI, search infrastructure, or developer platforms</li> <li>Proficiency with TypeScript, Python, or Ruby</li> <li>Strong system-design skills and a track record of architecting resilient production systems</li> <li>Excellent communication skills, with experience collaborating across teams and mentoring others</li> </ul> <h4><strong>While not required, It’s an added plus if you also have:</strong></h4> <ul> <li>Prior experience building AI infrastructure at scale, whether for model training or serving platforms</li> <li>Experience improving large-scale, shared developer platforms to enhance reliability and developer velocity</li> <li>A proven track record of leading technical strategy and delivering complex, multi-team projects</li> </ul> <div class="section page-centered"> <div> <div>At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</div> </div> </div> </div> </div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">Pay Transparency Disclosure</span></strong></p> <p>If based in Figma’s San Francisco or New York hub offices, this role has the annual base salary range stated below.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>Job level and actual compensation will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process (including skills and prior relevant experience, potential impact, and scope of role), market demands, and specific work location. The listed range is a guideline, and the range for this role may be modified. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, the pay range is localized according to employee work location by a factor of between 80% and 100% of range. Please discuss your specific work location with your recruiter for more information.&nbsp;</p> <p>Figma offers equity to employees, as well a competitive package of additional benefits, including health, dental &amp; vision, retirement with company contribution, parental leave &amp; reproductive or family planning support, mental health &amp; wellness benefits, generous PTO, company recharge days, a learning &amp; development stipend, a work from home stipend, and cell phone reimbursement.&nbsp; Figma also offers sales incentive pay for most sales roles and an annual bonus plan for eligible non-sales roles. Figma’s compensation and benefits are subject to change and may be modified in the future.</p></div><div class="title">Annual Base Salary Range:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$149,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$350,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p>At Figma we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our product and our community to flourish. Figma is an <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC_KnowYourRights_screen_reader_10_20.pdf">equal opportunity workplace</a> - we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity/expression, veteran status<strong>, </strong>or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.</p> <p>We will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to apply for a role, participate in the interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation, please reach out to <a href="mailto:accommodations-ext@figma.com">accommodations-ext@figma.com</a>. These modifications enable an individual with a disability to have an equal opportunity not only to get a job, but successfully perform their job tasks to the same extent as people without disabilities.&nbsp;</p> <p>Examples of accommodations include but are not limited to:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Holding interviews in an accessible location</li> <li>Enabling closed captioning on video conferencing</li> <li>Ensuring all written communication be compatible with screen readers</li> <li>Changing the mode or format of interviews&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>To ensure the integrity of our hiring process and facilitate a more personal connection, we require all candidates keep their cameras on during video interviews. Additionally, if hired you will be required to attend in person onboarding.</p> <p>By applying for this job, the candidate acknowledges and agrees that any personal data contained in their application or supporting materials will be processed in accordance with <a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Figma's Candidate Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with highly relevant AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, agentic systems, and full-stack development — that align well with Figma's Agent Platform and Extensibility teams. However, the role explicitly requires 5+ years of software engineering experience and 3+ years in AI/infrastructure, whereas Ruiqi is a recent graduate (completing their Master's in Oct 2025) with only ~4 months of relevant internship experience, creating a significant experience gap. The technical skill set is genuinely impressive for a mid-level candidate, but the seniority bar Figma is targeting is considerably higher than what the resume currently demonstrates.
strengths: Strong hands-on RAG and LLM pipeline experience (LangChain LCEL, LangGraph, ChromaDB, BGE-M3, Milvus, FlashRank) directly relevant to Figma's Agent Platform team
Proficiency in Python and TypeScript/JavaScript — two of Figma's preferred languages
Demonstrated ability to architect end-to-end AI systems with production-grade tooling (FastAPI, Docker, Redis, PostgreSQL, WebSocket)
Academic publication at ACM MM '23 signals research depth in multimodal AI and video-language models
Full-stack breadth (React, FastAPI, REST APIs, WebSocket) aligns with Figma's Extensibility team needs
Exceptional academic credentials: 3.9 GPA MEng at University of Waterloo + 3.7 GPA BASc at UBC with Dean's Honor List
Experience with automated evaluation pipelines (RAGAS) and quality-gated agentic routing shows platform-engineering mindset
Cloud exposure (AWS, Azure) and containerization (Docker Compose) relevant to infrastructure work
Remote work preference aligns with Figma's remote-friendly US policy
missing_skills: 5+ years of professional software engineering experience (candidate has ~4 months of internship experience)
3+ years of dedicated AI/search infrastructure or developer platform experience
Backend/infrastructure engineering at scale — no evidence of large-scale distributed systems ownership
Experience mentoring engineers or leading cross-team technical initiatives
Search infrastructure experience (e.g., Elasticsearch, large-scale vector search at production scale)
Ruby proficiency (one of Figma's listed languages)
Model training infrastructure (e.g., GPU cluster orchestration, MLflow, Kubeflow, or similar MLOps platforms)
MCP (Model Context Protocol) or plugin/API platform development experience
Track record of shaping platform strategy and roadmaps across an organization
interview_talking_points: Lead with the production RAG system at Disanji: highlight the 35% retrieval precision improvement, hybrid BM25+dense retrieval architecture, and RAGAS evaluation pipeline — this maps directly to Figma's Agent Platform infrastructure work

Showcase the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a concrete example of multi-agent LangGraph orchestration with quality-gated routing, drawing a direct parallel to Figma's agentic product functionality goals
Emphasize the full-stack, end-to-end ownership mindset: from model evaluation to FastAPI backend to React frontend to Docker deployment — demonstrating the platform-engineering breadth Figma values
Reference the ACM MM '23 publication to establish credibility in multimodal AI research, positioning yourself as someone who bridges research and production engineering

Address the experience gap proactively: frame your accelerated trajectory (research publication, production deployments, and complex system design all before completing your Master's) as evidence of outsized impact relative to years of experience

Highlight alignment with Figma's 'Grow as you go' value — explicitly mentioned in the job posting — and express enthusiasm for scaling your platform engineering skills in a collaborative, cross-functional environment
Connect your Extensibility-relevant skills (REST APIs, WebSocket, plugin-style integrations) to Figma's MCP and plugin platform work if interviewing for that sub-team

matches.title: Software Engineer, Workers Builds & Automation
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Workers Builds & Automation
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><h3><strong>Position Location: Austin, TX&nbsp;</strong></h3> <h3 id="Jobdescription:SeniorSystemsEngineerWorkersOnboarding-AbouttheDepartment"><strong>About the Department</strong></h3> <p class="diff-block-context">Emerging Technologies &amp; Incubation (ETI) is where new and bold products are built and released within Cloudflare. Rather than being constrained by the structures which make Cloudflare a massively successful business, we are able to leverage them to deliver entirely new tools and products to our customers. Cloudflare’s edge and network make it possible to solve problems at massive scale and efficiency which would be impossible for almost any other organization.</p> <p class="diff-block-context">The Workers Builds &amp; Automation team aims to provide the best in class experience for Workers users to move fast and quickly bring ideas to life.</p> <h3 id="Jobdescription:SoftwareEngineerWorkersOnboarding&amp;Integrations-Whatyouwilldo" class="diff-block-target"><strong><span id="changed-diff-5" class="diff-html-changed">What you will do</span></strong></h3> <p class="diff-block-context">As a member of the Workers team, you will collaborate with Engineers, Designers, and Product Managers to design, build and support large scale, customer facing systems that push the boundaries of what is possible at Cloudflare's edge computing platform. You will drive projects from idea to release, delivering solutions at all layers of the software stack to empower the Cloudflare customers. You can expect to interact with a variety of languages and technologies including, but not limited to Typescript/JavaScript, Go, SQL and the Cloudflare Developer Platform.</p> <h3 id="Jobdescription:SoftwareEngineerWorkersOnboarding&amp;Integrations-RequisiteSkills" class="diff-block-target diff-block-context"><strong><span id="changed-diff-6" class="diff-html-changed">Requisite Skills</span></strong></h3> <ul class="diff-block-target diff-block-context"> <li><span id="removed-diff-0" class="diff-html-removed">2-5 years professional software engineering experience</span></li> <li><span class="diff-html-removed">Experience using </span><span id="added-diff-0" class="diff-html-added">Cloudflare Workers or Pages</span></li> <li>Must have strong experience with Javascript and Typescript</li> <li>Experience working in frontend frameworks such as React</li> <li>Experience with SQL and common relational database systems such as PostgreSQL</li> <li>Experience with Kubernetes or similar deployment tools</li> <li>Product mindset and comfortable talking to customers and partners</li> <li>Experience delivering projects end-to-end – gathering requirements, writing technical specifications, implementing, testing, and releasing</li> <li>Comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously</li> <li>Able to participate in on an on-call shift</li> </ul> <h3 id="Jobdescription:SoftwareEngineerWorkersOnboarding&amp;Integrations-BonusPoints" class="diff-block-target diff-block-context"><strong><span id="changed-diff-7" class="diff-html-changed">Bonus Points</span></strong></h3> <ul class="diff-block-target diff-block-context"> <li><span class="diff-html-added">Experience with Go</span></li> <li>Experience with metrics and observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana</li> <li>Experience scaling systems to meet increasing performance and usability demands</li> <li>Knowledge of OAuth and building Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>

matches.title: Software Engineer, AI Product
matches.location: San Francisco, CA • New York, NY • United States
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Figma is growing our team of passionate creatives and builders on a mission to make design accessible to all. Figma’s platform helps teams bring ideas to life—whether you're brainstorming, creating a prototype, translating designs into code, or iterating with AI. From idea to product, Figma empowers teams to streamline workflows, move faster, and work together in real time from anywhere in the world. If you're excited to shape the future of design and collaboration, join us!</p></div><div class="section page-centered"> <div> <p>As Figma’s customer base continues to expand and diversify, and new technological advancements in AI and generative design emerge, the opportunity for AI experience engineering is greater than ever. You’ll collaborate closely with a cutting edge AI Research team and your work will help raise the ceiling of what’s possible for designers and lower the floor of who can design. We are seeking an accomplished and experienced AI Product Engineer who has built generative AI products to join our team and lead our AI efforts from inception to implementation. Join us in molding the future of AI at Figma!</p> <p>This is a full-time role that can be undertaken from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.</p> <h3><strong>What you'll do at Figma:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Lead the development of early-phase AI systems to enhance user experience and develop systems to measure and improve AI performance and relevance</li> <li>Direct the future of AI at Figma in collaboration with cross-functional teams of innovative software engineers, product managers, and data scientists</li> <li>Break down open-ended AI problems into engineering strategies utilizing machine learning, data analysis, and experimental design</li> <li>Provide mentorship and promote best practices in data and AI while cultivating a collaborative and inclusive team culture</li> <li>Contribute to the growth of the team by improving the hiring process and recruiting outstanding AI talent</li> </ul> <h3><strong>We’d love to hear from you if you have:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience of Software Engineering, with 1 or more years of developing generative AI products</li> <li>Comfort in prototyping and pathfinding new opportunities that led to successful 0→1 projects</li> <li>Proven experience implementing the full lifecycle of an early-phase AI development, from ideating on which models to use through productionizing and maintaining them</li> <li>Experience in developing deep product and business knowledge to connect abstract modeling and analysis tasks with business value</li> </ul> <h3><strong>While it’s not required, it’s an added plus if you also have:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Demonstrated expertise in AI indexing, retrieval systems, personalization, and/or natural language processing</li> <li>Proven track record of planning a multi-year roadmap in which shorter-term projects ladder up to the long-term vision</li> <li>A relevant advanced degree (Masters or PhD) in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, or a related field</li> <li>A growth mindset and experience investing in the learning, development, belonging, and impact of your peers, ex. mentoring/aligning senior engineers across organizations</li> </ul> <div class="section page-centered"> <div> <div>At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</div> </div> </div> </div> </div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">Pay Transparency Disclosure</span></strong></p> <p>If based in Figma’s San Francisco or New York hub offices, this role has the annual base salary range stated below.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>Job level and actual compensation will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process (including skills and prior relevant experience, potential impact, and scope of role), market demands, and specific work location. The listed range is a guideline, and the range for this role may be modified. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, the pay range is localized according to employee work location by a factor of between 80% and 100% of range. Please discuss your specific work location with your recruiter for more information.&nbsp;</p> <p>Figma offers equity to employees, as well a competitive package of additional benefits, including health, dental &amp; vision, retirement with company contribution, parental leave &amp; reproductive or family planning support, mental health &amp; wellness benefits, generous PTO, company recharge days, a learning &amp; development stipend, a work from home stipend, and cell phone reimbursement.&nbsp; Figma also offers sales incentive pay for most sales roles and an annual bonus plan for eligible non-sales roles. Figma’s compensation and benefits are subject to change and may be modified in the future.</p></div><div class="title">Annual Base Salary Range:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$149,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$350,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p>At Figma we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our product and our community to flourish. Figma is an <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC_KnowYourRights_screen_reader_10_20.pdf">equal opportunity workplace</a> - we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity/expression, veteran status<strong>, </strong>or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.</p> <p>We will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to apply for a role, participate in the interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation, please reach out to <a href="mailto:accommodations-ext@figma.com">accommodations-ext@figma.com</a>. These modifications enable an individual with a disability to have an equal opportunity not only to get a job, but successfully perform their job tasks to the same extent as people without disabilities.&nbsp;</p> <p>Examples of accommodations include but are not limited to:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Holding interviews in an accessible location</li> <li>Enabling closed captioning on video conferencing</li> <li>Ensuring all written communication be compatible with screen readers</li> <li>Changing the mode or format of interviews&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>To ensure the integrity of our hiring process and facilitate a more personal connection, we require all candidates keep their cameras on during video interviews. Additionally, if hired you will be required to attend in person onboarding.</p> <p>By applying for this job, the candidate acknowledges and agrees that any personal data contained in their application or supporting materials will be processed in accordance with <a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Figma's Candidate Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong technical candidate with impressive AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG systems, LLMs, LangChain, and full-stack development — that align well with Figma's AI Product Engineer role. However, the role explicitly requires 5+ years of software engineering experience with 1+ years in generative AI products, and Ruiqi is a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree with only ~1.5 years of internship-level experience, creating a significant experience gap. The candidate's AI expertise and academic credentials are genuinely compelling, but the seniority mismatch (the role also involves mentorship, roadmap planning, and cross-functional leadership) is the primary limiting factor for this match.
strengths: Strong hands-on RAG and LLM engineering experience — built a production-grade RAG pipeline with hybrid retrieval, reranking, and streaming at Disanji Technology Institute
Demonstrated generative AI product development with the AI Agent-powered Resume & Cover Letter Generator (LangGraph, ChromaDB, BGE-M3, full-stack)
Relevant advanced degree in progress: Master of Engineering at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specialization in LLM, DevOps, and Full-stack Development — a listed 'plus' in the job description
Published AI research at ACM MM '23, demonstrating depth in video-language models and multimodal understanding
Full-stack proficiency (FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, WebSocket) enables end-to-end AI product ownership
Experience with AI evaluation pipelines (RAGAS, ATS keyword scoring, LLM self-critique) aligns with Figma's need to measure and improve AI performance
Location preferences (Remote, United States) are compatible with Figma's remote-friendly US hiring policy
Familiarity with AI indexing and retrieval systems (BM25, dense/sparse vectors, Milvus, ChromaDB) matches a key 'nice-to-have' in the job posting
missing_skills: 5+ years of total software engineering experience — candidate has ~1–1.5 years of internship-level experience
Leadership and mentorship experience — role requires guiding senior engineers and promoting best practices across organizations
Multi-year AI product roadmap planning and execution
Experience productionizing and maintaining AI models at scale in a commercial product environment (0→1 to sustained growth)
Deep product and business acumen — connecting AI modeling to measurable business value in a B2B SaaS context
Experience with generative design, creative tooling, or design-adjacent AI products (Figma's core domain)
Recruiting and hiring process contribution experience
Cross-functional stakeholder management with PMs and data scientists at a senior level
interview_talking_points: Lead with the RAG system built at Disanji: emphasize the production-grade nature, the 35% retrieval precision improvement, and the automated RAGAS evaluation pipeline — this directly mirrors Figma's need to 'measure and improve AI performance'

Showcase the AI Agent Resume Generator as a 0→1 generative AI product: highlight the 4-agent LangGraph architecture, dual-layer evaluation, and full-stack ownership from ideation to deployment with 80%+ test coverage
Highlight the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate research depth and ability to work alongside cutting-edge AI research teams, which is central to this role at Figma
Frame the Master's degree specialization (LLM, Computer Vision, DevOps, Full-stack) as accelerated, structured preparation for exactly this type of AI product engineering role
Address the experience gap proactively: emphasize the density and quality of AI work delivered in a short time, and express eagerness to grow into the leadership and mentorship dimensions of the role

Connect computer vision and graphics background (YOLO, SAHI, Computer Graphics coursework) to Figma's design-centric AI domain — visual understanding is directly relevant to a design tool's AI features

matches.title: Software Engineer, Workers Observability
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Workers Observability
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Available Locations: Austin, TX | Lisbon, Portugal | London, UK</strong></p> <p><strong>Role Summary</strong></p> <p>Workers Observability (WOBS) Team provides a growing suite of tools to monitor, troubleshoot and optimize applications on the Cloudflare Developer platform. These tools increasingly work across Cloudflare products to provide complete visibility into user applications. We aim to make these tools not only best-in-class but also frictionless and intuitive to use. All this within the context of Cloudflare's scale and globally distributed infrastructure.</p> <p>Team members help design and ship core software features across the observability stack - including the frontend customer experience, integrations with other Cloudflare primitives, and our internal data stores and ingestion pipelines. You will own code across the development lifecycle from design to release including QA, incident management, and performance optimization.&nbsp;</p> <p>The Systems Engineer role is a full-stack position which requires extensive cross-functional collaboration. On a given day you might incorporate frontend feedback from a customer, run a Clickhouse query to diagnose a data ingestion bug, and propose a better tracing integration with another product on the Workers platform.</p> <p><strong>Role Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li><strong>Customer Focus:</strong> Be responsive to customer escalations, bug reports, and product feedback, and participate in pager duty for our production systems.</li> <li><strong>Software Development:</strong> Efficiently and reliably deliver high-quality software that meets the performance requirements of Cloudflare’s systems.</li> <li><strong>Troubleshooting:</strong> Address complex and subtle issues on our platform, which may require debugging across multiple systems, languages, and datastores.</li> <li><strong>Communication:</strong> Maintain clear written communication across a range of platforms as part of a globally distributed team (from US West Coast to UK) and across a range of different engineering and support teams.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Expertise: Success in this role will depend on becoming an expert not just on the observability platform, but on the Cloudflare Developer Platform as a whole.&nbsp;<br></strong></p> <p><strong>Role Requirements (Must-Have Skills)</strong></p> <p><strong>Must-Have Skills</strong></p> <ul> <li>Strong proficiency in at least one programming language, preferably a typed language (e.g. Go, TypeScript, Rust) as well as SQL</li> <li>Experience building high-volume distributed systems using cloud primitives (AWS, GCP, CF), including queues, key-value stores, relational databases, blob storage, and serverless compute</li> <li>Experience troubleshooting distributed data systems including working with logs and data stores.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Nice-to-Have Skills</strong></p> <p>The following are nice-to-haves:</p> <ul> <li>Working with lower level languages like Rust or C++</li> <li>Building frontend application in Typescript and React</li> <li>Building applications on the Cloudflare platform</li> <li>Working with observability platforms and tools</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi is a strong full-stack developer with solid Python, React/TypeScript, FastAPI, Docker, PostgreSQL, and AWS experience that partially aligns with Cloudflare's needs. However, the role is heavily focused on distributed systems observability, high-volume data ingestion pipelines, and typed systems languages (Go, TypeScript, Rust) at massive scale — areas where Ruiqi's background is primarily in AI/ML and RAG pipelines rather than infrastructure-level observability tooling. The location is also a significant concern, as the role is hybrid in Austin TX, Lisbon, or London, while the candidate prefers remote/Canada.
strengths: Strong full-stack proficiency with React/TypeScript and FastAPI, directly matching the nice-to-have frontend TypeScript/React requirement
Hands-on experience with distributed data stores including PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis, and ChromaDB — relevant to the distributed data systems requirement
AWS and Azure cloud experience aligns with the cloud primitives requirement
Docker and containerization experience demonstrates DevOps maturity needed for production systems
C++ proficiency satisfies the lower-level language nice-to-have
High academic credentials: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with Dean's Honor List from UBC
Production-grade system deployment experience (RAG system with FastAPI + Redis + Docker Compose) shows ability to ship real systems
WebSocket and streaming (SSE) experience demonstrates understanding of real-time data pipelines
SQL proficiency listed explicitly, matching a core must-have requirement
missing_skills: Go or Rust proficiency — the role strongly prefers typed systems languages like Go or Rust, neither of which appear on the resume
Observability platform experience (e.g., distributed tracing, OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, Grafana, Jaeger) — no mention of observability tooling
ClickHouse or columnar analytics database experience — the job description explicitly mentions ClickHouse for data diagnostics
High-volume distributed systems at internet scale — candidate's experience is with smaller-scale ML pipelines, not millions-of-requests infrastructure
Message queue systems (Kafka is listed but no demonstrated production use at scale; no mention of cloud-native queues like SQS, Pub/Sub)
Incident management / pager duty / on-call production operations experience
Serverless compute platforms (Cloudflare Workers, AWS Lambda) — no demonstrated experience
Blob storage systems (S3, R2, GCS) — not mentioned in resume
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production RAG system deployment at Disanji: emphasize the end-to-end pipeline architecture (FastAPI + Redis caching + Docker Compose + SSE streaming) as evidence of shipping real, production-grade distributed systems

Emphasize the automated evaluation pipeline (RAGAS, 0.84 context recall) as a form of observability and quality monitoring — draw a direct parallel to the WOBS team's mission of monitoring and troubleshooting applications
Leverage the React/TypeScript and full-stack project experience (Resume Generator with 80%+ test coverage) to address the nice-to-have frontend TypeScript/React requirement explicitly
Discuss AWS and Azure experience in the context of cloud primitives, and connect Redis semantic caching and PostgreSQL usage to distributed key-value and relational database experience
Address the Rust/Go gap proactively — mention C++ background and willingness/ability to ramp up on Go or Rust quickly given strong typed-language foundations
Bring up the hybrid location constraint early — clarify openness to relocation to Austin, TX or remote arrangement if possible, to avoid late-stage misalignment

Reference the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to work on complex technical problems and communicate findings clearly across teams — relevant to the communication requirement for a globally distributed team

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer - AI Code Gen - Agent Engineer
matches.description:
Title: Senior Software Engineer - AI Code Gen - Agent Engineer
Company: Datadog
Location: New York, New York, USA
Description: <p>We’re a new team building AI-assisted tools to make Datadog developers more effective, by autonomously generating tests, fixing bugs, and improving performance.</p> <p>We’re looking for a product-minded generalist to help us quickly define and ship products that make all Datadog customers 10x developers.</p> <p><em>At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.</em></p> <h4>What You’ll Do:</h4> <ul> <li>Work closely with our users, designers, PMs, and data scientists on cutting edge and delightful LLM-based agents.</li> <li>Work on prompts, evals, and agent tools for working with code, and on the engineering to productionize these systems and integrate them with Datadog products.</li> <li>Prototype and see what works well in the real world, iterate closely with our users, and then ship.</li> <li>Follow the latest research on LLM prompting, agents, and code editing.</li> <li>Work with other Datadog teams to expand capabilities, for example integrating with the Datadog IDE extensions to deliver a CoPilot-like assistant, or Dynamic Instrumentation to collect more runtime data from production and pre-production environments.</li> </ul> <h4>Who You Are:</h4> <ul> <li>You’re a backend engineer with at least 5 years of professional experience (Go, Java, Python) who values code simplicity and performance. You’ve shipped software that uses LLMs to production.</li> <li>You are passionate about Generative AI and its ability to help software engineers be more productive.</li> <li>You have relevant experience with Large Language Models, large-scale systems and data sets, machine learning, or adjacent fields.</li> <li>You are a great community ambassador and can drive hard technical conversations towards a pragmatic solution.</li> <li>You want to work in a fast, high-growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers.</li> <li>You have experience writing developer tools (such as IDEs, static code analysis tools, or compilers).</li> <li>You have demonstrated ability to use AI coding tools in day-to-day workflows and validate, critique, and refine AI-generated output</li> <li>You’re motivated to push the boundaries of how AI can improve software engineering best practices and contribute to building AI-enabled products</li> </ul> <p><em>Datadog values people from all walks of life. matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong technical candidate with a solid academic background (UWaterloo MEng, UBC BASc) and relevant full-stack, AI/ML, and backend engineering skills that partially align with Datadog's engineering culture. However, the role is a Senior Software Engineer position requiring significant production-scale systems experience, whereas the candidate is mid-level with only internship-grade professional experience and no demonstrated expertise in observability, distributed systems, or high-throughput data pipelines at Datadog's scale (trillions of data points/day). The location is a critical mismatch — the candidate prefers remote/US/Canada, while all listed positions are in Europe (France/Spain), and Datadog operates hybrid in those offices.
strengths: Strong academic credentials: MEng from University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) and BASc from UBC (GPA 3.7, Dean's Honor List) — directly satisfies the BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field requirement
Demonstrated AI/ML proficiency with hands-on LLM, RAG, LangChain, and LangGraph experience — aligns with Datadog's emphasis on AI-augmented engineering workflows
Full-stack engineering capability across Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, FastAPI, React, PostgreSQL, Docker, Redis — shows versatility valued in a fast-moving startup environment
Experience building and deploying production-grade systems (RAG pipeline with Docker Compose, FastAPI, Redis caching, SSE streaming) demonstrates end-to-end ownership
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and DevOps tooling (Docker, Git) relevant to Datadog's infrastructure-focused product
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates ability to work on complex, novel technical problems
Experience with Kafka listed in skills — relevant to Datadog's high-throughput data ingestion architecture
80%+ test coverage on personal projects shows commitment to code quality and engineering best practices
missing_skills: Observability & monitoring tooling experience (metrics, tracing, APM, logs — Datadog's core domain)
Distributed systems design at massive scale (trillions of events/day) — no evidence of this in resume
Senior-level production incident response and on-call ownership experience
Go or Java backend experience at scale (common at Datadog; candidate lists Java but no production use)
Feature flag / progressive rollout systems experience
Performance profiling and scalability bottleneck resolution in production services
Experience with time-series databases or metrics storage systems
Cloud-native infrastructure (Kubernetes, Terraform, or similar) — not listed on resume
interview_talking_points: Highlight the RAG pipeline project at Disanji: emphasize the architectural decisions (hybrid retrieval, reranking, Redis semantic caching) and quantified outcomes (35% precision improvement, 0.84 RAGAS context recall) to demonstrate production-grade systems thinking

Leverage the AI/LLM expertise heavily — Datadog explicitly calls out AI tool proficiency as a differentiator; discuss how you've used AI coding tools, validated AI-generated output, and built AI-enabled products (the Resume Generator agent pipeline is a strong example)

Address the seniority gap proactively: frame your rapid skill acquisition, academic depth (MEng specializing in DevOps + Performance Testing), and research publication as evidence of above-average growth trajectory for your years of experience

Connect your Kafka and Docker/cloud experience to Datadog's scale challenges — show you understand the problem domain of high-throughput data pipelines even if you haven't operated at Datadog's exact scale
Discuss your performance testing specialization (listed in MEng coursework) as directly relevant to Datadog's need to 'solve scaling bottlenecks in critical services'
Be transparent about location: clarify your openness to relocation to Europe or ask about any remote exceptions, as this is the single biggest practical barrier to this application
