matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong alignment with the AI/ML technical domain — particularly in LLM, RAG pipelines, LangChain, and evaluation frameworks — which are directly relevant to Datadog's ML Observability team. However, this is a Staff-level role requiring deep distributed systems expertise, production-scale observability platform experience, and senior leadership/mentorship capabilities that a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree cannot credibly demonstrate. The location and salary expectations also present meaningful gaps, as the role is hybrid in Boston/New York and pays $234K–$300K, well above the candidate's stated $100K–$200K ceiling (suggesting a seniority mismatch rather than a compensation win).
strengths: Hands-on RAG pipeline development using LangChain LCEL, BM25 + dense vector hybrid retrieval, and FlashRank reranking — directly relevant to LLM observability tooling
Built automated LLM evaluation pipelines using RAGAS (0.84 context recall), demonstrating familiarity with LLM evaluation techniques the role explicitly requires
Full-stack production experience: FastAPI, React/TypeScript, WebSocket, PostgreSQL, Docker, Redis — solid backend and deployment foundation
Published ACM MM '23 paper on video-language models, showing research depth in AI/ML
Strong academic credentials: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specialization in LLM, DevOps, and Full-stack Development
Experience with multi-agent LangGraph pipelines and quality-gated routing, relevant to tracing and debugging LLM workflows
Familiarity with vector databases (ChromaDB, Milvus) and semantic caching (Redis), relevant to scalable AI infrastructure
missing_skills: Distributed systems design and scalable backend architecture at production/enterprise scale (e.g., Kafka-based pipelines, large-scale data ingestion)
Observability platform experience (e.g., Datadog, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Grafana, tracing/metrics/logging infrastructure)
Staff-level engineering leadership: mentoring engineers, driving architecture decisions across teams, influencing product roadmap
Drift detection and model monitoring in production ML systems
Inference pipeline optimization and prompt engineering at scale
Cross-functional product collaboration experience (working with UX, Product, Applied Science at an org level)
Go or other compiled languages commonly used in observability backends (Datadog's backend is largely Go-based)
interview_talking_points: Lead with the RAG system built at Disanji: emphasize the end-to-end pipeline design, the 35% retrieval precision improvement, and the RAGAS evaluation framework — this maps directly to Datadog's LLM tracing and evaluation mission
Highlight the AI Agent Resume Generator project's 80%+ test coverage and dual-layer ATS + LLM self-critique evaluation as evidence of building observable, quality-gated AI systems
Discuss the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate research credibility in multimodal AI and video-language models, reinforcing depth in AI/ML beyond surface-level tool usage
Acknowledge the Staff-level seniority gap proactively and reframe the conversation: express interest in a mid-level SWE role on the ML Observability team as a growth path toward staff

Emphasize eagerness to learn observability tooling (OpenTelemetry, distributed tracing) and connect it to existing experience with Docker Compose deployments, Redis caching, and streaming architectures

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer, BizTech
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><strong>The Community You Will Join:</strong></p> <p>The CRM Engineering team builds world-class tools that drive growth and foster meaningful relationships between Airbnb and its community, including Hosts, Guests, Law Enforcement, Government Regulators, Local Community Leaders, and more. This team tackles some of the most challenging and unique problems faced by our business. Here are a few examples:</p> <ul> <li>Growth Platform: Designed to increase supply and retain existing hosts.</li> <li>Policy Platform: Enables Airbnb to engage with regulatory bodies across the globe regarding short-term rental regulations. This platform tracks regulations that impact the Airbnb business and provides intelligence to address unique business challenges.</li> <li>Community Platform: Establishes a social platform to drive community enablement, collaboration, and success.</li> <li>Agent Tools: Empowers agents to understand and resolve issues that customers are unable to address on their own.</li> <li>Aircover Claims Platform: Facilitates the processing of claims for Aircover insurance products, offering protection to both hosts and guests.</li> </ul> <p><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></p> <p>You will build the social platform that connects Airbnb's millions of hosts worldwide. The Community Platform enables hosts to share knowledge, collaborate locally, and build meaningful relationships that strengthen the global host community.</p> <p>Your work will directly shape how hosts discover content, engage with their local communities, and find support from peers. You will design scalable backend systems that power real-time social features, and build intelligent capabilities such as AI-powered content moderation and personalized feed ranking. The platform you help build will serve geographic-based host communities with features including events, direct messaging, search, and notifications - all at Airbnb scale.</p> <p><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work cross-functionally with product, design, and other engineering counterparts to execute on product and business strategy to build novel products and features.</li> <li>Drive, lead, and contribute to the full development cycle: technical design, development, test, experimentation, analysis, and launch. You’ll be reviewing code and design docs, giving feedback on product specs and mocks.</li> <li>Provide critical input in team roadmap and technical direction.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></p> <ul> <li>6+ years of experience with a BS/Masters or 4+ years with a PhD</li> <li>Experience building &amp; launching high-impact systems&nbsp;</li> <li>3 years of experience with design and architecture; and testing/launching software products.</li> <li>Previous experience with domain driven design and context mapping</li> <li>You are a full-cycle developer: strong ownership and experience building and operating&nbsp; high-scale, distributed systems across the full software life cycle.</li> <li>You have excellent communication skills and the ability to work well within a team and across engineering teams.</li> <li>You are a strong problem solver and have solid production debugging skills.</li> <li>End-to-end “big picture” perspective that connects technical decisions to real user impact</li> <li>Good judgment in making tradeoffs to balance short-term business needs with long-term technical quality</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> . If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.<br><br></span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$191,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$223,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong academic credentials and solid full-stack and AI/ML skills that partially align with Airbnb's BizTech CRM Engineering role, particularly in backend development, RAG/LLM systems, and React-based frontends. However, the role is a Senior Software Engineer position requiring 6+ years of industry experience with a focus on high-scale distributed systems, domain-driven design, and social platform architecture — areas where the candidate's profile (primarily internships and academic projects) falls significantly short. The candidate's experience is early-career/mid-level at best, making this a considerable seniority mismatch for a role targeting seasoned engineers at a company like Airbnb.
strengths: Strong full-stack development skills (FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, WebSocket) directly relevant to the platform engineering work described
Hands-on experience building production-grade RAG and LLM pipelines (LangChain, LangGraph, ChromaDB, Milvus) aligns with the AI-powered content moderation and intelligent features mentioned in the JD
High academic pedigree — MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) and BASc at UBC (GPA 3.7, Dean's Honor List) with specialization in Software Engineering
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates ability to work on complex, novel technical problems
Experience with Redis, Docker Compose, streaming (SSE/WebSocket), and REST APIs maps to real-time social feature infrastructure needs
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and DevOps practices relevant to operating high-scale systems
80%+ test coverage on personal projects shows quality-conscious engineering mindset
missing_skills: 6+ years of industry software engineering experience (candidate has ~4 months of internship experience)
Domain-driven design (DDD) and context mapping — explicitly required, not evidenced in resume
Experience designing and operating high-scale, distributed systems in production at significant traffic volume
Social platform or CRM platform engineering experience (feeds, events, direct messaging, notifications at scale)
Technical leadership: code reviews, design doc ownership, roadmap contribution at a senior level
Experience with experimentation frameworks and A/B testing at scale
Production debugging and incident response experience in large-scale environments
Cross-functional collaboration experience with product and design at a professional level
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji — emphasize the end-to-end ownership, architectural decisions (hybrid retrieval, reranking, streaming), and measurable outcomes (35% precision improvement, 0.84 context recall) to demonstrate full-cycle engineering capability

Discuss the AI Agent Resume Generator project as evidence of full-stack ownership: multi-agent orchestration, dual-layer evaluation, WebSocket real-time features, PostgreSQL, Docker, and 80%+ test coverage — draw parallels to the Community Platform's real-time social features

Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to tackle novel, complex technical problems and communicate findings — relevant to Airbnb's expectation of engineers who connect technical decisions to real user impact

Frame the MEng specialization in Software Engineering, DevOps, and LLM as preparation for building intelligent, scalable systems — directly tie to the AI-powered content moderation and personalized feed ranking mentioned in the JD
Be transparent about seniority level and position this as a growth opportunity — emphasize rapid learning trajectory, strong fundamentals, and readiness to take on increasing ownership

matches.title: Software Engineer - Registrar
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer - Registrar  
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Available Locations: Austin&nbsp;</strong></p> <p><strong>About the Department</strong></p> <p>At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>About the Team</strong></p> <p>Domain management is the foundation for any online presence and Cloudflare Registrar is our answer to a simple and straightforward experience.&nbsp; The Registrar product manages the full lifecycle of the domains, including searching/registering for new domains and transferring/renewing existing ones.&nbsp; Onboarding domains on Cloudflare is the gateway to the vast array of Cloudflare services.</p> <p><strong>What you'll do</strong></p> <p>We are looking for a talented systems engineer to be part of our engineering team. Come be part of the team and work with a group of passionate, talented engineers that will be creating innovative products. The amount of requests being processed is massive and we utilize all the latest technology to ensure its scalability and availability.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Requirements</strong></p> <ul> <li>3+ years of experience as a software engineer with a focus on designing, building and scaling data infrastructure</li> <li>Strong communication skills, especially around articulating technical concepts for technical and non-technical audiences</li> <li>Experience working on, and deploying, large scale systems in Typescript,&nbsp; Go, Ruby/Rails, Java, or other high performance languages</li> <li>Experience (and love) for debugging to ensure the system works in all cases</li> <li>Strong systems level programming skills</li> <li>Excited by the idea of optimizing complex solutions to general problems that all websites face</li> <li>Experience with a continuous integration workflow and using source control (we use git)&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li>Designing, building, running and scaling tools and services that support the full spectrum of domain management.</li> <li>Analyzing and communicating complex technical requirements and concepts, working with technical leaders to carve a path to delivery</li> <li>Improving system design and architecture to ensure stability and performance of the internal and customer-facing compliance concerns</li> <li>Ongoing monitoring and maintenance of production services, including participation in on-call rotations</li> </ul> <ul> <li>Experience working on, and deploying, large scale systems in Typescript,&nbsp; Go, Ruby/Rails, Java, or other high performance languages</li> <li>Experience (and love) for debugging to ensure the system works in all cases</li> <li>Strong systems level programming skills</li> <li>Excited by the idea of optimizing complex solutions to general problems that all websites face</li> <li>Experience with a continuous integration workflow and using source control (we use git)&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Bonus Points</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience with Cloudflare Developer Platform</li> <li>Experience with Ruby or Go&nbsp; (or a strong desire to learn)</li> <li>Experience working with OpenAPI</li> <li>Experience with AI coding tools</li> <li>Experience with Kubernetes</li> <li>Experience with Kibana, Grafana, and/or Prometheus</li> <li>Experience with relational databases (e.g. Postgres)</li> <li>Experience with Gitlab and Gitlab CI</li> <li>Experience with DNS (and DNSSEC)</li> <li>Experience in the registry/registrar industry</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with impressive AI/ML and full-stack credentials, but this Cloudflare Registrar role is specifically seeking a systems-level backend engineer with 3+ years of professional experience in large-scale distributed infrastructure — areas where the candidate's profile is notably thin. The job emphasizes TypeScript, Go, Ruby/Rails, systems programming, DNS/domain management, and large-scale service reliability, none of which appear meaningfully in the resume. While the candidate's PostgreSQL, Docker, FastAPI, and Git experience provide a partial foundation, the core technical alignment with this specific role is weak.
strengths: Strong academic background with a 3.9 GPA MEng from University of Waterloo and a 3.7 GPA BEng from UBC, both in Computer/Electrical Engineering
Hands-on experience with PostgreSQL (a bonus point requirement) in production-grade projects
Demonstrated use of Docker and containerized deployments, relevant to Cloudflare's infrastructure mindset
Experience with REST APIs, WebSocket, and FastAPI shows backend service development capability
Git/source control experience aligns with the CI/CD workflow requirement
AI coding tools experience (LangChain, LangGraph, RAG pipelines) satisfies a bonus point
Full-stack project experience with React/TypeScript frontend demonstrates TypeScript familiarity
Published research (ACM MM '23) demonstrates strong technical communication skills
Experience building and evaluating end-to-end pipelines shows systems thinking
missing_skills: Go or Ruby/Rails — the primary backend languages Cloudflare uses for this role
TypeScript at the backend/systems level (candidate uses it only on the frontend)
Large-scale distributed systems design and operation (millions of requests, high availability)
DNS and DNSSEC knowledge — critical for a Registrar team role
Kubernetes — listed as a bonus requirement
Observability tooling: Kibana, Grafana, Prometheus — none mentioned
OpenAPI specification experience
Continuous Integration pipelines (GitLab CI or equivalent) — not demonstrated
Domain registry/registrar industry knowledge
On-call production operations and incident response experience
3+ years of professional software engineering experience (candidate has ~4 months of internship experience)
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji — emphasize the end-to-end architecture, Docker Compose deployment, Redis caching, and FastAPI streaming as evidence of backend systems thinking at scale
Emphasize PostgreSQL experience from the Resume & Cover Letter Generator project, directly addressing a bonus requirement, and discuss schema design and query optimization if applicable
Leverage the academic depth in DevOps and Performance Testing (listed as MEng specializations) to show readiness to learn Cloudflare's observability stack (Grafana, Prometheus, Kibana)
Address the experience gap proactively: frame the MEng program (graduating Oct 2025) as equivalent to additional professional development, and express a strong desire to learn Go/Ruby
Connect the 80%+ test coverage achievement in the AI Agent project to Cloudflare's emphasis on debugging and ensuring systems work in all cases
Mention TypeScript usage in React projects as a stepping stone toward backend TypeScript/Go development, and articulate a concrete learning plan for Go
Use the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate the ability to articulate complex technical concepts — a stated requirement for this role

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer, Guest & Host
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Community You Will Join: </strong></span></p> <p>Pricing and availability (availability: think vacancy calendar) features on airbnb.com are visible, familiar and tangible to our guests. Our team drives feature delivery end-to-end launching new pricing and new availability products from the ground up. Pricing and availability anchors the guest booking flow from search to product page to checkout. And we collaborate closely with design/product to ship innovative product experiences with each release.</p> <p>Our team also cares deeply about culture. Happy healthy team is a primary focus for us. We get stuff done - but are also supportive, honest, and aim to have fun.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></span></p> <p>As a Senior Engineer in Pricing and Availability, you’ll lead large projects spanning engineers, services, and products. You will transform business needs into technical requirements, drive scoping, and lead implementation while coordinating with stakeholders and peer teams. And, importantly, you’ll mentor and support engineers on our team.</p> <p>At the Senior Engineer level, you’ll help lead the development and refinement of major new features on Airbnb. &nbsp;This includes shaping desired product goals into a viable guest user experience, while also helping increase developer velocity by preserving technical quality on critical surfaces for the Airbnb guest experience.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>Explore, shape, and develop new product experiences alongside cross-functional partners (design and product); from ideation to implementation at scale</li> <li>Lead investments into new technical capabilities that push the envelope and unlock product innovation</li> <li>Nurture a culture of happy healthy teams including supportive feedback, technical quality, and having fun</li> <li>Identify and propose solutions to problems that might otherwise create dissonance between technical and product engineering excellence</li> <li>Collaborate with internal teams across Search, Checkout, Reservations, Host Settings, Listings, Payments, Tax, Cities, Trust and others</li> </ul> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>5+ years of relevant software development industry experience in a fast-paced tech environment</li> <li>Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well within a team, and across teams, at Airbnb</li> <li>Ability to drive alignment, manage projects and effectively collaborate with stakeholders.</li> <li>Capable of making data driven decisions and articulating tradeoffs in any technical decisions.</li> <li>Strong programming (Scala / Python / Java/ C++ or equivalent) skills for hands-on IC work</li> <li>Passion to level-up those around you through curiosity and fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> . If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$191,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$223,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with impressive technical breadth — particularly in AI/ML, full-stack development, and backend engineering — and his skills partially align with Airbnb's engineering stack (Python, Java, React, PostgreSQL, Docker). However, this role is a Senior Software Engineer position requiring 5+ years of industry experience, and Ruiqi is a mid-level candidate currently completing his Master's degree with only ~6 months of internship experience, which is a significant gap. The role also emphasizes large-scale distributed systems, cross-functional leadership, stakeholder management, and mentorship — areas where Ruiqi has little demonstrated professional experience.
strengths: Strong programming skills in Python, Java, and C++ — directly matching Airbnb's preferred languages
Full-stack development experience with React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, and Docker aligns with the engineering stack
Demonstrated ability to build end-to-end systems (RAG pipeline, AI agent resume generator) with production-grade tooling
Excellent academic credentials: GPA 3.9 (MEng, Waterloo) and 3.7 (BEng, UBC) with Dean's Honor List recognition
Experience with REST APIs, WebSocket, Redis, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) relevant to Airbnb's infrastructure
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates ability to work on complex technical problems
Remote-eligible role aligns with candidate's preferred remote/hybrid work style
Location preference (US/Canada) is compatible with the US-remote eligible position
missing_skills: 5+ years of industry software engineering experience (candidate has ~6 months of internships)
Scala experience — a key language listed in the job requirements
Experience with large-scale distributed systems at consumer internet scale
Cross-functional stakeholder management and project leadership experience
Mentorship and team leadership experience expected at the Senior level
Pricing, availability, or booking/reservation domain knowledge
Experience driving technical scoping and alignment across multiple engineering teams
Data-driven decision making in a product engineering context (A/B testing, metrics, experimentation)
interview_talking_points: Highlight the end-to-end ownership of the AI Agent Resume Generator project — emphasize full-stack architecture decisions, 80%+ test coverage, and production-readiness as a proxy for engineering maturity
Discuss the RAG system built at Disanji: quantify the 35% retrieval precision improvement and 0.84 RAGAS context recall to demonstrate data-driven engineering and measurable impact
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to show ability to collaborate across disciplines and communicate complex technical ideas — a key Senior Engineer soft skill
Emphasize breadth of stack (React, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker, Redis, AWS/Azure) to show adaptability to Airbnb's diverse microservices environment
Address the experience gap proactively: frame the Master's specialization in Software Engineering and the variety of production-style projects as accelerated, hands-on preparation for industry roles

Express genuine interest in Airbnb's pricing and availability domain — connect it to experience building systems that handle real-time data (WebSocket streaming, Redis caching, SSE) which are relevant to dynamic pricing UX

matches.title: Software Engineer, AI - Lisbon
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, AI - Lisbon
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Available locations: Lisbon&nbsp;</strong></p> <p><strong>About the Department</strong></p> <p>Cloudflare helps build the future of the Internet. The Emerging Technology and Incubation (ETI) team invents, launches, and brings to market the technologies required to reach that goal. ETI ships software that changes the Internet. The world's fastest DNS resolver, 1.1.1.1, Cloudflare WARP, Cloudflare One, Cloudflare Workers, D1, R2, and Workers AI are examples of our launches.</p> <p><strong>About the Team</strong></p> <p>The team members in ETI make this possible. The group consists of engineers, product managers, developer advocates and researchers who share a common passion for helping build a better Internet. The ETI organization encourages individual team members to be ambitious and bold in how we find and solve problems. We move quickly and shape our products based on customer usage and feedback, while leveraging the massive scale and reliability of our global network.</p> <p>ETI also helps drive our Innovation Weeks at Cloudflare and contributes with new products, features, and visions for helping build a better Internet. Doing that requires all of ETI to execute on releases that customers will use today, tell our story as part of Cloudflare’s larger mission, and to build products that allow Cloudflare’s customers to realize that 1+1 can equal 3 when using all of these features together.</p> <p>We are looking for a Systems Engineer to join our team. You will work with a team of passionate, talented engineers that are building innovative AI products that bring security and speed to millions of internet users each day. You will play an active part in shaping product features based on what’s technically possible. Furthermore, you will make sure our company hits our ambitious goals from an engineering standpoint.</p> <p>You bring a passion for meeting business needs while building technically innovative solutions, and excel at shifting between the two—understanding how big-picture goals inform technical details, and vice-versa. You thrive in a fast-paced iterative engineering environment.</p> <p><strong>Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field;</li> <li>Proven experience in software development, with a strong focus on TypeScript, JavaScript or Rust programming languages;</li> <li>Solid understanding of systems engineering principles and practices;</li> <li>Experience with version control systems such as Git;</li> <li>Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail;</li> <li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment;</li> <li>Passion for learning and exploring new technologies;</li> <li>Creative thinker with the ability to propose innovative solutions to complex problems;</li> <li>An operational mindset - we don't just write code, we also own it in production;</li> <li>Previous experience working in an Agile environment is a plus.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Bonus Points:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Understanding of the web and technologies such as web browsers, HTTP and WebAssembly;</li> <li>Previous experience with AI solutions;</li> <li>Experience building high performance distributed systems;</li> <li>Deep Linux/UNIX systems, kernel, or networking knowledge;</li> <li>Contributions to large open source projects.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Locations:</strong> Lisbon</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong AI/ML-focused full-stack engineer with solid Python, FastAPI, RAG, and LangChain experience, and his background aligns well with Cloudflare's AI product ambitions. However, the role explicitly prioritizes TypeScript/JavaScript or Rust as primary languages, and while Ruiqi lists JavaScript, his portfolio skews heavily toward Python-based AI backends — with no demonstrated Rust experience and limited TypeScript depth. The most significant mismatch is geographic: the role is Lisbon-only hybrid, while the candidate's stated preferences are Remote/US/Canada, making this a near-disqualifying location conflict.
strengths: Strong AI/ML experience directly relevant to Cloudflare's Workers AI and ETI team — RAG pipelines, LangChain, LangGraph, LLMs, and vector databases (ChromaDB, Milvus)
Published ACM MM '23 research paper on video-language models, demonstrating research-grade AI depth
Full-stack capability with React/TypeScript frontend and FastAPI backend, plus Docker and PostgreSQL
Hands-on experience with production-grade system design: Redis caching, WebSocket streaming, SSE, Docker Compose deployments
Strong academic credentials — MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specialization in Software Engineering, DevOps, and LLMs
Experience with Git, REST APIs, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) aligns with Cloudflare's engineering culture
Demonstrated operational mindset: built automated evaluation pipelines (RAGAS), 80%+ test coverage on projects
JavaScript listed as a core language, partially satisfying the TypeScript/JS requirement
missing_skills: Rust programming language — a primary language preference for this role with no evidence on resume
TypeScript as a primary/production language — JavaScript is listed but no dedicated TypeScript projects are highlighted
Systems engineering depth — no evidence of kernel, networking, or low-level systems work (HTTP internals, WebAssembly, DNS)
Distributed systems at scale — no experience with high-performance or large-scale distributed infrastructure comparable to Cloudflare's global network
Linux/UNIX systems or kernel knowledge — not mentioned anywhere on the resume
WebAssembly (WASM) — listed as a bonus skill in the JD with no candidate coverage
Cloudflare-specific ecosystem knowledge (Workers, D1, R2, WARP) — no familiarity demonstrated
Open source contributions — no mention of contributions to large open source projects
interview_talking_points: Lead with your RAG pipeline work at Disanji — specifically the hybrid retrieval architecture (BM25 + BGE-M3 + Milvus), FlashRank reranking, and Redis semantic caching. This maps directly to Cloudflare's Workers AI and AI product ambitions.
Highlight your ACM MM '23 publication to establish research credibility and signal that you can operate at the frontier of AI — a key trait for the ETI team.

Emphasize your full-stack, production-oriented mindset: FastAPI + React/TypeScript + Docker + PostgreSQL + 80%+ test coverage on the Resume Generator project shows you own code end-to-end in production.

Address the TypeScript gap proactively — note that your React/TypeScript frontend work demonstrates familiarity, and express willingness to deepen TypeScript and learn Rust given your strong systems background from Computer Engineering.

Connect your Computer Engineering background (Verilog, VHDL, embedded systems) to systems-level thinking, positioning yourself as someone who understands hardware-software boundaries — relevant for a systems engineer role.
Acknowledge the Lisbon location requirement directly and clarify your actual availability/willingness to relocate if applicable, since this is the single biggest risk factor for your application.

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer, Search Input
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><strong>The Community You Will Join:</strong></p> <p>Airbnb’s Search Input team is responsible for the front-door to Airbnb’s guest product and search experience. The team aims to help users express their trip intents &amp; preferences easily, surface dynamic &amp; recommended filters adapting to what users need, and help them navigate Airbnb’s app and site to find the ideal listings for their trip.</p> <p>The team works on a number of highly impactful surfaces across Airbnb’s Search and key product pages, such as the delivery of innovative product features like<a href="https://news.airbnb.com/product-releases/airbnb-2023-summer-release/"> Airbnb Rooms</a>,<a href="https://www.airbnb.ca/release/2022-summer"> Airbnb Categories</a>, along with<a href="https://twitter.com/bchesky/status/1704466156835262755?t=EMFe19SmfTVz5nVVaxozzA"> new &amp; exciting Filter additions</a>.</p> <p>The team is cross-discipline with expertise in iOS, Android, web and backend development and highly collaborative with its partners in design, product, data science, creative, and marketing to deliver features and experiences used by millions of people. We also work closely with other engineering teams on Search and Foundation to enable engineers to develop more efficiently, create improvements that make the product more performant and configurable, and build architecture that’s scalable and robust.</p> <p><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop new, highly-impact product features on Airbnb’s search and other high-traffic surfaces.&nbsp;</li> <li>Work closely with cross functional partners in design, product, marketing, and data science to bring new features from design to production.</li> <li>Prototype new features to collect feedback and iterate on to reach ideal product solutions for Airbnb guests.</li> <li>Effectively advise stakeholders on the technical scope and feasibility of complex product requirements.</li> <li>Write technical specifications for new features and systems.</li> <li>Provide mentorship to junior team members to support their career and technical growth.</li> </ul> <p><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Attend a design share-out of an upcoming feature and provide feedback to design and product partners on feasibility and level of engineering effort required.&nbsp;</li> <li>Develop a prototype for a new capability the team needs to develop to achieve the design, and review and evaluate it with partner teams.</li> <li>Create and implement the technical design and code for a key initiative that enables impactful features/products on Airbnb’s search product.</li> <li>Review a team member’s technical design for an upcoming feature and provide feedback on implementations via code review.</li> <li>Deliver improvements that enable the team to ship features efficiently and&nbsp; improve product quality. Bring these improvements to the broader Search organization.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years of hands-on experience in backend/full-stack development.</li> <li>Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree, preferably in CS, or equivalent experience.</li> <li>In-depth experience working in Java and/or Kotlin within a microservice architecture at scale.</li> <li>Passion for efficiency, availability, technical quality, and system quality.</li> <li>Passion for design and UX, with a focus on building user-centric products.</li> <li>Excellent communication and collaboration skills, and the ability to work well within a large engineering organization as well as cross functionally.</li> <li>Enthusiastic about code reviews and architecture discussions, actively contributing to improve teammates’ productivity.</li> <li>Experience working on a product team or customer-centric software for a medium to large engineering organization.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Your Location:</strong></p> <p>This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity.<a href="https://careers.airbnb.com/"> Click here</a> for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list. If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</p> <p><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></p> <p>Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</p> <p>We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</p> <p>We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$191,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$223,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi is a strong academic candidate with solid full-stack and AI/ML skills, but this role is a poor fit on two critical dimensions: the job requires 5+ years of hands-on backend/full-stack experience with Java/Kotlin in a microservice architecture at scale, while Ruiqi is a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree with only ~6 months of relevant internship experience. Additionally, the role's core technical stack centers on Java/Kotlin microservices for a high-traffic consumer product, whereas Ruiqi's expertise is primarily Python-based with an AI/ML and RAG focus — Java is listed as a skill but there is no demonstrated production experience with it at scale.
strengths: Strong full-stack development background spanning FastAPI, React/TypeScript, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and Docker — aligns with the cross-discipline nature of the team
Demonstrated experience building production-grade systems (RAG pipeline deployed via Docker Compose with FastAPI + Redis caching)
Excellent academic credentials: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) + BASc at UBC (GPA 3.7, Dean's Honor List) in Computer/Electrical Engineering
Hands-on experience with WebSocket, REST APIs, and real-time streaming (SSE) — relevant to search product feature development
Published research (ACM MM '23) demonstrates ability to work on complex technical problems and communicate findings
Remote-eligible role aligns with candidate's preferred remote/hybrid work style
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerization (Docker) is relevant to Airbnb's infrastructure scale
AI/ML expertise (LangChain, LangGraph, RAG, YOLO) could be a differentiator for future search personalization features
missing_skills: 5+ years of hands-on backend/full-stack experience — candidate has ~6 months of internship experience, far below the requirement
In-depth production experience with Java and/or Kotlin — Java is listed as a skill but no Java-based project or work experience is demonstrated
Microservice architecture at scale — no evidence of working within a large-scale distributed microservice system
Experience mentoring junior engineers — required for Senior-level role, not demonstrated
Experience on a product team within a medium-to-large engineering organization — all experience is from internships or academic research
iOS or Android native development experience — the team is cross-discipline across iOS, Android, web, and backend
Search product domain knowledge — no experience with search ranking, query understanding, or filter systems
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji: emphasize the end-to-end architecture decisions, the 35% retrieval precision improvement, and the deployment pipeline — this demonstrates backend engineering rigor beyond typical intern work

Emphasize the full-stack AI Agent Resume Generator project as a proxy for product feature development: it covers the full lifecycle from design to deployment (FastAPI + React/TypeScript + PostgreSQL + Docker + 80%+ test coverage), mirroring how the Search Input team ships features

Address the Java/Kotlin gap proactively — mention Java as a listed skill and express willingness to ramp up quickly, citing fast learning demonstrated by mastering LangChain, LangGraph, and RAG pipelines in a short timeframe

Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to collaborate cross-functionally (with researchers, engineers) and communicate complex technical work — a key soft skill for this Senior role

Connect AI/ML background to Airbnb's search vision: dynamic & recommended filters and personalized search intent understanding are natural applications of the candidate's RAG, LLM, and recommendation system experience

Acknowledge the seniority gap honestly but frame the trajectory: MEng at Waterloo (graduating Oct 2025), two internships, a publication, and multiple production-quality projects show accelerated growth — position this as a strong mid-level candidate who could grow into the Senior scope

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer, Analytics and Reporting
matches.description:
Title: Senior Software Engineer, Analytics and Reporting
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Available Locations: Austin, Lisbon, London<br></strong></p> <p><strong>Hiring will be focused on those residing within the greater Austin, TX, London, UK, &amp; Lisbon, Portugal metro areas. It will be a hybrid role, with the expectation of 2 days per week in the office.</strong></p> <p><strong>We're hiring Software Engineers at all levels. This is a single pipeline position.</strong></p> <h4>What you'll do</h4> <p>As a member of the Analytics and Reporting (ART) team within CF1 (Zero Trust), you will work alongside other engineers, designers, and product managers to develop and enhance Cloudflare's analytics and reporting capabilities. Your role will involve developing software applications that efficiently handle large-scale data analytics, deliver full-stack solutions that include data ingestion, storage, processing, and visualization layers, contribute to the architecture and continuous improvement of analytics platforms. You will see projects through from conception to deployment, delivering data-driven solutions that empower Cloudflare customers to harness the full potential of Zero Trust.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Technologies we use:</strong></p> <ul> <li>ART core backend and API services are written in Go.</li> <li>We deploy our solutions in Kubernetes environments.</li> <li>We utilize Postgres, Clickhouse, and a number of cloud native data store technologies.</li> <li>We use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript for front-end development.</li> <li>Kafka plays a large role at Cloudflare and this team with message streaming.</li> <li>For service monitoring we use Prometheus and Grafana.</li> <li>For service logging we use Sentry, Elasticsearch and Kibana.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience</strong></p> <ul> <li>3-5+ years of professional experience building and managing reliable and performant software systems at scale, preferably with some experience in our tech stack.</li> <li>Experience in designing and architecting distributed systems.</li> <li>Experience in designing and implementing REST APIs.</li> <li>Experience in SQL, familiarity with common relational database concepts.</li> <li>Familiarity with the web and technologies such as web browsers, HTTP, JavaScript.</li> <li>Familiarity with Kubernetes, Kafka, Clickhouse.</li> <li>Passion for making the digital world a more secure place.</li> <li>Willingness, curiosity, and enthusiasm to learn new programming languages, technologies and systems</li> <li>Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Caring and empathy are coveted traits here!</li> </ul> <p><strong>Bonus</strong></p> <ul> <li>Previous experience with building enterprise analytics products.</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>

matches.title: Software Engineer, C++
matches.location: San Francisco, CA • New York, NY • United States
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Figma is growing our team of passionate creatives and builders on a mission to make design accessible to all. Figma’s platform helps teams bring ideas to life—whether you're brainstorming, creating a prototype, translating designs into code, or iterating with AI. From idea to product, Figma empowers teams to streamline workflows, move faster, and work together in real time from anywhere in the world. If you're excited to shape the future of design and collaboration, join us!</p></div><div class="section page-centered"> <div> <p>As a Software Engineer, you'll work on some of the most technically challenging and impactful parts of our product. You will be developing high-performance client-side systems in C++/WebAssembly, extending the multiplayer protocols that make collaborative design possible, and building out the communications layer between C++ and Javascript. Your contributions will help push the boundaries of what's possible in the browser. You'll also help shape our user experience by building features that are fast, accessible, and intuitive—even in the face of complex data models and intermittent connectivity.</p> <p>This is a highly collaborative role: you'll partner closely with designers, product managers, and other engineers to plan, build, and iterate on features that serve millions of users around the world. Whether you're optimizing our core engine, building authoring tools, or crafting new platform abstractions, your work will be key to advancing the future of design.</p> <p>This is a full-time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.</p> <h3><strong>What you’ll do at Figma:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Build core features and frontend infrastructure in a real-time, multiplayer system with a complex in-memory data model (SceneGraph)</li> <li>Optimize performance and memory usage to deliver a fast, reliable UX in the browser using C++/WebAssembly and TypeScript</li> <li>Extend our core C++ engine and multiplayer protocols to support scalable design systems, branching/merging flows, and advanced collaboration modes</li> <li>Design and build APIs and tooling to allow product teams to build against our platform with ease and confidence</li> <li>Contribute to accessibility strategy and implementation, ensuring our tools are usable by all</li> <li>Collaborate regularly with cross-functional partners across product, design, and engineering to plan and execute high-impact projects</li> <li>Write clear, maintainable code and documentation, and contribute to architectural decisions</li> <li>Mentor and support other engineers through pairing, code review, and feedback</li> <li>Help drive recruitment and shape our inclusive, high-performance engineering culture</li> </ul> <h3><strong>We’d love to hear from you if you have:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>4+ years of professional Software Engineering experience shipping user-facing features or products</li> <li>Strong programming skills in one or more languages relevant to our frontend such as TypeScript, C++, React, Go, Rust, or Python</li> <li>Experience working with web-based applications, browser performance, or real-time collaborative systems</li> <li>A track record of working collaboratively across teams and disciplines to deliver complex technical projects</li> </ul> <h3><strong>While it’s not required, it’s an added plus if you also have:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>2+ years of experience in a technical lead role, especially across multiple teams</li> <li>Experience with game engines, rendering systems, or other performance-critical applications</li> <li>Background in developer platforms or API design</li> <li>Familiarity with WebAssembly, browser internals, or C++ in a frontend context</li> <li>Passion for crafting collaborative tools and creative workflows</li> <li>A strong product mindset and attention to user experience</li> <li>A commitment to continuous learning, inclusion, and helping others grow</li> </ul> <div class="section page-centered"> <div> <div>At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</div> </div> </div> </div> </div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">Pay Transparency Disclosure</span></strong></p> <p>If based in Figma’s San Francisco or New York hub offices, this role has the annual base salary range stated below.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>Job level and actual compensation will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process (including skills and prior relevant experience, potential impact, and scope of role), market demands, and specific work location. The listed range is a guideline, and the range for this role may be modified. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, the pay range is localized according to employee work location by a factor of between 80% and 100% of range. Please discuss your specific work location with your recruiter for more information.&nbsp;</p> <p>Figma offers equity to employees, as well a competitive package of additional benefits, including health, dental &amp; vision, retirement with company contribution, parental leave &amp; reproductive or family planning support, mental health &amp; wellness benefits, generous PTO, company recharge days, a learning &amp; development stipend, a work from home stipend, and cell phone reimbursement.&nbsp; Figma also offers sales incentive pay for most sales roles and an annual bonus plan for eligible non-sales roles. Figma’s compensation and benefits are subject to change and may be modified in the future.</p></div><div class="title">Annual Base Salary Range:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$149,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$350,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p>At Figma we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our product and our community to flourish. Figma is an <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC_KnowYourRights_screen_reader_10_20.pdf">equal opportunity workplace</a> - we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity/expression, veteran status<strong>, </strong>or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.</p> <p>We will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to apply for a role, participate in the interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation, please reach out to <a href="mailto:accommodations-ext@figma.com">accommodations-ext@figma.com</a>. These modifications enable an individual with a disability to have an equal opportunity not only to get a job, but successfully perform their job tasks to the same extent as people without disabilities.&nbsp;</p> <p>Examples of accommodations include but are not limited to:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Holding interviews in an accessible location</li> <li>Enabling closed captioning on video conferencing</li> <li>Ensuring all written communication be compatible with screen readers</li> <li>Changing the mode or format of interviews&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>To ensure the integrity of our hiring process and facilitate a more personal connection, we require all candidates keep their cameras on during video interviews. Additionally, if hired you will be required to attend in person onboarding.</p> <p>By applying for this job, the candidate acknowledges and agrees that any personal data contained in their application or supporting materials will be processed in accordance with <a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Figma's Candidate Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>

The experience gap is significant: Figma requires 4+ years of professional SWE experience shipping user-facing products, while Ruiqi has roughly 4 months of relevant internship experience and is still completing their Master's degree. The candidate's strengths lie in AI/ML, RAG pipelines, and Python/FastAPI backends, which are largely orthogonal to the core requirements of this role.

Strong academic pedigree (UBC + University of Waterloo, 3.7/3.9 GPA, Dean's Honor List) signals high learning potential
