WebAssembly (Wasm) — explicitly required; not mentioned anywhere on the resume
Real-time multiplayer/collaborative systems experience (CRDTs, OT, conflict resolution)
Browser performance optimization and browser internals knowledge
SceneGraph or similar in-memory data model experience
Game engine or rendering system experience (a strong plus for this role)
4+ years of professional SWE experience (candidate has ~4 months of internship experience)
Technical leadership or cross-team collaboration at scale
API/developer platform design experience
Accessibility (a11y) implementation experience
interview_talking_points: Highlight Computer Graphics coursework and projects from both UBC and Waterloo — Figma's core engine is a rendering system, and any exposure to scene graphs, rasterization, or GPU pipelines is directly relevant
Emphasize C++ proficiency and connect it to performance-critical contexts — even if academic, frame it around memory management, low-level optimization, and systems thinking that Figma values
Discuss the real-time WebSocket architecture in the Resume Generator project as evidence of understanding low-latency, bidirectional communication — a building block for multiplayer systems
Leverage the RAG pipeline's performance engineering angle (Redis semantic caching, streaming, reranking) to demonstrate a mindset around latency, throughput, and system efficiency

Acknowledge the experience gap proactively and lean into Figma's stated value of 'Grow as you go' — position the Master's degree specialization in Software Engineering as accelerated, focused preparation
If applicable, mention any C++ projects from coursework (embedded development, computer vision with OpenCV, etc.) to substantiate the language claim beyond a bullet point on a skills list

matches.title: Software Engineer, Bridge
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Bridge
Company: Stripe
Location: San Francisco, NY, Seattle
Description: <p><strong>About Bridge</strong></p> <p>We’re creating an entirely new payments platform, built with stablecoins, to simplify global money movement. Bridge enables faster, cheaper payments and borderless access to dollars via stablecoins. Through our APIs, businesses can send and receive funds across borders faster / cheaper vs. SWIFT and other fiat-only rails. Our virtual accounts enable international consumers and businesses to easily access, store and spend US dollars. Our payouts infrastructure enables platforms to disburse USD to anyone globally. We believe many trillions of dollars will move and settle through stablecoin payment rails. Bridge is pulling this future forward.&nbsp;</p> <p>We have a small team of people who have previously built financial infrastructure at some of the world’s leading companies (Coinbase, Stripe, Square, Brex, Upstart, DoorDash, Airbnb) and each and every one of them chose Bridge because they fundamentally believe that stablecoins will be a critical piece of financial infrastructure that allows for the improvement of global money movement.</p> <p><strong>About the Role</strong></p> <p>As an early member of the Bridge engineering team, you will be given the autonomy to work on projects that are truly global in scale and aim to give customers access to products they've never had access to. Many of the use cases that we work on today didn't exist several months ago and that's because our team is dedicated to constant improvement for our partners and end users. Our Engineers have outsized ownership over projects so if you are looking for increased autonomy working on a completely greenfield opportunity, Bridge is the place for you.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>Ship software to build out our suite of API products. We’re an engineering and API-first company, and you will learn first-hand and contribute towards building highly reliable, performant, and mission critical infrastructure serving thousands of developers across the globe.</p> </li> <li> <p>Take sole ownership of projects, oftentimes without the support of Product Management, and liaise both internally with teams like Legal/Compliance and externally with our partners and developers.</p> </li> <li> <p>Look for constant improvements to our product offerings with the explicit goal of improving the experience for our partners and end users.</p> </li> <li> <p>Make effective tradeoffs that consider business priorities, user experience, and a sustainable technical foundation.</p> </li> <li> <p>Improve engineering standards, tooling and processes for the team and our broader org.</p> </li> </ul> <p><strong>Qualifications</strong></p> <ul> <li> <p>We are open to hiring engineers at various levels of seniority (SWE through Senior Staff) but at a minimum we are looking for somebody with 5+ years of experience.</p> </li> <li> <p>Experience building backend systems with SQL databases. Experience with frameworks such as Rails, Django, Express or equivalent is a bonus.</p> </li> <li> <p>An enlarged sense of ownership and the ability to lead and influence the design and direction of our products.</p> </li> <li> <p>An ability to thrive in a fast paced environment.</p> </li> <li> <p>A growth mindset and a constant curiosity and fearlessness to dive into the unknown.</p> </li> <li> <p>An ability to write maintainable, well-tested, modular code, but also be pragmatic about moving fast.</p> </li> <li> <p>Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to write clear technical documentation.</p> </li> <li> <p>Past experience working on crypto or financial products a plus, and while not required, we do look for people who are very passionate about building in this space.</p> </li> <li> <p>Experience with building API products a plus, but not required.</p> </li> <li> <p>Experience working with blockchain or distributed systems a big plus</p> </li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with solid full-stack and AI/ML skills, but this role at Bridge/Stripe is a poor fit on two critical dimensions: experience and domain. The job explicitly requires 5+ years of professional experience, while Ruiqi has roughly 4 months of relevant internship experience and is still completing a Master's degree — a significant gap. Additionally, Bridge is a fintech/stablecoin/crypto payments company, and Ruiqi has zero background in financial systems, payments infrastructure, blockchain, or distributed ledger technology, which are core to this role. While backend skills (FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker, REST APIs) are transferable, the absence of fintech/crypto experience and the experience-level mismatch make this a reach opportunity.
strengths: Strong backend development skills with FastAPI, PostgreSQL, REST APIs, and Docker — directly relevant to Bridge's API-first engineering culture
Demonstrated ability to build and ship full-stack systems end-to-end (Resume Generator project: FastAPI + React/TypeScript + WebSocket + PostgreSQL + Docker with 80%+ test coverage)
High academic pedigree: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) and BASc at UBC (GPA 3.7, Dean's Honor List), signaling strong technical fundamentals
Experience with production-grade system design (RAG pipeline with Redis caching, streaming, Docker Compose deployment) shows pragmatic engineering mindset
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates ability to communicate complex technical work clearly — relevant to Bridge's documentation and communication standards
Familiarity with SQL databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB) aligns with the job's backend SQL requirement
Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and DevOps tooling (Docker, Git) is a plus for infrastructure-heavy fintech work
missing_skills: 5+ years of professional software engineering experience (candidate has ~4 months of internship experience)
Fintech or payments domain knowledge (SWIFT, ACH, stablecoin rails, compliance workflows)
Blockchain or distributed ledger technology experience (Ethereum, Solidity, Web3, or equivalent)
Backend frameworks preferred by the role: Rails, Django, or Express (candidate uses FastAPI, which is adjacent but not listed)
Experience owning projects without Product Management support in a production fintech environment
Crypto product experience or demonstrated passion for the stablecoin/Web3 space
Experience with high-reliability, mission-critical infrastructure at scale (thousands of API consumers)
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji — emphasize the end-to-end ownership, Docker Compose deployment, Redis caching, and FastAPI streaming as evidence of building reliable, performant backend APIs similar to what Bridge requires

Emphasize the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a greenfield, full-stack product built independently — frame it as a proxy for the autonomy and ownership culture Bridge values, noting the 80%+ test coverage as a signal of code quality discipline

Address the experience gap proactively: position the MEng at Waterloo (graduating Oct 2025) as accelerated, specialized training in software engineering and DevOps, and express genuine curiosity about the stablecoin/payments space to compensate for lack of direct domain experience
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to write clear technical documentation and communicate complex systems — a stated requirement in the job posting

If possible, prepare a brief perspective on why stablecoins matter for global payments to show passion for the domain, even without direct crypto experience — Bridge explicitly values people who are 'passionate about building in this space'

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer, Messaging Foundations
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Community You Will Join: </strong></span></p> <p>Airbnb’s mission is to create a world where anyone can belong anywhere. Essential to this mission is the ability to have authentic conversations with members of a global community. The Messaging Foundations team builds the platform that powers these conversations. As a Senior Software Engineer on the team, you will build innovative products, architect scalable solutions, collaborate across organizations, and help shape our roadmap - ensuring that our global community of guests and hosts can communicate seamlessly, wherever they are.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></span></p> <p>You will build and operate the reliable, performant, and scalable infrastructure that powers all messaging experiences across Airbnb. You will build a platform that enables product teams across Airbnb to innovate new conversational experiences faster. You will support and deliver AI-powered features as part of the messaging intelligence platform, driving improvements in trip quality and reducing host effort through contextual assistance.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>Lead multiple projects that improve the messaging experience</li> <li>Mentor, guide, advocate and support the career growth of individual contributors</li> <li>Write and review technical designs that solve large, open-ended foundational technical problems without clearly-known solutions</li> <li>Collaborate with other engineers and cross-functional partners across Messaging and other organizations across the company to align on long-term technical solutions</li> <li>Build knowledge of leading edge practices and trends</li> <li>Drive key technical deliverables for the larger Communications organization</li> </ul> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>5+ years of relevant engineering hands-on work experience</li> <li>Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD in CS or related field</li> <li>Exceptional architecture abilities and experience with architectural patterns of large, high-scale applications</li> <li>Shipped several large scale projects with multiple dependencies across teams</li> <li>Has technical leadership and strong communication skills with ability to lead other experienced engineers</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> . If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$185,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$220,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi is a strong academic candidate with impressive AI/ML and full-stack skills, but this role is a significant reach. The Airbnb Senior SWE - Messaging Foundations position demands 5+ years of hands-on engineering experience, proven large-scale distributed systems architecture, and technical leadership — areas where Ruiqi, as a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree, falls considerably short. While their RAG/LLM and backend skills are genuinely relevant to the AI-powered messaging intelligence platform component, the core role centers on high-scale messaging infrastructure (think Kafka-level reliability, real-time systems at billions of events), cross-team technical leadership, and mentorship — none of which are evidenced in the resume. The education background is excellent and the AI/ML work is a bright spot, but the experience gap is the dominant factor dragging down the overall match.
strengths: Strong academic pedigree: Master's in ECE from University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) and Bachelor's from UBC (GPA 3.7, Dean's Honor List) — directly satisfies the education requirement
Hands-on AI/ML and RAG experience (LangChain, LangGraph, ChromaDB, BGE-M3, RAGAS) is directly relevant to the job's AI-powered messaging intelligence platform component
Backend and infrastructure exposure: FastAPI, Docker, Redis, PostgreSQL, WebSocket, REST APIs — foundational building blocks for messaging systems
Demonstrated ability to build production-grade pipelines (RAG system with 35% retrieval precision improvement, 0.84 context recall) with measurable outcomes
Familiarity with Kafka listed in skills, which is a core technology for high-throughput messaging infrastructure
Full-stack capability (React/TypeScript + FastAPI) aligns with the team's need to enable product teams to build conversational experiences
Remote-eligible role matches candidate's preferred remote/hybrid work style
missing_skills: 5+ years of hands-on engineering experience (candidate has ~1 year of internship experience)
Proven large-scale distributed systems architecture at production scale (billions of events, high availability)
Technical leadership and mentorship of other senior/experienced engineers
Experience shipping large, cross-team projects with multiple organizational dependencies
Deep expertise in real-time messaging infrastructure (e.g., WebSocket at scale, message queuing, delivery guarantees)
Experience with high-scale backend systems (microservices, service mesh, observability/monitoring at scale)
Cross-functional collaboration and roadmap influence at a senior level
No evidence of Java/Scala or Go — common languages in Airbnb's backend stack
interview_talking_points: Lead with your AI/ML depth: Emphasize the production RAG system you built at Disanji — quantify the 35% retrieval precision improvement and 0.84 RAGAS context recall score, and connect it directly to Airbnb's stated goal of building an AI-powered messaging intelligence platform

Highlight your LangGraph multi-agent architecture project: The 4-agent quality-gated pipeline with ATS scoring and LLM self-critique demonstrates sophisticated AI system design thinking that maps to Airbnb's contextual assistance features for hosts and guests

Showcase your full-stack messaging-adjacent work: WebSocket integration, Redis semantic caching, and SSE streaming in your FastAPI projects are directly transferable to real-time messaging infrastructure — make this connection explicit

Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively and reframe it: Position yourself as a high-velocity learner (two strong internships, ACM MM publication, 3.9 GPA Master's) who can grow into the role, and express genuine interest in the mentorship and technical leadership track

Leverage your Kafka familiarity: Even if surface-level, mention it and express eagerness to go deep — Kafka is central to Airbnb's messaging backbone and showing awareness of its role signals infrastructure maturity

Reference your ACM MM '23 publication on video-language models to demonstrate you can operate at a research-engineering intersection, which is valuable for a team building cutting-edge conversational AI features

matches.title: Software Engineer, Engagement & Privacy Analytics
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Engagement & Privacy Analytics 
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Location: Lisbon or London</strong></p> <p><strong>About the Department</strong><strong><br></strong>Emerging Technologies &amp; Incubation (ETI) is where new and bold products are built and released within Cloudflare. Rather than being constrained by the structures which make Cloudflare a hugely successful business, we are able to leverage them to deliver entirely new tools and products to our customers. Cloudflare’s edge and network make it possible to solve problems at massive scale and efficiency which would be impossible for almost any other organization.</p> <p><strong>About the Team</strong><strong><br></strong>Our team builds on top of the Cloudflare development platform, pushing its limits to deliver tooling ranging from open source dev-tooling contributions to bespoke Enterprise-grade product solutions for massive-traffic volumes and bespoke customer demands.&nbsp;</p> <p>What started with Cloudflare Zaraz - a solution that made third-party tooling safer, faster, and more privacy-conscious - has grown into a broader mandate. Today, our scope has broadened to include stewardship of CDNJS, the open source Managed Components project, and a range of strategic initiatives focused on empowering developers with more control over data privacy and analytics.</p> <p>At our core, we’re building new ways to help web application owners streamline development and accelerate growth on the Internet.</p> <p>We are a tight-knit team, communicating &amp; collaborating regularly. We like to celebrate our achievements, support each other when we make mistakes, and hold each other and our work to the highest standard.</p> <p><strong>What you'll do</strong><strong><br></strong>In this role, you will join world-class engineers in shaping new products built entirely on Cloudflare’s global network, while continuing to nurture the growing impact of existing offerings - ensuring continual reliability, best-in-class performance, and the implementation of new features and functionality.</p> <p>You will be encouraged to bring your ideas forward and own your code from inception to release, delivering solutions at every layer of the software stack to empower Cloudflare customers. On any given day, you might:</p> <ul> <li>Write a design document outlining your strategy to tackle a specific challenge.</li> <li>Ship a new feature that integrates multiple technologies.</li> <li>Fix a bug affecting how our user experience renders.</li> </ul> <p>You can expect to work with a variety of languages and technologies including, but not limited to, TypeScript, Go, and Rust. We use Cloudflare Workers heavily and creatively. If applicable to ongoing projects, you will also help maintain the health and availability of services by participating in an on-call rotation.</p> <p><strong>About you</strong><strong><br></strong>We want you to love it here! This role is a great fit for you if:</p> <ul> <li>You have a passion for meeting business needs while building technically innovative solutions, and you excel at balancing big-picture goals with technical detail.</li> <li>You are bold and persistent in your efforts to get your work across the finish line.</li> <li>You are excited to collaborate and communicate with engineers across Cloudflare, contributing across many layers of the stack.</li> <li>You take pride in shipping effective, reliable code.</li> <li>You are energized by learning new skills, tackling challenging debugging sessions, and sharing your knowledge with others.</li> <li>You believe that thorough documentation is just as important as delivering code.</li> <li>You want to join a team that upholds a culture of support, open and honest communication, and collaborative problem-solving.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Examples of Desirable Skills, Knowledge, and Experience</strong></p> <ul> <li>2+ years of experience working with high-volume software applications, with a strong focus on the TypeScript programming language.</li> <li>Ability to scope, work on, and independently deliver initiatives.</li> <li>Knowledge of at least one modern, strongly-typed programming language such as Go, Rust, or C++.</li> <li>Strong written communication skills for contributing to both internal and public-facing technical documentation, as well as authoring blog posts.</li> <li>Strong understanding of how web pages load and operate, including the role of cookies, browser rendering, and client-side execution models</li> </ul> <p><strong>Bonus Points</strong></p> <ul> <li>Familiarity with the ecosystem of third-party scripts (e.g., marketing pixels, analytics tags, consent managers) and their impact on performance, privacy, and user experience</li> <li>Experience building reliable, high-performance distributed systems or working on cloud platforms.</li> <li>Familiarity with the Cloudflare Workers development platform.</li> <li>Experience contributing to or maintaining open source software projects.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Locations:</strong> Lisbon</p> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi has a strong academic background and solid full-stack development experience, but the role at Cloudflare specifically demands deep TypeScript proficiency, Go or Rust expertise, and familiarity with web performance/privacy tooling (e.g., Cloudflare Workers, third-party scripts, browser rendering models) — areas where the candidate's resume shows limited or no evidence. The candidate's strengths lie heavily in AI/ML, RAG pipelines, and Python-based backends, which are largely orthogonal to this role's core focus on TypeScript-driven, high-volume web infrastructure. Additionally, the job is located in Lisbon or London (hybrid), which conflicts with the candidate's preference for remote work in the US or Canada, creating a significant location mismatch.
strengths: Strong full-stack development experience with React/TypeScript frontend and FastAPI/Node.js backend
C++ knowledge satisfies the 'strongly-typed language' requirement (Go/Rust/C++)
Experience with Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis, and distributed system components aligns with cloud-native development
High GPA (3.9) from University of Waterloo MEng in ECE with software engineering specialization
Demonstrated ability to own projects end-to-end, from architecture to deployment
Experience with REST APIs and WebSocket communication relevant to web application development
80%+ test coverage on personal projects shows commitment to code quality and reliability
Published research (ACM MM '23) demonstrates strong technical communication skills
missing_skills: TypeScript as a primary backend/systems language (candidate uses it mainly on the frontend)
Go or Rust programming experience (neither appears on the resume)
Cloudflare Workers or edge computing platform experience
Deep understanding of browser rendering, cookies, and client-side execution models
Familiarity with third-party scripts ecosystem (marketing pixels, analytics tags, consent managers)
Web performance and privacy analytics domain knowledge
Experience with high-volume, large-scale distributed web traffic systems
Open source project contribution or maintenance experience
interview_talking_points: Highlight C++ background as evidence of comfort with strongly-typed, systems-level languages, and express eagerness to ramp up on Go and Rust quickly
Emphasize the full-stack React/TypeScript project (AI Resume Generator) to demonstrate TypeScript familiarity and willingness to deepen expertise
Discuss the RAG system deployment with Docker, FastAPI, Redis caching, and streaming as evidence of building reliable, high-performance backend services at scale
Connect experience with WebSocket and streaming APIs to Cloudflare Workers' event-driven, edge-execution model
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication and technical documentation habits to address the role's emphasis on strong written communication and documentation
Address the location mismatch proactively — clarify willingness to relocate to Lisbon or London, or inquire about remote flexibility, as this is a critical factor for candidacy

matches.title: Software Engineer, Workers Deploy & Config
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Workers Deploy & Config
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><h3><strong>Position Location: Austin, TX | Lisbon, Portugal | London, UK</strong></h3> <h3><strong>Role Summary</strong></h3> <p>Join the Workers Deploy &amp; Config team, the engine behind Cloudflare's unique serverless, edge-computing developer platform. This isn't just another backend role; you'll be building the critical, large-scale systems that empower developers worldwide to deploy everything - from a personal static site to full-stack applications serving millions of users. In fact, you'll be building the very foundation that the rest of our developer platform—from Pages to R2—is built upon.</p> <p>You will tackle the complex challenges of distributed systems and high-traffic APIs every single day. Your mission? To build and scale the platform that lets customers upload, configure, and manage their Workers, ensuring it's incredibly fast, extremely resilient, and scales effortlessly. You’ll drive projects from the initial idea to global release, delivering solutions at every layer of the stack. You’ll get to master a diverse and modern tech stack, writing high-performance Go, architecting APIs, optimizing storage interactions, building Workers with JavaScript/TypeScript, and managing it all on Kubernetes.</p> <p>We're looking for engineers who are obsessed with the developer experience and thrive on solving large-scale problems with a track record to prove it. If you care as much about the quality of the user's experience as you do about the quality of your code, and you want to join a high-impact, fast-growing team helping to build a better Internet, we want to talk to you.</p> <h3><strong>Role Responsibilities</strong></h3> <p>This role is about solving some of the most challenging problems in large scale, distributed systems. You'll be making a massive, direct impact on the broader developer community.</p> <p><strong>Build &amp; Architect for Massive Scale</strong></p> <ul> <li>Own the core architecture of the Workers control plane, the system that deploys and configures millions of applications globally.</li> <li>Proactively identify and eliminate performance bottlenecks, re-architecting critical services to handle exponential growth.</li> <li>Design and implement resilient database schemas and read/write patterns built to support exponential platform growth and long-term usage.</li> <li>Evolve our services into a true developer platform, building the foundational capabilities that unlock future products.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Drive for Extreme Performance &amp; Reliability</strong></p> <ul> <li>Obsess over the developer experience, with a relentless focus on reducing API latency and increasing API availability.</li> <li>Own the reliability of one of Cloudflare’s most critical, customer-facing systems.</li> <li>Take pride in production ownership by participating in an on-call rotation to ensure our platform is always on.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Lead, Collaborate, &amp; Innovate</strong></p> <ul> <li>Partner directly with Product Managers and customers to translate complex problems into simple, elegant, and scalable solutions.</li> <li>Lead technical design from the ground up, collaborating with a brilliant, globally-distributed team of engineers.</li> <li>Act as a mentor and knowledge-sharer, leveling up the entire team.</li> <li>Constantly research, prototype, and introduce cutting-edge technologies to solve new classes of problems.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Role Requirements (Must-Have Skills)</strong></h3> <h3><strong>Must-Have Skills</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Strong experience using Go</li> <li>Experience with Javascript and Typescript</li> <li>Experience with metrics and observability tools such as Prometheus and Grafana</li> <li>Experience with SQL and common relational database systems such as PostgreSQL</li> <li>Experience with Kubernetes or similar deployment tools</li> <li>Experience with distributed systems</li> <li>Proven ability to drive projects independently, from concept to implementation – gathering requirements, writing technical specifications, implementing, testing, and releasing</li> <li>Familiarity with implementing and consuming RESTful APIs</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Nice-to-Have Skills</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Experience with C++ or Rust</li> <li>Experience scaling systems to meet increasing performance and usability demands</li> <li>Experience working on a control and/or data plane</li> <li>Experience using Cloudflare Workers or Pages</li> <li>Experience working in frontend frameworks such as React</li> <li>Experience managing interns or mentoring junior engineers</li> <li>Product mindset and comfortable talking to customers and partners</li> <li>Familiarity with GraphQL</li> <li>Familiarity with RPC</li> </ul> <h3>&nbsp;</h3><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong candidate in AI/ML, full-stack development, and backend engineering, but this Cloudflare role is specifically focused on distributed systems, high-performance infrastructure, and Go-based backend engineering — areas where the candidate's resume shows limited direct evidence. The candidate demonstrates solid fundamentals (PostgreSQL, REST APIs, Docker, JavaScript/TypeScript, C++) and a strong academic background, but critically lacks Go experience, Kubernetes, observability tooling (Prometheus/Grafana), and distributed systems work at scale, which are all must-have requirements. The location is also a partial mismatch, as the role is hybrid in Austin TX, Lisbon, or London, while the candidate prefers remote/Canada.
strengths: Strong academic credentials: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with software engineering specialization, plus BASc from UBC (GPA 3.7, Dean's Honor List)
Experience with PostgreSQL, REST APIs, and Docker — all listed as job requirements
JavaScript/TypeScript experience aligns with the job's JS/TS requirement
C++ listed in skills, which is a nice-to-have for this role
Demonstrated ability to drive end-to-end projects independently (RAG system, AI Agent pipeline) from concept to deployment
React frontend experience matches a nice-to-have skill
FastAPI and WebSocket experience shows solid backend API development capability
Published research (ACM MM '23) demonstrates technical depth and ability to tackle complex problems
missing_skills: Go (Golang) — the primary language for this role; no mention anywhere on the resume
Kubernetes or equivalent container orchestration — not listed in skills
Prometheus and/or Grafana — observability/metrics tooling not mentioned
Distributed systems design and architecture at scale — no direct experience demonstrated
Control plane / data plane engineering experience
Cloudflare Workers or Pages experience
GraphQL familiarity
On-call production ownership and SRE-style reliability engineering
interview_talking_points: Highlight end-to-end project ownership: the RAG system at Disanji (FastAPI + Docker Compose + Redis + streaming) and the AI Agent Resume Generator show you can independently drive projects from design to production deployment — directly matching Cloudflare's requirement for independent project execution

Emphasize PostgreSQL and REST API experience: your hands-on use of PostgreSQL and REST API design in multiple projects maps directly to must-have requirements; be ready to discuss schema design decisions and API performance considerations
Leverage C++ as a differentiator: C++ is listed as a nice-to-have; your background in embedded and systems-level programming signals you can learn Go quickly and work close to the metal

Address the Go gap proactively: acknowledge you haven't used Go professionally but draw parallels to your Python/C++ systems experience and express concrete steps you've taken or plan to take to ramp up (e.g., side projects, Go tour)

Connect AI/ML background to developer experience: Cloudflare values developer experience obsession; your work building evaluation pipelines and quality-gated routing shows you think deeply about system quality and user-facing outcomes
Discuss Docker and containerization depth: your use of Docker Compose in production deployments is a bridge to Kubernetes — frame it as a natural next step in your infrastructure journey

Title: Software Engineer- AI
Company: Cloudflare
Location: In-Office
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Available Location: Bengaluru, India</strong></p> <p><strong>About the Team:</strong></p> <div>As customer zero, we evangelize our products to drive maximum business value while serving as the "glue" that aligns cross-functional stakeholders with our technical ecosystem. We operate with an <strong>automation-first mindset</strong>, purposefully outgrowing yesterday’s processes to create the headspace needed to solve tomorrow’s problems. On this team, you won't just maintain the status quo—you'll foster the collaboration and innovation necessary to ensure our products and people work better together.</div> <div><strong>&nbsp;</strong></div> <div><strong>Enablement</strong>: We evangelize and elevate awareness around our product offerings and opportunities to leverage our own product for business value capabilities<br><br><strong>Be the glue</strong>: Like the many products we have, it only works if it all works well together.&nbsp; Finding common ground to enhanced cross-functional collaboration and alignment with business stakeholders will strengthen customer and product common ground.<br><br><strong>Automation First mindset:</strong>&nbsp; We can only truly do our best work when we have the space to reimagine how we solve tomorrow's problems today.&nbsp; It's okay that what worked well yesterday may not be what we need for tomorrow.</div> <div>&nbsp;</div> <p><strong>About this Role:</strong></p> <p>We are seeking a highly experienced LLM Developer to join our team. In this role, you will lead the development of our internal AI initiatives, starting with taking ownership of the Cloudflare IT support chatbot. You will be responsible for designing and executing new AI use cases that directly improve employee experience and productivity across the organization. You will leverage Cloudflare’s own ecosystem, including AI Gateway, to build scalable, production-ready AI applications.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Take ownership of the development and maintenance of the internally built Cloudflare IT support chatbot, ensuring high availability and continuous improvement of response quality.</li> <li>Identify, design, and build new AI-driven use cases and tools to enhance employee productivity and streamline internal workflows.</li> <li>Develop and deploy AI applications at scale, ensuring reliability, performance, and security.</li> <li>Integrate and optimize AI applications using Cloudflare’s AI Gateway to manage and monitor model usage effectively.</li> <li>Partner closely with internal teams to understand their pain points and translate them into technical AI solutions.</li> <li>Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in LLMs and Generative AI to continuously innovate our internal toolset.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience in software development, with a strong focus on AI, Machine Learning, or Agentic applications.</li> <li>Proven experience in the development and deployment of AI applications at scale in a production environment with focus on strong authorization and data privacy.</li> <li>Familiarity with Cloudflare AI Gateway and experience managing API traffic for LLMs.</li> <li>Strong proficiency in TypeScript and experience with relevant AI/ML libraries and frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, LangChain).</li> <li>Experience with observability and configuration management, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), and CI/CD pipelines (GitLab/GitHub), Grafana, OTEL, K8s etc.</li> <li>Experience and expertise in Agile methodology.</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in written and spoken English.</li> <li>Prior experience working on enterprise engineering teams or building internal developer tools is a plus.</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong AI/ML and LLM engineering skills — particularly in RAG pipelines, LangChain, and full-stack development — that align well with the core technical demands of this Software Engineer - AI role at Cloudflare. However, the candidate falls significantly short on the experience requirement (5+ years required vs. ~1–2 years of internship-level experience), lacks familiarity with Cloudflare-specific tooling (AI Gateway), and the role is strictly in-office in Bengaluru, India, which is incompatible with the candidate's preferred remote/hybrid locations in the US or Canada. The salary range is also unspecified by Cloudflare, making alignment uncertain given the India-based role likely targets a lower compensation band than the candidate's $100K–$200K expectation.
strengths: Strong hands-on RAG pipeline experience using LangChain, LangGraph, ChromaDB, BM25, and vector databases (Milvus) — directly relevant to the chatbot and AI use-case development responsibilities
Production-grade AI deployment experience with FastAPI, Docker, Redis, and streaming (SSE/WebSocket), demonstrating ability to build scalable AI applications
Demonstrated LLM evaluation expertise using RAGAS and custom ATS/LLM self-critique pipelines, showing maturity in AI quality assurance
Full-stack proficiency (React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL) aligns with the role's need to build end-to-end internal AI tools
Published AI research (ACM MM '23) and strong academic credentials (GPA 3.9, Dean's Honor List) signal high learning potential and technical depth
Experience with multi-agent architectures (LangGraph 4-agent pipeline) is directly applicable to Agentic AI application development mentioned in requirements
missing_skills: 5+ years of professional software development experience (candidate has ~1–2 years of internship experience)
Cloudflare AI Gateway familiarity and API traffic management for LLMs
Infrastructure as Code (Terraform) experience
Observability tooling: Grafana, OpenTelemetry (OTEL)
Kubernetes (K8s) orchestration experience
CI/CD pipeline experience with GitLab
Strong TypeScript proficiency (candidate lists JavaScript but not TypeScript explicitly in skills)
Enterprise-scale production AI deployment with authorization and data privacy focus
Agile methodology formal experience in a team setting
interview_talking_points: Lead with the RAG system built at Disanji Technology — highlight the 35% retrieval precision improvement, RAGAS evaluation score of 0.84, and production deployment via Docker + FastAPI, as this maps directly to the IT support chatbot ownership responsibility
Emphasize the AI Agent Resume Generator project's LangGraph multi-agent architecture, dual-layer evaluation system, and 80%+ test coverage to demonstrate production-readiness and quality mindset

Address the experience gap proactively by showcasing the breadth and depth of shipped AI systems — argue that project complexity and research publication (ACM MM '23) compensate for years of experience

Highlight TypeScript usage in React/TypeScript projects to partially address the TypeScript proficiency requirement, and express willingness to deepen expertise in Cloudflare's ecosystem (AI Gateway, Workers AI)
Discuss automation-first thinking by referencing the automated RAGAS evaluation pipeline and end-to-end data pipelines, aligning with Cloudflare's stated 'automation-first mindset'

ClickHouse-backed systems).</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="12">Work on modern, AI-enabled components such as vector search, MCP-based services, and AI-powered application features.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="13">Participate in design reviews, knowledge sharing, and mentorship, helping raise the technical bar across the team.</span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="14">Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience</span></strong></p> <ul class="gdAMzb"> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="16">6+ years of professional experience building and operating production systems, ideally across backend, data, and application layers.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="17">Strong proficiency in one or more systems or backend languages such as Go, Java, or Python, with the ability to data-ast-node-id="19">Proven experience building modern web applications, including JavaScript/TypeScript and React, and collaborating effectively across frontend and backend boundaries.</span></li> Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>

matches.title: Senior Backend Developer
matches.description:
Title: Senior Backend Developer Company: TripleTen Location: Berlin Workplace: remote Description:


At TripleTen , we’re creating innovative learning products that empower people to master IT professions like software engineering, data science, business intelligence, and QA — no matter their prior experience. Our AI-driven and thoughtfully designed platform helps students build real skills and access meaningful career opportunities. We're passionate about making education accessible, engaging, and empowering for everyone.

We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to lead the evolution of our multitenant infrastructure and access management services. This isn't just about writing tickets; you will be a core architect of the systems that ensure our platform remains secure, scalable, and robust.


﻿The Tech Stack

  • Core: Python 3.x (FastAPI)
  • Data & Messaging: Postgres, Kafka
  • Infrastructure: AWS, Kubernetes, Helm
  • CI/CD: GitLab CI
  • Patterns: DDD, Onion Architecture




What you will do:


  • ﻿Architect & Build: Design and maintain high-performance server-side applications with a focus on multitenancy and IAM.
  • Product Partnership: Share end-to-end ownership of the product lifecycle with your Product Manager — from initial discovery and requirement sharpening to deployment.
  • Technical Excellence: Implement DDD and Clean Architecture principles to keep our codebase maintainable and easy to extend.


What we can offer you:


  • ﻿Fully remote, full-time role with flexible hours to balance work and personal life.
  • Paid parental leave and paid sick leave to ensure your well-being.
  • A supportive and inclusive team where empathy, respect, and open communication are valued.
  • Opportunities for learning, mentorship, and professional growth.
  • Competitive compensation with transparent working conditions.
  • A suite of thoughtfully chosen collaboration tools: Miro, Notion, Google Workspace.


*At this time, we are unable to offer H-1B, L-1A/B sponsorship opportunities.


**This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.

﻿

**TripleTen is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, protected military/veteran status, or any other legally protected factor.



Brand:
TripleTen
Requirements


  • ﻿Multitenancy Expert: You understand the nuances of data isolation, tenant-specific configurations, and the complexities of shared infrastructure.
  • Deep Roots in Statically Typed Languages: You have an extensive background in C#, Java, Kotlin or similar languages. You understand the structural discipline, strict typing, and design patterns that these ecosystems demand.
  • Ready to Master Python: Our primary stack is Python 3.x/FastAPI. You don't need to be a Python expert on day one, but you are eager to translate your architectural expertise into the Python world and are a fast enough learner to hit the ground running.
  • Architecturally Disciplined: You don’t just "write code"; you apply DDD and Clean Architecture because you’ve seen what happens to "spaghetti" projects at scale.
  • Testing Advocate: You believe that code isn't finished until it’s tested (Unit, Integration, and ideally TDD).
  • Collaborative: You value Agile principles and enjoy investing in team processes, mentoring, and collective growth.
  • Fluent in English: Able to articulate complex technical trade-offs to both engineers and stakeholders.

Find Jobs in Germany on Arbeitnow Requirements: Remote
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi has a strong academic foundation and solid Python/FastAPI experience that partially aligns with TripleTen's core stack, but the role demands a Senior Backend Engineer with deep expertise in statically typed languages (C#, Java, Kotlin), multitenancy/IAM architecture, DDD, and Kubernetes — areas where the candidate shows little to no demonstrated experience. The candidate is mid-level with ~1 year of internship experience, while the role explicitly seeks a senior architect capable of leading infrastructure evolution. The location is technically compatible (fully remote), but the job is Berlin-based and the candidate prefers US/Canada, which may introduce timezone and legal hiring constraints.
strengths: Proficient in Python and FastAPI, which is the core backend stack at TripleTen
Hands-on experience with PostgreSQL, Kafka, Docker, and Redis — all relevant to the job's data and messaging layer
Demonstrated ability to build production-grade systems (RAG pipeline with FastAPI, SSE streaming, Redis caching)
Strong academic credentials: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with software engineering specialization
Experience with AWS, which aligns with TripleTen's infrastructure stack
Exposure to testing practices with 80%+ test coverage noted in a project
Full-stack versatility (React/TypeScript, WebSocket) adds product partnership value
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates technical depth and communication ability
missing_skills: Multitenancy and IAM (Identity & Access Management) architecture — a core requirement
Statically typed language expertise: C#, Java (listed but not demonstrated), or Kotlin
Domain-Driven Design (DDD) and Clean/Onion Architecture patterns
Kubernetes and Helm for infrastructure orchestration
GitLab CI/CD pipeline experience
Senior-level system design and architectural leadership experience
Test-Driven Development (TDD) methodology
Agile team leadership and mentoring experience
interview_talking_points: Highlight your FastAPI production experience — specifically the RAG system deployed with Docker Compose, FastAPI, and Redis, which mirrors TripleTen's core stack closely
Emphasize your AWS and Kafka familiarity as direct overlaps with their infrastructure, and express eagerness to expand into Kubernetes/Helm

Address the statically typed language gap proactively: mention Java from your skills list and frame your C++ background as evidence of structural, type-disciplined thinking transferable to C# or Kotlin patterns
Showcase your 80%+ test coverage achievement in the Resume Generator project as evidence of a testing-first mindset, and express interest in adopting TDD formally
Discuss your end-to-end ownership of projects (from architecture to deployment) to demonstrate readiness for the product partnership model TripleTen values
Be transparent about your mid-level status but position your MEng specialization and rapid project delivery as indicators of accelerated growth toward senior responsibilities

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Data Science
Company: Datadog
Location: Bordeaux, France; Lyon, France; Madrid, Spain; Nantes, France; Paris, France; Sophia Antipolis, France
Description: <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The Data Science team designs and builds algorithmically driven features in the Datadog app. We work across a range of applications, primarily focusing on analysis on streaming data such as </span><a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/watchdog/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">anomaly detection</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">, </span><a href="https://docs.datadoghq.com/logs/explorer/watchdog_insights/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">error outliers</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and </span><a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/faulty-deployment-detection/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">faulty deployment analysis</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. As a Software Engineer on the Data Science team, you will design, build and scale the backend systems that power our growing suite of </span><a href="https://docs.datadoghq.com/watchdog/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Watchdog products</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. You will be working on large-scale distributed systems, horizontally-scalable datastores and a variety of data-processing frameworks to build our next-generation platform and capabilities for Data Science at Datadog.&nbsp;</span></p> <p><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.</span></em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You’ll Do:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Build common services and components encapsulating data science capabilities for other products and teams to leverage</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Enable new capabilities for our core products by integrating and preprocessing data from tens of sources and preparing it for incorporation into data science models</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Ensure that our data science-driven features continue to scale well as Datadog adds more customers and ingests more data per customer</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Leverage modern tools and frameworks to improve the performance and cost-efficiency of data science services</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Join an amazing team of data scientists and software engineers building a product that our customers love to use</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Work all over the stack, moving fluidly between programming languages and technologies</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"><br></span></li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Who You Are:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">You have experience working in Python, Java, Scala or Go&nbsp;</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">You have experience working with microservices and/or distributed systems</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">You value simplicity and getting the right things done</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">(Senior Level) You have built high-volume data pipelines</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">(Senior Level) You have expertise in Python, Go or Scala and are familiar with Spark or Flink</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;"><span data-sheets-root="1">You’re excited about leveraging AI tools to enhance how you code, solve problems, and build – or eager to learn how</span></span></li> </ul> <p><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.&nbsp;</span></em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Benefits and Growth:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Competitive global benefits&nbsp;</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Opportunity to collaborate closely with colleagues across the Datadog offices in New York City and Paris</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Opportunity to attend and present at conferences and meetups</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking</span></li> <li><span style="font-weight: 400;">An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;"><em>Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</em></span></p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-ER1</p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Hybrid</p><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>About Datadog:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on <a href="https://www.instagram.com/datadoghq/?hl=en" target="_blank">Instagram</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/datadog" target="_blank">LinkedIn,</a> and <a href="https://learn.datadoghq.com/" target="_blank">Datadog Learning Center. </a></p> <hr> <p data-renderer-start-pos="215"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Equal Opportunity at Datadog:</strong></p> <p>Datadog is proud to offer <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf" target="_blank">equal employment opportunity</a> to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/candidate-legal-notices/" target="_blank">Candidate Legal Notices</a> for your reference.&nbsp;</p> <p>Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeoJeduEZ2NdZF_65uZmWUrCM-zee7yADXX1s6Xr9zAGq8iKA/viewform" target="_blank">this form</a>. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.&nbsp;</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Privacy and AI Guidelines:</strong></p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662">Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice</a>. For information on our AI policy, please visit <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/interviewing-at-datadog-ai-guidelines/" target="_blank">Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian has a strong academic background and solid Python/AI/ML skills that partially align with Datadog's Data Science team needs, particularly around data pipelines and backend systems. However, the role is a Senior-level position requiring expertise in distributed systems, high-volume streaming data pipelines, and tools like Spark or Flink — areas where the candidate's experience is limited to internships and academic projects. The most significant mismatch is location: the candidate prefers remote/US/Canada, while the role is exclusively based in European cities (France/Spain) with a hybrid requirement.
strengths: Strong Python proficiency demonstrated across multiple projects and internships
Hands-on experience building data pipelines (RAG pipeline with 500+ page document processing, 5,000+ image data pipeline)
Familiarity with backend technologies relevant to the role: FastAPI, Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis, Kafka
AI/ML depth including LLM, LangChain, LangGraph, RAG, and Computer Vision — aligns with Datadog's AI-leveraging culture
Experience with streaming concepts (SSE streaming, WebSocket, Redis semantic caching)
