matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Data Orchestration
Company: Stripe
Location: N/A
Description: <h2>Who we are</h2> <h3>About Stripe</h3> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</span></p> <p><strong>About the team&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>The Big Data Infrastructure operates the critical infrastructure that powers the batch data processing at Stripe. The team supports a variety of use cases, including Payment, Ledger, ML, Fraud Detection, Product Analytics, Regulatory Reporting, Financial Data Reconciliation, and externally facing products like Radar and Sigma. As an example of the scale, the team’s systems serve hundreds of teams, thousands of workflows, 100,000+ task executions, O(billion) transformations, and moving terabytes of data processing over 1 GB/second every day. Our users inside Stripe include other engineering teams, Data Scientists, Sales &amp; Operations, Finance, etc.&nbsp;</p> <p>Data Orchestration builds and operates the time-based and event-based orchestration infrastructure that powers and accelerates batch data pipelines. The team operates on a wide range of tech stacks including Airflow, Spark, SQL, Kafka, Flink, Hive MetaStore, Trino, Pinot, Python, Java, Scala, S3, and Iceberg.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What you’ll do&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>As a Software Engineer on our team, you will do the following:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Design, build, and maintain innovative next-generation or first-generation versions of key Data Platform products, with an emphasis on usability, reliability, security, and efficiency.&nbsp;</li> <li>Design ergonomic APIs and abstractions that build a great customer experience for internal Stripes, that will in turn enhance the experience of millions of Stripe users.</li> <li>Ensure operational excellence and enable a highly available &amp; reliable Data Orchestration platform across batch workloads.&nbsp;</li> <li>Collaborate nimbly with high-visibility teams and their stakeholders to support their key initiatives - while building a robust platform that benefits all of Stripe in the long term.&nbsp;</li> <li>Plan for the growth of Stripe’s infrastructure by unblocking, supporting, and communicating proactively with internal partners to achieve results. ● Connect your work with improvements in the usability and reliability of Open Source Software (OSS) like Apache Airflow, Iceberg, Spark and contribute back to the OSS community.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Who you are&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.&nbsp;</p> <p>Minimum requirements&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>8+ years of professional experience writing high quality production level code or software programs and interest in Data Infrastructure.&nbsp;</li> <li>Has experience operating or enabling large-scale, high-availability data pipelines from design, to execution and safe change management. Expertise in Spark, Flink, Spark, Airflow, Python, Java, SQL, and API design is a plus.&nbsp;</li> <li>Has experience developing, maintaining, and debugging distributed systems built with open source tools&nbsp;</li> <li>Has experience building infrastructure-as-a-product with a strong focus on users needs&nbsp;</li> <li>Has strong collaboration and communication skills, and can comfortably interact with both technical and non-technical participants.&nbsp;</li> <li>Has the curiosity to continuously learn about new technologies and business processes.&nbsp;</li> <li>Is energized by delivering effective, user-first solutions through creative problem-solving and collaboration.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>Preferred qualifications&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Has experience writing production-level code in Expertise in Scala, Spark, Flink, Spark, Airflow, Python, Java, and SQL is a plus.</li> <li>Has experience designing APIs or building developer platforms ● Has experience optimizing the end to end performance of distributed systems ● Has experience with scaling distributed systems in a rapidly moving environment ● Has experience working with Airflow Infrastructure.&nbsp;</li> <li>Genuine enjoyment of innovation and a deep interest in understanding how things work&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.&nbsp;</p> <p>Office location - Bengaluru , KA, India&nbsp;</p>

matches.title: Software Engineer, Secrets Infrastructure
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Secrets Infrastructure
Company: Stripe
Location: na
Description: <h2>Who we are</h2> <h3>About Stripe</h3> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</span></p> <h3>About the team</h3> <p>The Secrets Infrastructure team provides the cryptographic identity and secrets management foundation for Stripe. We build and operate the internal certificate authority that authenticates every person and service at Stripe, and the secrets platform that manages everything from financial partner credentials to infrastructure access keys.</p> <p>We build foundational security infrastructure at scale: our certificate authority issues mTLS client certificate identities for thousands of services and engineers, and our secrets platform and libraries protect access to critical financial systems and external partners across all of Stripe’s codebases, services, and platforms. The technical challenges include building systems with 99.99%+ availability, implementing TLS workload identity and attestation logic for new platforms, and designing secret management tools that are both secure and user-friendly. Our infrastructure must be both reliable and developer-friendly—we maintain libraries in Go, Java, Ruby, and Python. As a small team responsible for critical systems, engineers take on meaningful ownership. Through collaboration with teams across Stripe, you'll build and set direction for the authentication and secrets management underpin identity in distributed systems at scale.&nbsp;</p> <p>Secrets Infrastructure is a fully remote team, with a small presence in the Seattle and New York City offices. We pride ourselves on a friendly, technically rigorous, and supportive team culture.</p> <h3>What you'll do</h3> <p>You'll be responsible for TLS identity and secrets infrastructure that every Stripe service depends on. You'll build infrastructure, developer tools, and guide partner teams on architecture decisions; we regularly need to help other teams reason about cryptographic primitives and PKI, transitive trust, potential failure modes and threat models.&nbsp;</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Since our infrastructure and libraries are used across the entire Stripe codebase, you'll work in Go, Java, Ruby, and Python. The services we own are written in Go, so most of your hands-on work will be in Go. The typical balance of hands-on work is about 60% coding, 20% infrastructure work, and 20% security design/guidance with partner teams.</p> <h3>Responsibilities</h3> <ul> <li>Design and implement significant features in our certificate authority and secrets management systems</li> <li>Work across Go, Java, Ruby, and Python to implement authentication and secrets infrastructure used by every service at Stripe</li> <li>Work with with other engineering teams to understand their needs and design secrets and identity integrations</li> <li>Develop certificate provisioning and secret management integrations for various compute platforms (Kubernetes, EC2, developer workstations)</li> <li>Work on reliability improvements to maintain 99.99%+ availability for critical infrastructure; we take pride in making failure modes impossible instead of reacting to them</li> <li>Participate in on-call rotation for critical infrastructure, working alongside senior engineers to debug and resolve production issues</li> </ul> <h3>Who you are</h3> <p>We’re looking for a senior candidate who has enough prior experience in security, backend API development, and infrastructure to quickly take responsibility for significant projects. We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.&nbsp;</p> <h3>Minimum requirements</h3> <ul> <li>5+ years of professional software development experience. Strong programming skills in Go, with significant experience in other similar system programming languages (C++, Rust, C#, etc) as a potential alternative.</li> <li>3+ years of infrastructure and security experience (can overlap with other experience)</li> <li>Experience in cryptography, PKI, secret management, or other security topics</li> <li>Familiarity with infrastructure tools like Kubernetes, Terraform, and cloud platforms</li> <li>Interest in security, infrastructure, and software development</li> <li>Enthusiasm for learning new technologies and working across multiple programming languages</li> <li>Strong debugging and problem-solving skills; the team maintains and troubleshoots integrations across all Stripe languages and infrastructure</li> <li>Clear verbal and written communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with other engineers</li> <li>Experience leading cross-team projects and building alignment on multi-team technical direction</li> <li>Strong technical writing skills to write design documents</li> <li>On-call experience</li> </ul> <h3>Preferred qualifications</h3> <ul> <li>Prior experience building PKI or secret management infrastructure (as an SWE - not just provisioning a 3rd party tool or service)</li> <li>Experience in Java, Ruby, or Python</li> <li>Experience building developer tools, libraries, or platform services</li> <li>Experience with kubernetes internals (how the platform works, not just as a user)</li> <li>Experience operating complex services on AWS</li> <li>Experience in fully remote work environments</li> </ul>

matches.title: Software Engineer, macOS Core Product - Dortmund, Germany
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, macOS Core Product - Dortmund, Germany Company: Speechify Location: Dortmund, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany Description:

About Speechify

At Speechify, our mission is to ensure reading is never a barrier to learning. Over 50 million people use Speechify's text-to-speech products—including apps on iOS, Android, macOS, Chrome, and web—to listen to PDFs, books, docs, and web content faster, smarter, and more joyfully than ever before. Our product has earned recognition from Google (Chrome Extension of the Year) and Apple (App of the Day and 2025 Inclusivity Design Award) for its impact and accessibility. 

We're a fully remote, distributed team of engineers, designers, researchers, and product builders from world-class companies like Amazon, Microsoft, Google, Stripe, and more. We move fast, ship often, and love solving real user problems.

Role Overview

As a Software Engineer on the macOS team, you'll help build and scale Speechify's core desktop experience for millions of users. You'll own significant parts of our macOS app architecture, ship production-ready code, and collaborate closely with product, design, and engineering teams across the company.

This is a key role for someone who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment, enjoys making high-impact product decisions, loves delightful user experiences, and has a passion for accessibility and performance.

What You'll Do

  • Lead key engineering and product decisions for the macOS app.
  • Write, test, and ship production-quality code that scales to millions of users.
  • Maintain and evolve complex app architecture with a focus on performance and stability.
  • Work within a cross-functional team, partnering with designers and PMs to shape features from concept to launch.
  • Participate in product planning and roadmap discussions.
  • Drive continuous improvement in code quality, CI/CD processes, and development workflows.

You should have:

  • Demonstrated experience shipping macOS (or related desktop) applications used by many customers.
  • Strong engineering instincts with a deep focus on user experience.
  • A strategic mindset for building great products—not just writing code.
  • Ability to work quickly, decide what to build now vs. later, and iterate fast.
  • Experience working in remote, distributed teams.

Technical requirements:

  • Swift / SwiftUI (macOS) proficiency.
  • Solid understanding of AppKit, macOS frameworks, and desktop-specific UI paradigms.
  • Strong understanding of concurrency and asynchronous execution models
  • Familiarity with Bitrise, CI/CD workflows (e.g., Xcode Cloud, GitHub Actions).
  • Strong understanding of concurrency and asynchronous execution models

What We offer:

  • Impact & Ownership: Build and influence a product used by millions globally.
  • Remote First: Flexible, asynchronous work culture.
  • Growth & Leadership: Flat org — leadership is earned by impact, not title.
  • Collaborative Environment: Work with smart, passionate engineers and designers.
  • Competitive Compensation: Market-aligned salary, bonus, and equity.

Why Join Speechify?

At Speechify, we ship fast, build for real users, and care deeply about quality and accessibility. You'll work on products that change lives, and your contributions will shape both the product and the company.

If this sounds like your kind of challenge, we'd love to hear from you. Apply with your resume and links to your portfolio or GitHub!

Think you're a good fit for this job? 

Tell us more about yourself and why you're interested in the role when you apply.
And don't forget to include links to your portfolio and LinkedIn.

Not looking but know someone who would make a great fit? 

Refer them! 

Speechify is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Speechify does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Find more English Speaking Jobs in Germany on Arbeitnow

The technical stack mismatch is severe: the job is entirely focused on Apple's native desktop ecosystem, while the candidate's experience centers on Python, RAG pipelines, LangChain, FastAPI, and React. While the candidate's education is impressive and their remote work compatibility is partial, the location preference (Remote/US/Canada) conflicts with the job's Dortmund, Germany posting, and the salary range is unspecified by the employer, making alignment uncertain.
strengths: Strong academic background with a 3.9 GPA MEng from University of Waterloo in Software Engineering
Demonstrated experience with CI/CD workflows (Docker, GitHub Actions implied via Docker Compose deployments)
Experience working on production-grade systems with real users (RAG system, AI agent pipeline)
Familiarity with asynchronous execution models via WebSocket and FastAPI async/streaming patterns
Full-stack development experience with React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, and Docker
Published research at ACM MM '23, demonstrating technical depth and communication skills
GitHub portfolio available, which Speechify explicitly requests
missing_skills: Swift programming language — the primary language for this role
SwiftUI — the core UI framework required
AppKit — explicitly required for macOS desktop UI paradigms
macOS application development experience — no desktop app experience shown
Bitrise CI/CD — specifically mentioned in job requirements
Xcode Cloud — mentioned as a CI/CD tool for the role
Desktop-specific UI/UX paradigms and performance optimization for macOS
Concurrency models specific to Swift (async/await, actors, GCD)
interview_talking_points: Highlight your async/concurrent programming experience via FastAPI SSE streaming and WebSocket implementations as a bridge to Swift concurrency concepts
Emphasize your CI/CD experience with Docker Compose and containerized deployments as evidence of DevOps maturity transferable to Xcode Cloud/Bitrise
Mention your C++ background as evidence of systems-level programming capability, which is adjacent to native macOS development
Discuss your published ACM MM research to demonstrate you can work on complex, user-facing technical products at scale
If applying, be transparent about your willingness to learn Swift/SwiftUI rapidly and reference any self-study or side projects you can quickly build to demonstrate macOS aptitude

matches.title: Senior Staff Software Engineer
matches.description:
Title: Senior Staff Software Engineer 
Company: Datadog
Location: New York, New York, USA
Description: <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true" data-pm-slice="0 0 []"><strong data-prosemirror-content-type="mark" data-prosemirror-mark-name="strong">About Datadog:</strong></p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—providing always-on alerting, metrics visualization, logs, and application tracing for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way.</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">&nbsp;</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true"><strong data-prosemirror-content-type="mark" data-prosemirror-mark-name="strong">The Opportunity:</strong></p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Datadog’s Senior Staff Engineers are technical leaders operating at the forefront of large-scale systems design, building the infrastructure that will support our next five years of growth and beyond. They do this in three major ways:</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">As individual contributors, they bring world-class technical depth to build industry-leading systems in areas such as observability data platforms, distributed query engines, and real-time event streaming at global scale.</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">As technical leaders, they apply broad architectural perspective and deep systems thinking to align design decisions across teams and domains. They work across complex, multi-team problem spaces to define long-term technical direction, drive large-scale initiatives forward, and ensure consistent execution.</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">As engineering stewards, they play a key role in evolving our systems and engineering culture. They actively participate in Datadog’s senior technical community, bringing external insights and internal experience to elevate engineering standards and mentor the next generation of technical leaders.</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Examples of projects a Senior Staff Engineer may lead include designing and launching a new distributed data storage engine capable of handling hundreds of millions of records per second, building the real-time infrastructure behind a new observability product, or re-architecting a core service to support exponential growth in throughput and complexity.</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">&nbsp;</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true"><strong data-prosemirror-content-type="mark" data-prosemirror-mark-name="strong">What You’ll Do:</strong></p> <ul> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Be the technical owner of multiple critical systems or architecture areas, often spanning several teams or product lines.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Drive the design and delivery of high-scale, high-impact projects, from vision to execution in production.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Build consensus and alignment across stakeholders on key architectural decisions and long-term strategy.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Deeply investigate and optimize performance, reliability, and efficiency in large-scale distributed systems.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Collaborate with Staff Engineers, Directors, and VPs across the company to shape Datadog’s technical roadmap.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Guide teams through ambiguity, scaling challenges, and evolving requirements with clear technical direction.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Actively mentor engineers and influence engineering culture through leadership in design reviews, technical talks, and working groups.<br data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="hardBreak" data-prosemirror-node-inline="true"><br></li> </ul> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true"><strong data-prosemirror-content-type="mark" data-prosemirror-mark-name="strong">Who You Are:</strong></p> <ul> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent practical experience.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">You have 10+ years of backend, infrastructure, or distributed systems engineering experience.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">You have 4+ years of experience leading complex technical initiatives and cross-team projects.<br data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="hardBreak" data-prosemirror-node-inline="true">You have designed and delivered systems that are deeply technical, highly reliable, and serve critical business needs.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">You can navigate and make progress in ambiguous problem spaces, identifying the right problems to solve.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">You have exceptional communication skills, with the ability to align diverse stakeholders around a shared technical vision.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">You have deep expertise in one or more core systems domains—such as distributed storage, event streaming, networking, data infrastructure, or large-scale observability—and broad awareness of adjacent areas.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">You care about getting things right, not just getting them done, and you raise the bar for engineering quality around you.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">You have demonstrated ability to use AI coding tools in day-to-day workflows and validate, critique, and refine AI-generated output</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Bonus: You’re motivated to push the boundaries of how AI can improve software engineering best practices and contribute to building AI-enabled products</li> </ul> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true"><em data-prosemirror-content-type="mark" data-prosemirror-mark-name="em">Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.</em></p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">&nbsp;</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true"><strong data-prosemirror-content-type="mark" data-prosemirror-mark-name="strong">Benefits and Growth:</strong></p> <ul> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Get to build tools for software engineers, just like yourself. And use the tools we build to accelerate our development.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Have a lot of influence on product direction and impact on the business .</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Work with skilled, knowledgeable, and kind teammates who are happy to teach and learn</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Competitive global benefits</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Continuous professional development</li> </ul> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true"><em data-prosemirror-content-type="mark" data-prosemirror-mark-name="em">Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</em></p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">&nbsp;</p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Hybrid</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.</p></div><div class="title">The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$272,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$340,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>About Datadog:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on <a href="https://www.instagram.com/datadoghq/?hl=en" target="_blank">Instagram</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/datadog" target="_blank">LinkedIn,</a> and <a href="https://learn.datadoghq.com/" target="_blank">Datadog Learning Center. </a></p> <hr> <p data-renderer-start-pos="215"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Equal Opportunity at Datadog:</strong></p> <p>Datadog is proud to offer <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf" target="_blank">equal employment opportunity</a> to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/candidate-legal-notices/" target="_blank">Candidate Legal Notices</a> for your reference.&nbsp;</p> <p>Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeoJeduEZ2NdZF_65uZmWUrCM-zee7yADXX1s6Xr9zAGq8iKA/viewform" target="_blank">this form</a>. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.&nbsp;</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Privacy and AI Guidelines:</strong></p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662">Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice</a>. For information on our AI policy, please visit <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/interviewing-at-datadog-ai-guidelines/" target="_blank">Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a mid-level candidate with strong AI/ML and full-stack skills, but this role is a Senior Staff Software Engineer position at Datadog requiring 10+ years of backend/distributed systems experience and 4+ years of cross-team technical leadership — areas where the candidate has virtually no demonstrated depth. While the candidate shows promising technical breadth (RAG pipelines, LangChain, FastAPI, Docker), the role demands world-class expertise in large-scale distributed systems, observability infrastructure, and organizational leadership that is far beyond the candidate's current career stage. The location is also a mismatch, as the role is NYC-based hybrid while the candidate prefers remote/Canada.
strengths: Strong academic credentials with a 3.9 GPA MEng from University of Waterloo and 3.7 GPA BASc from UBC, both in Computer/Electrical Engineering
Hands-on AI/ML experience including RAG pipelines, LangChain, LangGraph, LLMs, and vector databases (ChromaDB, Milvus) — aligns with Datadog's AI bonus criteria
Demonstrated full-stack development capability (FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, WebSocket)
Published research at ACM MM '23, showing ability to contribute to cutting-edge technical work
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and distributed data tools (Kafka, Redis, MongoDB)
Practical DevOps exposure: Docker Compose, CI/CD awareness, 80%+ test coverage in projects
missing_skills: 10+ years of backend, infrastructure, or distributed systems engineering experience (candidate has ~1-2 years)
4+ years of cross-team technical leadership and large-scale initiative ownership
Deep expertise in distributed storage engines, real-time event streaming at global scale, or large-scale observability platforms
Experience designing systems handling hundreds of millions of records per second or trillions of data points per day
Stakeholder alignment and executive-level communication (Staff/Director/VP collaboration)
Mentorship and engineering culture leadership at an organizational level
Experience with distributed query engines, networking infrastructure, or large-scale data infrastructure
Go or Java at production scale (common at Datadog for backend systems)
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji — emphasize architectural decisions (hybrid retrieval, reranking, streaming) and measurable outcomes (35% precision improvement, 0.84 context recall) to demonstrate systems thinking
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to show research-grade technical depth and ability to work on novel, complex problems — relevant to Datadog's culture of solving hard problems the right way
Discuss the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline project to showcase multi-component system design, quality-gated routing, and end-to-end ownership from architecture to deployment
Be transparent about career stage and frame the conversation around growth trajectory — reference Datadog's own note that 'not everyone will meet all qualifications on day one'
Emphasize AI tooling proficiency (LangChain, LangGraph, LLMs, RAGAS evaluation) as directly relevant to Datadog's bonus criteria around AI-enabled product development

matches.title: AI Engineer - FDE (Forward Deployed Engineer)
matches.description: <p data-pm-slice="1 1 []">CSQ227R16</p> <p>The AI Forward Deployed Engineering (AI FDE) team is a highly specialized customer-facing AI team at Databricks. We deliver professional services engagements to help our customers build and productionize first-of-its-kind AI applications. We work cross-functionally to shape long-term strategic priorities and initiatives alongside engineering, product, and developer relations, as well as support internal subject matter expert (SME) teams. We view our team as an ensemble: we look for individuals with strong, unique specializations to improve the overall strength of the team. This team is the right fit for you if you love working with customers, teammates, and fueling your curiosity for the latest trends in GenAI, LLMOps, and ML more broadly. This role can be remote.</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="2006"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">The impact you will have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop cutting-edge GenAI solutions, incorporating the latest techniques from our <a href="https://www.databricks.com/research/mosaic">Mosaic AI Research</a> to solve customer problems.</li> <li>Own production rollouts of consumer and internally facing GenAI applications.</li> <li>Serve as a trusted technical advisor to customers across a variety of domains.</li> <li>Present at conferences such as <a href="https://www.databricks.com/dataaisummit">Data + AI Summit</a>, recognized as a thought leader internally and externally.</li> <li>Collaborate cross-functionally with the product and engineering teams to influence priorities and shape the product roadmap.</li> </ul> <p data-renderer-start-pos="2367"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience building GenAI applications, including RAG, multi-agent systems, Text2SQL, fine-tuning, etc., with tools such as HuggingFace, LangChain, and DSPy.</li> <li>Expertise in deploying production-grade GenAI applications, including evaluation and optimizations.</li> <li>Extensive years of hands-on industry data science experience, leveraging common machine learning and data science tools (i.e., pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, etc.).</li> <li>Experience building production-grade machine learning deployments on AWS, Azure, or GCP.</li> <li>Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Operations Research, etc.) or equivalent practical experience.</li> <li>Experience communicating and/or teaching technical concepts to non-technical and technical audiences alike.</li> <li>Passion for collaboration, life-long learning, and driving business value through AI.</li> <li>[Preferred] Experience using the Databricks Intelligence Platform and Apache Spark™ to process large-scale distributed datasets.</li> </ul><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.&nbsp; Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticpates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above.&nbsp;<br></span></p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Canada Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$162,400</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$223,384 CAD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>,&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a>&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span>&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit&nbsp;<a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>.&nbsp;<br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong technical candidate with directly relevant AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG pipelines, LangChain, LangGraph, multi-agent systems, and production deployments — which align well with Databricks' AI FDE role. However, the role explicitly calls for "extensive years of hands-on industry data science experience" and familiarity with the Databricks platform, Apache Spark, and classical ML tools (PyTorch, scikit-learn, pandas), areas where the candidate's profile is thin given their early-career status and limited industry tenure. The education background is excellent (MEng at Waterloo, BASc at UBC with strong GPAs), and the location/remote preference is a perfect fit for this Canada-based remote role.
strengths: Production-grade RAG pipeline experience with LangChain LCEL, hybrid retrieval (BM25 + dense vectors), reranking, and RAGAS evaluation — directly matching the job's GenAI application requirements
Multi-agent system design using LangGraph (4-agent pipeline with quality-gated routing), aligning with the job's multi-agent systems requirement
Hands-on experience with AWS and Azure cloud platforms for ML deployments
Published research at ACM MM '23 on video-language models, demonstrating thought leadership and academic credibility valued for conference presentations
Strong full-stack engineering skills (FastAPI, React/TypeScript, Docker, PostgreSQL, WebSocket) enabling end-to-end production rollouts
Excellent academic credentials: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specialization in LLM, Reinforcement Learning, and Computer Vision
Experience with semantic caching (Redis), streaming (SSE/WebSocket), and containerized deployments (Docker Compose) — production-readiness indicators
Location in Canada with remote/hybrid preference perfectly matches the role's Canada-based remote offering
missing_skills: Databricks Intelligence Platform experience (explicitly preferred in the job posting)
Apache Spark and large-scale distributed data processing
PyTorch (not listed in skills despite deep learning experience)
Classical ML tools: scikit-learn, pandas — standard data science stack not mentioned
DSPy framework (listed alongside LangChain in job requirements)
Text2SQL experience (listed as a key GenAI application type)
Fine-tuning LLMs (not evidenced in resume)
Customer-facing / consulting experience — the FDE role is heavily client-advisory
HuggingFace ecosystem (not mentioned despite LLM work)
interview_talking_points: Lead with the RAG system built at Disanji: emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement, RAGAS evaluation pipeline (0.84 context recall), and production deployment with Docker + FastAPI — this directly mirrors Databricks' focus on productionizing GenAI applications
Highlight the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline project as evidence of multi-agent system design expertise, and walk through the quality-gated routing architecture to demonstrate systems thinking
Reference the ACM MM '23 publication to position yourself as a researcher-practitioner who can represent Databricks at conferences like Data + AI Summit
Acknowledge the Databricks/Spark gap proactively and frame it as a fast-learning opportunity — mention your MEng coursework in distributed systems or any exposure to big data tooling
Emphasize cross-functional collaboration instincts from research assistant and intern roles, since the FDE role requires working with product, engineering, and customer teams simultaneously
Discuss the dual-layer ATS + LLM self-critique evaluation system in the Resume Generator project as an example of building robust GenAI evaluation frameworks — a key competency for this role
Tie your computer vision work (YOLOv8, SAHI, industrial defect detection) to breadth of ML experience, showing you can advise customers across diverse AI domains beyond just LLMs

matches.title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning Infrastructure
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning Infrastructure
Company: Stripe
Location: Toronto, Canada
Description: <h2>Who we are</h2> <h3>About Stripe</h3> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</span></p> <h3>About the team</h3> <p>Stripe processes over $1T in payments volume per year, which is roughly 1% of the world’s GDP. The tremendous amount of data makes Stripe one of the best places to do machine learning. The ML Infra team builds services and tools that power every step in the ML lifecycle, including data exploration, feature generation, experimentation, training, deploying, serving ML models, and building LLM applications. With the phenomenal developments happening in the field of AI, we are positioned to accelerate the adoption of AI/ML across all parts of the company by building highly scalable and reliable foundational infrastructure.</p> <h2>What you’ll do</h2> <p>You will work closely with machine learning engineers, data scientists, and product engineering teams to enable seamless end-to-end experience in building solutions across data, analytics, and AI/ML platforms. You will build the next generation of ML Infra services and major new capabilities that substantially improve ML development velocity and MLOps maturity across the company.</p> <h3>Responsibilities<span style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;</span></h3> <ul> <li>Designing and building scalable, reliable, and secure services for notebooks, ML model training, experimentation, serving, and LLM applications across multiple regions.&nbsp;</li> <li>Creating services and libraries that enable ML engineers at Stripe to seamlessly transition from experimentation to production across Stripe’s systems.&nbsp;</li> <li>Working directly with product teams and ML engineers to improve their day-to-day productivity.&nbsp;</li> <li>Taking ownership of and finding solutions for technical and product challenges by working with a diverse set of systems, processes, and technologies.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Who you are</strong></h2> <p>We’re looking for people with a strong background or interest in building successful products or systems; you’re passionate about solving business problems and making impact, you are comfortable in dealing with lots of moving pieces; and you’re comfortable learning new technologies and systems. You are comfortable working with other Stripe teams across the US and Canada.</p> <h3>Minimum requirements</h3> <ul> <li>2+ years of professional software development experience with a solid background on service oriented architecture and large-scale distributed systems</li> <li>Experience working through the full life cycle of software development, from talking to users, to design and implementation, to testing and deployment, to operations</li> <li>Experience working on production ML platforms, MLOps solutions, or building LLM applications</li> <li>Experience running operations for high availability, low latency systems</li> <li>Experience partnering with other teams to drive business outcomes</li> <li>A sense of pragmatism: you know when to aim for the ideal solution and when to adjust course</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred qualifications</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;</span></h3> <ul> <li>Experience building and shipping production AI agents</li> <li>Familiarity with the LLMs and LLM Frameworks</li> <li>Experience training and shipping machine learning models to production to solve critical business problems</li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with highly relevant AI/ML skills — particularly in LLM applications, RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, and MLOps tooling — that align well with Stripe's ML Infrastructure team. However, the role demands 2+ years of professional software development experience with a focus on large-scale distributed systems and high-availability production infrastructure, areas where Ruiqi's relatively limited internship experience (roughly 4 months total) and academic background fall short. The candidate's hands-on production RAG deployment and AI agent projects are compelling differentiators, but the gap in distributed systems depth and operational experience at scale is a notable concern for this mid-level role at a company like Stripe.
strengths: Production RAG system experience: Built and deployed a full end-to-end RAG pipeline with hybrid retrieval (BM25 + BGE-M3), reranking, Redis semantic caching, and FastAPI/SSE streaming — directly relevant to Stripe's LLM application infrastructure work.
LLM frameworks proficiency: Hands-on experience with LangChain LCEL, LangGraph multi-agent pipelines, and ChromaDB embeddings aligns with the preferred qualification of LLM/LLM framework familiarity.
AI Agent development: The 4-agent LangGraph Resume Generator project demonstrates production AI agent shipping experience, a key preferred qualification.
MLOps tooling: Experience with Docker Compose deployments, automated evaluation pipelines (RAGAS), and full software lifecycle (design → test → deploy) maps to the MLOps maturity focus of the role.
Strong academic pedigree: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specializations in LLM, Reinforcement Learning, Computer Vision, and DevOps is highly aligned with the team's technical domain.
ML model training and shipping: Trained and deployed YOLOv8 models (91% mAP@50) to production for industrial defect detection, satisfying the preferred qualification around shipping ML models.
Published research: ACM MM '23 publication on video-language models demonstrates depth in multimodal ML, a growing area for Stripe's AI platform.
Location compatibility: Based in Waterloo, ON — within Canada, matching Stripe's Toronto location and the candidate's preference for Canada/remote roles.
missing_skills: Large-scale distributed systems experience: No demonstrated experience designing or operating distributed systems at scale (e.g., Kafka at production scale, microservices orchestration, multi-region deployments beyond Docker Compose).
High-availability / low-latency systems operations: No evidence of on-call, SLO/SLA ownership, or operating systems with strict uptime requirements — a minimum requirement for this role.

ML platform or MLOps platform engineering: Experience is with building ML applications on top of platforms, not building the underlying ML infrastructure (feature stores, training orchestration, model serving layers, experimentation frameworks).
Service-oriented architecture depth: Limited professional exposure to SOA patterns at enterprise scale; internship work is primarily application-layer.
2+ years professional SWE experience: Total professional experience is approximately 4–5 months of internships, falling short of the 2+ year minimum requirement.

Cloud infrastructure at scale: AWS/Azure are listed as skills but no evidence of production-grade cloud infrastructure design (e.g., auto-scaling, multi-region failover, infrastructure-as-code like Terraform).
Experimentation/A-B testing platforms: No mention of building or using ML experimentation frameworks, a core responsibility of the ML Infra team.
interview_talking_points: Lead with the production RAG system at Disanji: Quantify the impact (35% retrieval precision improvement, 0.84 RAGAS context recall) and emphasize the full-stack deployment story — FastAPI, Redis caching, Docker Compose, SSE streaming — to demonstrate production-readiness beyond academic projects.

Frame the LangGraph AI Agent project as infrastructure thinking: Highlight the quality-gated routing architecture and dual-layer evaluation system as examples of building reliable, observable AI pipelines — language that resonates with ML Infra teams.

Connect academic specializations to Stripe's ML lifecycle: Explicitly map your MEng coursework in LLM, Reinforcement Learning, DevOps, and Performance Testing to the specific stages of Stripe's ML lifecycle (experimentation → training → serving → LLM apps).

Address the experience gap proactively: Acknowledge the internship-heavy background but pivot to the density and production quality of your work — shipping a RAG system over 500+ pages of documents and a multi-agent pipeline with 80%+ test coverage demonstrates senior-level engineering habits.

Highlight cross-functional collaboration: The Nanjing University research collaboration and the ACM MM '23 publication demonstrate ability to partner with diverse teams (researchers, engineers) to drive outcomes — a stated requirement.

Show distributed systems awareness: Even if limited in practice, reference your knowledge of Kafka, Redis, and multi-region deployment considerations from your projects, and express a concrete learning roadmap toward large-scale distributed systems.

matches.title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning Infrastructure
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Machine Learning Infrastructure
Company: Stripe
Location: Seattle, SF
Description: <h2>Who we are</h2> <h3>About Stripe</h3> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</span></p> <h3>About the team</h3> <p>Stripe processes over $1T in payments volume per year, which is roughly 1% of the world’s GDP. The tremendous amount of data makes Stripe one of the best places to do machine learning. The ML Infra team builds services and tools that power every step in the ML lifecycle, including data exploration, feature generation, experimentation, training, deploying, serving ML models, and building LLM applications. With the phenomenal developments happening in the field of AI, we are positioned to accelerate the adoption of AI/ML across all parts of the company by building highly scalable and reliable foundational infrastructure.</p> <h2>What you’ll do</h2> <p>You will work closely with machine learning engineers, data scientists, and product engineering teams to enable seamless end-to-end experience in building solutions across data, analytics, and AI/ML platforms. You will build the next generation of ML Infra services and major new capabilities that substantially improve ML development velocity and MLOps maturity across the company.</p> <h3>Responsibilities<span style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;</span></h3> <ul> <li>Designing and building scalable, reliable, and secure services for notebooks, ML model training, experimentation, serving, and LLM applications across multiple regions.&nbsp;</li> <li>Creating services and libraries that enable ML engineers at Stripe to seamlessly transition from experimentation to production across Stripe’s systems.&nbsp;</li> <li>Working directly with product teams and ML engineers to improve their day-to-day productivity.&nbsp;</li> <li>Taking ownership of and finding solutions for technical and product challenges by working with a diverse set of systems, processes, and technologies.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Who you are</strong></h2> <p>We’re looking for people with a strong background or interest in building successful products or systems; you’re passionate about solving business problems and making impact, you are comfortable in dealing with lots of moving pieces; and you’re comfortable learning new technologies and systems. You are comfortable working with other Stripe teams across the US and Canada.</p> <h3>Minimum requirements</h3> <ul> <li>2+ years of professional full time software development experience with a solid background on service oriented architecture and large-scale distributed systems</li> <li>Experience working through the full life cycle of software development, from talking to users, to design and implementation, to testing and deployment, to operations</li> <li>Experience working on production ML platforms, MLOps solutions, or building LLM applications</li> <li>Experience running operations for high availability, low latency systems</li> <li>Experience partnering with other teams to drive business outcomes</li> <li>A sense of pragmatism: you know when to aim for the ideal solution and when to adjust course</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred qualifications</strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;</span></h3> <ul> <li>Experience building and shipping production AI agents</li> <li>Familiarity with the LLMs and LLM Frameworks</li> <li>Experience training and shipping machine learning models to production to solve critical business problems</li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with highly relevant AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG systems, LLM frameworks (LangChain, LangGraph), and production deployment (Docker, FastAPI, Redis) — that align well with Stripe's ML Infrastructure team. However, the role demands 2+ years of full-time professional software development experience with a focus on large-scale distributed systems and MLOps, and Ruiqi's professional experience is limited to short internships and research roles, which is a meaningful gap. The location is a moderate concern as the role is based in Seattle/SF and is not explicitly remote, while the candidate prefers remote/hybrid work.
strengths: Hands-on production RAG system experience: built an end-to-end RAG pipeline with hybrid retrieval (BM25 + BGE-M3), reranking, and streaming at Disanji — directly relevant to Stripe's LLM application infrastructure work
Strong LLM framework proficiency: LangChain, LangGraph, ChromaDB, and RAGAS evaluation pipeline align with Stripe's preferred qualifications around LLM frameworks and AI agents
Production deployment experience: Docker Compose, FastAPI, Redis semantic caching, SSE streaming, and PostgreSQL demonstrate full-stack deployment capability
AI Agent development: Built a 4-agent LangGraph pipeline with quality-gated routing and dual-layer evaluation, matching Stripe's preferred qualification of shipping production AI agents
ML model training and deployment: YOLOv8 models trained and deployed for industrial defect detection (91% mAP@50), showing end-to-end ML lifecycle experience
Exceptional academic credentials: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specializations in LLM, Reinforcement Learning, Computer Vision, and DevOps; Dean's Honor List at UBC
Published research: Co-authored paper at ACM MM '23 on multimodal video-language models, demonstrating depth in ML research
Full software development lifecycle exposure: experience from user-facing design to testing (80%+ test coverage) and deployment
missing_skills: Large-scale distributed systems engineering: No demonstrated experience with high-throughput, multi-region distributed infrastructure at the scale Stripe operates (e.g., Kubernetes, service mesh, gRPC, Spark, Flink)
MLOps platform engineering: No experience building or maintaining ML platforms (e.g., Kubeflow, MLflow, SageMaker, Vertex AI, feature stores, model registries) for other engineers to consume
High-availability / low-latency systems operations: No evidence of on-call, SLO/SLA ownership, or operating production systems at scale
2+ years full-time professional SWE experience: Current experience is limited to internships (2–3 months each) and academic projects; does not yet meet the minimum requirement
Kafka / streaming data infrastructure: Listed in skills but no demonstrated production use case in resume
Cloud-native infrastructure depth: AWS/Azure listed but no specifics on VPCs, IAM, auto-scaling, or cloud-native ML services (e.g., SageMaker, Vertex AI)
Experimentation platforms: No experience building A/B testing or ML experimentation frameworks
interview_talking_points: Lead with the Disanji RAG system: Quantify the 35% retrieval precision improvement and 0.84 RAGAS context recall — these are production-grade metrics that speak directly to Stripe's LLM infrastructure work. Frame it as building infrastructure for ML, not just using ML.

Highlight the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline project: Emphasize the architectural decisions (quality-gated routing, dual-layer evaluation, ATS + LLM self-critique) to demonstrate systems thinking and AI agent shipping experience — a direct match to Stripe's preferred qualifications.

Address the experience gap proactively: Acknowledge that your professional tenure is early-stage, but pivot to the breadth and depth of your project portfolio, academic rigor (GPA 3.9, ACM MM publication), and the production-quality standards you've applied (Docker, CI/CD, 80%+ test coverage).

Connect your skills to ML Infrastructure specifically: Stripe's ML Infra team builds tools for other engineers. Reframe your RAG pipeline and agent system as 'internal developer tooling' — you built systems that abstract complexity and improve ML development velocity, which mirrors Stripe's mission.

Discuss scalability awareness: Even if you haven't operated at Stripe's scale, demonstrate awareness of distributed systems concepts (Redis caching for latency, Milvus for vector search at scale, streaming with SSE/WebSocket) and your eagerness to grow into high-availability system ownership.

Leverage the ACM MM publication: Mention the Nanjing University research and publication to signal depth in multimodal ML and ability to collaborate cross-functionally with researchers and engineers — relevant to Stripe's cross-team collaboration requirement.

Address location/remote preference early: Stripe lists Seattle/SF but has Canadian offices. Highlight your Canadian base (Waterloo, ON) and openness to hybrid arrangements, and ask about Stripe's distributed work policies for this team.

matches.title: Elastic AI Engineer
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Elastic, the Search AI Company, enables everyone to find the answers they need in real time, using all their data, at scale — unleashing the potential of businesses and people. The Elastic Search AI Platform, used by more than 50% of the Fortune 500, brings together the precision of search and the intelligence of AI to enable everyone to accelerate the results that matter. By taking advantage of all structured and unstructured data — securing and protecting private information more effectively — Elastic’s complete, cloud-based solutions for search, security, and observability help organizations deliver on the promise of AI.</p></div><p>At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open-source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 40+ countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.</p> <h3><strong>What is The Role</strong></h3> <p>The Elastic IT team is moving beyond simple chat to the next frontier: Agentic Workflows. We are looking for an innovative <strong>Elastic AI Engineer</strong> to join our team to build autonomous, enterprise-grounded agents that don't just answer questions—they complete complex business tasks to accelerate productivity across the entire organization.</p> <p>The ideal candidate is an Elastic product expert (including but not limited to Agent Builder and Workflows), using the full power of the Elastic Stack to provide the "brain" and "memory" for our agentic ecosystem.</p> <p><strong>Are you ready to build the agents that supercharge enterprise efficiency? </strong>Join us to enable agentic workflows that turn collective knowledge into instant action, empowering everyone at Elastic to achieve more.&nbsp;</p> <h2><strong>What You Will Be Doing:</strong></h2> <ul> <li><strong>Agentic Strategy &amp; Design:</strong> Invent and implement sophisticated agentic workflows that use reasoning and tools to complete end-to-end business processes.</li> <li><strong>Enterprise Grounding:</strong> Apply Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and the Elasticsearch Relevance Engine (ESRE) to ensure agents are deeply grounded in enterprise knowledge for high-accuracy task completion.</li> <li><strong>AI Model &amp; Tool Integration:</strong> Develop and fine-tune LLMs and integrate them with internal APIs and third-party SaaS tools to enable autonomous action.</li> <li><strong>Scalable Infrastructure:</strong> Firm understanding of cloud-based environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) in order to support the high-concurrency demands of enterprise agents.</li> <li><strong>Lifecycle Management:</strong> Oversee the training, deployment, and performance optimization of agents, ensuring they remain secure, reliable, and compliant.</li> <li><strong>Technical Leadership:</strong> Act as a domain expert on the Elastic Stack, making technical recommendations that push the boundaries of AI-driven productivity.</li> <li><strong>Documentation:</strong> Maintain comprehensive documentation of AI workflows, cloud infrastructure, and deployment processes.</li> <li><strong>Security:</strong> Implement standards for security and data privacy to protect sensitive information and ensure compliance with relevant regulations.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>What you bring:</strong></h2> <ul> <li><strong>3-5 years of work experience in a relevant field.</strong></li> <li><strong>Minimum 1 year experience building with the Elastic Stack. </strong></li> <li><strong>Knowledge of Elasticsearch Relevance Engine (ESRE), Jina AI, and advanced RAG patterns is critical.</strong></li> <li><strong>Proven success</strong> in delivering independent GenAI projects, specifically those involving autonomous task completion or complex workflow automation.</li> <li><strong>Agentic Frameworks:</strong> Familiarity with <strong>LangGraph</strong>, <strong>LangChain</strong>, and <strong>LangSmith</strong> for building and debugging multi-agent systems.</li> <li><strong>Expertise in Enterprise Agentic &amp; Workflow Platforms:</strong> Deep familiarity with leading agentic AI and workflow automation platforms (such as Microsoft Copilot Studio, Salesforce Agentforce, ServiceNow AI Agents.)</li> <li><strong>Market Trend Integration:</strong> Proven ability to apply emerging market trends—such as <strong>Multi-Agent Orchestration and</strong> <strong>Model Context Protocol (MCP)</strong>—to build high-impact, cost-optimized solutions that scale across the enterprise.</li> <li><strong>Programming:</strong> Experience with <strong>Python</strong> or <strong>TypeScript</strong> for backend logic and agent orchestration.</li> <li><strong>Cloud &amp; Orchestration:</strong> Familiarity with <strong>Kubernetes</strong> (Operators/Controllers), <strong>Docker</strong>, and <strong>Terraform</strong> for automated deployment.</li> <li><strong>Model Expertise:</strong> Hands-on experience with LLM providers.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Bonus Points</strong></h2> <ul> <li>Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related engineering field.</li> <li>Strong communication skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical agent architectures.</li> <li>A commitment to <strong>Ethical AI</strong> and responsible development practices.</li> <li>Experience with containerization and orchestration (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).</li> <li>Knowledge of DevOps practices for model deployment and automation.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-weight: 400;"><br>Compensation for this role is in the form of base salary.&nbsp; This role does not have a variable compensation component.&nbsp;&nbsp;<br></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The typical starting salary range for new hires in this role is listed below.&nbsp; In select locations (including Seattle WA, Los Angeles CA, the San Francisco Bay Area CA, and the New York City Metro Area), an alternate range may apply as specified below.&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">These ranges represent </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">the lowest to highest salary we reasonably and in good faith believe we would pay for this role at the time of this posting.&nbsp; We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range, and the ranges may be modified in the future.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">An employee's position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, performance, and business or organizational needs.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Elastic believes that employees should have the opportunity to share in the value that we create together for our shareholders. Therefore, in addition to cash compensation, this role is currently eligible to participate in Elastic's stock program.&nbsp; Our total rewards package also includes a company-matched 401k with dollar-for-dollar matching up to 6% of eligible earnings, along with a range of other benefits offered with a holistic emphasis on employee well-being.</span></p></div><div class="title">The typical starting salary range for this role is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$94,300</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$149,200 USD</span></div></div><div class="pay-input"><div class="title">The typical starting salary range for this role in the select locations listed above is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$113,300</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$179,200 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Additional Information - We Take Care of Our People</strong></h2> <p>As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.</p> <p>We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.</p> <ul> <li>Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary</li> <li>Health coverage for you and your family in many locations</li> <li>Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles</li> <li>Generous number of vacation days each year</li> <li>Increase your impact - We match up to $2000 (or local currency equivalent) for financial donations and service</li> <li>Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love</li> <li>Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave</li> </ul> <p>Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.</p> <p>We welcome individuals with disabilities and strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all individuals. To request an accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email <a href="mailto:candidate_accessibility@elastic.co" target="_blank">candidate_accessibility@elastic.co</a><span class="gmail_default">.</span>&nbsp;We will reply to your request within 24 business hours of submission.</p> <p><span style="color: #000000;">Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws, view posters linked below:</span> <a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/WHD/legacy/files/fmlaen.pdf" target="_blank">Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)</a> <span style="color: #000000;">Poster;</span><span style="color: #000000;">&nbsp;<a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_%20English_formattedESQA508c.pdf" target="_blank">Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision</a> Poster; </span><a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/WHD/legacy/files/eppabw.pdf" target="_blank">Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA)</a> <span style="color: #000000;">Poster and <a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/OFCCP/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights.pdf" target="_blank">Know Your Rights</a> (Poster)</span></p> <p><span style="color: #000000;">Elasticsearch develops and distributes technology and information that is subject to U.S. and other countries’ export controls and licensing requirements for individuals who are located in or are nationals of the following sanctioned countries and regions: Belarus, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, or Russia, including the Ukrainian territories annexed by Russia (The Crimea region of Ukraine, The Donetsk People's Republic (DNR), The Luhansk People's Republic (LNR), Kherson or Zaporizhzhia). If you are located in or are a national of one of the listed countries or regions, an export license may be required as a condition of your employment in this role. Please note that national origin and/or nationality do not affect eligibility for employment with Elastic.</span></p> <p>Please see&nbsp;<a href="https://www.elastic.co/legal/applicant-privacy-statement" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.elastic.co/legal/applicant-privacy-statement&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1611068262479000&amp;usg=AFQjCNG3orAPk5sJIr9WVm0ZDxYw82c5DA">here</a>&nbsp;for our Privacy Statement.</p></div>

However, the candidate has a critical gap: no demonstrated experience with the Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, ESRE), which is listed as a minimum 1-year hard requirement, and overall professional experience (~1 year of internships) falls well short of the 3–5 years required. The education credentials and AI project portfolio are impressive and partially compensate, but the experience and Elastic-specific tooling gaps are significant hurdles.

Highlight your LangGraph multi-agent project: walk through the 4-agent pipeline with quality-gated routing in the Resume Generator project, framing it as autonomous workflow design — this is the core of what the role builds
