matches.title: Software Engineer, Experimental Projects
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer, Experimental Projects
Company: Stripe
Location: LOCATION
Description: <h2>Who we are</h2> <h3>About Stripe</h3> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</span></p> <h3>About the team</h3> <p>Stripe's Experimental Projects team is our in-house innovation lab where we rapidly transform ideas into working prototypes. We operate as an idea incubator, building and testing new concepts with real users, sometimes going from concept to functional prototype in just days.</p> <h2>What you’ll do</h2> <p>As a Software Engineer on the Experimental Projects team, you'll be at the forefront of innovation at Stripe, turning promising ideas into tangible solutions that could shape the future of our platform. You'll have the autonomy to identify opportunities, rapidly build prototypes, and work directly with users to validate and iterate on your solutions.&nbsp;</p> <p>This role combines technical excellence with creative problem-solving – you'll work across our entire technology stack to bring ideas to life, sometimes in just days.&nbsp;</p> <p>Your work will help us discover new ways to empower businesses worldwide, contributing directly to Stripe's mission of increasing the GDP of the internet. Whether it's creating new developer tools, exploring novel payment experiences, or inventing entirely new products, you'll have the freedom to experiment and the resources to make a significant impact.</p> <h3>Responsibilities<span style="font-weight: 400;">&nbsp;</span></h3> <ul> <li>Drive projects from ideation to implementation, taking ownership of the full development lifecycle</li> <li>Build full-stack solutions including intuitive web frontends, clean APIs, and robust backend systems</li> <li>Work across various technologies and languages (TypeScript, Ruby, Python, Java, etc.) based on project needs</li> <li>Collaborate directly with users to understand their needs and gather feedback</li> <li>Prototype and validate ideas quickly, pivoting or adjusting based on real-world usage</li> <li>Partner with teams across Stripe to integrate with existing systems and infrastructure</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Who you are</strong></h2> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.</span></p> <h3>Minimum requirements</h3> <ul> <li>5+ years of professional, hands on full-stack development experience with languages such as JavaScript, TypeScript, Ruby, Python, Go, or Java</li> <li>Excel at rapid prototyping while maintaining appropriate quality standards</li> <li>Demonstrate strong product intuition and user empathy</li> <li>Have experience building and shipping customer facing products from scratch</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred qualifications</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Are comfortable with ambiguity and fast-paced environments</li> <li>Have a passion for working on side-projects, open source, or similar self-driven initiatives you’re proud of</li> <li>Bring energy and enthusiasm that inspires collaboration</li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a technically strong candidate with solid full-stack and AI/ML skills that partially align with Stripe's Experimental Projects team, particularly in rapid prototyping and building end-to-end systems. However, the role's hard minimum requirement of 5+ years of professional full-stack development experience is a significant barrier — Ruiqi has roughly 4–5 months of relevant internship experience and is still completing a Master's degree, making this a poor experience-level match. The role is also not specifically an AI Engineer position but rather a generalist software engineering innovation role, meaning Ruiqi's deep AI/ML specialization is a partial fit but not the primary focus.
strengths: Strong full-stack development capability demonstrated across FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, and WebSocket — directly matching Stripe's tech stack requirements
Proven rapid prototyping mindset: built production-grade RAG systems and multi-agent pipelines end-to-end, sometimes as solo projects
Hands-on experience with Python and JavaScript/TypeScript, two of the core languages listed in the job description
Published research (ACM MM '23) and real-world AI deployments show ability to take ideas from concept to working implementation

Self-driven project portfolio (AI Agent Resume Generator, Drone Hiker Detection) demonstrates the passion for side-projects and open-source work that Stripe explicitly values as a preferred qualification
High academic pedigree: 3.9 GPA MEng at University of Waterloo with Dean's Honor List at UBC, signaling strong technical fundamentals
Experience with Docker, Redis, and cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure) aligns with Stripe's need to integrate with existing systems and infrastructure
missing_skills: 5+ years of professional full-stack development experience (candidate has ~4–5 months of internship experience)
Ruby or Go experience (Stripe commonly uses Ruby; neither appears on the resume)
Customer-facing product shipping experience at scale (internship projects are limited in scope and user base)
Financial infrastructure or payments domain knowledge
Experience collaborating directly with users/customers in a product feedback loop
TypeScript listed in skills but limited evidence of production-level TypeScript usage beyond personal projects
interview_talking_points: Lead with the RAG system built at Disanji: emphasize the end-to-end ownership, production deployment, and measurable outcomes (35% retrieval precision improvement, 0.84 RAGAS context recall) — this mirrors Stripe's 'concept to prototype in days' culture

Highlight the 4-agent LangGraph Resume Generator project as a showcase of full-stack ownership (FastAPI + React/TypeScript + PostgreSQL + Docker + 80%+ test coverage) and self-driven innovation, directly addressing Stripe's preferred qualification around side-projects

Address the experience gap proactively: frame the combination of a research publication, two internships, and multiple shipped full-stack projects as equivalent in output and quality to more years of traditional employment
Emphasize adaptability across languages and stacks (Python, JavaScript, C++, SQL, Java) to reassure interviewers about Stripe's multi-language environment
Connect AI/ML background to Stripe's experimental mandate — position yourself as uniquely able to prototype AI-powered financial tools that most generalist engineers couldn't build

Mention comfort with ambiguity and fast iteration cycles, citing the drone footage hiker detection project (Sept 2023 – Apr 2024) as an example of navigating an open-ended, research-driven problem to a working product

matches.title: Senior Applied AI Engineer – ML for Systems & Infrastructure
matches.description:
Title: Senior Applied AI Engineer – ML for Systems & Infrastructure
Company: Databricks
Location: San Francisco, California
Description: <p>P-1380</p> <p>As a Senior Applied AI Engineer at Databricks, you will apply machine learning, scheduling and optimization algorithms to improve the efficiency and performance of our engineering systems and infrastructure. From cluster management all the way down to query compilation, our Applied AI team works on some of the hardest, most interesting problems facing the business, making Databricks infrastructure and products as performant and cost-efficient as possible. This is a high impact problem as our customers look at us to deliver the most optimized workloads.</p> <p><strong>The impact you will have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Build end-to-end systems from the ground up in a small team of experienced people.</li> <li>Shape the direction of our applied ML areas of investment by engaging with engineering and product teams across the company.</li> <li>Drive the development and deployment of state-of-the-art AI models and systems that directly impact the capabilities and performance of Databricks' products, infrastructure and services.</li> <li>Architect and implement robust, scalable ML infrastructure, including data storage and&nbsp; processing, model training and serving components, and monitoring and reporting systems to support seamless integration of AI/ML models into production environments.</li> <li>Work on novel modeling techniques in the field of ML for Systems</li> <li>Contribute to the broader AI community by publishing research, presenting at conferences, and actively participating in open-source projects, enhancing Databricks' reputation as an industry leader.</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>2-8 years of machine learning engineering experience in high velocity, high-growth companies</li> <li>Strong understanding of both computer systems and statistics</li> <li>Large breadth of knowledge or interest in mathematical modeling beyond ML (OR, combinatorial optimization</li> <li>Experience developing AI/ML systems at scale in production</li> <li>Strong track record of ML modeling that goes beyond using standard libraries.</li> <li>Strong coding and software engineering skills, and familiarity with software engineering principles around testing, code reviews and deployment.</li> <li>Experience deploying, scaling and monitoring models in production; deep understanding of the unique infrastructure challenges posed by training and serving predictions in Tier 0 environments.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Why Join Us?</strong><strong><br></strong>At Databricks, we are building state-of-the-art AI solutions that redefine how users interact with data and our products. You’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of AI-driven products at Databricks, work with cutting-edge models, and collaborate with a world-class team of AI and ML experts.</p> <p>If you're excited about pushing the boundaries of AI in real-world applications, we’d love to hear from you!</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>Please note we are open to employees working from our Mountain View, CA office for this position.&nbsp;</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.&nbsp; Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticipates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page <a href="https://www.databricks.com/sites/default/files/2024-08/us-pay-zone-mapping.pdf">here</a>.<br></span></p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Local Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$166,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$210,250 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>,&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a>&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span>&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit&nbsp;<a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>.&nbsp;<br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates solid AI/ML foundations — particularly in RAG systems, LLMs, and computer vision — which partially aligns with Databricks' Applied AI team. However, the role is specifically focused on ML for Systems & Infrastructure (cluster management, query compilation, scheduling/optimization algorithms), which is a niche that Ruiqi has virtually no demonstrated experience in. The candidate is also a mid-level engineer still completing their Master's degree, while the role is explicitly "Senior" and requires 2–8 years of production ML engineering experience at high-growth companies — Ruiqi's professional experience totals roughly 4–5 months of internships. The location is also a significant mismatch, as the role requires on-site presence in San Francisco or Mountain View, CA, while the candidate prefers remote or Canadian locations.
strengths: Strong academic credentials with a 3.9 GPA MEng from University of Waterloo and a 3.7 GPA BEng from UBC, both with AI/ML specializations
Hands-on production RAG system experience using LangChain, Milvus, BM25, BGE-M3, and RAGAS evaluation — directly relevant to LLM infrastructure
Published research at ACM MM '23 on video-language models, demonstrating ability to contribute to the AI research community
Full-stack engineering capability (FastAPI, React, Docker, PostgreSQL, WebSocket) enabling end-to-end system building
Experience with automated evaluation pipelines and retrieval precision optimization (35% improvement over baseline)
Familiarity with containerized deployment (Docker Compose, Redis caching, FastAPI + SSE streaming) in production-like settings
Exposure to computer vision at scale (YOLOv8, SAHI pipeline, 91% mAP@50 on industrial defect detection)
missing_skills: ML for Systems & Infrastructure (cluster management, query compilation, workload scheduling)
Operations Research (OR) and combinatorial optimization algorithms
Experience with large-scale distributed systems (e.g., Apache Spark, Delta Lake, or similar data platforms)
Model training and serving at Tier 0 / enterprise production scale
Deep understanding of infrastructure monitoring and observability for ML systems
Mathematical modeling beyond standard ML libraries (e.g., integer programming, constraint optimization)
Experience at high-velocity, high-growth tech companies (not internship-level)
Familiarity with Databricks ecosystem (MLflow, Lakehouse, Delta Lake)
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production RAG system built at Disanji — emphasize the end-to-end pipeline architecture, hybrid retrieval design decisions, and measurable 35% precision improvement as evidence of systems thinking
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate research credibility and ability to contribute to Databricks' goal of publishing and presenting at conferences

Connect the LangGraph multi-agent pipeline project to infrastructure orchestration concepts — frame the quality-gated routing and evaluation layers as analogous to scheduling and optimization challenges
Emphasize software engineering rigor: 80%+ test coverage, Docker-based deployment, Redis caching, and streaming APIs show production-readiness beyond typical academic candidates

Acknowledge the gap in ML-for-Systems experience but express genuine interest in optimization and scheduling problems, and reference any relevant coursework in algorithms, operations research, or performance testing from the MEng program
Mention the performance testing specialization listed in the MEng to bridge toward infrastructure performance optimization, a core focus of the role

matches.title: Senior AI Engineer - APM Integrations
matches.description: <p>IDM is the team that works on Datadog APM integrations: the parts that connect Datadog to the tools and services customers use. The team’s job is to make it easier for engineers to build and maintain integrations over time, and to keep quality and reliability high.&nbsp;You will build AI-assisted tools that help with day-to-day engineering work, like drafting code changes, suggesting fixes, and checking results with tests and other automated checks. The goal is building tools that engineers can trust in real production work. You’ll also work closely with other teams, understand how they work, and build solutions that fit their process.&nbsp;You will define what “good” means for these tools, measure results, and improve them over time. You’ll set up evaluation and testing so the AI output stays correct and doesn’t silently get worse. This is a senior role with high ownership, from early prototypes to production and ongoing support.</p> <p><em>At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You’ll Do:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Build agent workflows that take an integration need from plan to implementation and validation with humans approving at the right checkpoints</li> <li>Create systems that synthesize context from codebases, docs, specs, telemetry, and historical incidents to make changes that match Datadog conventions and customer expectations</li> <li>Generate and evolve integration code and tests, including end-to-end scenarios that reflect real customer workloads and product features</li> <li>Design evaluation harnesses that prevent silent regressions: golden sets, scenario baselines, semantic checks, performance thresholds, and release gating</li> <li>Build portfolio-level automation: proactive updates for upstream breaking changes, tracer feature rollouts across the catalog, migrations to new schemas/semantics, and targeted coverage expansion</li> <li>Partner tightly with PM, support engineers, and integration-owning teams to make the system adoptable, trustworthy, and embedded in daily engineering workflows</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Who You Are:</strong></p> <p><strong>Product-minded engineer who ships AI to production</strong></p> <ul> <li>6+ years building backend systems (Go, Java, or .NET) with strong focus on simplicity, correctness, and performance</li> <li>Proven experience delivering LLM/agent features to production (prompting, tooling, evals, safety/guardrails)</li> <li>Comfortable navigating ambiguity, iterating from prototype to production, and measuring impact with clear metrics</li> <li>You have demonstrated ability to use AI coding tools in day-to-day workflows and validate, critique, and refine AI-generated output</li> </ul> <p><strong>Strong ML fundamentals</strong></p> <ul> <li>Solid grasp of the ML lifecycle (task definition, dataset construction, modeling, evaluation, deployment, iteration) and statistics for experiments</li> <li>Fluency with offline/online evals: golden sets, automated regressions, and evaluation harnesses that prevent silent quality drift</li> </ul> <p><strong>Distributed systems &amp; observability savvy</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience with microservices performance: tracing, latency breakdowns, concurrency, resiliency patterns</li> <li>Production operations mindset: monitoring, alerting, and participating in on‑call rotations where applicable</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Bonus Point:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Hands‑on with distributed tracing stacks (OpenTelemetry/Datadog APM), profilers, and logs/metrics pipelines</li> <li>Experience with planning/agent frameworks, tool‑use orchestration, RAG, and retrieval/indexing over large context</li> <li>Experience building developer tools (IDEs, static analysis, compilers, code transformation pipelines) or code-generation systems</li> <li>Familiarity with semantic conventions / schema migrations, scenario-based testing, and cross-language porting at scale</li> <li>You’re motivated to push the boundaries of how AI can improve software engineering best practices and contribute to building AI-enabled products</li> </ul> <p><em>Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Benefits and Growth:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)</li> <li>Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing</li> <li>Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking</li> <li>An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)</li> <li>Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions</li> <li>Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+</li> <li>Competitive global benefits</li> </ul> <p><br><em>Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Remote</p><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>About Datadog:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on <a href="https://www.instagram.com/datadoghq/?hl=en" target="_blank">Instagram</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/datadog" target="_blank">LinkedIn,</a> and <a href="https://learn.datadoghq.com/" target="_blank">Datadog Learning Center. </a></p> <hr> <p data-renderer-start-pos="215"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Equal Opportunity at Datadog:</strong></p> <p>Datadog is proud to offer <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf" target="_blank">equal employment opportunity</a> to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/candidate-legal-notices/" target="_blank">Candidate Legal Notices</a> for your reference.&nbsp;</p> <p>Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeoJeduEZ2NdZF_65uZmWUrCM-zee7yADXX1s6Xr9zAGq8iKA/viewform" target="_blank">this form</a>. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.&nbsp;</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Privacy and AI Guidelines:</strong></p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662">Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice</a>. For information on our AI policy, please visit <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/interviewing-at-datadog-ai-guidelines/" target="_blank">Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong foundational AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph agent workflows, and LLM evaluation — that align well with the AI engineering aspects of this role. However, this is a Senior-level position requiring 6+ years of backend engineering experience (preferably in Go, Java, or .NET), distributed systems expertise, and production-grade observability/APM knowledge, all of which the candidate significantly lacks given their early-career profile (~1 year of internship experience). The location is also a partial mismatch, as the role is based in Portugal (remote) while the candidate prefers US/Canada remote positions.
strengths: Hands-on RAG pipeline experience with hybrid retrieval (BM25 + dense vectors), reranking, and streaming — directly relevant to the role's retrieval/indexing requirements
LangGraph multi-agent workflow architecture aligns with the job's requirement to build agent workflows from plan to implementation and validation
Built automated LLM evaluation pipelines using RAGAS, matching the role's emphasis on eval harnesses and preventing silent quality regressions
Strong academic background with a 3.9 GPA MEng from University of Waterloo, specializing in LLM, Reinforcement Learning, and Computer Vision
Full-stack production deployment experience (FastAPI, Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis, WebSocket) demonstrates end-to-end shipping capability
Published research in ACM MM '23 on video-language models shows ML depth and academic rigor
Experience with semantic caching, vector databases (ChromaDB, Milvus), and embeddings (BGE-M3) is directly applicable to the role's context synthesis requirements
missing_skills: 6+ years of backend engineering experience — candidate has ~1 year of internship experience, far below the senior threshold
Go, Java (production-grade), or .NET backend proficiency — the role explicitly requires these; candidate's Java is listed as a language but not demonstrated in production
Distributed systems and microservices expertise — no evidence of tracing, latency optimization, concurrency, or resiliency patterns at scale
APM/observability tooling experience — no mention of Datadog, OpenTelemetry, distributed tracing, metrics/logs pipelines, or on-call operations
Production LLM safety and guardrails implementation — candidate shows eval work but not safety/guardrail systems
Developer tooling experience (IDEs, static analysis, compilers, code transformation pipelines) — not present in resume
Cross-language porting, schema migrations, and semantic conventions at portfolio scale — not demonstrated
interview_talking_points: Lead with the RAG system built at Disanji: emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement, RAGAS evaluation pipeline achieving 0.84 context recall, and production deployment with Docker/FastAPI — this directly mirrors the role's eval harness and production reliability requirements

Highlight the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline in the Resume Generator project as proof of agent workflow orchestration with quality-gated routing, drawing a direct parallel to the job's requirement of building agent workflows with human approval checkpoints

Discuss the RAGAS automated evaluation pipeline and ATS keyword scoring + LLM self-critique dual-layer evaluation as evidence of building systems that prevent silent quality regressions — a core responsibility of this role

Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively but frame the MEng at Waterloo (graduating Oct 2025) and the breadth of production-grade projects as evidence of accelerated growth and readiness to take on high-ownership work

Express genuine interest in Datadog's APM domain and connect it to your computer vision/telemetry background — mention willingness to ramp up on Go and OpenTelemetry quickly given your polyglot programming background

matches.title: Senior AI Engineer - CD Visibility
matches.description:
Title: Senior AI Engineer - CD Visibility
Company: Datadog
Location: Madrid, Spain
Description: <p>At Datadog, we leverage AI across our observability platform to improve monitoring, speed up incident resolution, and ensure data reliability for cloud applications.</p> <p>Datadog’s <a href="https://docs.datadoghq.com/deployment_gates/">Deployment Gates</a> team builds customer-facing systems that decide whether software should ship to production. Deployment Gates sit directly in customers’ CI/CD pipelines and use observability data to answer one of the hardest questions in software delivery:<br>Given everything we know right now, is this deployment safe to proceed?<em><br></em><em><br></em>In this role, you will:</p> <ul> <li>Work on the evolution of Deployment Gates from static rules to AI-driven decisions, combining Datadog telemetry to detect and block faulty changes before they impact users</li> <li>Lead the design of progressive deployment automation, starting with zero-setup, conservative AI rules and evolving toward adaptive gates that learn from incidents and organizational patterns</li> <li>Design the foundation for autonomous remediation, connecting what changed in code to what broke in production, from blocking and rolling back unsafe deployments to proposing fixes and enforcing policies</li> </ul> <p>This is a highly product‑minded engineering role: you’ll work from problem discovery and UX all the way to reliable, scalable production systems.</p> <p><em>At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What you’ll do:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Build AI-driven deployment gates: Design and ship decision systems that evaluate customer deployments using CI/CD context and Datadog telemetry, producing safe, explainable allow/block outcomes</li> <li>Own evals and rollout: Define precision, recall, and trust metrics; build offline and online evals; validate changes in shadow mode; and safely promote improvements to enforcement</li> <li>Design for robustness and safety: Implement conservative defaults, guardrails, fallbacks, and human-in-the-loop paths so gates behave predictably under noisy or incomplete data</li> <li>Partner closely with Product: Work hand-in-hand with the Product Manager to translate customer problems, adoption signals, and roadmap goals into concrete technical decisions and iterations</li> <li>Integrate across the Datadog platform: Partner with internal AI teams building the Faulty Deployment Detection pipeline, as well as teams working on LLMs and AI agents</li> <li>Own production systems: Build and operate reliable backend services that run in the critical path of customer deployments, and be on-call for those services</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Who you are:</strong></p> <ul> <li>A Product‑minded engineer who ships AI to production</li> <li>You have 5+ years experience with backend systems and microservices performance: tracing, latency breakdowns, concurrency, and resiliency patterns</li> <li>You are proficient in a modern programming language; strong API/service design; production ops (monitoring, alerting, on‑call rotation)</li> <li>You have proven experience delivering LLM/agent features to production</li> <li>You are comfortable owning user journeys, iterating from prototype → alpha → GA, and measuring impact with clear product metrics</li> <li>An End-to-end AI implementation owner: You understands the end-to-end LLM product lifecycle</li> <li>Fluent with offline/online evals for AI systems</li> <li>You have demonstrated ability to use AI coding tools in day-to-day workflows and validate, critique, and refine AI-generated output</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Bonus Point:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience with Continuous Delivery tools (i.e. ArgoCD / Argo Rollouts, Spinnaker, Octopus Deploy)</li> <li>Exposure to planning/agent frameworks, tool‑use orchestration, RAG, and retrieval/indexing for observability data</li> <li>You’re motivated to push the boundaries of how AI can improve software engineering best practices and contribute to building AI-enabled products</li> </ul> <p><em>Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.&nbsp;</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Benefits and Growth:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)</li> <li>Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing</li> <li>Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking</li> <li>An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)</li> <li>Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions</li> <li>Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+</li> <li>Competitive global benefits</li> </ul> <p><br><em>Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Hybrid</p><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>About Datadog:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on <a href="https://www.instagram.com/datadoghq/?hl=en" target="_blank">Instagram</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/datadog" target="_blank">LinkedIn,</a> and <a href="https://learn.datadoghq.com/" target="_blank">Datadog Learning Center. </a></p> <hr> <p data-renderer-start-pos="215"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Equal Opportunity at Datadog:</strong></p> <p>Datadog is proud to offer <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf" target="_blank">equal employment opportunity</a> to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. Here are our <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/candidate-legal-notices/" target="_blank">Candidate Legal Notices</a> for your reference.&nbsp;</p> <p>Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeoJeduEZ2NdZF_65uZmWUrCM-zee7yADXX1s6Xr9zAGq8iKA/viewform" target="_blank">this form</a>. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.&nbsp;</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Privacy and AI Guidelines:</strong></p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662">Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice</a>. matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong foundational AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, and LLM-based systems — that align well with the AI engineering aspects of this role. However, this is a Senior-level position requiring 5+ years of backend/microservices experience, and Ruiqi is a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree with only internship-level professional experience, creating a significant seniority gap. Additionally, the role is based in Madrid, Spain (hybrid), which conflicts with the candidate's preferred locations of Remote/US/Canada, and the job lacks CI/CD observability domain expertise that is central to Datadog's Deployment Gates product.
strengths: Strong RAG pipeline experience: built production-grade RAG system with hybrid retrieval (BM25 + BGE-M3), reranking, and streaming at Disanji Technology Institute
Hands-on LangChain and LangGraph expertise demonstrated in both professional and project contexts
Built automated AI evaluation pipelines using RAGAS (0.84 context recall), directly relevant to the job's 'own evals' requirement
Full-stack production deployment experience: FastAPI, Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis, WebSocket — matching the backend service ownership requirement
Published AI research (ACM MM '23) on multimodal video understanding, demonstrating depth in AI/ML
Multi-agent AI system design experience (4-agent LangGraph pipeline with quality-gated routing) aligns with the agent orchestration bonus criteria
Strong academic credentials: 3.9 GPA MEng at University of Waterloo with specialization in LLM, Reinforcement Learning, and DevOps
Computer Vision and deep learning background (YOLOv8, SAHI) shows breadth in applied AI
missing_skills: 5+ years of professional backend/microservices experience — candidate has only internship-level experience (~6 months total)
CI/CD pipeline domain knowledge (ArgoCD, Argo Rollouts, Spinnaker, Octopus Deploy, Deployment Gates concepts)
Observability platform experience (Datadog telemetry, distributed tracing, monitoring, alerting, on-call operations)
Production systems ownership and on-call rotation experience at scale
Offline/online evaluation frameworks for AI systems in production (shadow mode, precision/recall/trust metrics at scale)
Microservices architecture: tracing, latency breakdowns, concurrency, and resiliency patterns at production scale
Progressive deployment automation and rollback systems
Experience with cloud-native observability tooling (APM, metrics pipelines, incident detection)
interview_talking_points: Lead with your RAGAS evaluation pipeline: The job explicitly requires owning evals and defining precision/recall/trust metrics — your 0.84 context recall result with automated evaluation is a direct proof point to highlight prominently

Frame your LangGraph multi-agent project as production AI system design: Emphasize the quality-gated routing logic, fallback handling, and dual-layer evaluation (ATS + LLM self-critique) as evidence of safety-conscious AI design — a core requirement of Deployment Gates

Connect your RAG hybrid retrieval work to observability data indexing: The bonus criteria mentions 'retrieval/indexing for observability data' — draw a parallel between indexing 500+ pages of documents and indexing Datadog telemetry signals for deployment decisions

Highlight your full-stack production deployment stack: FastAPI + Docker + Redis + PostgreSQL + WebSocket with 80%+ test coverage demonstrates you can own backend services end-to-end, which is critical for this role

Address the seniority gap proactively: Acknowledge you are targeting a Senior role as a growth opportunity, and emphasize the breadth of your AI system design experience (research publication, production RAG, multi-agent systems) as evidence of above-average trajectory

Discuss your ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate research rigor: The paper on multimodal video understanding shows you can work at the intersection of AI research and engineering, which aligns with Datadog's push to evolve Deployment Gates from static rules to adaptive AI

Prepare to discuss location flexibility: The role is Madrid hybrid — be ready to address whether you are open to relocation or if you are targeting this as a remote exception, as this is a potential dealbreaker

Your work will directly impact how our customers monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize LLM-based applications in production.</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Join us in building the foundational tools that make AI systems observable, understandable, and reliable in the real world.</p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true"><em data-prosemirror-content-type="mark" data-prosemirror-mark-name="em">At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. And use the tools we build to accelerate our development.</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Have a lot of influence on product direction and impact on the business .</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Work with skilled, knowledgeable, and kind teammates who are happy to teach and learn</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Competitive global benefits</li> <li data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">Continuous professional development</li> </ul> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true"><em data-prosemirror-content-type="mark" data-prosemirror-mark-name="em">Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</em></p> <p data-prosemirror-content-type="node" data-prosemirror-node-name="paragraph" data-prosemirror-node-block="true">&nbsp;</p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Hybrid</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong AI/ML technical foundations — particularly in LLM application development, RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, and evaluation frameworks like RAGAS — which align well with Datadog's ML Observability team's focus on LLM tooling. However, this is a Staff Software Engineer role requiring deep distributed systems expertise, production-scale observability platform experience, and senior leadership/mentorship capabilities that a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree cannot credibly demonstrate. The location is also a significant mismatch, as the role is hybrid in Boston or New York, while the candidate prefers remote/Canada, and the salary range ($234K–$300K) far exceeds the candidate's stated expectation of $100K–$200K, suggesting a seniority gap as much as a compensation one.

Built automated LLM evaluation pipelines using RAGAS (context recall, ATS scoring, LLM self-critique), aligning with the role's focus on model evaluation and tracing

Observability platform experience (e.g., Datadog, OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, Grafana, tracing/metrics/logging infrastructure)
Staff-level engineering leadership: mentoring engineers, driving architecture decisions, cross-functional product influence
Drift detection and model monitoring in production ML systems

Go or other systems-level languages commonly used in observability backends

Highlight the LangGraph 4-agent pipeline project with quality-gated routing as evidence of understanding LLM system behavior and failure modes — a core concern in observability
Discuss the 35% retrieval precision improvement as a concrete, metrics-driven outcome that demonstrates product-oriented thinking and experimentation mindset

Acknowledge the Staff-level gap proactively and position yourself as a high-growth mid-level engineer who can ramp quickly given the depth of hands-on LLM work already completed
Connect Redis semantic caching and Docker Compose deployment experience to scalable, production-grade system design to partially address the distributed systems requirement

matches.title: Software Engineer , AI Agents Tooling & Platforms
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer , AI Agents Tooling & Platforms 
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Available locations: Lisbon or London</strong></p> <p><strong>About the Department</strong><strong><br></strong>Emerging Technologies &amp; Incubation (ETI) is where new and bold products are built and released within Cloudflare. Rather than being constrained by the structures which make Cloudflare a hugely successful business, we are able to leverage them to deliver entirely new tools and products to our customers. Cloudflare’s edge and network make it possible to solve problems at massive scale and efficiency which would be impossible for almost any other organization.</p> <p><strong>About the Team</strong><strong><br></strong>We’re building the foundational tooling and platform capabilities that power the next generation of AI agents on the Cloudflare Developer Platform. Our goal is to make it easier for AI agents to communicate, interact with the web, and work together - all while maintaining performance, scalability, and security.</p> <p>Our team is leading efforts to ship core platform primitives for AI agent orchestration, including the Cloudflare Browser Rendering API, which enables efficient, headless browsing for agents. We're also focused on AI auditability and traceability for site owners, along with creating frameworks for seamless Agent-to-Agent interactions. Working closely with other Cloudflare platform teams, we’re shaping the future of how software engineers build, deploy, and manage intelligent agents at scale.</p> <p>We are a tight-knit team that communicates and collaborates regularly. We celebrate our achievements, support one another through challenges, and hold both our work and each other to the highest standard.</p> <p><strong>What you'll do</strong><strong><br></strong>In this role, you will join world-class engineers in shaping new products built entirely on Cloudflare’s global network, while continuing to nurture the growing impact of existing offerings—ensuring continual reliability, best-in-class performance, and the implementation of new features and functionality.</p> <p>You will be encouraged to bring your ideas forward and own your code from inception to release, delivering solutions at every layer of the software stack to empower Cloudflare customers. On any given day, you might:</p> <ul> <li>Write a design document outlining your strategy to tackle a specific challenge.</li> <li>Ship a new feature that integrates multiple technologies.</li> <li>Architect and deliver innovative API primitives for our AI agent platforms, including enhancements to the Cloudflare Browser Rendering API.</li> <li>Fix a bug affecting how our user experience renders.</li> </ul> <p>You can expect to work with a variety of languages and technologies including, but not limited to, TypeScript, Go, and Rust. We use Cloudflare Workers heavily and creatively. If applicable to ongoing projects, you will also help maintain the health and availability of services by participating in an on-call rotation.</p> <p><strong>About you</strong><strong><br></strong> We want you to love it here! This role is a great fit for you if:</p> <ul> <li>You have a passion for meeting business needs while building technically innovative solutions, and you excel at balancing big-picture goals with technical detail.</li> <li>You are bold and persistent in your efforts to get your work across the finish line.</li> <li>You are excited to collaborate and communicate with engineers across Cloudflare, contributing to many layers of the stack.</li> <li>You take pride in shipping effective, reliable code.</li> <li>You are energized by learning new skills, tackling challenging debugging sessions, and sharing your knowledge with others.</li> <li>You believe that thorough documentation is just as important as delivering code.</li> <li>You want to join a team that upholds a culture of support, open and honest communication, and collaborative problem-solving.</li> <li>You are keen to explore emerging AI technologies and are excited by the opportunity to integrate AI agent platform primitives into our product suite.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Examples of Desirable Skills, Knowledge, and Experience</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience working with high-volume software applications, with a strong focus on the TypeScript programming language.</li> <li>Ability to scope, work on, and independently deliver initiatives.</li> <li>Knowledge of at least one modern, strongly-typed programming language such as Go, Rust, or C++.</li> <li>Strong written communication skills for contributing to both internal and public-facing technical documentation, as well as authoring blog posts.</li> <li>Solid understanding of computer science fundamentals including data structures, algorithms, and either object-oriented or functional design.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Bonus Points</strong></p> <ul> <li>Understanding of the web and related technologies such as web browsers, HTTP, and JavaScript.</li> <li>Experience building reliable, high-performance distributed systems or working on cloud platforms.</li> <li>Familiarity with the Cloudflare Workers development platform.</li> <li>Experience contributing to or maintaining open source software projects.</li> <li>Exposure to AI frameworks or experience in shipping AI-driven platform primitives (e.g., developing or enhancing the Cloudflare Browser Rendering API).</li> </ul> <p><strong>Locations:</strong> Lisbon</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi has a strong AI/ML and full-stack background with solid hands-on experience in LLM pipelines, RAG systems, and agent orchestration (LangGraph), which aligns well with the AI Agents theme of the role. However, the job heavily emphasizes TypeScript, Go, Rust, and Cloudflare Workers for building distributed platform primitives — areas where Ruiqi's resume shows limited or no direct experience, and the required 5+ years of experience is a significant gap for a mid-level candidate graduating in 2025. The location is also a mismatch, as the role is based in Lisbon or London (hybrid), while the candidate prefers remote/US/Canada.

Demonstrated AI agent orchestration experience with a 4-agent LangGraph pipeline project

C++ listed as a known language, partially satisfying the strongly-typed language requirement
High academic credentials: 3.9 GPA MEng at University of Waterloo with relevant specializations in LLM, CV, and RL
Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and containerized deployments (Docker Compose)

Go — not mentioned anywhere in the resume
Rust — not mentioned anywhere in the resume
Cloudflare Workers or any edge computing platform experience
5+ years of professional software engineering experience (candidate is a mid-level new grad)
Distributed systems engineering at high scale (e.g., building platform primitives, APIs for millions of users)
Headless browser / Browser Rendering API experience
Agent-to-Agent (A2A) communication frameworks or protocols
Open source contribution history

Emphasize the production RAG system at Disanji — specifically the hybrid retrieval architecture, streaming with SSE, Redis caching, and Docker deployment — to demonstrate production-grade engineering discipline

matches.title: Staff Applied AI/ ML Engineer
matches.location: Denver, CO;San Francisco, CA;New York, NY;Seattle, WA;Toronto, Ontario, CAN - Remote
matches.description:
Title: Staff Applied AI/ ML Engineer 
Company: Gusto, Inc.
Location: Denver, CO;San Francisco, CA;New York, NY;Seattle, WA;Toronto, Ontario, CAN - Remote
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p style="line-height: 1.2;">&nbsp;</p> <hr> <p><strong>About Gusto</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">At Gusto, we're on a mission to grow the small business economy. We handle the hard stuff—like payroll, health insurance, 401(k)s, and HR—so owners can focus on their craft and customers. With teams in Denver, San Francisco, and New York, we’re proud to support more than 400,000 small businesses across the country, and we’re building a workplace that represents and celebrates the customers we serve. Learn more about our </span><a href="https://gusto.com/about/careers/total-rewards"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Total Rewards philosophy</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">.&nbsp;</span></p></div><h2>About the role</h2> <p>Gusto’s AI/ML Eng team leverages our rich dataset to guide product direction and decision-making by building the right solutions at scale. We’re looking for a senior technical leader (individual contributor) who will design robust AI/ML systems and services through close partnership with seasoned leaders across Engineering, Product, Design, Data Science, Marketing, and Customer Excellence. This means you will also define the strategy along with shipping impactful models and services to evolve our AI/ML capabilities and practices.</p> <p>We have several open roles across two embedded areas:</p> <ul> <li>Unified Service Platform optimizes our customer experience, creates personalized engagement moments, and drives automated or AI enhanced assistance. We develop AI tools and platform components (ex. embedding algorithms) to improve performance and customer satisfaction.</li> <li>Growth builds AI/ML-powered experiences that drive relevant, timely product adoption. Our team enables contextual customer interactions through growth-oriented capabilities like propensity modeling and recommendations.</li> </ul> <h2>Here’s what you’ll do day-to-day</h2> <ul> <li>Design and develop scalable, production-grade AI/ML models and services for complex business and customer experience problems.</li> <li>Lead technical strategy and architecture for key AI/ML domains, including model lifecycle, observability, safety, and evaluation.</li> <li>Collaborate cross-functionally to identify high-leverage AI/ML opportunities, translate them into actionable roadmaps, and deliver measurable outcomes.</li> <li>Build, harden, and operate platform capabilities that power customer journey experiences (e.g., personalization, assistance, routing, content selection).</li> <li>Stay current with the latest AI/ML research; prototype, evaluate, and productionize new algorithms and techniques from academia and industry.</li> <li>Establish robust practices for validation, deployment, monitoring, explainability, and ongoing performance management.</li> <li>Communicate findings, roadmaps, tradeoffs, and impact clearly to executives and non-technical partners.</li> <li>Mentor engineers and scientists, fostering a culture of technical excellence and pragmatic innovation.</li> </ul> <h2>Here’s what we’re looking for</h2> <ul> <li>8+ years of hands-on experience building and deploying end-to-end AI/ML systems in industry or academia.</li> <li>Deep expertise in one or more advanced ML areas (e.g., supervised/unsupervised learning, deep learning, NLP, LLMs, retrieval/RAG, reinforcement learning).&nbsp;</li> <ul> <li>Our Growth positions would require a background in growth-oriented solutions (e.g., propensity scoring, recommendation systems, forecasting, lead scoring) and experimentation.</li> </ul> <li>Proven track record delivering large, impactful AI/ML projects into production environments with measurable business and customer impact.&nbsp;</li> <ul> <li>Experience monitoring AI agents with an attention to safety/guardrails, evaluation frameworks, and sentiment/quality analysis is necessary for the Unified Service Platform roles but not required for our Growth positions.</li> </ul> <li>Proficiency with modern ML frameworks and tooling (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Hugging Face) and cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS, or Azure).&nbsp;</li> <ul> <li>Hands-on experience building LLM-based applications and agentic AI workflows (e.g., Claude, Gemini, OpenAI), including prompt/retrieval design and evaluation, is a bonus.</li> </ul> <li>Strong programming skills in Python and sound software engineering fundamentals (testing, code review, CI/CD, reliability).</li> <li>Demonstrated leadership in cross-disciplinary settings and the ability to influence direction through technical depth and clarity.</li> <li>Excellent communication skills and strong product/business judgment.</li> <li>Ph.D. or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field is a plus.</li> </ul> <p>Our cash compensation amount for this role is targeted at $230k-280k for San Francisco, New York, and Seattle $205k - 255k in Los Angeles, $185k-234k in Denver, and 200k-250k CAD for Toronto. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including candidate experience and expertise and may vary from the amounts listed above.</p><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Gusto has physical office spaces in Denver, San Francisco, and New York City. Employees who are based in those locations will be expected to work from the office on designated days approximately <strong>2-3 days </strong>per week (or more depending on role). The same office expectations apply to all Symmetry roles, Gusto's subsidiary, whose physical office is in Scottsdale.</span></p> <p>Note: The San Francisco office expectations encompass both the San Francisco and San Jose metro areas.&nbsp;</p> <p>When approved to work from a location other than a Gusto office, a secure, reliable, and consistent internet connection is required. This includes non-office days for hybrid employees.</p> <hr> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Our customers come from all walks of life and so do we. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. If you share our values and our enthusiasm for small businesses, you will find a home at Gusto.&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Gusto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Gusto considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Gusto is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. We want to see our candidates perform to the best of their ability. If you require a medical or religious accommodation at any time throughout your candidate journey, please fill out <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdEfl7Bp-Twz7LLlhGlha46CrxZ9Kacgakmarf3K2TbnaEgKQ/viewform">this form</a> and a member of our team will get in touch with you.</span></p> <p>Gusto takes security and protection of your personal information very seriously. Please review our <a href="https://gusto.com/about/careers/fraudulent-activity-disclaimer">Fraudulent Activity Disclaimer</a>.</p> <p>Personal information collected and processed as part of your Gusto application will be subject to&nbsp;<a href="https://gusto.com/about/careers/applicant-privacy-notice" target="_blank">Gusto's Applicant Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong technical alignment in AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG systems, LLM pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, and computer vision — which are directly relevant to Gusto's AI/ML team. However, the role is a Staff-level position requiring 8+ years of industry experience, cross-functional leadership, and a proven track record of delivering large-scale production AI/ML systems with measurable business impact, none of which the candidate can credibly demonstrate at this early career stage (currently completing a Master's with ~1 year of internship experience). The salary expectations also fall well below the role's compensation band, indicating a significant seniority mismatch.
strengths: Hands-on RAG pipeline experience with hybrid retrieval (BM25 + dense vectors), reranking, and streaming — directly relevant to Gusto's Unified Service Platform
Practical LLM application development using LangChain and LangGraph, including multi-agent orchestration and evaluation frameworks (RAGAS)
Production deployment experience with Docker, FastAPI, Redis caching, and PostgreSQL — solid software engineering fundamentals
Computer vision expertise (YOLOv8, SAHI) and published research (ACM MM '23) demonstrate depth in applied ML
Cloud platform exposure (AWS, Azure) aligns with job requirements
Strong academic credentials: Master's in ECE from University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specializations in LLM, RL, and Computer Vision — a preferred qualification
Full-stack capability (React/TypeScript, WebSocket, REST APIs) adds versatility for platform-oriented AI roles
missing_skills: 8+ years of industry experience — candidate has ~1 year of internship experience, far below the Staff-level requirement
Demonstrated technical leadership and mentorship of engineers/scientists at scale
Propensity modeling, recommendation systems, forecasting, and lead scoring (required for Growth track)
Experience with ML observability, model monitoring, and explainability in production
Proficiency with PyTorch or TensorFlow (not explicitly listed on resume)
Hugging Face ecosystem experience (not mentioned)
Cross-functional executive communication and roadmap ownership
CI/CD pipelines and MLOps practices at production scale
Safety/guardrails and sentiment/quality analysis for AI agents
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji — emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement and 0.84 RAGAS context recall as quantifiable, business-relevant outcomes

Discuss the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline project as evidence of agentic AI workflow design, including the dual-layer ATS + LLM self-critique evaluation framework which maps to Gusto's safety/evaluation requirements
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to stay current with AI/ML research and translate academic work into applied systems
Frame the multi-modal and multi-model experience (YOLOv8, BGE-M3, BM25, FlashRank) as evidence of breadth across ML domains relevant to Gusto's embedding and personalization platform
Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively and position yourself as a high-growth mid-level candidate — consider targeting Gusto's mid-level or senior AI/ML Engineer roles instead of Staff level

matches.title: AI Engineer - FDE (Forward Deployed Engineer)
matches.description: <p><strong>CSQ326R35</strong></p> <p><strong>Mission</strong></p> <p>The AI Forward Deployed Engineering (AI FDE) team is a highly specialized customer-facing AI team at Databricks. We deliver professional services engagements to help our customers build and productionize first-of-its-kind AI applications. We work cross-functionally to shape long-term strategic priorities and initiatives alongside engineering, product, and developer relations, as well as support internal subject matter expert (SME) teams. We view our team as an ensemble: we look for individuals with strong, unique specializations to improve the overall strength of the team. This team is the right fit for you if you love working with customers, teammates, and fueling your curiosity for the latest trends in GenAI, LLMOps, and ML more broadly. This role can be remote.</p> <p><strong>The impact you will have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop cutting-edge GenAI solutions, incorporating the latest techniques from our Mosaic AI research to solve customer problems</li> <li>Own production rollouts of consumer and internally facing GenAI applications</li> <li>Serve as a trusted technical advisor to customers across a variety of domains</li> <li>Present at conferences such as Data + AI Summit, recognized as a thought leader internally and externally</li> <li>Collaborate cross-functionally with the product and engineering teams to influence priorities and shape the product roadmap&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience building GenAI applications, including RAG, multi-agent systems, Text2SQL, fine-tuning, etc., with tools such as HuggingFace, LangChain, and DSPy</li> <li>Minimum of 5+ years of relevant experience as a Data Scientist preferably working in a consulting role</li> <li>Expertise in deploying production-grade GenAI applications, including evaluation and optimizations&nbsp;</li> <li>Extensive years of hands-on industry data science experience, leveraging common machine learning and data science tools, i.e. pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, etc.</li> <li>Experience building production-grade machine learning deployments on AWS, Azure, or GCP</li> <li>Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Operations Research, etc.) or equivalent practical experience</li> <li>Experience communicating and/or teaching technical concepts to non-technical and technical audiences alike</li> <li>Passion for collaboration, life-long learning, and driving business value through AI</li> <li>[Preferred] Experience using the Databricks Intelligence Platform and Apache Spark™ to process large-scale distributed datasets</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>,&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a>&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span>&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit&nbsp;<a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>.&nbsp;<br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong technical alignment in GenAI and RAG systems, with hands-on experience in LangChain, LangGraph, multi-agent pipelines, and production-grade deployments — directly matching core skill requirements. However, the role demands a minimum of 5+ years of industry Data Science/consulting experience, and Ruiqi is a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree with only ~1 year of internship experience, which is a significant gap. Additionally, the job is posted for Remote - India, which conflicts with the candidate's preferred locations of Remote US/Canada.
strengths: Hands-on RAG pipeline development using LangChain LCEL, BM25 + dense/sparse hybrid retrieval, and reranking — directly matching job requirements
Multi-agent system experience via LangGraph (4-agent pipeline with quality-gated routing)
