Published research at ACM MM '23 on video-language models, showing academic depth in AI
Graduate degree (MEng) in ECE from University of Waterloo with specialization in LLM, CV, and RL — strong educational fit
Cloud experience on AWS and Azure, aligning with job's infrastructure requirements
Computer Vision expertise (YOLOv8, SAHI) adds a unique specialization valued by the FDE team ensemble model
missing_skills: 5+ years of industry Data Science or consulting experience (candidate has ~1 year of internships)
Databricks Intelligence Platform experience (no mention of Databricks, Delta Lake, or MLflow)
Apache Spark experience for large-scale distributed data processing
DSPy framework experience (listed as a preferred tool in the job posting)
Text2SQL experience (explicitly listed as a desired GenAI application type)
Fine-tuning LLMs (not mentioned in resume beyond training CV models)
Pandas and scikit-learn proficiency (standard DS tools not listed in skills)
Customer-facing consulting or professional services experience
PyTorch explicitly listed (deep learning frameworks not specified in skills section)
interview_talking_points: Lead with the production RAG system built at Disanji: emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement, RAGAS evaluation pipeline, and the full deployment stack — this directly mirrors Databricks FDE's mandate to productionize GenAI applications
Highlight the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to communicate complex AI concepts and establish thought leadership, a key expectation for conference presentations like Data + AI Summit
Discuss the 4-agent LangGraph resume generator project as evidence of multi-agent system design skills, drawing parallels to the GenAI application types (RAG, agents) Databricks customers need

Acknowledge the experience gap proactively and reframe: emphasize the density and production-readiness of work done in a short time, and express eagerness to grow into the consulting/customer-facing dimension of the role
Mention AWS and Azure exposure to address the cloud deployment requirement, and express willingness to rapidly learn Databricks, Spark, and MLflow given the strong foundational overlap

matches.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
matches.description:
Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Company: Cloudflare
Location: In-Office
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><h4><strong>Location: Bengaluru India</strong></h4> <h4><strong>About the team</strong></h4> <p>The Data Intelligence &amp; Analytics organization builds the core data platform and internal products that power decision-making across the company. We design and operate large-scale data systems, own the company’s data lake, ingestion infrastructure, and platform tooling, and develop end-to-end applications that transform complex datasets into fast, reliable, business-critical products used daily by go-to-market, product, and engineering teams. Our work sits at the intersection of data platforms, distributed systems, and product development, giving engineers the opportunity to own meaningful problems across the stack and build systems that truly run the business.</p> <h4><strong>About the role</strong></h4> <p>We are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our Bengaluru team and help scale the next generation of our AI/ML models. In this role, you will build and operate the pipelines behind AI-driven applications, Agents, Chatbots that power teams across the company, including go-to-market, engineering, and product. Because the products we build are initiated and owned by the team, you will be involved end-to-end — from shaping requirements and designing systems to implementation, deployment, and long-term ownership.</p> <p>You will focus on building scalable, reliable services and application backends, partnering closely with data and full-stack engineers to deliver new features and operate the pipelines and platforms behind our products. Our stack spans multiple languages and technologies, including Python, React, and TypeScript, and continues to evolve. Many of our applications also incorporate strong AI components, giving you opportunities to work with modern AI infrastructure and tools such as vector databases, MCP-based services, and Workers AI.</p> <p><strong>What you'll do</strong></p> <ul> <li>Deploy, manage &amp; support ML Applications &amp; Services on Kubernetes<br><br></li> <li>Understand MLOps landscape i.e tooling, tech stack, source systems etc. and work on introducing new tools and solutions for ML &amp; AI initiatives.<br><br></li> <li>Partner and align with Data Scientists, Data Engineers and internal teams to deliver ML solutions in a globally distributed environment.<br><br></li> <li>Lead development of efficiencies to boost model training to deployment lead times<br><br></li> <li>Understand business/product strategy and high-level roadmap and align analysis efforts to enable them with data insights and help achieve their strategic goals.<br><br></li> <li>Leverage Cloudflare products and services for AI &amp; ML initiatives and applications<br><br></li> <li>Use software engineering best practices to publish model scores/insights/learnings at scale within the company.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience</strong></p> <ul> <li>M.S or Ph.D in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields.<br><br></li> <li>5+ years of ML Engineering experience with proven industry experience in a large scale environment (PBs scale &amp; globally distributed teams) <br><br></li> <li>Strong experience in scientific computing using Python with Scikit-Learn &amp; PyTorch or Tensorflow.<br><br></li> <li>Strong experience working with Docker &amp; Kubernetes to build and deploy applications and systems.<br><br></li> <li>Experience working with ML Platform tools (AirFlow, Argo Workflows, ArgoCD) preferred.<br><br></li> <li>Experience working with Data Scientists to deploy Machine Learning applications systems for training, inference and observability.<br><br></li> <li>Experience with Full-stack Web technologies and languages (FastAPI, Streamlit, JavaScript/TypeScript, Cloudflare Workers, etc.) preferred with the ability to quickly learn and contribute across a multi-language stack.<br><br></li> <li>Experience with Terraform, Google Cloud Platform (or any other public cloud equivalent) etc.<br><br></li> <li>Experience working with CI/CD systems, version control (Git, Bitbucket, etc.), testing (Pytest, etc.) and DevOps tools.<br><br></li> <li>Experience with Databases such as BigQuery, Postgres, SQLite and ETL/ELT practices<br><br></li> <li>Strong cross-functional collaboration experience with data engineering and data analysts teams within the function.<br><br></li> <li> <div>Proficiency in large language models and the frameworks like Langchain, LangGraph, etc. necessary for implementing GenAI applications, such as chatbots and related use cases.</div> </li> <li>Strong communication and presentation skills catered to different audiences within the company.<br><br></li> <li>Demonstrated ability to design scalable, reliable, and observable systems, with experience influencing architecture and improving platform foundations.<br><br></li> <li>Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with a track record of working effectively with cross-functional partners and driving projects through ambiguous problem spaces.<br><br></li> <li>Experience mentoring engineers, leading by example in code and design, and contributing to a culture of technical excellence.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong technical alignment in AI/ML tooling — particularly in LangChain, LangGraph, RAG pipelines, FastAPI, Docker, and full-stack development — which maps well to Cloudflare's ML Engineering stack. However, the role is a Senior-level position requiring 5+ years of ML Engineering experience in large-scale, globally distributed environments, while the candidate is a mid-level engineer still completing their Master's degree with roughly 1–2 years of internship-level experience. The location is a critical mismatch: the role is in-office in Bengaluru, India, while the candidate is based in Canada and prefers remote or hybrid work in the US/Canada.
strengths: Strong hands-on experience with LangChain and LangGraph for building AI agent pipelines, directly matching the job's GenAI requirements
Production-grade RAG system development with hybrid retrieval (BM25 + dense vectors), reranking, and streaming — highly relevant to Cloudflare's AI application work
Full-stack proficiency across FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, and WebSocket aligns with the team's multi-language stack
Published research (ACM MM '23) on video-language models demonstrates academic depth in ML
Experience with automated ML evaluation pipelines (RAGAS) shows understanding of model observability
Strong educational background: M.Eng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specializations in LLM, CV, RL, and DevOps
Experience with vector databases (ChromaDB, Milvus) and semantic caching (Redis) matches the job's mention of vector database infrastructure
Computer Vision experience (YOLOv8, SAHI) adds breadth to ML skill set
missing_skills: Kubernetes (K8s) — required for deploying and managing ML applications; not mentioned in resume
MLOps platform tools: Airflow, Argo Workflows, ArgoCD — explicitly preferred by the job
PyTorch or TensorFlow / Scikit-Learn — core ML frameworks not listed in skills
Terraform or Infrastructure-as-Code tooling — required for cloud infrastructure management
Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or equivalent large-scale cloud experience — candidate lists AWS/Azure but no GCP depth
BigQuery or large-scale data warehouse / ETL/ELT experience
5+ years of industry ML Engineering experience — candidate has ~1–2 years of internship-level experience
Experience in PB-scale, globally distributed ML systems
CI/CD pipeline experience (e.g., GitHub Actions, ArgoCD) — not explicitly mentioned
Mentorship and technical leadership experience — required for senior-level role
interview_talking_points: Lead with the production RAG system built at Disanji: highlight the end-to-end pipeline design, 35% retrieval precision improvement, RAGAS evaluation (0.84 context recall), and Docker/FastAPI deployment — this directly mirrors Cloudflare's AI application work
Emphasize the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline project with quality-gated routing, dual-layer ATS + LLM evaluation, and 80%+ test coverage to demonstrate software engineering rigor in AI systems
Discuss the ACM MM '23 publication to establish credibility in ML research and multimodal AI, which aligns with Cloudflare's advanced AI initiatives

Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively and frame your rapid skill acquisition, academic excellence (3.9 GPA), and production deployments as evidence of above-average trajectory for a mid-level engineer
Highlight Docker experience and express eagerness to expand into Kubernetes, framing it as a natural next step from your containerization background
Address the location mismatch directly if applying — clarify willingness to relocate to Bengaluru or inquire about remote/hybrid flexibility for this specific role

matches.title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer - Community Support Engineering
matches.description:
Title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer - Community Support Engineering
Company: Airbnb
Location: Remote - USA
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Community You Will Join: </strong></span></p> <p>Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence are at the heart of the Airbnb product. From Trust to Payments, and from Customer Service to Marketing we rely on ML to ensure that guests and hosts have the best possible experience with Airbnb.&nbsp;</p> <p>The Community Support Products (CSP) Machine Learning team is the core team responsible for driving CSxAI (Customer Support x Artificial Intelligence) initiatives by adopting the Generative AI technologies to enable an intelligent, scalable and exceptional service experience. The team develops and enhances various AI models, ML services and tools including LLM fine-tuning and optimization, RAG/Search,&nbsp; LLM evaluation and testing automation, feedback-based learning and guardrail for a wide range of applications in Airbnb.&nbsp;</p> <p>The richness of Airbnb's data, the complexity of its marketplace and the variety innate in our product mean that we need to operate at the state of the art of AI practice. We are committed to investing in long term innovation to solve the complex problems we face, and to do that we need the very best experts in ML and AI to join us.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></span></p> <p>We believe our current customer experiences in these domains are only scratching the surface of the innovations that are possible, and that science is at the heart of delivering a step-function change for our Guest and and Host on Airbnb.&nbsp;</p> <p>You will build and leverage cutting edge AI technologies to transform Airbnb’s customer service by delivering personalized, easy-to-use and proactive customer service experience.&nbsp;</p> <p>Many of the initiatives you’ll tackle are in their early conceptual stages. You will have the opportunity to shape these ideas from inception to production, turning visionary concepts into impactful realities.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></span></p> <ul> <li> <p>Envision, champion, and support the development of novel ML systems, product integrations, and performance optimizations to solve real-world problems</p> </li> <li> <p>Work cross-functionally with product, design, and other engineering counterparts to design and build efficient AI solutions for Airbnb CS products</p> </li> <li> <p>Learn and share the latest AI/ML technologies with the team.</p> </li> </ul> <p><br><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li> <p>PhD/Master’s degree, preferably in CS, or equivalent experience</p> </li> <li> <p>6/9+ years of ML engineering experience, with ownership responsibility over large-scale software systems</p> </li> <li> <p>Background in the design and development of AI and ML systems and services, and a deep passion for building efficient and scalable ML-powered products</p> </li> <li> <p>Experience with LLM driven chatbot and Agentic AI products would be a big plus</p> </li> <li>Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well within a team and with teams across the engineering, product &amp; design organizations</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. <a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list.</a></span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p> <div id="te-floating-button-container"></div> <div id="te-floating-button-container"></div> <div id="te-floating-button-container"></div> <div id="te-floating-button-container"></div> <div id="te-floating-button-container"></div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$204,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$255,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong technical alignment with the role's AI/ML stack — particularly in RAG systems, LLM pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, and agentic AI — which are core to Airbnb's CSP ML team. However, this is a Staff-level role requiring 6–9+ years of ML engineering experience with ownership over large-scale systems, while the candidate is a mid-level engineer still completing their Master's degree with roughly 1–2 years of internship/project experience. The experience gap is the dominant mismatch and makes this role a significant reach regardless of technical skill quality.
strengths: Hands-on RAG pipeline experience with hybrid retrieval (BM25 + dense vectors), reranking, and streaming — directly mirrors Airbnb's RAG/Search focus
Built production-grade RAG system with automated RAGAS evaluation, aligning with the job's emphasis on LLM evaluation and testing automation
LangGraph multi-agent pipeline project demonstrates agentic AI experience, a stated 'big plus' in the job posting
Master's degree in ECE from University of Waterloo with specializations in LLM, Reinforcement Learning, and Computer Vision — meets the educational preference
Full-stack capability (FastAPI, React, PostgreSQL, Docker, WebSocket) enables cross-functional collaboration with product and engineering teams
Published research at ACM MM '23 on video-language models demonstrates academic ML credibility
Remote-eligible candidate with preference for remote/hybrid aligns with the job's US Remote designation
missing_skills: 6–9+ years of ML engineering experience (candidate has ~1–2 years of internship-level experience)
Ownership and leadership over large-scale production ML systems at Staff/Senior level
LLM fine-tuning and optimization experience (not mentioned in resume)
Experience with feedback-based learning systems and guardrails for LLMs
Cross-functional leadership and stakeholder management at a Staff engineer level
Experience with enterprise-scale customer support or trust/safety ML systems
No evidence of experience with Airbnb-scale distributed ML infrastructure (e.g., Kafka usage is listed but not demonstrated in ML context)
interview_talking_points: Lead with the Disanji RAG system: emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement, RAGAS evaluation pipeline (0.84 context recall), and production deployment with Docker/FastAPI/Redis — this directly maps to Airbnb's RAG/Search and LLM evaluation priorities
Highlight the 4-agent LangGraph Resume Generator project as a concrete example of agentic AI product development, including the dual-layer ATS + LLM self-critique evaluation system
Reference the ACM MM '23 publication on multimodal video-language models to demonstrate research depth and ability to work at the frontier of AI

Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively and frame it as an opportunity: express eagerness to grow into Staff-level ownership, and highlight the breadth of end-to-end system design experience despite early career stage
Emphasize full-stack ownership (frontend to backend to ML pipeline to deployment) as evidence of the cross-functional collaboration skills the role requires
Connect YOLOv8 industrial defect detection work to Airbnb's trust and safety ML use cases as an analogy for real-world, high-stakes ML applications

matches.title: Senior AI Engineer - APM Integrations
matches.location: Germany, Remote; Italy, Remote; Spain, Remote
matches.description: <p>IDM is the team that works on Datadog APM integrations: the parts that connect Datadog to the tools and services customers use. The team’s job is to make it easier for engineers to build and maintain integrations over time, and to keep quality and reliability high.&nbsp;You will build AI-assisted tools that help with day-to-day engineering work, like drafting code changes, suggesting fixes, and checking results with tests and other automated checks. The goal is building tools that engineers can trust in real production work. You’ll also work closely with other teams, understand how they work, and build solutions that fit their process.&nbsp;You will define what “good” means for these tools, measure results, and improve them over time. You’ll set up evaluation and testing so the AI output stays correct and doesn’t silently get worse. This is a senior role with high ownership, from early prototypes to production and ongoing support.</p> <p><em>At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You’ll Do:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Build agent workflows that take an integration need from plan to implementation and validation with humans approving at the right checkpoints</li> <li>Create systems that synthesize context from codebases, docs, specs, telemetry, and historical incidents to make changes that match Datadog conventions and customer expectations</li> <li>Generate and evolve integration code and tests, including end-to-end scenarios that reflect real customer workloads and product features</li> <li>Design evaluation harnesses that prevent silent regressions: golden sets, scenario baselines, semantic checks, performance thresholds, and release gating</li> <li>Build portfolio-level automation: proactive updates for upstream breaking changes, tracer feature rollouts across the catalog, migrations to new schemas/semantics, and targeted coverage expansion</li> <li>Partner tightly with PM, support engineers, and integration-owning teams to make the system adoptable, trustworthy, and embedded in daily engineering workflows</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Who You Are:</strong></p> <p><strong>Product-minded engineer who ships AI to production</strong></p> <ul> <li>6+ years building backend systems (Go, Java, or .NET) with strong focus on simplicity, correctness, and performance</li> <li>Proven experience delivering LLM/agent features to production (prompting, tooling, evals, safety/guardrails)</li> <li>Comfortable navigating ambiguity, iterating from prototype to production, and measuring impact with clear metrics</li> <li>You have demonstrated ability to use AI coding tools in day-to-day workflows and validate, critique, and refine AI-generated output</li> </ul> <p><strong>Strong ML fundamentals</strong></p> <ul> <li>Solid grasp of the ML lifecycle (task definition, dataset construction, modeling, evaluation, deployment, iteration) and statistics for experiments</li> <li>Fluency with offline/online evals: golden sets, automated regressions, and evaluation harnesses that prevent silent quality drift</li> </ul> <p><strong>Distributed systems &amp; observability savvy</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience with microservices performance: tracing, latency breakdowns, concurrency, resiliency patterns</li> <li>Production operations mindset: monitoring, alerting, and participating in on‑call rotations where applicable</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Bonus Point:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Hands‑on with distributed tracing stacks (OpenTelemetry/Datadog APM), profilers, and logs/metrics pipelines</li> <li>Experience with planning/agent frameworks, tool‑use orchestration, RAG, and retrieval/indexing over large context</li> <li>Experience building developer tools (IDEs, static analysis, compilers, code transformation pipelines) or code-generation systems</li> <li>Familiarity with semantic conventions / schema migrations, scenario-based testing, and cross-language porting at scale</li> <li>You’re motivated to push the boundaries of how AI can improve software engineering best practices and contribute to building AI-enabled products</li> </ul> <p><em>Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Benefits and Growth:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)</li> <li>Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing</li> <li>Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking</li> <li>An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)</li> <li>Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions</li> <li>Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+</li> <li>Competitive global benefits</li> </ul> <p><br><em>Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Remote</p><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>About Datadog:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on <a href="https://www.instagram.com/datadoghq/?hl=en" target="_blank">Instagram</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/datadog" target="_blank">LinkedIn,</a> and <a href="https://learn.datadoghq.com/" target="_blank">Datadog Learning Center. </a></p> <hr> <p data-renderer-start-pos="215"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Equal Opportunity at Datadog:</strong></p> <p>Datadog is proud to offer <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf" target="_blank">equal employment opportunity</a> to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/candidate-legal-notices/" target="_blank">Candidate Legal Notices</a> for your reference.&nbsp;</p> <p>Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeoJeduEZ2NdZF_65uZmWUrCM-zee7yADXX1s6Xr9zAGq8iKA/viewform" target="_blank">this form</a>. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.&nbsp;</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Privacy and AI Guidelines:</strong></p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662">Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice</a>. For information on our AI policy, please visit <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/interviewing-at-datadog-ai-guidelines/" target="_blank">Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong AI/ML fundamentals — particularly in RAG pipelines, LLM tooling, LangChain/LangGraph, and evaluation frameworks — which align well with the AI engineering aspects of this role. However, this is a Senior-level position requiring 6+ years of backend engineering experience (specifically in Go, Java, or .NET), distributed systems expertise, and APM/observability domain knowledge, all of which the candidate significantly lacks given their early-career profile (~1–2 years of internship experience). The location is also a mismatch, as the role is Europe-remote (Germany, Italy, Spain) while the candidate prefers US/Canada remote.
strengths: Strong RAG pipeline experience: built production-grade RAG system with hybrid retrieval (BM25 + BGE-M3), reranking, and RAGAS evaluation — directly relevant to the role's retrieval/indexing requirements
LangGraph agent workflow experience: architected a 4-agent LangGraph pipeline with quality-gated routing, closely matching the job's requirement to build agent workflows from plan to validation

LLM evaluation mindset: built automated evaluation pipelines using RAGAS (0.84 context recall) and dual-layer ATS/LLM self-critique scoring, aligning with the role's emphasis on eval harnesses and preventing silent regressions

Solid academic foundation: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with specializations in LLM, Reinforcement Learning, Computer Vision, and DevOps — strong theoretical grounding for an AI engineering role
Full-stack production deployment: experience with FastAPI, Docker, Redis, PostgreSQL, WebSocket, and streaming (SSE) demonstrates ability to ship end-to-end systems
Published AI research: co-authored a paper at ACM MM '23 on multimodal video understanding, showing depth in ML fundamentals
Computer Vision & deep learning breadth: YOLOv8, SAHI, and multimodal QA experience shows versatility across AI domains
missing_skills: 6+ years of backend engineering experience — candidate has ~1–2 years of internship-level experience, far short of the senior bar
Go, Java (production-grade), or .NET backend proficiency — the role explicitly requires these; candidate's Java is listed as a language but not demonstrated in production contexts
Distributed systems expertise: microservices, tracing, latency analysis, concurrency, and resiliency patterns are not evidenced in the resume
APM/observability domain knowledge: no experience with Datadog APM, OpenTelemetry, distributed tracing stacks, profilers, or logs/metrics pipelines
Production on-call and operations mindset: no evidence of monitoring, alerting, or incident response experience
Code generation or developer tooling experience: no background in IDEs, static analysis, compilers, or code transformation pipelines
Semantic conventions and schema migration experience at scale
Cross-language porting or large-scale integration catalog management
interview_talking_points: Lead with your RAG production experience at Disanji: emphasize the end-to-end pipeline (hybrid retrieval, reranking, streaming, Redis caching) and the measurable 35% precision improvement — this directly mirrors what the IDM team builds

Highlight your RAGAS evaluation pipeline as evidence of an 'eval harness' mindset — draw a direct parallel to the job's requirement for golden sets, automated regressions, and preventing silent quality drift

Showcase the LangGraph 4-agent pipeline project: frame it around the job's language of 'agent workflows from plan to implementation and validation with human checkpoints' — the quality-gated routing is a strong match

Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively but pivot to your trajectory: MEng at Waterloo (graduating Oct 2025), published research at ACM MM '23, and production deployments demonstrate above-average growth velocity for your experience level

Express genuine interest in the APM/observability domain and show you've done homework on Datadog's tracing stack and OpenTelemetry — even if you lack direct experience, demonstrating domain curiosity matters
Mention your Docker/FastAPI/PostgreSQL deployment experience as evidence you can own systems end-to-end, not just prototype AI features
Address the location mismatch directly if contacted — clarify your openness to European remote work if applicable, or note your timezone flexibility

matches.title: Senior AI Engineer - AI Developer Workflows
matches.description:
Title: Senior AI Engineer - AI Developer Workflows
Company: Datadog
Location: Tel Aviv, Israel
Description: <p>We’re building a new team building to bring the power of Datadog to developers within AI-focused Developer workflows such as AI agents like Cursor, Claude code, GitHub Copilot and Datadog’s native AI agents.</p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p>We’re looking for product-minded engineers who are excited about developer tools, SDLC improvements and AI in general to help us quickly define and ship features and tools that make all Datadog customers 10x developers.</p> <p><em>At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You’ll Do:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work on agents, prompts, evals, MCPs and direct agent tools from ideation to productization, for allowing Datadog to help companies and developers to maximize the benefit of their integration with Datadog</li> <li>Help conceptualize and build innovative User flows and experiences within Datadog’s user space and different extensions&nbsp;</li> <li>Prototype and see what works well in the real world, iterate closely with our users, and then ship</li> <li>Follow the latest research on LLM prompt optimization, agents, and code editing.</li> <li>Support other Datadog product teams to help them build and productionize their developer-focused AI Workflows. For example, you’ll work with the Live Debugger team to create an agentic production debugging experience, delivering on the vision of&nbsp; “one click to reproduce” for production errors.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Who You Are:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>You’re a backend engineer with at least 5 years of professional experience who values code simplicity and performance. You’ve shipped software that uses LLMs to production</li> <li>You are passionate about Generative AI and its ability to help software engineers be more productive</li> <li>You have relevant experience with Large Language Models, large-scale systems and data sets, machine learning, or adjacent fields</li> <li>You are a great community ambassador and can drive hard technical conversations towards a pragmatic solution</li> <li>You want to work in a fast, high-growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers</li> <li>You have experience writing classic or AI oriented developer tools(such as IDEs, static code analysis, SDLC tools etc).</li> <li>You have a BS/MS/PhD in a Computer Science, Engineering or related scientific field or equivalent experience</li> </ul> <p><em>Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Benefits and Growth:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+</span></li> <li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Competitive global benefits</span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;"><br></span><em><span style="font-weight: 400;">Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</span></em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Hybrid</p><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>About Datadog:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on <a href="https://www.instagram.com/datadoghq/?hl=en" target="_blank">Instagram</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/datadog" target="_blank">LinkedIn,</a> and <a href="https://learn.datadoghq.com/" target="_blank">Datadog Learning Center. </a></p> <hr> <p data-renderer-start-pos="215"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Equal Opportunity at Datadog:</strong></p> <p>Datadog is proud to offer <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf" target="_blank">equal employment opportunity</a> to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/candidate-legal-notices/" target="_blank">Candidate Legal Notices</a> for your reference.&nbsp;</p> <p>Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeoJeduEZ2NdZF_65uZmWUrCM-zee7yADXX1s6Xr9zAGq8iKA/viewform" target="_blank">this form</a>. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.&nbsp;</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Privacy and AI Guidelines:</strong></p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662">Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice</a>. For information on our AI policy, please visit <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/interviewing-at-datadog-ai-guidelines/" target="_blank">Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong AI/ML technical alignment with the role — particularly in LLM-based systems, RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, and agentic architectures — which maps well to Datadog's AI developer workflow focus. However, the role is a Senior position requiring 5+ years of professional experience, while the candidate is a mid-level engineer still completing their Master's degree with only ~6 months of relevant internship experience. The location is a critical mismatch: the role is based in Tel Aviv, Israel (hybrid), while the candidate prefers remote work in the US or Canada.

Observability/monitoring platform knowledge (Datadog-specific domain expertise)

Highlight the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline project as a concrete example of agentic architecture design, quality-gated routing, and end-to-end ownership from ideation to deployment

Acknowledge the location constraint directly and clarify willingness to relocate to Tel Aviv or negotiate a remote arrangement, as this is a significant blocker for the application

matches.title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer, Listings and Host Tools Data and AI
matches.description:
Title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer, Listings and Host Tools Data and AI
Company: Airbnb
Location: Remote-USA
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Community You Will Join: </strong></span></p> <p>Listings and Host Tools Data and AI (DnA) team: This team supports host personalization products and provides data driven solutions to achieve superior host experience on Airbnb. These products include but are not limited to managing your space (MYS), host tools etc. We own data pipelines and ML models and will build services for serving that are used in the above areas.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></span></p> <p>There is a huge opportunity to improve the Host and Guest experience by leveraging open source, third party, and home grown ML models. As an ML engineer, you will partner closely with our data science, product partners, and other ML + data engineers on the team to execute on these opportunities in order to improve the Host and Guest product experience on Airbnb.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>Work with large scale structured and unstructured data, build and continuously improve cutting edge Machine Learning models for Airbnb product, business and operational use cases.</li> <li>Work collaboratively with cross-functional partners including software engineers, product managers, operations and data scientists, identify opportunities for business impact, understand, refine, and prioritize requirements for machine learning models, drive engineering decisions, and quantify impact.</li> <li>Prototype machine learning use cases for use in the product, and work with stakeholders to iterate on requirements.</li> <li>Develop, productionize, and operate Machine Learning models and pipelines at scale, including both batch and real-time use cases.</li> <li>Design and build services, API to enable serving ML model driven data to product use cases.</li> </ul> <p><br><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>8+ years of industry experience in applied Machine Learning, inclusive MS or PhD in relevant fields.</li> <li>Must have experience in both Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision.</li> <li>Strong programming (Scala / Python / Java/ C++ or equivalent) and data engineering skills</li> <li>Deep understanding of Machine Learning best practices (eg. training/serving skew minimization, A/B test, feature engineering, feature/model selection), algorithms (eg. gradient boosted trees, neural networks/deep learning, optimization, state-of-art NLP and CV algorithms) and domains (eg. natural language processing, computer vision, personalization and recommendation, anomaly detection)</li> <li>Experience with 3 or more of these technologies: Tensorflow, PyTorch, Kubernetes, Spark, Airflow (or equivalent), data warehouse (eg. Hive)</li> <li>Industry experience building end-to-end Machine Learning infrastructure and/or building and productionizing Machine Learning models, as well as integrating to product use cases.</li> <li>Exposure to architectural patterns of a large, high-scale software applications (e.g., well-designed APIs, high volume data pipelines, efficient algorithms, models)</li> <li>Experience with test driven development, familiar with A/B testing, incremental delivery and deployment.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. <a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list.</a></span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$204,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$255,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong foundational AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG systems, LLMs, Computer Vision, and full-stack ML deployment — that partially align with Airbnb's Staff ML Engineer role. However, the role demands 8+ years of industry experience and Staff-level seniority, while the candidate is a mid-level engineer still completing their Master's degree with only a few months of internship experience, representing a significant experience gap. Additionally, the candidate lacks several enterprise-scale ML technologies explicitly required by the job posting, such as Spark, Airflow, TensorFlow/PyTorch at scale, Kubernetes, and large-scale data warehouse experience.
strengths: Strong NLP/LLM expertise including RAG pipelines, LangChain, LangGraph, and vector databases (ChromaDB, Milvus)
Demonstrated Computer Vision experience with YOLOv8, SAHI, and multimodal video understanding (ACM MM '23 publication)
Hands-on production ML deployment using FastAPI, Docker, Redis caching, and streaming (SSE/WebSocket)
Solid programming skills in Python, C++, Java, and JavaScript — all listed as preferred languages in the job posting
End-to-end ML pipeline experience including data ingestion, model training, evaluation (RAGAS), and serving
Strong academic credentials: UBC (3.7 GPA, Dean's Honor List) + University of Waterloo MEng (3.9 GPA) with relevant specializations
Experience with hybrid retrieval systems (BM25 + dense/sparse vectors) and reranking — relevant to personalization/recommendation use cases
Remote-eligible location preference aligns with the job's US Remote designation (candidate is Canada-based, which may require verification)
missing_skills: 8+ years of industry experience — candidate has only internship-level experience (~6 months total)
Apache Spark for large-scale distributed data processing
Apache Airflow or equivalent workflow orchestration
Kubernetes for ML model serving and infrastructure
TensorFlow or PyTorch explicitly listed and used at production scale
Data warehouse experience (e.g., Hive, BigQuery, Snowflake)
A/B testing and experimentation frameworks at scale
Gradient boosted trees and classical ML algorithms (e.g., XGBoost, LightGBM)
Personalization and recommendation systems experience
Scala programming language
Staff/senior-level cross-functional leadership and stakeholder management
Experience with high-volume, real-time ML inference pipelines at internet scale
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji — emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement, RAGAS evaluation pipeline (0.84 context recall), and scalable deployment with Docker + Redis caching as evidence of real-world ML engineering rigor
Discuss the ACM MM '23 publication on Dual Branches Video Modeling to demonstrate both NLP and Computer Vision expertise, directly satisfying the 'must have experience in both NLP and CV' requirement
Emphasize the 4-agent LangGraph AI pipeline project with quality-gated routing, ATS scoring, and LLM self-critique as a demonstration of advanced agentic AI architecture and end-to-end system design
Frame the YOLOv8 industrial defect detection project (91% mAP@50, 5,000+ image pipeline) as experience with large-scale data pipelines and production CV model deployment

Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively and position yourself as a high-trajectory candidate — strong academic pedigree (Waterloo MEng, UBC Dean's List), published researcher, and fast learner who can grow into the Staff role
Express willingness to quickly ramp on Spark, Airflow, and Kubernetes by drawing parallels to existing Docker/orchestration and data pipeline experience

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer, AI Applications Tooling
matches.description:
Title: Senior Software Engineer, AI Applications Tooling
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><h3><strong>Preferred Location: Lisbon, Portugal | </strong><strong>London, UK</strong></h3> <h3><strong>Other Locations: Austin, TX</strong></h3> <h3><strong>About the Role</strong></h3> <p>We are building a new, high-impact team of AI application experts to define, <strong>drive</strong>, and develop our AI solutions, from AI observability to autonomous intelligent agents. As a <strong>Senior AI Engineer</strong>, you will be instrumental in <strong>defining Cloudflare’s AI strategy</strong>, <strong>leading</strong> critical projects such as LLM-powered code generation, AI observability, and edge-optimized model inference. This role requires bringing cutting-edge AI capabilities to our developer platform and will involve setting the technical direction for high-performance, scalable AI applications that push the boundaries of what’s possible on the web.</p> <h3>About the Department</h3> <p>Our team is part of Cloudflare's Emerging Technology and Incubation (ETI) team where new, bold products are built and released within Cloudflare. Rather than being constrained by the structures which make Cloudflare a successful business, ETI leverages our network to deliver entirely new tools and products to our customers. Our most successful endeavors include the Cloudflare development platform, which is composed of Cloudflare Workers, Durable Objects, R2, D1, and many other developer products.</p> <h3>What you'll do</h3> <p>As a Senior member of the AI Applications team, you will own and strategically shape the future of AI-powered applications on our platform. You will work across Cloudflare’s stack, collaborating with teams to define, build, and optimize mission-critical AI solutions that enhance developer experience, security, and performance.</p> <p>To this end, you will:</p> <ul> <li>Lead the development of high-impact AI-powered tools and integrations that enhance the developer experience, such as AI-assisted code generation and debugging.</li> <li>Design, architect, and implement AI observability solutions to improve model monitoring, explainability, and performance optimization at scale.</li> <li>Drive cross-functional efforts to integrate AI into Cloudflare’s developer platform, ensuring optimal scalability and efficiency.</li> <li>Mentor and champion best practices, engaging with the broader AI and developer community, contributing to open-source projects, technical documentation, and blog posts.</li> <li>Work across Cloudflare’s ecosystem to identify and evaluate new AI opportunities, influence technical direction, and drive adoption of AI technologies.</li> <li>If applicable to ongoing projects, you may also participate in an on-call rotation to support critical AI-powered services.</li> </ul> <h3>Minimum Requirements</h3> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience, heavy focus on Typescript and Javascript</li> <li>Proven experience in building and optimizing AI applications, with a deep understanding of LLMs, model inference, and AI-powered developer tools.</li> <li>Expertise in tackling complex debugging challenges, optimizing AI workloads, and working with large-scale distributed systems.</li> </ul> <h3>About you</h3> <p>We want you to love it here! This role is a good fit for you if you are:</p> <h3>&nbsp;<strong>Must Have</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Strong experience with Cloudflare platform or similar edge/serverless architectures</li> <li>Deep understanding of modern agent patterns and LLM application development</li> <li>Excellence in TypeScript, with expertise in async, performance optimization</li> <li>Experience with AI/ML tooling: prompts, evals, safety systems, observability</li> <li>Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Nice to Have</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Experience with Agents SDK, Workers AI, AI Gateway, and Vectorize in production</li> <li>Security depth: prompt injection protection, PII handling, secrets management</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi demonstrates solid foundational AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, and LLM application development — that partially align with Cloudflare's AI Applications Tooling role. However, this is a Senior-level position requiring 5+ years of experience with a heavy TypeScript/JavaScript focus, edge/serverless architectures, and AI observability at scale, areas where the candidate shows significant gaps given their mid-level profile (~1–2 years of relevant work experience) and Python-centric background. The location is also a concern, as Cloudflare prefers Lisbon or London, while the candidate is Canada-based and prefers remote/US/Canada.

Hands-on LangChain and LangGraph experience, including a 4-agent LangGraph pipeline with quality-gated routing in a personal project

matches.title: Staff AI Engineer - Simulation Environments
matches.description:
Title: Staff AI Engineer - Simulation Environments
Company: Datadog
Location: New York, New York, USA
Description: <p>Datadog is building the platform that empowers engineers to observe, understand, and act on their systems. As we expand into the world of intelligent systems, our Simulation Environments team is pioneering high-fidelity, synthetic environments to safely train and evaluate AI agents. As a Staff Engineer on this team, you’ll play a foundational role in designing and scaling this simulation platform. You'll collaborate across AI research and product teams to deliver environments where AI agents can learn, reason, and take action—pushing the boundaries of observability and automation.</p> <p><em data-renderer-mark="true">At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.</em><br><br></p> <p><strong>What You’ll Do:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Design and build high-fidelity simulation environments that model complex distributed systems with realism and scalability</li> <li>Develop synthetic data generation tools and evaluation pipelines to train and assess AI agents across Datadog products</li> <li>Collaborate with AI research and product engineering teams to integrate models into simulation and production workflows</li> <li>Define architecture and technical direction for Datadog’s emerging simulation platform</li> <li>Mentor engineers and contribute to shaping the culture of a new, cross-functional team<br><br></li> </ul> <p><strong>Who You Are:</strong></p> <ul> <li>You have a BS, MS, PhD, or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field</li> <li>Strong experience in distributed systems, backend, or infrastructure engineering</li> <li>Hands-on experience building or deploying ML/AI systems, beyond consumption of existing models</li> <li>Familiarity with synthetic data, simulation frameworks, or generative modeling approaches</li> <li>Proven ability to turn ambiguity into clarity and define new systems from the ground up</li> <li>Skilled communicator and team leader, especially in cross-functional and early-stage environments</li> </ul> <p><em data-renderer-mark="true">Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.</em><br><br></p> <p><strong>Benefits and Growth:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Generous and competitive benefits package</li> <li>New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan</li> <li>Continuous career development and pathing opportunities</li> <li>Employee-focused best in class onboarding</li> <li>Internal mentor and cross-departmental buddy program</li> <li>Friendly and inclusive workplace culture</li> </ul> <p><em data-renderer-mark="true">Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</em><br><br></p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Hybrid</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.</p></div><div class="title">The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$234,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$300,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>About Datadog:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on <a href="https://www.instagram.com/datadoghq/?hl=en" target="_blank">Instagram</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/datadog" target="_blank">LinkedIn,</a> and <a href="https://learn.datadoghq.com/" target="_blank">Datadog Learning Center. </a></p> <hr> <p data-renderer-start-pos="215"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Equal Opportunity at Datadog:</strong></p> <p>Datadog is proud to offer <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf" target="_blank">equal employment opportunity</a> to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/candidate-legal-notices/" target="_blank">Candidate Legal Notices</a> for your reference.&nbsp;</p> <p>Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeoJeduEZ2NdZF_65uZmWUrCM-zee7yADXX1s6Xr9zAGq8iKA/viewform" target="_blank">this form</a>. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.&nbsp;</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Privacy and AI Guidelines:</strong></p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662">Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice</a>. For information on our AI policy, please visit <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/interviewing-at-datadog-ai-guidelines/" target="_blank">Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines</a>.</p></div>
