matches.title: Software Engineer- AI
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer- AI
Company: Cloudflare
Location: In-Office
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Available Location: Bengaluru, India</strong></p> <p><strong>About the Team:</strong></p> <div>As customer zero, we evangelize our products to drive maximum business value while serving as the "glue" that aligns cross-functional stakeholders with our technical ecosystem. We operate with an <strong>automation-first mindset</strong>, purposefully outgrowing yesterday’s processes to create the headspace needed to solve tomorrow’s problems. On this team, you won't just maintain the status quo—you'll foster the collaboration and innovation necessary to ensure our products and people work better together.</div> <div><strong>&nbsp;</strong></div> <div><strong>Enablement</strong>: We evangelize and elevate awareness around our product offerings and opportunities to leverage our own product for business value capabilities<br><br><strong>Be the glue</strong>: Like the many products we have, it only works if it all works well together.&nbsp; Finding common ground to enhanced cross-functional collaboration and alignment with business stakeholders will strengthen customer and product common ground.<br><br><strong>Automation First mindset:</strong>&nbsp; We can only truly do our best work when we have the space to reimagine how we solve tomorrow's problems today.&nbsp; It's okay that what worked well yesterday may not be what we need for tomorrow.</div> <div>&nbsp;</div> <p><strong>About this Role:</strong></p> <p>We are seeking a highly experienced LLM Developer to join our team. In this role, you will lead the development of our internal AI initiatives, starting with taking ownership of the Cloudflare IT support chatbot. You will be responsible for designing and executing new AI use cases that directly improve employee experience and productivity across the organization. You will leverage Cloudflare’s own ecosystem, including AI Gateway, to build scalable, production-ready AI applications.</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Take ownership of the development and maintenance of the internally built Cloudflare IT support chatbot, ensuring high availability and continuous improvement of response quality.</li> <li>Identify, design, and build new AI-driven use cases and tools to enhance employee productivity and streamline internal workflows.</li> <li>Develop and deploy AI applications at scale, ensuring reliability, performance, and security.</li> <li>Integrate and optimize AI applications using Cloudflare’s AI Gateway to manage and monitor model usage effectively.</li> <li>Partner closely with internal teams to understand their pain points and translate them into technical AI solutions.</li> <li>Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in LLMs and Generative AI to continuously innovate our internal toolset.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Requirements:</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience in software development, with a strong focus on AI, Machine Learning, or Agentic applications.</li> <li>Proven experience in the development and deployment of AI applications at scale in a production environment with focus on strong authorization and data privacy.</li> <li>Familiarity with Cloudflare AI Gateway and experience managing API traffic for LLMs.</li> <li>Strong proficiency in TypeScript and experience with relevant AI/ML libraries and frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, LangChain).</li> <li>Experience with observability and configuration management, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), and CI/CD pipelines (GitLab/GitHub), Grafana, OTEL, K8s etc.</li> <li>Experience and expertise in Agile methodology.</li> <li>Excellent interpersonal and communication skills in written and spoken English.</li> <li>Prior experience working on enterprise engineering teams or building internal developer tools is a plus.</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>

Additionally, the position is strictly in-office in Bengaluru, India, which is incompatible with the candidate's preferred locations of Remote, US, or Canada.

Emphasize the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline project to demonstrate agentic AI design thinking, quality-gated routing, and end-to-end ownership — framing it as experience building internal productivity tools
Discuss Docker Compose deployment with FastAPI + SSE streaming to show production-readiness and scalability awareness, and bridge toward willingness to learn Terraform and K8s for IaC/orchestration
Highlight the RAGAS automated evaluation pipeline as evidence of an observability and continuous improvement mindset, connecting it to Cloudflare's need for monitoring model usage via AI Gateway
Address the experience gap proactively by emphasizing the breadth and production quality of work delivered in a compressed timeline, and express eagerness to grow into the 5+ year benchmark

matches.title: Machine Learning Engineer, Payments ML Accelerator
matches.location: Seattle; San Francisco; New York City
matches.description:
Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Payments ML Accelerator
Company: Stripe
Location: Seattle; San Francisco; New York City
Description: <div class="ace-line gutter-author-p-118095 emptyGutter"> <div class="ace-line gutter-author-p-118095 emptyGutter"> <h3><strong>About Stripe</strong></h3> <p>Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</p> <h3><strong>About the team</strong></h3> <p>The Payments ML Accelerator team is developing foundational ML capabilities that drive innovation across Stripe's payment products. We build deep learning models that tackle Stripe's most complex payment challenges - from fraud detection to authorization optimization - and deliver measurable business impact. Our work combines advanced ML techniques with large-scale data infrastructure to enable rapid experimentation and seamless deployment of AI-powered solutions. As a central ML innovation hub, we work closely with product teams to identify high-impact opportunities and implement scalable solutions that can be leveraged across the organization.</p> <h3><strong>What you'll do:</strong></h3> <p>As a machine learning engineer on our team, you’ll develop advanced ML solutions that directly impact Stripe’s payment products and core business metrics. Your role will span the entire ML lifecycle, from research and experimentation to production deployment.</p> <p>You’ll work on high-leverage problems that require innovation in modeling, optimization, and system design. Where possible, you’ll look beyond point solutions - designing approaches and architectures that are reusable, extensible, and serve as foundation models for future capabilities.</p> <p>The role demands strong technical judgment, deep knowledge of modern ML methods, and the ability to translate ideas into systems that deliver measurable impact. You’ll partner with product and engineering teams to identify opportunities where ML can move the needle today while setting Stripe up for long-term success.</p> <h3><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Design and deploy deep learning architectures and foundation models to address problems across key payment entities such as merchants, issuers, or customers</li> <li>Identify high-impact opportunities, and drive the long-term ML roadmap through well-scoped high-leverage initiatives</li> <li>Architect generalizable ML workflows to enable rapid scaling and optimized online performance</li> <li>Deploy ML models online and ensure operational stability</li> <li>Experiment with advanced ML solutions in the industry and ideate on product applications&nbsp;</li> <li>Explore cutting-edge ML techniques and evaluate their potential to solve business problems</li> <li>Work closely with ML infrastructure teams to shape new platform capabilities</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Who you are:</strong></h3> <p>We are looking for ML Engineers who are passionate about using ML to improve products and delight customers. You have experience developing streaming feature pipelines, building ML models, and deploying them to production, even if it involves making substantial changes to backend code. You are comfortable with ambiguity, love to take initiative, and have a bias towards action.&nbsp;</p> <h3><strong>Minimum requirements</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Minimum 7 years of industry experience doing end-to-end ML development on a machine learning team and bringing ML models to production&nbsp;</li> <li>Proficient in Python, Scala, and Spark</li> <li>Proficient in deep learning and LLM/foundation models</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred qualifications</strong></h3> <ul> <li>MS/PhD degree in quantitative field or ML/AI (e.g. computer science, math, physics, statistics)</li> <li>Knowledge about how to manipulate data to perform analysis, including querying data, defining metrics, or slicing and dicing data to evaluate a hypothesis</li> <li>Experience evaluating niche and upcoming ML solutions</li> </ul> </div> </div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong foundational ML and AI engineering skills — particularly in RAG systems, LLMs, LangChain, deep learning, and computer vision — which partially align with Stripe's ML engineering needs. However, the role has a hard minimum of 7 years of industry experience, and Ruiqi is a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree with only ~4 months of relevant internship experience, making this a significant mismatch on the experience dimension. Additionally, the role is onsite/hybrid in Seattle, San Francisco, or New York City, while the candidate prefers remote or Canadian locations, creating a location friction point.

Master's degree in ECE from University of Waterloo with specialization in RL, LLM, and Computer Vision — aligns with preferred MS/PhD qualification
Experience with LangGraph multi-agent architectures and automated evaluation pipelines
Proficient in Python and backend infrastructure (FastAPI, Redis, PostgreSQL, Docker)

Apache Spark — required for large-scale data/streaming feature pipelines; absent from resume
Streaming feature pipeline development at scale (Kafka is listed but no ML feature pipeline context)
Payments domain knowledge (fraud detection, authorization optimization, financial ML)
Foundation model design and deployment at production scale (beyond RAG/LLM application layer)
7+ years of industry ML experience — candidate has ~4 months of internship experience
Experience with large-scale distributed ML infrastructure and online model serving at enterprise scale

Discuss the RAGAS-based automated evaluation pipeline as evidence of rigorous ML evaluation methodology, connecting it to Stripe's need to define metrics and evaluate hypotheses
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate research depth and ability to work on novel, complex ML problems similar to Stripe's fraud/authorization challenges
Address the Scala/Spark gap proactively — express willingness and ability to ramp up quickly given strong Python and distributed systems adjacent experience (Kafka, Redis, Docker)
Emphasize the LangGraph 4-agent pipeline project as evidence of systems thinking and designing reusable, extensible ML architectures — a key Stripe requirement
Frame the YOLOv8 industrial defect detection work as analogous to anomaly/fraud detection, drawing a parallel to Stripe's fraud detection use cases

matches.title: Staff AI Engineer - Notebooks
matches.description:
Title: Staff AI Engineer - Notebooks 
Company: Datadog
Location: Portugal, Remote
Description: <p>We're looking for a Staff Software Engineer with deep experience in AI/ML to join the Notebooks team. Datadog Notebooks provide a flexible tool for ad-hoc data analysis, collaborative investigations, and technical documentation. Its fluidity makes it an ideal surface for agents and humans to interact. The Notebook team is building AI-driven workflows for natural-language data analysis, assisted graph generation, automated investigations, and more. You will act as a technical leader in this domain, focused on building industry-leader AI-powered features. We’re looking for a product-minded ML engineer with strong technical expertise, excellent communication skills, and a track record of driving impactful initiatives end to end.</p> <p><em>At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. Title: Staff AI Engineer - Notebooks
Company: Datadog
Location: New York, New York, USA
Description: <p>We're looking for a Staff Software Engineer with deep experience in AI/ML to join the Notebooks team. Datadog Notebooks provide a flexible tool for ad-hoc data analysis, collaborative investigations, and technical documentation. Its fluidity makes it an ideal surface for agents and humans to interact. The Notebook team is building AI-driven workflows for natural-language data analysis, assisted graph generation, automated investigations, and more. You will act as a technical leader in this domain, focused on building industry-leader AI-powered features. We’re looking for a product-minded ML engineer with strong technical expertise, excellent communication skills, and a track record of driving impactful initiatives end to end.</p> <p><em>At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You’ll Do:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Spearhead AI initiatives within Notebooks, serving as the technical owner for the design, development, and deployment of ML/AI-driven features.</li> <li>Shape the long-term technical direction and strategy for AI workflows within Notebooks and related products.</li> <li>Champion the full development cycle: from rapid prototyping and defining success metrics/evaluations to running experiments, iterating, and achieving production-ready scale and reliability.</li> <li>Drive product direction with a strong user focus, always advocating for the best end-user experience.</li> <li>Coordinate with other leaders and product teams interested in leveraging Notebooks in their AI-powered workflows.</li> <li>Develop robust agent systems, including tools, retrieval and planning strategies, guardrails, prompt management/evaluations, fallbacks, and human-in-the-loop processes.</li> <li>Stay up to date with industry trends, guiding the adoption of new technologies and evolving best-practices.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Who You Are:</strong></p> <ul> <li>You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent experience</li> <li>10+ years of relevant engineering experience, as well as experience acting as a technical lead</li> <li>Proven track record of leading large-scale AI/ML initiatives in a product-driven environment</li> <li>You have significant experience in model deployment, development, training, fine-tuning, and evaluation</li> </ul> <ul> <li>You are passionate about mentoring others and cultivating a high-performing engineering culture.</li> <li>You’re excited about leveraging AI tools to enhance how you code, solve problems, and build</li> </ul> <p><em>Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Benefits and Growth:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Generous and competitive benefits package</li> <li>New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan</li> <li>Continuous career development and pathing opportunities</li> <li>Employee-focused best in class onboarding</li> <li>Internal mentor and cross-departmental buddy program</li> <li>Friendly and inclusive workplace culture<br><br></li> </ul> <p><em>Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Hybrid</p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.</p></div><div class="title">The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$234,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$300,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>About Datadog:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. matches.title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer, Relevance and Personalization
matches.description:
Title: Staff Machine Learning Engineer, Relevance and Personalization
Company: Airbnb
Location: United States
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Community You Will Join: </strong></span></p> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">The Relevance and Personalization team at Airbnb is responsible for search and recommendation across the entire Airbnb digital platform. Be a leader in the team working on critical, impactful projects with focus on developing end-to-end ranking algorithms and ecosystems for optimizing multiple critical business objectives.&nbsp;</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">We build cutting-edge AI technologies across the end-to-end search ranking product stack w.r.t. data pipelines, feature and model innovations, serving and experimentation efficiency, leveraging rich signals from various types of data (structured, sequential, image, text, etc) at Airbnb. We collaborate closely with teams across Airbnb to develop the ranking solutions and support a healthy marketplace for hosts and guests to further Airbnb’s mission of creating a world where people can Belong Anywhere. Some past publications from the team can be found here:<a href="https://sites.google.com/view/airbnb-relevance-publications/home"> https://sites.google.com/view/airbnb-relevance-publications/home</a></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></span></p> <ul> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Work with large scale structured and unstructured data, build and continuously improve cutting edge Machine Learning models for Airbnb product, business and operational use cases.</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Work collaboratively with cross-functional partners including software engineers, product managers, operations and data scientists, identify opportunities for business impact, understand, refine, and prioritize requirements for machine learning models, drive engineering decisions, and quantify impact.</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Hands-on develop, productionize, and operate Machine Learning models and pipelines at scale, including both batch and real-time use cases.</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Leverage third-party and in-house Machine Learning tools &amp; infrastructure to develop reusable, highly differentiating and high-performing Machine Learning systems, enable fast model development, low-latency serving and ease of model quality upkeep.</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Example projects include: feature platform, model interpretability, hyperparameter optimization, concept drift detection.<br></span></li> </ul> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">9+ years of industry experience in applied Machine Learning, inclusive MS or PhD in relevant fields.</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Strong programming (Scala / Python / Java / C++ or equivalent) and data engineering skills.</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Deep understanding of Machine Learning best practices (eg. training/serving skew minimization, A/B test, feature engineering, feature/model selection), algorithms (eg. neural networks/deep learning, optimization) and domains (eg. natural language processing, computer vision, personalization, search and recommendation, marketplace optimization, anomaly detection).</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Experience with 3 or more of these technologies: Tensorflow, PyTorch, Kubernetes, Spark, Airflow (or equivalent), Kafka (or equivalent), data warehouse (eg. Hive).</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Industry experience building end-to-end Machine Learning infrastructure and/or building and productionizing Machine Learning models.</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Exposure to architectural patterns of a large, high-scale software applications (e.g., well-designed APIs, high volume data pipelines, efficient algorithms, models).</span></li> <li><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">Experience with test driven development, familiar with A/B testing, incremental delivery and deployment.<br></span></li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. <a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list.</a></span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$212,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$265,000 USD</span></div></div></div>

interview_talking_points: Highlight the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji — emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement and the RAGAS evaluation pipeline as evidence of rigorous, metrics-driven ML engineering

Discuss the ACM MM '23 publication on multimodal video understanding to demonstrate research depth and ability to work with complex, multi-signal data — analogous to Airbnb's use of structured, sequential, image, and text data
Emphasize the LangGraph multi-agent pipeline project as evidence of architecting complex, scalable AI systems end-to-end, including quality-gated routing and self-critique evaluation
Connect computer vision work (YOLOv8, SAHI) to Airbnb's listing image understanding and multi-modal ranking signals
Be transparent about the seniority gap but frame the trajectory: strong academic pedigree, published research, and production deployments within a short career span show accelerated growth
Express willingness to rapidly upskill in Spark, Airflow, Kubernetes, and PyTorch/TensorFlow at scale — and reference any coursework or self-study in these areas

matches.title: Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer - Guest & Host
matches.description:
Title: Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer - Guest & Host
Company: Airbnb
Location: United States
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><strong>The Community You Will Join:</strong></p> <p>The Users, Listings, and Marketplaces team supports features across the application related to Guests, Hosts and Listings. These products include but are not limited to management tools for listings, enforcement/quality systems, and merchandising systems. The team works closely with product and design to ship highly visible product functionality and drive innovation within the product.</p> <p><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></p> <p>There is huge potential for AI to how guests book and how Hosts manage listings at Airbnb. You will improve the Guest and Host experience by improving the intelligence of our product through state of the art machine learning models. This will involve close partnerships and influencing stakeholders across tech, product, and design organizations to identify, scope, and deliver AI features. While you will be leading efforts with XFN stakeholders supported by a team of engineers, you’ll also be working hand in hand with the team to prototype, evaluate, and implement models.</p> <p><strong>A Typical day:</strong></p> <p>Your contributions take a variety of shapes:</p> <ul> <li>Leverage structured and unstructured data to build and continuously improve state of the art Machine Learning models for Airbnb product, business and operational use cases.</li> <li>Work collaboratively with engineers, product managers, data scientists, and operations to identify problems and deploy ML capabilities.</li> <li>Stay up to date with SoT models and prototype machine learning product features and iterate with product and design.&nbsp;&nbsp;</li> <li>Drive best practices, develop playbooks, and create a repeatable process for shipping quality machine learning features.</li> <li>Hands-on development, productionization, and maintenance of machine learning models and pipelines at scale.</li> </ul> <p><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Industry experience building and shipping end to end machine learning features</li> <li>12+ years of industry experience in applied Machine Learning, with experience in both Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision</li> <li>A Bachelor’s, Master’s or PhD in CS/ML or related field</li> <li>Strong programming (Python / Java/ C++ or equivalent) skills with data and backend engineering expertise</li> <li>Deep understanding of Machine Learning best practices (eg. training/serving skew minimization, A/B test, feature engineering, feature/model selection) and algorithms (eg. gradient boosted trees, neural networks/deep learning, optimization)</li> <li>Experience with technologies such as: Tensorflow, PyTorch, Kubernetes, Airflow (or equivalent), Kafka (or equivalent)</li> <li>Expertise with architectural patterns of a large, high-scale software applications (e.g., well-designed APIs, high volume data pipelines, efficient algorithms, models)</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong><br><br><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list. If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span><br></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$244,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$305,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates a solid foundation in AI/ML — particularly in RAG systems, LLMs, LangChain, and Computer Vision — which partially aligns with Airbnb's ML engineering needs. However, this is a Senior Staff-level role requiring 12+ years of industry experience, and the candidate is a mid-level engineer still completing their Master's degree with only a few months of internship experience, representing a critical mismatch. Additionally, the candidate lacks key production ML stack experience (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Kubernetes, Airflow) and large-scale ML systems expertise that Airbnb explicitly requires.
strengths: Strong RAG and LLM pipeline experience using LangChain, LangGraph, ChromaDB, and BGE-M3 embeddings — directly relevant to Airbnb's AI product ambitions
Hands-on Computer Vision experience with YOLOv8, SAHI, and multimodal video understanding (DBVM), matching the NLP + CV dual requirement
Published research at ACM MM '23 on deep video understanding, demonstrating academic ML credibility
Full-stack engineering capability (FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, WebSocket) supports end-to-end ML feature delivery
Experience with Kafka (listed in skills) aligns with Airbnb's tech stack requirement
Strong academic background: 3.9 GPA Master's at University of Waterloo with specialization in RL, LLM, and CV
Production-grade RAG deployment with Docker Compose, Redis semantic caching, and RAGAS evaluation pipeline shows MLOps awareness
Python, Java, and C++ proficiency matches Airbnb's programming language requirements
missing_skills: 12+ years of industry experience — candidate has only ~4 months of internship experience, far below the Senior Staff threshold
TensorFlow and PyTorch — not listed anywhere on the resume despite being explicitly required
Kubernetes — not mentioned; critical for large-scale ML model serving at Airbnb's scale
Airflow or equivalent orchestration tools — absent from the resume
A/B testing and training/serving skew minimization — no evidence of production ML experimentation frameworks
Gradient boosted trees and classical ML algorithms — no mention of XGBoost, LightGBM, or similar
Large-scale high-volume data pipeline architecture — candidate's pipelines are small-scale (5,000 images, 500 pages)
Cross-functional stakeholder leadership and influencing product/design orgs — no evidence of this at Senior Staff level
Feature engineering and feature/model selection at production scale �� not demonstrated
interview_talking_points: Lead with your RAG system at Disanji: emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement, hybrid BM25 + dense vector retrieval, and RAGAS evaluation pipeline — this maps directly to Airbnb's goal of improving Guest/Host intelligence through AI

Highlight your ACM MM '23 publication on multimodal video understanding to demonstrate research depth and ability to work with state-of-the-art models, which Airbnb values for staying current with SoT ML

Discuss your AI Agent Resume Generator project as a full end-to-end ML product: multi-agent LangGraph orchestration, ATS scoring, LLM self-critique, and 80%+ test coverage — this shows you can ship quality ML features independently

Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively and reframe: express interest in growing into a Staff-level role, and emphasize your rapid skill acquisition (3.9 GPA, two internships, a publication, and multiple production projects in a short timeframe)
Mention Kafka experience explicitly when discussing Airbnb's tech stack familiarity, and note your AWS/Azure cloud exposure as a foundation for scaling ML systems
If asked about PyTorch/TensorFlow, be honest about gaps but highlight your deep learning coursework and YOLO model training as adjacent experience, and express a concrete plan to close the gap

matches.title: Staff AI Engineer - Notebooks
matches.location: France, Remote; Germany, Remote; Ireland, Remote; Italy, Remote; Spain, Remote; Switzerland, Remote
matches.description:
Title: Staff AI Engineer - Notebooks 
Company: Datadog
Location: France, Remote; Germany, Remote; Ireland, Remote; Italy, Remote; Spain, Remote; Switzerland, Remote
Description: <p>We're looking for a Staff Software Engineer with deep experience in AI/ML to join the Notebooks team. Datadog Notebooks provide a flexible tool for ad-hoc data analysis, collaborative investigations, and technical documentation. Its fluidity makes it an ideal surface for agents and humans to interact. The Notebook team is building AI-driven workflows for natural-language data analysis, assisted graph generation, automated investigations, and more. You will act as a technical leader in this domain, focused on building industry-leader AI-powered features. We’re looking for a product-minded ML engineer with strong technical expertise, excellent communication skills, and a track record of driving impactful initiatives end to end.</p> <p><em>At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>What You’ll Do:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Spearhead AI initiatives within Notebooks, serving as the technical owner for the design, development, and deployment of ML/AI-driven features.</li> <li>Shape the long-term technical direction and strategy for AI workflows within Notebooks and related products.</li> <li>Champion the full development cycle: from rapid prototyping and defining success metrics/evaluations to running experiments, iterating, and achieving production-ready scale and reliability.</li> <li>Drive product direction with a strong user focus, always advocating for the best end-user experience.</li> <li>Coordinate with other leaders and product teams interested in leveraging Notebooks in their AI-powered workflows.</li> <li>Develop robust agent systems, including tools, retrieval and planning strategies, guardrails, prompt management/evaluations, fallbacks, and human-in-the-loop processes.</li> <li>Stay up to date with industry trends, guiding the adoption of new technologies and evolving best-practices.</li> </ul> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Who You Are:</strong></p> <ul> <li>You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent experience</li> <li>10+ years of relevant engineering experience, as well as experience acting as a technical lead</li> <li>Proven track record of leading large-scale AI/ML initiatives in a product-driven environment</li> <li>You have significant experience in model deployment, development, training, fine-tuning, and evaluation</li> <li>You are passionate about mentoring others and cultivating a high-performing engineering culture.</li> <li>You’re excited about leveraging AI tools to enhance how you code, solve problems, and build</li> </ul> <p><em>Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.</em></p> <p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Benefits and Growth:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Generous and competitive benefits package</li> <li>New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan</li> <li>Continuous career development and pathing opportunities</li> <li>Employee-focused best in class onboarding</li> <li>Internal mentor and cross-departmental buddy program</li> <li>Friendly and inclusive workplace culture<br><br></li> </ul> <p><em>Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.</em></p> <p style="color: white;">#LI-Remote</p><div class="content-conclusion"><hr> <p><strong>About Datadog:&nbsp;</strong></p> <p>Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on <a href="https://www.instagram.com/datadoghq/?hl=en" target="_blank">Instagram</a>, <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/datadog" target="_blank">LinkedIn,</a> and <a href="https://learn.datadoghq.com/" target="_blank">Datadog Learning Center. </a></p> <hr> <p data-renderer-start-pos="215"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Equal Opportunity at Datadog:</strong></p> <p>Datadog is proud to offer <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2023-06/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights6.12ScreenRdr.pdf" target="_blank">equal employment opportunity</a> to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/candidate-legal-notices/" target="_blank">Candidate Legal Notices</a> for your reference.&nbsp;</p> <p>Datadog endeavors to make our Careers Page accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please complete <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeoJeduEZ2NdZF_65uZmWUrCM-zee7yADXX1s6Xr9zAGq8iKA/viewform" target="_blank">this form</a>. This form is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.&nbsp;</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">Privacy and AI Guidelines:</strong></p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="662">Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s&nbsp;<a class="c-link" href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/applicant-candidate-privacy/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice</a>. For information on our AI policy, please visit <a href="https://www.datadoghq.com/legal/interviewing-at-datadog-ai-guidelines/" target="_blank">Interviewing at Datadog AI Guidelines</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi demonstrates genuinely strong and relevant AI/ML skills — particularly in RAG pipelines, LangChain/LangGraph, agent systems, and full-stack development — that align well with the technical nature of this role. However, this is a Staff-level position requiring 10+ years of engineering experience and a proven track record of leading large-scale AI/ML initiatives, whereas Ruiqi is a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree with roughly 1–2 years of internship/research experience. The location is also a significant mismatch: the role is exclusively remote within Europe (France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Spain, Switzerland), while the candidate prefers the US or Canada.
strengths: Strong hands-on RAG pipeline experience (LangChain LCEL, BM25 + dense hybrid retrieval, Milvus, FlashRank reranking, RAGAS evaluation) directly relevant to Datadog's AI-driven Notebooks features
Practical LangGraph multi-agent system design demonstrated in the Resume Generator project, aligning with the job's requirement to build robust agent systems with planning, routing, and evaluation
Full-stack proficiency (FastAPI, React/TypeScript, WebSocket, PostgreSQL, Docker) supports the end-to-end product development cycle Datadog expects
Published research at ACM MM '23 on video-language models shows academic depth in multimodal AI
Strong academic credentials: 3.9 GPA MEng at University of Waterloo with specialization in LLM, Reinforcement Learning, and Computer Vision
Experience with model evaluation pipelines (RAGAS, ATS keyword scoring, LLM self-critique) aligns with the role's emphasis on defining success metrics and running experiments
Computer Vision and YOLO experience adds breadth to the AI/ML skill set
missing_skills: 10+ years of engineering experience — candidate has ~1-2 years of internship/research experience, far below the Staff-level requirement
Technical leadership and mentorship experience at scale — no evidence of leading engineering teams or cross-functional AI initiatives
Model fine-tuning and training at production scale — resume focuses on inference/RAG, not large-scale model training or fine-tuning workflows
Observability/monitoring domain knowledge (Datadog's core product) — no experience with APM, metrics, logs, or infrastructure monitoring tools
Prompt management systems and guardrails at production scale — mentioned conceptually but not demonstrated at enterprise level
Experience driving product direction and coordinating across multiple product teams
Cloud-scale ML deployment experience (e.g., Kubernetes, MLOps platforms, model serving infrastructure beyond Docker Compose)
interview_talking_points: Lead with your RAG pipeline work at Disanji: emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement, hybrid BM25 + BGE-M3 retrieval, and RAGAS evaluation framework — this maps directly to Datadog's natural-language data analysis and automated investigation features

Highlight the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline in your Resume Generator project as a concrete example of building agent systems with quality-gated routing, evaluation layers, and human-in-the-loop design — language that mirrors the job description almost exactly

Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively but frame your trajectory: MEng at Waterloo (graduating 2025), ACM MM publication, and production deployments show you're advancing rapidly — position yourself as a high-ceiling candidate worth investing in

Emphasize your full-stack ownership (FastAPI + React + WebSocket + Docker + PostgreSQL) to demonstrate you can drive features end-to-end without handoffs, which is critical for a small, product-focused AI team
Connect your RAGAS and LLM self-critique evaluation experience to Datadog's emphasis on 'defining success metrics and evaluations' — show you think about AI quality rigorously, not just prototyping
If applying, be transparent about your location (Canada) and willingness to relocate to or work from a supported European country, as the role is EU-remote only

matches.title: Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer, Communication & Connectivity
matches.description:
Title: Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer, Communication & Connectivity
Company: Airbnb
Location: Remote - USA
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Community You Will Join: </strong></span></p> <p>We connect Airbnb’s community with the right information, in the right place, at the right time. We tailor Messaging &amp; Notifications so hosts on Airbnb can streamline their operations, and travelers get just the information they need to enjoy their stay worry-free.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>Additionally, we are building new connections within our community to help enrich the experience of hosting &amp; traveling on Airbnb: easing the process of hosting, and adding meaning to our guest’s trips.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></span></p> <p>We believe our current customer experiences in these domains are only scratching the surface of the innovations that are possible, and that science is at the heart of delivering a step-function change for our Guest and and Host on Airbnb.&nbsp;</p> <p>You will architect and implement advanced machine learning solutions—including recommendation engines, ranking systems, intent detection models, and the integration of intelligence into existing platforms. Additionally, you’ll lead efforts to harness the power of Large Language Models (LLMs) to create transformative AI experiences.</p> <p>Many of the initiatives you’ll tackle are in their early conceptual stages. You will have the opportunity to shape these ideas from inception to production, turning visionary concepts into impactful realities. You will be leading ML, Data and Product engineers to drive ML applications.&nbsp;</p> <p>A core focus of your work will be spearheading Machine Learning applications in Messaging and Notification—a high-impact area with significant potential to enhance guest and host experiences at Airbnb.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>Envision, champion, and support the development of novel ML systems, product integrations, and performance optimizations to solve real-world problems</li> <li>Lead, mentor, challenge and grow enthusiastic, collaborative software engineers and applied scientists across the organization</li> <li>Raise the AI/ML skillset within the organization.&nbsp; A passion for teaching/mentoring is important.</li> </ul> <p><br><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>12+ years of software engineering experience, with 2+ years of experience in a Principal or Senior Staff Engineer role having ownership responsibility over large-scale software systems</li> <li>Background in the design and development of scalable AI and ML systems and services, and a deep passion for building ML-powered products</li> <li>You’re an inspiring colleague, a coach and mentor with experience owning and fostering engineering maturity in multiple organizations.</li> <li>You’re a builder, and implementer, who seeks out high impact work, and who is: proactive, curious, and an excellent communicator</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list.</a></span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. matches.title: Lead Conversational Ai Platform Engineer (M/W/D)
matches.description:
Title: Lead Conversational Ai Platform Engineer (M/W/D) Company: Helle Köpfe Recruiting Location: Hamburg Workplace: remote Description:

As a specialized recruiting firm, we are hiring on behalf of our client an experienced Tech Lead who will own the technical core of a globally used AI platform.

This is not a research role and not a prototype environment! You will work on a real, revenue-generating product used by millions of users and operating under extreme growth and real production pressure. Your technical decisions directly impact stability, performance, and user experience in live production.

Tasks

  • Actively develop production-level code and take overall technical ownership.
  • Provide technical leadership to a small senior AI team (3–4 engineers).
  • Design the architecture for training, inference, and deployment of language models under high load and real-time requirements.
  • Improve context handling, memory mechanisms, retrieval approaches, and response quality.
  • Define and drive fine-tuning and post-training strategies.
  • Build precise moderation and classification solutions for adult / NSFW content, balancing safety with model quality and user freedom.

Requirements

  • 8+ years of experience in software engineering and/or machine learning.
  • Proven responsibility for AI or LLM systems serving millions of users in production.
  • Strong hands-on experience with Python, PyTorch, and modern LLM frameworks.
  • Practical experience with fine-tuning, data preparation, and model steering.
  • Comfortable working with adult / NSFW content within clearly defined technical and safety boundaries.
  • Based in Europe and able to collaborate reliably within European time zones.

Benefits

  • Fully remote role with long-term perspective.
  • Flexible contract models (B2B or EoR).
  • Salary up to € 200,000 (depending on experience and setup)
  • Additional $ 80,000 in equity (company shares or stock options)
  • 20 days of paid vacation and flexible working arrangements.
  • Budget for professional development, conferences, and learning resources.
  • Modern hardware and access to current AI tools.
  • High degree of autonomy and direct technical impact on a scalable product.

You can expect a focused environment with short decision paths, high pace, and real technical ownership — not a corporate structure.

If you want to build LLM systems that operate under real production pressure and extreme growth, we look forward to your application.

Find Jobs in Germany on Arbeitnow Requirements: Remote, Software Development

matches.title: Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer – GenAI
matches.description:
Title: Senior Staff Machine Learning Engineer – GenAI
Company: Airbnb
Location: United States
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><strong>Community you will join</strong></p> <p>At Airbnb, we’re reimagining how support is delivered at a global scale. The Community Support Engineering (CSE) team is leading a multi-year transformation—building intelligent, AI-augmented systems that provide timely, personalized, and always-on support experiences for our global community.</p> <p>The CS Foundations Engineering (CSFE) team powers this mission by delivering robust platforms, reusable systems, and developer-facing infrastructure. Our tools help agents deliver exceptional service, enable faster product iteration, and support Airbnb’s mission to create a world where anyone can belong anywhere—with help that’s just a moment away.</p> <p><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></p> <ul> <li>As a machine learning engineer or scientist, your expertise will be pivotal in developing AI-powered solutions to shape the future of the Airbnb customer experience with cutting-edge AI techniques. You will drive and guide the rest of the engineers to brainstorm, design and develop AI products and features from inception to production.&nbsp;</li> <li>We're seeking a Senior Staff Engineer who thrives at the intersection of technical depth, architectural thinking, and mentorship.</li> <li>You’ll collaborate with cross-functional leaders, build resilient systems that operate globally at scale, and help evolve the foundational building blocks behind AI-powered customer support.</li> </ul> <p>While this role won’t own every project below, the below showcase the breadth and depth of work across our group, and where your leadership may be needed:</p> <ul> <li>Building a unified, platform-native case management system (AirCase), abstracted via Viaduct APIs and replacing legacy CRM systems.</li> <li>Designing scalable AI workflow orchestration to power agent co-pilot tools and intelligent response automation.</li> <li>Modernizing our Delivery Management Console (DMC) to include AI powered real-time performance insights, outlier detection, and agent coaching tools.</li> <li>Establishing shared data foundations to enable AI/ML solutions, feedback loops, and personalization across the support journey.</li> <li>Delivering next generating matching capabilities (Routing) so incoming customer contacts are matched to the best agents using AI and Intelligence to deliver personalized and differentiated support experiences</li> </ul> <p><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Work with large scale structured and unstructured data; explore, experiment, build and continuously improve Machine Learning models and pipelines for Airbnb product, business and operational use cases.</li> <li>Work collaboratively with cross-functional partners including product managers, operations and data scientists, to identify opportunities for business impact; understand, refine, and prioritize requirements for machine learning, and drive engineering decisions.</li> <li>Hands-on develop, productionize, and operate Machine Learning models and pipelines at scale, including both batch and real-time use cases.</li> <li>Leverage third-party and in-house Machine Learning tools &amp; infrastructure to develop reusable, highly differentiating and high-performing Machine Learning systems, enable fast model development, low-latency serving and ease of model quality upkeep.</li> <li>Collaborate actively with engineers to apply ML / AI in their solutions to help validate ideas and guide to the right outcomes.</li> <li>Partner with other ML Engineers in foundations engineering to mentor and develop initiative to make ML application a core discipline for non ML engineers.&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong>:</p> <ul> <li>Educational Background: PhD in Computer Science,&nbsp; Mathematics, Statistics, or related technical field.</li> <li>Industry Experience: 10+ years of experience in building, testing and shipping AI models and products from inception to production; including 2+ years of experience with GenAI.&nbsp;</li> <li>Leadership Experience: 10+ years experience leading and guiding machine learning and AI projects that deliver sizable impact as a senior IC.</li> <li>Technical Proficiency: Deep knowledge and hands-on experience with Machine Learning best practices (eg. training/serving skew minimization, feature engineering, feature/model selection), algorithms (eg. neural networks/deep learning, optimization) and domains (eg. NLP, computer vision, personalization, search and recommendation, marketplace optimization, anomaly detection)</li> </ul> <p>Preferred Qualifications:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Agentic and Automation</strong>: Experience with AI technologies in automating processes and developing agentic solutions and frameworks.</li> <li><strong>Agile Practice for AI Production</strong>: Experience with the entire AI product development lifecycle from incubation to production at scale, following agile practices in the Applied AI/ML domain.</li> <li>Infrastructure Acumen: Experience building robust testing frameworks for agent behavior validation and continuous improvement, and driving architectural requirements on ML infrastructures</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb Payments, Inc. (a subsidiary of Airbnb, Inc.) is a registered entity. Approved remote states include: Alabama, California, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Minnesota, Mississippi, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, and Washington. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is excluded. If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$244,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$305,000 USD</span></div></div></div>

matches.title: Software Engineer, Full Stack
matches.location: San Francisco, CA • New York, NY • United States
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Figma is growing our team of passionate creatives and builders on a mission to make design accessible to all. Figma’s platform helps teams bring ideas to life—whether you're brainstorming, creating a prototype, translating designs into code, or iterating with AI. From idea to product, Figma empowers teams to streamline workflows, move faster, and work together in real time from anywhere in the world. If you're excited to shape the future of design and collaboration, join us!</p></div><div class="section page-centered"> <div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">As a Full Stack Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to build both the products and the platforms that empower millions of users—from startups to Fortune 500 companies—to create and collaborate in real time. Whether you’re designing core features, improving developer workflows, scaling enterprise infrastructure, or launching entirely new products, your work will directly shape the future of how teams bring ideas to life. You’ll take on complex technical challenges across the stack, building intuitive user experiences, optimizing performance in real-time collaborative systems, and designing secure, reliable, and scalable systems to support Figma’s rapid growth and global expansion.</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">&nbsp;</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">Our engineers are highly cross-functional, partnering closely with Product, Design, Research, and Data to deliver best-in-class experiences. If you’re excited to work across the stack, push the boundaries of product development, and help scale the systems that power Figma, we’d love for you to join us.</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">&nbsp;</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">This opportunity applies to openings at varying seniority levels across our teams, including but not limited to Figma Editor, FigJam, Figma Slides, Figma Sites, Figma Buzz, Growth &amp; Monetization, Internal Tools, and our cross-product Foundations team. We’ll discuss more specifics about open roles during the interview process.</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">&nbsp;</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">This is a full-time role that can be held from one of our US hubs or remotely in the United States.</div> <div class="p-rich_text_section">&nbsp;</div> <strong data-stringify-type="bold">What you’ll do at Figma:</strong> <ul class="p-rich_text_list p-rich_text_list__bullet p-rich_text_list--nested" data-stringify-type="unordered-list" data-list-tree="true" data-indent="0" data-border="0"> <li data-stringify-indent="0" to hear from you if you have:</strong> <ul class="p-rich_text_list p-rich_text_list__bullet p-rich_text_list--nested" data-stringify-type="unordered-list" data-list-tree="true" data-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Strong proficiency in modern front-end frameworks (e.g., React/TypeScript) and back-end technologies (e.g., Ruby, Python, Go, C++, PostgreSQL)</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">A product mindset, with the ability to translate user needs into scalable technical solutions</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with experience working effectively across cross-functional teams</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Passion for engineering craft and building polished, maintainable, and scalable systems</li> </ul> <strong data-stringify-type="bold">While not required, it’s an added plus if you also have:</strong> <ul class="p-rich_text_list p-rich_text_list__bullet p-rich_text_list--nested" data-stringify-type="unordered-list" data-list-tree="true" data-indent="0" data-border="0">
