C++ and WebAssembly in user-facing applications</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Background in areas such as growth engineering, developer tooling, billing and payments infrastructure, or extensibility platforms (plugins, APIs, widgets)</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">Exposure to technologies like Stripe, Salesforce, Snowflake, SCIM, SAML, or experimentation and observability tooling</li> <li data-stringify-indent="0" data-stringify-border="0">A passion for mentoring peers and helping shape engineering culture</li> </ul> <div class="section page-centered"> <div> <div>At Figma, one of our values is Grow as you go. We believe in hiring smart, curious people who are excited to learn and develop their skills. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with the points outlined in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.</div> </div> </div> </div> </div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><strong><span style="font-size: 16px;">Pay Transparency Disclosure</span></strong></p> <p>If based in Figma’s San Francisco or New York hub offices, this role has the annual base salary range stated below.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>Job level and actual compensation will be decided based on factors including, but not limited to, individual qualifications objectively assessed during the interview process (including skills and prior relevant experience, potential impact, and scope of role), market demands, and specific work location. The listed range is a guideline, and the range for this role may be modified. For roles that are available to be filled remotely, the pay range is localized according to employee work location by a factor of between 80% and 100% of range. Please discuss your specific work location with your recruiter for more information.&nbsp;</p> <p>Figma offers equity to employees, as well a competitive package of additional benefits, including health, dental &amp; vision, retirement with company contribution, parental leave &amp; reproductive or family planning support, mental health &amp; wellness benefits, generous PTO, company recharge days, a learning &amp; development stipend, a work from home stipend, and cell phone reimbursement.&nbsp; Figma also offers sales incentive pay for most sales roles and an annual bonus plan for eligible non-sales roles. Figma’s compensation and benefits are subject to change and may be modified in the future.</p></div><div class="title">Annual Base Salary Range:</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$149,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$350,000 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p>At Figma we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our product and our community to flourish. Figma is an <a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC_KnowYourRights_screen_reader_10_20.pdf">equal opportunity workplace</a> - we are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity/expression, veteran status<strong>, </strong>or any other characteristic protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.</p> <p>We will work to ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to apply for a role, participate in the interview process, perform essential job functions, and receive other benefits and privileges of employment. If you require accommodation, please reach out to <a href="mailto:accommodations-ext@figma.com">accommodations-ext@figma.com</a>. These modifications enable an individual with a disability to have an equal opportunity not only to get a job, but successfully perform their job tasks to the same extent as people without disabilities.&nbsp;</p> <p>Examples of accommodations include but are not limited to:&nbsp;</p> <ul> <li>Holding interviews in an accessible location</li> <li>Enabling closed captioning on video conferencing</li> <li>Ensuring all written communication be compatible with screen readers</li> <li>Changing the mode or format of interviews&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p>To ensure the integrity of our hiring process and facilitate a more personal connection, we require all candidates keep their cameras on during video interviews. Additionally, if hired you will be required to attend in person onboarding.</p> <p>By applying for this job, the candidate acknowledges and agrees that any personal data contained in their application or supporting materials will be processed in accordance with <a class="c-link c-link--underline" href="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" target="_blank" data-stringify-link="https://www.figma.com/legal/candidate-privacy-notice/" data-sk="tooltip_parent">Figma's Candidate Privacy Notice</a>.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong academic candidate with a high-GPA Master's degree from the University of Waterloo and solid full-stack project experience using React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, and Docker — all directly aligned with Figma's core tech stack. However, the candidate's professional experience is limited to short internships and research roles, which may fall short of Figma's expectation for "proven experience shipping and maintaining full-stack applications in production" at a mid-level bar. The candidate's heavy AI/ML focus is a differentiator but not a primary requirement for this role, and notable gaps exist in areas like Ruby, Go, WebAssembly, and real-time collaborative systems that are central to Figma's platform.
strengths: Strong full-stack proficiency with React/TypeScript and FastAPI, directly matching Figma's preferred front-end and back-end stack
High academic pedigree — 3.9 GPA Master's from University of Waterloo with specialization in Software Engineering and Full-stack Development
Demonstrated end-to-end project ownership (AI Agent Resume Generator) with 80%+ test coverage, WebSocket, PostgreSQL, and Docker
Experience with C++ listed in skills, which is a bonus qualification for Figma's editor and WebAssembly work
Cloud experience with AWS and Azure, supporting Figma's scalable infrastructure needs
Published research at ACM MM '23, demonstrating strong technical depth and communication skills
Candidate's location preference (Remote/US/Canada) aligns with Figma's remote-friendly US hiring policy
AI/ML expertise (LangChain, RAG, LLMs) is a growing area of investment at Figma (AI-powered features)
Salary expectations ($100K–$200K) fall within the lower-to-mid range of Figma's disclosed band ($149K–$350K)
missing_skills: Ruby — Figma lists Ruby as a preferred back-end language; candidate has no Ruby experience
Go — Listed as a preferred back-end language with no evidence in the resume
WebAssembly — A bonus skill for Figma's editor; not present in candidate's profile
Real-time collaborative systems experience — Figma's core product is built on real-time sync; candidate lacks explicit experience here
Stripe / Salesforce / Snowflake / SCIM / SAML — Enterprise and billing infrastructure tools listed as nice-to-haves
Production-scale system operations — Candidate's production experience is limited to a single internship; no evidence of operating/monitoring large-scale systems
Mentorship and engineering culture leadership — Expected at mid-level; not demonstrated in resume
interview_talking_points: Highlight the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a full end-to-end production-grade application — emphasize the React/TypeScript frontend, FastAPI backend, WebSocket real-time communication, PostgreSQL, Docker, and 80%+ test coverage as direct parallels to Figma's stack

Leverage the RAG system built at Disanji Technology Institute to demonstrate production deployment experience: Docker Compose, FastAPI, Redis caching, and streaming — frame this as shipping and operating a real system under production constraints
Connect C++ skills to Figma's editor and potential WebAssembly work — even if WebAssembly is not on the resume, express genuine interest and readiness to learn it given the C++ foundation

Emphasize cross-functional collaboration experience from research roles (co-authoring ACM MM '23 paper) and internships to address Figma's strong emphasis on partnering with Product, Design, and Research teams

Address the experience gap proactively — frame the Master's program (graduating Oct 2025) as accelerated, hands-on engineering training with real project delivery, and position yourself at the junior-to-mid boundary Figma explicitly says they hire across
Express enthusiasm for Figma's 'Grow as you go' value and connect it to your rapid skill acquisition across AI/ML, full-stack, and cloud domains in a short timeframe

matches.title: Fullstack Software Engineer
matches.description:
Title: Fullstack Software Engineer
Company: Cloudflare
Location: Hybrid
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong>Available Locations: Austin&nbsp;</strong></p> <p><strong>About the Department</strong></p> <p>Cloudflare’s Engineering Team builds and runs the software that handles trillions of requests per month We also build and run the internal tools that builds and runs our software. The Engineering Team is split into two groups: one handles product development and the other handles operations. Product development covers both new features and functionality and scaling our existing software to meet the challenges of a massively growing customer base. The operations team handles one of the world’s largest networks with data centers in 200+ cities worldwide.</p> <p><strong>About the Team</strong></p> <p>Domain management is the foundation for any online presence and Cloudflare Registrar our answer to a simple and straightforward experience.&nbsp; The Registrar product manages the full lifecycle of the domains, including searching/registering for new domains and transferring/renewing existing ones.&nbsp; Onboarding domains on Cloudflare is the gateway to the vast array of Cloudflare services.</p> <p><strong>What you'll do</strong></p> <p>We are looking for a talented systems engineer to be part of our Austin or Lisbon office. Come be part of the team and work with a group of passionate, talented engineers that will be creating innovative products. The amount of requests being processed is massive and we utilize all the latest technology to ensure its scalability and availability.&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Responsibilities:&nbsp;</strong></p> <ul> <li>Designing, building, running and scaling tools and services that support the full spectrum of domain management.</li> <li>Analyzing and communicating complex technical requirements and concepts, identifying the highest priority areas, and carving a path to delivery</li> <li>Collaborating with product teams to understand goals and develop robust and scalable solutions that align with the customer need</li> <li>Improving system design and architecture to ensure stability and performance of the internal and customer-facing compliance concerns</li> <li>Working closely with Cloudflare's Trust and Safety team to help make the internet a better place</li> <li>Ongoing monitoring and maintenance of production services, including participation in on-call rotations</li> </ul> <h4><strong>Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience</strong></h4> <ul> <li>Experience working on, and deploying UI front ends implemented in Typescript</li> <li>Experience (and love) for debugging to ensure the system works in all cases</li> <li>Strong programming skills</li> <li>The ability to collaborate across teams</li> <li>Excited by the idea of optimizing complex solutions to general problems that all websites face</li> <li>Experience with a continuous integration workflow and using source control (we use git)&nbsp;</li> </ul> <p><strong>Bonus Points</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience with Javascript and Typescript&nbsp;</li> <li>Experience with Gitlab CI</li> <li>Experience with Cloudflare Workers &amp; Pages</li> <li>Experience with Kibana, Grafana, and/or Prometheus</li> <li>Experience with relational databases (e.g. Postgres)</li> <li>Experience with DNS (and DNSSEC)</li> <li>Experience with using AI</li> </ul> <h4><strong><br><br></strong></h4><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong full-stack candidate with solid React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker, and Git experience that aligns well with Cloudflare's core requirements. However, the role is heavily systems-oriented (domain management, DNS, large-scale infrastructure) and requires Cloudflare-specific tooling (Workers, Pages, Kibana/Grafana/Prometheus, GitLab CI) that are absent from the resume. The candidate's experience is primarily internship/project-level, which may fall slightly short of Cloudflare's expectations for a mid-level systems engineer handling production on-call rotations at internet scale.
strengths: Strong TypeScript/JavaScript proficiency with React frontend experience directly matching the UI frontend requirement
PostgreSQL experience aligns with the relational database bonus requirement
Docker and CI/CD (DevOps) experience demonstrates familiarity with continuous integration workflows
Git source control experience explicitly listed and used across multiple projects
Extensive AI/ML experience (LangChain, RAG, LLMs) satisfies the 'Experience with using AI' bonus point
High academic pedigree — MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) with software engineering specialization
Full-stack project with FastAPI + React/TypeScript + WebSocket + PostgreSQL + Docker demonstrates end-to-end delivery capability
AWS and Azure cloud experience shows comfort with large-scale infrastructure environments
Published ACM MM '23 paper demonstrates ability to work on complex technical problems and communicate findings
missing_skills: DNS and DNSSEC knowledge — critical for the Cloudflare Registrar domain management team
Cloudflare Workers & Pages — a listed bonus with high relevance to the role
GitLab CI — Cloudflare's specific CI tooling; candidate only lists general Git experience
Observability tooling: Kibana, Grafana, and/or Prometheus — no monitoring/alerting stack experience shown
Systems-level scalability experience — no evidence of handling high-throughput, internet-scale traffic (trillions of requests/month)
On-call production operations experience — role requires participation in on-call rotations, which is not reflected in the resume
Rust or Go — common languages in Cloudflare's backend stack, not present on the resume
interview_talking_points: Highlight the FastAPI + React/TypeScript + PostgreSQL + Docker project (Resume Generator) as a direct demonstration of full-stack production-grade development matching the role's tech stack
Emphasize the RAG system deployment at Disanji — specifically the Docker Compose, Redis caching, and streaming architecture — to showcase experience building and deploying scalable backend services
Discuss the 80%+ test coverage achieved in the Resume Generator project to demonstrate commitment to reliability and debugging rigor, which Cloudflare explicitly values
Leverage AWS and Azure experience to show comfort with cloud-native infrastructure and segue into willingness to quickly learn Cloudflare Workers & Pages

Address the location/hybrid requirement proactively — clarify availability and willingness to work from Austin if needed, since the role is listed as Austin hybrid and the candidate prefers remote/Canada

Speak to the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to analyze complex technical problems and communicate solutions cross-functionally — relevant to Cloudflare's cross-team collaboration requirement
Express genuine interest in internet infrastructure and domain management; connect Cloudflare's mission (better internet) to personal motivation, and show willingness to ramp up on DNS/DNSSEC quickly

matches.title: AI Engineer - FDE (Forward Deployed Engineer)
matches.description:
Title: AI Engineer - FDE (Forward Deployed Engineer)
Company: Databricks
Location: Canada
Description: <p data-pm-slice="1 1 []">CSQ227R16</p> <p>The AI Forward Deployed Engineering (AI FDE) team is a highly specialized customer-facing AI team at Databricks. We deliver professional services engagements to help our customers build and productionize first-of-its-kind AI applications. We work cross-functionally to shape long-term strategic priorities and initiatives alongside engineering, product, and developer relations, as well as support internal subject matter expert (SME) teams. We view our team as an ensemble: we look for individuals with strong, unique specializations to improve the overall strength of the team. This team is the right fit for you if you love working with customers, teammates, and fueling your curiosity for the latest trends in GenAI, LLMOps, and ML more broadly. This role can be remote.</p> <p data-renderer-start-pos="2006"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">The impact you will have:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Develop cutting-edge GenAI solutions, incorporating the latest techniques from our <a href="https://www.databricks.com/research/mosaic">Mosaic AI Research</a> to solve customer problems.</li> <li>Own production rollouts of consumer and internally facing GenAI applications.</li> <li>Serve as a trusted technical advisor to customers across a variety of domains.</li> <li>Present at conferences such as <a href="https://www.databricks.com/dataaisummit">Data + AI Summit</a>, recognized as a thought leader internally and externally.</li> <li>Collaborate cross-functionally with the product and engineering teams to influence priorities and shape the product roadmap.</li> </ul> <p data-renderer-start-pos="2367"><strong data-renderer-mark="true">What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>Experience building GenAI applications, including RAG, multi-agent systems, Text2SQL, fine-tuning, etc., with tools such as HuggingFace, LangChain, and DSPy.</li> <li>Expertise in deploying production-grade GenAI applications, including evaluation and optimizations.</li> <li>Extensive years of hands-on industry data science experience, leveraging common machine learning and data science tools (i.e., pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, etc.).</li> <li>Experience building production-grade machine learning deployments on AWS, Azure, or GCP.</li> <li>Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Operations Research, etc.) or equivalent practical experience.</li> <li>Experience communicating and/or teaching technical concepts to non-technical and technical audiences alike.</li> <li>Passion for collaboration, life-long learning, and driving business value through AI.</li> <li>[Preferred] Experience using the Databricks Intelligence Platform and Apache Spark™ to process large-scale distributed datasets.</li> </ul><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.&nbsp; Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticpates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above.&nbsp;<br></span></p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Canada Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$162,400</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$223,384 CAD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>,&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a>&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span>&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit&nbsp;<a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>.&nbsp;<br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong technical alignment with the AI/GenAI stack required for this role — particularly in RAG pipelines, LangChain, multi-agent systems (LangGraph), and production deployment via Docker/FastAPI — which are core to the Databricks AI FDE position. However, the role explicitly demands "extensive years of hands-on industry data science experience" and a customer-facing, forward-deployed consulting profile, whereas Ruiqi's industry experience is limited to two short internships and academic/research projects, making this a significant experience gap for a senior-level role. The candidate's education (Master's in ECE from Waterloo with a 3.9 GPA) and location (Canada, open to remote) are near-perfect fits, but the seniority mismatch and absence of Databricks-specific tools (Spark, MLflow, Delta Lake) are notable weaknesses.
strengths: Strong RAG pipeline expertise with production-grade implementation (BM25 + dense/sparse hybrid retrieval, FlashRank reranking, RAGAS evaluation achieving 0.84 context recall)
Hands-on LangChain and LangGraph experience, directly matching the job's requirement for multi-agent system development
Production deployment experience using Docker, FastAPI, Redis, and PostgreSQL — aligns with 'productionize GenAI applications' mandate
Multi-agent AI architecture demonstrated in the Resume & Cover Letter Generator project (4-agent LangGraph pipeline with quality-gated routing)
Graduate degree (MEng, ECE) from a top Canadian university (University of Waterloo) with 3.9 GPA — satisfies the graduate degree in quantitative discipline requirement
Cloud platform exposure on AWS and Azure, matching the job's cloud deployment requirements
Published research at ACM MM '23, demonstrating ability to communicate technical concepts and contribute to thought leadership
Located in Canada and open to remote work — perfect geographic alignment with the role's location and remote policy
Salary expectations ($100K–$200K) overlap with the lower-to-mid range of Databricks' posted range ($162K–$223K CAD)
missing_skills: Apache Spark and Databricks Intelligence Platform experience (explicitly preferred in the job posting)
MLflow for experiment tracking and model lifecycle management
Delta Lake and Lakehouse architecture knowledge
DSPy framework experience (listed alongside LangChain in requirements)
HuggingFace ecosystem depth (fine-tuning, model hub, Transformers library)
Data science fundamentals: pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch — not explicitly listed on resume
Text2SQL development experience
Customer-facing consulting or forward-deployed engineering experience
Large-scale distributed data processing skills
Conference speaking or external thought leadership experience
interview_talking_points: Lead with the production RAG system built at Disanji: emphasize the 35% retrieval precision improvement, hybrid retrieval architecture, and RAGAS evaluation pipeline — this directly mirrors Databricks' focus on productionizing GenAI applications

Highlight the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline project as evidence of multi-agent system design skills, specifically the quality-gated routing and dual-layer ATS + LLM evaluation — frame it as a miniature version of what the FDE team builds for enterprise customers
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to communicate complex AI concepts to technical audiences, a key soft skill for a customer-facing FDE role

Address the Databricks platform gap proactively: express eagerness to learn Spark, MLflow, and Delta Lake, and reference any distributed systems or data pipeline coursework from Waterloo's MEng program
Use the RAGAS evaluation pipeline experience to speak to LLMOps and GenAI evaluation best practices �� a niche but critical skill the team values

Frame the breadth of the tech stack (FastAPI, WebSocket, PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker, React/TypeScript) as full-stack AI engineering capability, positioning yourself as someone who can own end-to-end production rollouts

matches.title: Full Stack Engineer, Link
matches.description: <h2>Who we are</h2> <h3>About the Organization&nbsp;</h3> <p>Link is a digital wallet designed for effortless and secure online payments and digital transactions. With Link, consumers enjoy convenience and peace of mind: it works on any device or browser, is backed by the highest security mechanisms, offers purchase protections on eligible items, and ensures seamless and quick payments. Across the Link Engineering org, we focus on building delightful payment experiences and to allow our global consumer base to pay with their preferred payment methods. Our team’s work spans the entire stack from front-end experiences, to infrastructure that supports low-latency transactions, to intelligent systems that help protect consumers and merchants from bad actors.</p> <p>Team Matching: exact team matching for one of the subteams will begin during final stages. Please note we may also consider you for different orgs based on your experience, location, etc. More information on our team matching process can be found <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zvJkO2c7GzukHG-_oqc5wbOLajpuh5FjbmZPcZPU1o0/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.ahb3b6nrktv1">here</a>.</p> <h2>What you’ll do</h2> <p>We’re looking for engineers who want to make an impact on payments at a global scale. You’ll play a key role in expanding our product suite and the infrastructure that supports it. Our team collaborates with many cross-functional teams and many other teams across Stripe to deliver innovative solutions that address evolving user needs.</p> <h3>Responsibilities</h3> <ul> <li>Build and design the next generation of Stripe products, to meet the high growth needs of our company and customers for years to come.</li> <li>Debug and solve critical production issues across services and multiple levels of the stack</li> <li>Mentor engineers to help them grow</li> <li>Collaborate with stakeholders across the company to build new features at large-scale, while improving internal engineering standards, tooling, and processes</li> <li>Collaborate effectively in a distributed and hybrid team, maintaining open communication and strong connections with colleagues</li> </ul> <h2>Who you are</h2> <p>We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.</p> <h3>Minimum requirements</h3> <ul> <li>2-10+ years of industry software engineering experience (does not include internships nor includes co-ops)</li> <li>Strong coding skills in any programming language&nbsp;</li> <li>Strong collaboration skills, can work across workstreams within your team and contribute to your peers’ success</li> <li>Have the ability to thrive on a high level of autonomy, responsibility, and think of yourself as entrepreneurial</li> <li>Interest in working as a generalist across varying technologies and stacks to solve problems and delight both internal and external users</li> </ul> <h3>Preferred Qualifications</h3> <ul> <li>Experience with large-scale financial tracking systems</li> <li>Good understanding and practical knowledge in cloud based services (e.g. gRPC, GraphQL, Docker/Kubernetes, cloud services such as AWS, etc.)&nbsp;</li> </ul>

matches.description:
Title: Full Stack Engineer, Developer Experience & Product Platform
Company: Stripe
Location: NA
Description: <p><strong><em>Note: </em></strong><em>if you are an intern or new grad, please do not apply using this link and visit our </em><a href="https://stripe.com/jobs/search"><em>jobs page</em></a><em> for those specific postings.</em></p> <h2><strong>Who we are</strong></h2> <h3><strong>About Stripe</strong></h3> <p>Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies - from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups - use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone's reach while doing the most important work of your career.</p> <h3><strong>About the Organization&nbsp;</strong></h3> <p><em><strong>Developer Experience and Product Platform (DEeP)</strong> Sub-orgs within DEeP: Merchant Experience, Developer Platform, Organizations and Auth Platform (OAP), Growth Platform</em></p> <p>Stripe’s DEeP organization empowers all of Stripe's products with a shared product platform that helps with rapidly delivering high-quality, cross-product experiences across our UI and API surfaces. It focuses on providing a consistent and scalable developer experience that any developer (both internal and external) can leverage to accelerate a merchant’s ability to create value using Stripe.</p> <p><strong>Team Matching:</strong> exact team matching for one of the subteams will begin during final stages.<em> Please note we may also consider you for different orgs based on your experience, location, etc. </em>More information on our team matching process can be found <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zvJkO2c7GzukHG-_oqc5wbOLajpuh5FjbmZPcZPU1o0/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.ahb3b6nrktv1">here</a>.&nbsp;</p> <h2><strong>What you’ll do</strong></h2> <p>We’re looking for Full Stack engineers who are interested in building software services and platforms that impact thousands of employees and millions of Stripe users, regardless of whether they’re an end user, developer, or partner.</p> <h3><strong>Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Ensure our platforms are reliable, scalable, secure, and extensible</li> <li>Shape future-proof interfaces that are easy to build with</li> <li>Make effective tradeoffs that consider business priorities, user experience, and a sustainable technical foundation</li> <li>Help drive sound technical decision making and lead technical conversations with other teams across Stripe</li> <li>Debug production issues across services and various levels of the tech stack</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Who you are</strong></h2> <p>We're looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.</p> <h3><strong>Minimum requirements</strong></h3> <ul> <li>2-12+ years of industry software engineering experience (does not include internships nor includes co-ops)</li> <li>Strong coding skills in any programming language <em>(we understand new languages can be learned on the job so our interview process is language agnostic)</em></li> <li>Strong collaboration skills, can work across workstreams within your team and contribute to your peers’ success</li> <li>Have the ability to thrive on a high level of autonomy, responsibility, and think of yourself as entrepreneurial</li> <li>Interest in working as a generalist across varying technologies and stacks to solve problems and delight both internal and external users</li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a technically strong candidate with a compelling full-stack and AI/ML background, solid academic credentials from top Canadian universities, and hands-on project experience with modern stacks (FastAPI, React, PostgreSQL, Docker). However, the role explicitly requires 2–12+ years of industry software engineering experience excluding internships and co-ops — Ruiqi's professional experience consists entirely of short internships and research assistantships, which likely disqualifies him under the minimum requirements. His skills align well with the generalist full-stack nature of the role, but gaps exist in enterprise-scale platform engineering, payments/fintech domain knowledge, and distributed systems at Stripe's scale.
strengths: Strong full-stack proficiency across React/TypeScript (frontend) and FastAPI/Node.js/PostgreSQL (backend)
Hands-on experience with Docker, Redis, WebSocket, and REST APIs — all relevant to Stripe's platform engineering
Demonstrated ability to architect end-to-end systems (RAG pipeline, multi-agent LangGraph app) with production-grade concerns like caching, streaming, and test coverage
Exceptional academic background: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) and BASc at UBC (GPA 3.7, Dean's Honor List)
Polyglot programmer fluent in Python, JavaScript, C++, SQL, and Java — aligns with Stripe's language-agnostic interview process
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and message queuing (Kafka) relevant to scalable platform work
Published research (ACM MM '23) demonstrates ability to work on complex, cross-functional technical problems
Location preferences (Remote/Canada/US) are compatible with Stripe's NA-based role
missing_skills: Qualifying full-time industry experience (2+ years post-graduation, excluding internships/co-ops — a hard requirement Ruiqi currently does not meet)
Fintech or payments domain knowledge (Stripe's core business)
Experience with large-scale distributed systems and microservices at enterprise scale
API platform or developer experience (DevEx) tooling background
Authentication/authorization platform experience (relevant to OAP sub-org)
Ruby (Stripe's primary backend language) or Go experience
Experience with observability, monitoring, and production incident response at scale
Cross-team technical leadership or mentorship experience
interview_talking_points: Lead with the RAG system built at Disanji: emphasize production-grade architecture decisions (hybrid retrieval, Redis semantic caching, SSE streaming) to demonstrate systems thinking beyond academic projects
Highlight the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a full-stack showcase — mention the 80%+ test coverage, WebSocket integration, and multi-agent orchestration to signal engineering rigor

Address the experience gap proactively: frame the MEng program (graduating Oct 2025) as applied engineering with real deliverables, and note that the role's 2-year minimum may be met upon graduation combined with internship depth

Emphasize generalist versatility — Python, JavaScript, C++, SQL, cloud (AWS/Azure), and AI/ML — directly matching Stripe's stated preference for engineers who work across varying technologies and stacks
Connect the developer experience angle: building tools and pipelines (RAGAS evaluation, ATS scoring, automated data pipelines) mirrors Stripe's DEeP mission of accelerating developer productivity
Mention the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to collaborate cross-functionally and communicate complex technical work — relevant to Stripe's emphasis on cross-team technical leadership

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer - Fullstack
matches.description: <p>Databricks is on a mission to simplify and democratize data and AI — from making the next mode of transportation a reality to accelerating the development of medical breakthroughs. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business. Founded by engineers — and customer obsessed — we leap at every opportunity to solve technical challenges, from designing next-gen UI/UX for interfacing with data to scaling our services and infrastructure across millions of virtual machines. And we're only getting started.</p> <p>As a Fullstack software engineer, you will work with your team and product management to make insights from data simple. We are looking for engineers that are customer obsessed, who can take on the full scope of the product and user experience beyond the technical implementation. You'll set the foundation for how we build robust, scalable and delightful products.</p> <p>Vancouver will be the newest R&amp;D center for Databricks, expanding our presence in the Pacific Northwest. We are actively hiring world-class engineers to join us on our mission to democratize data + AI.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>We envision the Vancouver site becoming a key driver of product innovation at Databricks. To start, we’re bringing a few strategic areas to the Vancouver site and we have several open roles across the teams below, including:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Log Analytics</strong> - Our customers increasingly use Databricks to analyze petabyte-scale logs in real time. This creates new challenges across the entire data processing pipeline, including ingestion, indexing, processing, and the user experience itself.</li> <li><strong>AI/BI </strong>-<a href="https://www.databricks.com/product/business-intelligence"> AI/BI</a> is redefining Business Intelligence for the AI age. We launched this product last summer and have already seen tremendous adoption (98.7% of our data warehousing customers are already using AI/BI!). From rich dashboarding and advanced visualizations to powerful talk-to-your-data solutions, the products we are building involve exciting technical challenges across the entire stack.&nbsp;</li> <li><strong>Unity Catalog Business Semantics </strong>- Context is everything for AI. For enterprise data, that context needs to be governed and managed, which is what Unity Catalog Business Semantics offers. We recently launched our first Semantics modelling capability, Unity Catalog Metrics, this past Data + AI Summit but we have a lot more in store. Engineers on this team work at the intersection of large scale distributed systems, data modeling, governance, and AI enablement.</li> <li><strong>Databricks Apps - </strong>Databricks Apps is one of the fastest growing products at Databricks, used by more than 2,500 customers who have created more than 20,000 apps — and it was only GA’ed this past June. The Apps team is one of the few teams that are exposed to low-level platform components (k8s, networking), owns fundamental tech (apps runtime and proxy), and is heavily investing in app builder AI agents.</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>5+ years of experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.</li> <li>Passion for user experience and design and a deep understanding of front-end architecture.</li> <li>Comfortable working towards a multi-year vision with incremental deliverables.</li> <li>Motivated by delivering customer value.</li> <li>Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, or VueJs/Ember).</li> <li>5+ years of experience with server-side web technologies (eg: Node.js, Java, Python, Scala, C#, C++,Go).</li> <li>Good knowledge of SQL.</li> <li>Experience with cloud technologies, e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, or Kubernetes.</li> <li>Experience developing large-scale distributed systems.</li> </ul><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.&nbsp; Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticpates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above.&nbsp;<br></span></p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Canada Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$146,200</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$201,100 CAD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>,&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a>&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span>&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit&nbsp;<a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>.&nbsp;<br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. matches.title: Full Stack Technical Developer
matches.description:
Title: Full Stack Technical Developer
Company: Elastic
Location: Costa Rica
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Elastic, the Search AI Company, enables everyone to find the answers they need in real time, using all their data, at scale — unleashing the potential of businesses and people. The Elastic Search AI Platform, used by more than 50% of the Fortune 500, brings together the precision of search and the intelligence of AI to enable everyone to accelerate the results that matter. By taking advantage of all structured and unstructured data — securing and protecting private information more effectively — Elastic’s complete, cloud-based solutions for search, security, and observability help organizations deliver on the promise of AI.</p></div><h3><strong>What is The Role</strong></h3> <p>The Marketing Innovation team at Elastic builds the custom tools that power our global reach. Our flagship platform integrates campaign planning, reporting, and audience management into one seamless experience. We’re looking for a <strong>Full Stack Application Engineer</strong> to join our team and contribute to the development and scaling of this vision.</p> <h3><strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong></h3> <p>As a core member of our engineering group, you’ll dive into our React and TypeScript stack to develop and ship features that our marketing partners love. We value high-quality engineering and collaborative problem-solving. You’ll spend your time <strong>building modular components, contributing to our development lifecycle, and engaging in constructive code reviews.</strong> We are constantly looking for ways to consolidate tools and reduce SaaS dependencies, you'll play a vital role in building the next generation of natively integrated apps.</p> <h3>What You Bring</h3> <ul> <li><strong>3+ years of Full Stack experience:</strong> A strong foundation in React and TypeScript is essential.</li> <li><strong>API &amp; Integration Skills:</strong> You are comfortable managing application state and building reliable integrations with enterprise-grade APIs (experience with Workfront or Salesforce is a plus).</li> <li><strong>A Collaborative Mindset:</strong> You enjoy working alongside Database Engineers, TPMs, and Senior Engineers to turn marketing requirements into clean, performant code.</li> <li><strong>Technical Curiosity:</strong> You have a solid understanding of modern web standards and a desire to learn new technologies as our stack evolves.</li> <li><strong>AI Interest:</strong> You are excited about the practical application of LLMs and are eager to help implement generative AI features within our internal tools.</li> </ul> <h3>Bonus Points</h3> <ul> <li> <p>We’d love to hear if you have experience with Google Cloud (Cloud Functions/BigQuery), Next.js, or have experimented with integrating AI capabilities into web applications!</p> </li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Additional Information - We Take Care of Our People</strong></h2> <p>As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.</p> <p>We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.</p> <ul> <li>Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary</li> <li>Health coverage for you and your family in many locations</li> <li>Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles</li> <li>Generous number of vacation days each year</li> <li>Increase your impact - We match up to $2000 (or local currency equivalent) for financial donations and service</li> <li>Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love</li> <li>Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave</li> </ul> <p>Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.</p> <p>We welcome individuals with disabilities and strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all individuals. To request an accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email <a href="mailto:candidate_accessibility@elastic.co" target="_blank">candidate_accessibility@elastic.co</a><span class="gmail_default">.</span>&nbsp;We will reply to your request within 24 business hours of submission.</p> <p><span style="color: #000000;">Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws, view posters linked below:</span> <a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/WHD/legacy/files/fmlaen.pdf" target="_blank">Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)</a> <span style="color: #000000;">Poster;</span><span style="color: #000000;">&nbsp;<a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_%20English_formattedESQA508c.pdf" target="_blank">Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision</a> Poster; </span><a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/WHD/legacy/files/eppabw.pdf" target="_blank">Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA)</a> <span style="color: #000000;">Poster and <a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/OFCCP/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights.pdf" target="_blank">Know Your Rights</a> (Poster)</span></p> <p><span style="color: #000000;">Elasticsearch develops and distributes technology and information that is subject to U.S. and other countries’ export controls and licensing requirements for individuals who are located in or are nationals of the following sanctioned countries and regions: Belarus, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, or Russia, including the Ukrainian territories annexed by Russia (The Crimea region of Ukraine, The Donetsk People's Republic (DNR), The Luhansk People's Republic (LNR), Kherson or Zaporizhzhia). If you are located in or are a national of one of the listed countries or regions, an export license may be required as a condition of your employment in this role. Please note that national origin and/or nationality do not affect eligibility for employment with Elastic.</span></p> <p>Please see&nbsp;<a href="https://www.elastic.co/legal/applicant-privacy-statement" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.elastic.co/legal/applicant-privacy-statement&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1611068262479000&amp;usg=AFQjCNG3orAPk5sJIr9WVm0ZDxYw82c5DA">here</a>&nbsp;for our Privacy Statement.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong technical candidate with solid full-stack fundamentals (React, TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker) and impressive AI/ML depth that aligns well with Elastic's stated interest in LLM/generative AI integration. However, the role explicitly requires 3+ years of full-stack experience, and Ruiqi's professional software engineering experience is limited to short internships (~4 months total), with the bulk of relevant work coming from academic projects — this is a meaningful gap for a mid-level role. The location is also a concern: the job is based in Costa Rica, while the candidate prefers remote/US/Canada, and no salary data is available to assess compensation alignment.
strengths: Strong React and TypeScript proficiency demonstrated in both professional and project work (AI Agent Resume Generator, Drone Footage project)
Hands-on AI/LLM integration experience (LangChain, LangGraph, RAG pipelines, ChromaDB) directly aligns with Elastic's AI interest bonus criteria
Full-stack project delivery with FastAPI, PostgreSQL, WebSocket, Docker, and 80%+ test coverage shows production-minded engineering habits
Exceptional academic credentials: 3.9 GPA MEng at University of Waterloo with specialization in Software Engineering and Full-stack Development
Experience with REST APIs, WebSocket, and application state management matches core API & Integration requirements
Published research (ACM MM '23) demonstrates technical curiosity and depth beyond typical mid-level candidates
Familiarity with Redis (semantic caching) and cloud-adjacent tooling (AWS, Azure) adds infrastructure breadth
missing_skills: 3+ years of professional full-stack experience (candidate has ~4 months of internship experience; most work is project/academic-based)
Enterprise-grade API integration experience (Workfront, Salesforce — explicitly listed as a plus)
Google Cloud Platform experience (Cloud Functions, BigQuery — listed as bonus)
Next.js experience (listed as bonus)
No demonstrated experience with campaign planning, marketing tools, or audience management platforms
Limited evidence of collaborative code review culture or working within a large engineering team lifecycle
interview_talking_points: Lead with the AI Agent Resume Generator project — it mirrors Elastic's stack (React/TypeScript, FastAPI, WebSocket, PostgreSQL, Docker) and demonstrates end-to-end full-stack ownership with production-quality standards (80%+ test coverage, multi-agent LangGraph pipeline)

Emphasize the RAG system built at Disanji Technology: production-grade deployment, measurable outcomes (35% retrieval precision improvement, 0.84 RAGAS context recall), and streaming architecture — this directly speaks to Elastic's AI interest and search-AI identity

Address the experience gap proactively: frame the combination of two internships + multiple complex independent projects as equivalent to continuous professional development, and highlight the MEng program's applied engineering focus

Highlight technical curiosity and learning velocity — published at ACM MM '23 as an undergrad, built systems spanning LLMs, computer vision, embedded systems, and full-stack web, showing rapid adaptation to new technologies
If location flexibility is possible, clarify willingness to work Costa Rica hours remotely from Canada, as Elastic is a distributed company that explicitly supports flexible locations

matches.title: Software Engineer - Fullstack
matches.description:
Title: Software Engineer - Fullstack
Company: Databricks
Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands
Description: <p>P-1320</p> <p>At Databricks, we are passionate about enabling data teams to solve the world's toughest problems — from making the next mode of transportation a reality to accelerating the development of medical breakthroughs. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business. Founded by engineers — and customer obsessed — we leap at every opportunity to solve technical challenges, from designing next-gen UI/UX for interfacing with data to scaling our services and infrastructure across millions of virtual machines. And we're only getting started.</p> <p>Unlike traditional enterprise software, we design and build modern SaaS products that bring delight to all of the stakeholders: decision makers, admins, and end users. As a full stack software engineer, you will work closely with your team and product management to bring that delight through great user experience.</p> <p>Below are some example teams you can join:</p> <p><strong>SQL Analytics Console: </strong>SQL Analytics is a new product that provides Databricks customers with a first-class experience for performing Business Intelligence (BI) and running SQL workloads directly on the data lake. Our team builds the "console" for SQL Analytics, where users configure, manage and monitor their SQL usage.</p> <p><strong>Jobs and Workflows: </strong>This team powers all asynchronous customer workloads for Databricks which is the majority of Databricks usage. As this usage has rapidly increased - we've rearchitected the system for increased stability and scalability. We are also building exciting new features for more advanced workflows and customer observability. This team has a mix of frontend, backend, and reliability engineering skills &amp; projects.</p> <p><strong>Developer Ecosystem:</strong> The developer ecosystem team focuses on the development experience and best practices using tools<strong> </strong>outside of the workspace. We own and govern the core developer ecosystem open-source components: the SDK, the CLI, and Terraform.</p> <p>Neon&nbsp;<strong>Backend as a Service</strong> team is responsible for making Neon.com more than just a database — providing services that enable developers and AI agents to build full-stack applications without leaving our platform (auth, data API, email, etc.). The team focuses on designing the core primitives that will power the next generation of AI agents and developer workflows</p> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science, or a related field</li> <li>2+ years of experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li> <li>Passion for user experience and design and a deep understanding of front-end architecture</li> <li>Comfortable working towards a multi-year vision with incremental deliverables</li> <li>Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, VueJs/Ember)</li> <li>Strong familiarity with server-side web technologies (eg: Nodejs, Java, Python, Scala, C#, C++,Go, JVM)</li> <li>Good knowledge of SQL</li> <li>Experience with cloud technologies, e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes</li> <li>Experience in architecting, developing, deploying, and operating large scale distributed systems</li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>,&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a>&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span>&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit&nbsp;<a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>.&nbsp;<br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong technical fit for the full-stack role at Databricks, demonstrating solid command of the required frontend (React, TypeScript, HTML/CSS/JS) and backend (FastAPI, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Docker, AWS/Azure) technologies, along with a standout AI/ML background that aligns well with Databricks' data and AI platform mission. However, the candidate's professional experience is limited to short internships and research roles, falling short of the implied 2+ years of hands-on industry experience, and the job is based in Amsterdam — a location incompatible with the candidate's stated preferences for Remote/US/Canada. The salary range is also unspecified by Databricks, making alignment uncertain, though Amsterdam-based compensation may differ significantly from North American expectations.
strengths: Strong full-stack proficiency: React/TypeScript frontend paired with FastAPI, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Redis, and WebSocket backend — directly matching Databricks' requirements
Cloud and containerization experience with AWS, Azure, and Docker, aligning with the job's cloud technology requirements
Solid SQL knowledge listed explicitly in skills, matching the job's SQL requirement

Hands-on AI/ML and RAG pipeline experience (LangChain, LangGraph, ChromaDB) is highly relevant to Databricks' AI-first platform vision
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates ability to work on complex, cutting-edge technical problems
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks including React and Vue, directly matching the job's framework requirements
Demonstrated ability to architect end-to-end systems (RAG pipeline, multi-agent LangGraph system) with production-grade practices like Docker Compose, Redis caching, and 80%+ test coverage
missing_skills: Kubernetes experience (listed in job requirements, absent from resume)
Scala or Go proficiency (common at Databricks for backend services)
Experience with large-scale distributed systems at production scale (internship experience is limited in scope)
No mention of Spark, Delta Lake, or Databricks-specific technologies
Limited frontend architecture depth — no mention of state management libraries (Redux, Zustand), testing frameworks (Jest, Cypress), or performance optimization
No experience with Terraform or infrastructure-as-code tools (relevant to the Developer Ecosystem team)
TypeScript is only implied via React/TypeScript in projects, not explicitly listed as a core language skill
interview_talking_points: Highlight the end-to-end AI Agent Resume Generator project as a direct demonstration of full-stack ownership: FastAPI backend, React/TypeScript frontend, WebSocket real-time communication, PostgreSQL, Docker, and 80%+ test coverage — mirroring Databricks' product engineering standards

Emphasize the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji: quantify the 35% retrieval precision improvement and 0.84 RAGAS context recall score to show data-driven engineering discipline that resonates with Databricks' culture

Connect AI/ML expertise (LangChain, LangGraph, multi-agent pipelines) to Databricks' Neon Backend-as-a-Service team's focus on powering AI agents and developer workflows — this is a unique differentiator vs. typical full-stack candidates
Address the location mismatch proactively: clarify willingness to relocate to Amsterdam or inquire about remote/hybrid flexibility for the Netherlands role

Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate ability to contribute to technically ambitious, long-horizon projects — aligning with the job's requirement to 'work towards a multi-year vision with incremental deliverables'
Mention AWS and Azure hands-on experience to reinforce cloud readiness, and express intent to expand into Kubernetes and GCP to close the gap on missing cloud orchestration skills

matches.title: Full Stack Engineer, Expansion
matches.description: <h2><strong>Who we are</strong></h2> <h3><strong>About Stripe</strong></h3> <p>Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</p> <h3><strong>About the team</strong></h3> <p>Web Presence and Platform is organized into two pillars, each of which is grouped into pods that focus on the central tenets of Stripe's public mission. The Presence pillar creates industry-leading designs for Stripe’s front door surfaces, educating customers about the power of our platform, sharing Stripe’s ideas and expertise with the public, and driving adoption. The Platform pillar builds the internal machinery that powers these surfaces, and is responsible for making our websites fast, stable, and easy to update.</p> <p>Together we design and build stripe.com and other sites that amount to what is, for many, their first impression of Stripe. As such, WPP offers exciting opportunities to have a major impact on Stripe’s success. We want to make every pixel count, we want it to be enthralling, and we want to help other Stripes seamlessly benefit from our systematic work.</p> <h2><strong>What you’ll do</strong></h2> <p>The Expansion pod brings creativity and executional rigor to attracting new prospects and driving conversion, focusing on user journeys, interactive and highly polished tools for users, and building targeted experiences for our global users.</p> <p>As a fullstack engineer you will reimagine the user experience moments that contribute to acquisition journeys. You will build delightful and original interactive tools and resources that attract users. You will collaborate deeply across design, engineering, and cross-functional teams and work across teams and tech stacks to create new site capabilities.&nbsp; You’ll enable prospective clients to self-select into the right Stripe product lines, bring additional partners into the authoring process while upholding our high quality bar, and directly impact Stripe’s success by marrying data-driven rigor with our deep commitment to craft.</p> <h3><strong>Responsibilities</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Develop and implement the tooling and platforms to support interactive content tools (e.g., calculators, generators, templates) that provide utility to current and prospective businesses.</li> <li>Utilize a user-first mindset to implement feedback mechanisms for continuous improvement of content and product offerings.</li> <li>Design and build integrations to third-party software and create seamless workflows across these tools to unleash their full potential to the rest of Stripe.</li> <li>Work with a small team of technically sophisticated engineers who put users first.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Who you are</strong></h2> <p>We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.</p> <h3><strong>Minimum requirements</strong></h3> <ul> <li>2+ years of backend and/or full stack development experience, with emphasis on creating user-facing experiences</li> <li>Experience writing clear, elegant code in a team environment</li> <li>Passion for engineering solutions focused around growth hacking &amp; enablement</li> <li>Excellent verbal and written communication</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred qualifications</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Proven ability to stitch different services and processes together even if you have not worked with them before</li> <li>Experience in developing interactive tools and integrating them with existing systems.</li> <li>Experience building highly complex interactive tools, including state management and data fetching</li> <li>Proficiency with React, with a focus on interactions, animation, performance, and polish</li> <li>Experience with A/B testing, synthetic monitoring, or accessibility testing</li> </ul>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi is a technically strong candidate with solid full-stack fundamentals (React, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker, WebSocket) and a high-caliber academic background, making him a reasonable fit for the engineering core of this role. However, the Stripe Expansion pod is heavily focused on polished, user-facing web experiences, interactive tools, animations, A/B testing, and growth-oriented frontend craft — areas where Ruiqi's portfolio skews more toward AI/ML and backend systems rather than consumer-grade UI polish. The location is a significant mismatch: the role is based in the United Kingdom, while the candidate prefers remote US/Canada positions, and Stripe's UK posting is unlikely to be remote-eligible for candidates outside the region.
strengths: Strong full-stack experience with React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker, and WebSocket — directly matching Stripe's preferred tech stack
Demonstrated ability to architect end-to-end systems (RAG pipeline, AI Agent resume generator) showing integration of multiple services and tools
