Hands-on experience with Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis, and REST/WebSocket APIs — core infrastructure tools used in high-scale services
Demonstrated end-to-end product delivery in the AI Agent Resume Generator project with 80%+ test coverage, showing testing discipline
Advanced AI/ML expertise (RAG, LangChain, LangGraph, LLMs) adds emerging technology value to Airbnb's CP&ET team mandate
High academic pedigree: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) + BASc at UBC (GPA 3.7) with Dean's Honor List recognition
Chinese language fluency (implied by name, Chinese internship, and Chinese-language RAG system) satisfies the bilingual Chinese/English requirement
Experience with Java and C++ listed in skills, matching Airbnb's preferred backend language stack
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates ability to tackle complex, open-ended technical problems
missing_skills: 5+ years of professional software development experience (candidate has ~4 months of internship experience)
Experience designing and scaling high-traffic, production-grade backend services at scale (millions of users)
Native mobile development experience (iOS/Android) — listed as a collaboration requirement
Frontend architecture expertise: build tools (Webpack, Vite, etc.), reusable component library design at enterprise scale
Kotlin proficiency (listed as a preferred backend language by Airbnb)
Cross-functional technical leadership and stakeholder management at a senior level
Experience with A/B experimentation frameworks and feature flagging systems
interview_talking_points: Highlight the AI Agent Resume Generator as a flagship full-stack project — emphasize the FastAPI + React/TypeScript + PostgreSQL + Docker stack, WebSocket integration, and 80%+ test coverage to demonstrate production-quality engineering habits

Leverage the Chinese-language RAG system built at Disanji Technology as proof of bilingual technical capability and experience building real-world, document-scale backend pipelines — directly relevant to Airbnb's China team
Frame the ACM MM '23 publication and Nanjing University research as evidence of tackling large, open-ended problems and driving impactful outcomes — a key behavioral trait Airbnb calls out explicitly

Emphasize the breadth of the tech stack (Python, Java, C++, JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Docker, Redis, PostgreSQL, AWS, Azure) to address the multi-language backend and modern frontend architecture requirements

Address the seniority gap proactively: position the MEng at Waterloo (graduating Oct 2025) as accelerated, specialized training equivalent to industry experience, and highlight the density of project work completed during the degree

matches.title: Senior Full Stack Developer
matches.description:
Title: Senior Full Stack Developer
Company: Elastic
Location: Costa Rica
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p>Elastic, the Search AI Company, enables everyone to find the answers they need in real time, using all their data, at scale — unleashing the potential of businesses and people. The Elastic Search AI Platform, used by more than 50% of the Fortune 500, brings together the precision of search and the intelligence of AI to enable everyone to accelerate the results that matter. By taking advantage of all structured and unstructured data — securing and protecting private information more effectively — Elastic’s complete, cloud-based solutions for search, security, and observability help organizations deliver on the promise of AI.</p></div><h3><strong>What is The Role</strong></h3> <p>The Marketing Innovation team at Elastic builds the custom tools that power our global reach. Our flagship platform integrates campaign planning, reporting, and audience management into one seamless experience. We’re looking for a <strong>Senior Full Stack Application Engineer</strong> to join our team and help us scale this vision.</p> <h3><strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong></h3> <p>As a key member of our engineering group, you’ll dive into our React and TypeScript stack to build features that our marketing partners love. We value high-quality engineering and collaborative problem-solving. You’ll spend your time designing modular components, streamlining our development lifecycle alongside peers, and participating in thoughtful code reviews. We are constantly looking for ways to consolidate tools and reduce SaaS dependencies, could you help us build the next generation of natively integrated apps?</p> <h3>What You Bring</h3> <ul> <li><strong>6+ years of Full Stack experience:</strong> Deep expertise in React and TypeScript is essential.</li> <li><strong>Integration Orchestrator:</strong> You are comfortable managing complex application states and building reliable, bi-directional integrations with enterprise-grade APIs (Workfront or Salesforce experience is a major plus).</li> <li><strong>Collaborative Builder:</strong> You enjoy partnering with Database Engineers and TPMs to translate high-level marketing strategies into elegant, performant technical solutions.</li> <li><strong>AI Enthusiast:</strong> You are excited about the practical application of LLMs and have experience (or a strong interest) in implementing generative AI features.</li> </ul> <h3>Bonus Points</h3> <ul> <li> <p>We’d love to hear if you have experience with Google Cloud (Cloud Functions/BigQuery), Next.js, or integrating AI capabilities into internal tools!</p> </li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><h2><strong>Additional Information - We Take Care of Our People</strong></h2> <p>As a distributed company, diversity drives our identity. Whether you’re looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life. Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.</p> <p>We strive to have parity of benefits across regions and while regulations differ from place to place, we believe taking care of our people is the right thing to do.</p> <ul> <li>Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary</li> <li>Health coverage for you and your family in many locations</li> <li>Ability to craft your calendar with flexible locations and schedules for many roles</li> <li>Generous number of vacation days each year</li> <li>Increase your impact - We match up to $2000 (or local currency equivalent) for financial donations and service</li> <li>Up to 40 hours each year to use toward volunteer projects you love</li> <li>Embracing parenthood with minimum of 16 weeks of parental leave</li> </ul> <p>Different people approach problems differently. We need that. Elastic is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.</p> <p>We welcome individuals with disabilities and strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all individuals. To request an accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please email <a href="mailto:candidate_accessibility@elastic.co" target="_blank">candidate_accessibility@elastic.co</a><span class="gmail_default">.</span>&nbsp;We will reply to your request within 24 business hours of submission.</p> <p><span style="color: #000000;">Applicants have rights under Federal Employment Laws, view posters linked below:</span> <a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/WHD/legacy/files/fmlaen.pdf" target="_blank">Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)</a> <span style="color: #000000;">Poster;</span><span style="color: #000000;">&nbsp;<a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_%20English_formattedESQA508c.pdf" target="_blank">Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision</a> Poster; </span><a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/WHD/legacy/files/eppabw.pdf" target="_blank">Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA)</a> <span style="color: #000000;">Poster and <a href="https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/OFCCP/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights.pdf" target="_blank">Know Your Rights</a> (Poster)</span></p> <p><span style="color: #000000;">Elasticsearch develops and distributes technology and information that is subject to U.S. and other countries’ export controls and licensing requirements for individuals who are located in or are nationals of the following sanctioned countries and regions: Belarus, Cuba, Iran, North Korea, Syria, or Russia, including the Ukrainian territories annexed by Russia (The Crimea region of Ukraine, The Donetsk People's Republic (DNR), The Luhansk People's Republic (LNR), Kherson or Zaporizhzhia). If you are located in or are a national of one of the listed countries or regions, an export license may be required as a condition of your employment in this role. Please note that national origin and/or nationality do not affect eligibility for employment with Elastic.</span></p> <p>Please see&nbsp;<a href="https://www.elastic.co/legal/applicant-privacy-statement" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.elastic.co/legal/applicant-privacy-statement&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1611068262479000&amp;usg=AFQjCNG3orAPk5sJIr9WVm0ZDxYw82c5DA">here</a>&nbsp;for our Privacy Statement.</p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates a solid technical foundation in full-stack development with React/TypeScript, FastAPI, and AI/ML integration — all of which align well with Elastic's tech stack and their interest in AI-enthusiastic engineers. However, the role demands 6+ years of full-stack experience and is titled "Senior," while Ruiqi is a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree with only ~1 year of professional internship experience, creating a significant seniority gap. Additionally, the job is based in Costa Rica, which conflicts with the candidate's preferred locations of Remote, United States, and Canada, and no salary data is available to confirm alignment.
strengths: Proficient in React and TypeScript, which are the core technologies explicitly required by Elastic's stack
Demonstrated hands-on AI/LLM experience including RAG pipelines, LangChain, LangGraph, and ChromaDB — directly aligning with Elastic's AI Enthusiast requirement
Full-stack project experience with FastAPI, PostgreSQL, WebSocket, Docker, and React/TypeScript in a production-like context (Resume Generator project)
Strong academic background with a 3.9 GPA Master's in ECE at University of Waterloo, specializing in Software Engineering and Full-stack Development
Experience with REST APIs and complex backend integrations, relevant to Elastic's need for an Integration Orchestrator
Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) which complements Elastic's cloud-based product environment
Published research at ACM MM '23, demonstrating depth in AI/ML — a bonus for Elastic's AI-forward culture
missing_skills: 6+ years of full-stack professional experience (candidate has ~1 year of internship experience)
Enterprise-grade API integration experience, specifically Workfront or Salesforce
Google Cloud Platform experience (Cloud Functions, BigQuery) listed as a bonus requirement
Next.js experience (listed as a bonus by Elastic)
Complex application state management at enterprise scale (e.g., Redux, Zustand, or similar at production scale)
Experience leading or mentoring engineering teams, expected at the Senior level
Marketing technology domain knowledge (campaign planning, audience management tools)
interview_talking_points: Highlight the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a direct parallel to Elastic's internal tooling vision — it's a full-stack app (FastAPI + React/TypeScript + PostgreSQL + Docker) with integrated LLM/RAG capabilities, mirroring exactly what Elastic wants to build natively

Emphasize the RAG pipeline work at Disanji Technology (LangChain, Milvus, Redis caching, FastAPI + SSE streaming) to demonstrate practical, production-grade AI integration experience that aligns with Elastic's Search AI platform identity
Address the seniority gap proactively by showcasing the breadth and depth of independent project ownership, academic research publication, and rapid skill acquisition across the full stack
Leverage the Elastic Search AI Company narrative — connect your LLM/RAG expertise to Elastic's core product mission and express genuine enthusiasm for building AI-powered search features
Mention AWS and Azure cloud experience as a bridge toward their Google Cloud bonus requirement, and express willingness to quickly ramp up on GCP/BigQuery and Next.js

matches.title: Senior Fullstack Engineer, Trust
matches.description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Community You Will Join:&nbsp;</strong></span></p> <p>Join our team at Airbnb to enhance transparency, empower our global community, and build user trust through strong data privacy protections. The Privacy Engineering team is at the forefront of building cutting-edge technologies to protect user data and ensure compliance with global privacy regulations. We design and implement scalable privacy solutions that empower product teams to innovate while upholding the highest standards of data privacy. Our team works with design, product, legal, operations, security, infrastructure and other engineering teams to ensure that user data is protected and privacy standards are upheld, fostering a safer and more trustworthy Airbnb community. If you're a front-end leaning engineer thats passionate about building privacy-first architectures for large-scale distributed systems, this team is the place to make a real impact!&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>Design, prototype, and productionize next-gen privacy product and infrastructure solutions.</li> <li>Work cross-functionally with product, design, and other engineering counterparts to execute on product and business strategy.</li> <li>Provide technical leadership and deeply collaborate with privacy experts to design and integrate cutting-edge privacy safeguards into Airbnb’s tech stack.</li> <li>Drive, lead, and contribute to the full software development cycle: technical design, development, QA, experimentation, analysis, and launch.</li> <li>Provide critical input in code and design reviews, give feedback on product specs and mocks, influence team roadmap and long term technical direction.</li> <li>Work with cross functional partners to enable Privacy by Design into engineering &amp; product development processes at Airbnb.</li> </ul> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>6+ years of full stack (front-end leaning) software development experience.</li> <li>Proficient in at least one major programming language (preferably Java / Kotlin / Scala).</li> <li>Experience with modern Javascript / TypeScript frameworks such as React, Preact, Angular, Next, Vue or Meteor.</li> <li>Hands-on experience writing, optimizing, and monitoring GraphQL queries and mutations in a production environment.</li> <li>Passion for delivering products end-to-end: from ideation through planning and scoping to implementation and experimental A/B testing.</li> <li>Exposure to architectural patterns of large, high-scale web applications, such as well-designed APIs, high volume data pipelines, and efficient algorithms.</li> <li>Passionate about design and building UX products. You bring flexibility to collaboration with design and product partners by presenting tradeoffs and iterating to the ideal solution.</li> <li>Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills with strong attention to detail.</li> <li>Desire to work collaboratively with cross-functional partners, such as design, product, data science, infrastructure, policy, operations, and legal partners</li> <li>Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree, preferably in CS, or equivalent experience.</li> <li>Familiarity with privacy regulations (such as GDPR), and privacy enforcing tooling and infrastructure</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> . If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$180,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$220,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi is a technically strong candidate with a solid full-stack foundation (React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker) and impressive AI/ML depth, but this role is a poor fit on two critical dimensions. First, the job demands 6+ years of full-stack experience with a front-end lean, while Ruiqi is a mid-level candidate still completing their Master's degree with only ~4 months of relevant industry internship experience. Second, the role has a very specific focus on privacy engineering (GDPR, privacy-by-design, GraphQL in production), none of which appear anywhere in the resume. The education credentials and remote location compatibility are genuine strengths, but the experience gap and missing domain-specific skills make this a reach role.
strengths: Strong full-stack project experience with React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker, and WebSocket — directly relevant technologies
Exceptional academic credentials: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) + BASc at UBC (GPA 3.7) with Dean's Honor List, satisfying the Bachelor's/Master's in CS/Engineering requirement

Privacy engineering domain knowledge — no mention of GDPR, CCPA, privacy-by-design, data minimization, consent management, or any privacy tooling/infrastructure
Java / Kotlin / Scala — the job prefers proficiency in one of these; Ruiqi lists Java but shows no meaningful Java project experience
6+ years of industry experience — Ruiqi has ~4 months of internship experience; this is the single largest gap for a Senior-level role
A/B experimentation and product analytics — the role emphasizes experimentation and analysis as part of the dev cycle; not evidenced in the resume
Cross-functional collaboration at scale — no demonstrated experience working with legal, policy, operations, or data science partners in a large org
Front-end depth at production scale — while React is listed, there is no evidence of large-scale, high-traffic front-end system ownership
interview_talking_points: Lead with your full-stack project architecture: walk through the AI Agent Resume Generator (FastAPI + React/TypeScript + PostgreSQL + Docker + WebSocket) as proof of end-to-end ownership and modern stack fluency

Highlight your RAG pipeline work at Disanji — emphasize the production-grade deployment (Docker Compose, Redis semantic caching, FastAPI + SSE streaming) to demonstrate you can ship real systems, not just prototypes

Connect your AI/ML background to Airbnb's Trust mission: frame your experience building evaluation pipelines and quality-gated routing as directly applicable to trust, safety, and content moderation systems

Address the seniority gap proactively: emphasize the breadth and complexity of systems you've independently architected (multi-agent pipelines, hybrid retrieval systems, automated evaluation) to demonstrate senior-level thinking despite fewer years
Express genuine interest in learning privacy engineering — mention any coursework, self-study, or awareness of GDPR/privacy-by-design principles, and frame it as a domain you're eager to grow into
Mention your React and Vue experience and any performance or UX considerations you've made in your projects to reinforce the front-end lean the team is looking for
If you have any Java experience from coursework or side projects, be ready to speak to it — the team prefers Java/Kotlin/Scala on the backend

matches.title: Staff Software Engineer - Fullstack
matches.description:
Title: Staff Software Engineer - Fullstack
Company: Databricks
Location: Vancouver, Canada
Description: <p>Databricks is on a mission to simplify and democratize data and AI — from making the next mode of transportation a reality to accelerating the development of medical breakthroughs. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business. Founded by engineers — and customer obsessed — we leap at every opportunity to solve technical challenges, from designing next-gen UI/UX for interfacing with data to scaling our services and infrastructure across millions of virtual machines. And we're only getting started.</p> <p>As a Fullstack software engineer, you will work with your team and product management to make insights from data simple. We are looking for engineers that are customer obsessed, who can take on the full scope of the product and user experience beyond the technical implementation. You'll set the foundation for how we build robust, scalable and delightful products.</p> <p>Vancouver will be the newest R&amp;D center for Databricks, expanding our presence in the Pacific Northwest. We are actively hiring world-class engineers to join us on our mission to democratize data + AI.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>We envision the Vancouver site becoming a key driver of product innovation at Databricks. To start, we’re bringing a few strategic areas to the Vancouver site and we have several open roles across the teams below, including:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Log Analytics</strong> - Our customers increasingly use Databricks to analyze petabyte-scale logs in real time. This creates new challenges across the entire data processing pipeline, including ingestion, indexing, processing, and the user experience itself.</li> <li><strong>AI/BI </strong>-<a href="https://www.databricks.com/product/business-intelligence"> AI/BI</a> is redefining Business Intelligence for the AI age. We launched this product last summer and have already seen tremendous adoption (98.7% of our data warehousing customers are already using AI/BI!). From rich dashboarding and advanced visualizations to powerful talk-to-your-data solutions, the products we are building involve exciting technical challenges across the entire stack.&nbsp;</li> <li><strong>Unity Catalog Business Semantics </strong>- Context is everything for AI. For enterprise data, that context needs to be governed and managed, which is what Unity Catalog Business Semantics offers. We recently launched our first Semantics modelling capability, Unity Catalog Metrics, this past Data + AI Summit but we have a lot more in store. Engineers on this team work at the intersection of large scale distributed systems, data modeling, governance, and AI enablement.</li> <li><strong>Databricks Apps - </strong>Databricks Apps is one of the fastest growing products at Databricks, used by more than 2,500 customers who have created more than 20,000 apps — and it was only GA’ed this past June. The Apps team is one of the few teams that are exposed to low-level platform components (k8s, networking), owns fundamental tech (apps runtime and proxy), and is heavily investing in app builder AI agents.</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>10+ years of experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.</li> <li>Passion for user experience and design and a deep understanding of front-end architecture.</li> <li>Comfortable working towards a multi-year vision with incremental deliverables.</li> <li>Motivated by delivering customer value.</li> <li>Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, or VueJs/Ember).</li> <li>10+ years of experience with server-side web technologies (eg: Node.js, Java, Python, Scala, C#, C++,Go).</li> <li>Good knowledge of SQL.</li> <li>Experience with cloud technologies, e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, or Kubernetes.</li> <li>Experience developing large-scale distributed systems.</li> </ul><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.&nbsp; Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticpates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above.&nbsp;<br></span></p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Canada Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$173,400</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$238,350 CAD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>,&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a>&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span>&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit&nbsp;<a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>.&nbsp;<br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian is a strong mid-level candidate with a solid full-stack and AI/ML skill set that aligns well with Databricks' technical stack (React, FastAPI, Python, Docker, AWS/Azure, PostgreSQL), and his AI/RAG expertise is a genuine differentiator for teams like AI/BI and Databricks Apps. However, the role is a Staff Software Engineer position explicitly requiring 10+ years of experience with both frontend and backend technologies — Ruiqi is a recent graduate (BASc 2024, MEng in progress) with roughly 1–2 years of professional experience, creating a severe seniority gap. The location and education dimensions are strong fits, but the experience mismatch is the dominant factor limiting this match.
strengths: Strong full-stack proficiency with React/TypeScript, FastAPI, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and Docker — directly matching Databricks' tech stack
Hands-on AI/ML and RAG pipeline experience (LangChain, LangGraph, ChromaDB, Milvus) is highly relevant to Databricks' AI/BI and Apps teams
Cloud experience with both AWS and Azure aligns with the job's cloud technology requirement
Excellent academic credentials: 3.9 GPA MEng at University of Waterloo with software engineering specialization, plus Dean's Honor List at UBC
Located in Canada (UBC/Waterloo background) — perfectly aligned with the Vancouver R&D center hiring
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates ability to work on cutting-edge technical problems
Experience with WebSocket, Redis, Kafka, and streaming architectures relevant to Databricks' Log Analytics and real-time data products
SQL knowledge explicitly listed, matching a stated job requirement
Production-grade deployment experience with Docker Compose, FastAPI, and SSE streaming
missing_skills: 10+ years of professional experience in frontend (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) — candidate has ~1-2 years
10+ years of server-side web technology experience — far below the Staff-level bar
Experience with large-scale distributed systems at petabyte scale
Kubernetes (k8s) experience not demonstrated
Scala or Go experience (common in Databricks' backend stack)
Deep front-end architecture ownership and UI/UX design leadership at scale
Experience leading or mentoring engineering teams (expected at Staff level)
No demonstrated experience with data warehousing, BI dashboards, or analytics platforms
interview_talking_points: Highlight the production RAG system built at Disanji — emphasize the end-to-end pipeline (LangChain, Milvus, Redis caching, Docker, FastAPI streaming) as evidence of full-stack, production-grade thinking relevant to Databricks Apps and AI/BI teams

Emphasize the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a showcase of full-stack ownership: React/TypeScript frontend, FastAPI backend, WebSocket, PostgreSQL, Docker, and 80%+ test coverage — demonstrating the breadth Databricks expects
Leverage the ACM MM '23 publication to demonstrate research depth and ability to contribute to Databricks' innovation-driven Vancouver R&D center

Address the seniority gap proactively — frame the MEng at Waterloo (graduating Oct 2025) as accelerated, intensive training and express openness to a mid-level SWE role rather than Staff if one is available
Connect AI/ML expertise (RAG, LLM, LangGraph) to Databricks' AI/BI product and the Databricks Apps AI agent builder investment, positioning yourself as uniquely valuable at the AI-data intersection
Mention familiarity with both AWS and Azure to reinforce cloud readiness for Databricks' multi-cloud platform

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer, Guest & Host
matches.description:
Title: Senior Software Engineer, Guest & Host
Company: Airbnb
Location: Remote, USA
Description: <div class="content-intro"><p><span style="font-family: helvetica, arial, sans-serif; font-size: 12pt;">Airbnb was born in 2007 when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 5 million hosts who have welcomed over 2 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.</span></p></div><p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Community You Will Join</strong></span></p> <p>The Cities Team at Airbnb is chartered with driving sustainable global growth by developing the necessary software systems to enable Airbnb to work effectively with local governments. This involves designing systems that allow us to flexibly model the breadth of regulations around the world, deploy them safely and operationalize thousands around the world. At the same time, we are stewards of our global business and build systems to maximize growth and retention of global supply. Advocating for fair regulations is key, as it establishes a clear framework for Airbnb's continued growth and ensures continuous business expansion.</p> <p>This is a highly collaborative team that works in close partnership with Operations, Product, Policy and legal functions around the company. In addition, you will be part of a global team with members in the US and India.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>The Difference You Will Make:</strong></span></p> <p>As a Senior Fullstack Engineer, you will be responsible for building the tools and systems to scale regulatory launches worldwide with a focus on supply growth and retention. You will design and build product and platform features to achieve our goals. You will help define and maintain a culture of craftsmanship and excellence. You will represent the engineering team with global cross-functional partners across a variety of regulatory projects.</p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>A Typical Day:&nbsp;</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>Work closely with global cross-functional stakeholders for product alignment, requirements and shaping specifications</li> <li>Build our features and platforms for high-scale and reliability and employing engineering best practices</li> <li>Foster a culture of craftsmanship that emphasizes both the successful delivery of business initiatives and a commitment to quality</li> <li>Strategising and brainstorming opportunities along with Product, Partnerships &amp; other cross-functional leaders and driving effective relevant metrics to measure the success of these initiatives.</li> <li>Support 24x7 engineering ops to maintain high reliability services</li> </ul> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Your Expertise:</strong></span></p> <ul> <li>BS, MS or Ph.D. in computer science or related field, or equivalent work experience.</li> <li>7+​ years of relevant engineering work experience</li> <li>Strong coding abilities and experience with architectural patterns of large, high-scale applications.</li> <li>Proficiency in one or more JVM based languages (Java, Kotlin, Scala, etc.) are preferred</li> <li>Familiar with frontend web technologies&nbsp; (e.g. HTML, CSS, React and Graphql etc)</li> <li>Experience architecting, building, and maintaining highly available services in a service-oriented architecture (SOA).</li> <li>Familiarity with patterns, libraries and frameworks for building and testing services, and service-to-service communication.</li> <li>Successfully partnering with Operations, Policy, Legal, and Product functions</li> <li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to structure complex, ambiguous problems, identify patterns, and propose data-driven solutions. Self-driven with strong project management abilities.</li> <li>Ability to drive end-to-end initiatives, aligning stakeholders, managing timelines, and proactively removing roadblocks for high-quality outcomes in fast-moving environments.</li> </ul> <p><span style="color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif;"><strong>Your Location:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="https://careers.airbnb.com/">Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> . If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><strong>Our Commitment To Inclusion &amp; Belonging:</strong></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.</span></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: </span><a style="color: #000000;" href="mailto:reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com"><span style="font-weight: 400;">reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.&nbsp;</span></span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: #000000;">We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.</span></p><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p><span style="font-size: 16px;"><strong><span style="font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">How We'll Take Care of You:</span></strong></span></p> <p class="p1"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits. &nbsp;</span></p></div><div class="title">Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$210,000</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$220,000 USD</span></div></div></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong full-stack technical breadth and solid academic credentials, with relevant experience in React, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker, and REST APIs that align with Airbnb's frontend and backend requirements. However, the most critical gap is experience level: Airbnb requires 7+ years of engineering experience for a Senior role, while Ruiqi is a current Master's student with only ~4 months of internship experience, making this a significant mismatch. Additionally, the role emphasizes JVM-based languages (Java/Kotlin/Scala) and high-scale SOA/microservices architecture — areas where the candidate's resume shows limited depth.
strengths: Full-stack development capability with React/TypeScript on the frontend and FastAPI/Node.js on the backend
Hands-on experience with Docker, PostgreSQL, Redis, and WebSocket — all relevant to Airbnb's infrastructure
Strong academic pedigree: MEng at University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) and BASc at UBC (GPA 3.7) with Dean's Honor List recognition
Demonstrated ability to architect end-to-end systems (RAG pipeline, AI agent pipeline) with production-grade tooling
Experience with REST APIs and service communication patterns
Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and React aligns with the frontend web technologies listed in the job posting
Java listed as a known language, partially satisfying the JVM language preference
Remote work preference aligns with the job's US-Remote Eligible designation
missing_skills: 7+ years of professional engineering experience (candidate has ~4 months of internship experience)
Deep proficiency in JVM-based languages such as Kotlin or Scala (Java is listed but not demonstrated in projects)
Experience architecting and maintaining high-scale, highly available services in a Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA)
GraphQL experience (listed as a preferred frontend technology)
Experience with large-scale distributed systems and 24x7 engineering operations
Cross-functional stakeholder management with Operations, Policy, and Legal teams
Enterprise-level project ownership and end-to-end initiative leadership
Experience with regulatory or compliance-driven software systems
interview_talking_points: Highlight the end-to-end system design of the RAG pipeline project — emphasize architectural decision-making, hybrid retrieval strategy, and production deployment via Docker Compose, which mirrors the high-reliability service design Airbnb values

Emphasize the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a full-stack showcase: FastAPI backend, React/TypeScript frontend, WebSocket, PostgreSQL, Docker, and 80%+ test coverage — demonstrating engineering craftsmanship and quality culture
Discuss the RAGAS evaluation pipeline and quantitative results (35% retrieval precision improvement, 0.84 context recall) to demonstrate data-driven problem solving and analytical rigor
Frame the ACM MM '23 publication as evidence of collaborative, cross-functional work and ability to contribute to complex, ambiguous research problems — analogous to Airbnb's regulatory complexity

Acknowledge the seniority gap proactively and position yourself as a high-trajectory mid-level engineer targeting growth into a senior role, with strong academic foundations and rapid project delivery
If applying, consider targeting mid-level or L4/L5 Software Engineer roles at Airbnb instead, where your skills and experience level are a much stronger match

matches.title: Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack)
matches.description:
Title: Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack)
Company: Cloudflare
Location: In-Office
Description: <div class="content-intro"><div><strong>About Us</strong></div> <div> <p>At Cloudflare, we are on a mission to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world’s largest networks that powers millions of websites and other Internet properties for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine’s Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World’s Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.&nbsp;</p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!&nbsp;</span></p> </div></div><p><strong><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="0">About the team</span></strong></p> <p><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="1">The Data Intelligence &amp; Analytics organization builds the core data platform and internal products that power decision-making across the company. We design and operate large-scale data systems, own the company’s data lake, ingestion infrastructure, and platform tooling, and develop end-to-end applications that transform complex datasets into fast, reliable, business-critical products used daily by go-to-market, product, and engineering teams. Our work sits at the intersection of data platforms, distributed systems, and product development, giving engineers the opportunity to own meaningful problems across the stack and build systems that truly run the business.</span></p> <p><strong><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="2">About the role</span></strong></p> <p><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="3">We are looking for an experienced </span><strong><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="4">Full Stack Software Engineer</span></strong><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="5"> to join our Bengaluru team and help scale the next generation of our internal data products. In this role, you will build and operate the systems behind data-driven applications that power teams across the company, including go-to-market, engineering, and product. Because the products we build are initiated and owned by the team, you will be involved end-to-end — from shaping requirements and designing systems to implementation, deployment, and long-term ownership. You will focus on building scalable, reliable services and application backends, partnering closely with data and full-stack engineers to deliver new features and operate the pipelines and platforms behind our products. Our stack spans multiple languages and technologies, including Go, Scala, and ClickHouse, and continues to evolve. Many of our applications also incorporate strong AI components, giving you opportunities to work with modern AI infrastructure and tools such as vector databases, MCP-based services, and Workers AI.</span></p> <p><strong><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="6">What you'll do</span></strong></p> <ul class="gdAMzb"> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="7">Design and implement core features across our internal data applications, spanning backend services, data integrations, and application systems.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="8">Partner closely with product, data, and engineering stakeholders to shape requirements and design solutions that solve real, high-impact business problems.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="9">Build and evolve scalable, reliable, and observable systems that power business-critical products used across the company.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="10">Contribute to the ongoing evolution of our data and application platform, improving architecture, performance, and developer experience.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="11">Develop and operate services and pipelines in a multi-language environment (including Go, Scala, and ClickHouse-backed systems).</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="12">Work on modern, AI-enabled components such as vector search, MCP-based services, and AI-powered application features.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="13">Participate in design reviews, knowledge sharing, and mentorship, helping raise the technical bar across the team.</span></li> </ul> <p><strong><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="14">Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience</span></strong></p> <ul class="gdAMzb"> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="15">B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="16">6+ years of professional experience building and operating production systems, ideally across backend, data, and application layers.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="17">Strong proficiency in one or more systems or backend languages such as Go, Java, or Python, with the ability to quickly learn and contribute across a multi-language stack.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="18">Experience designing and working with data-intensive systems, including strong SQL skills and hands-on experience with relational and/or analytical databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, ClickHouse).</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="19">Proven experience building modern web applications, including JavaScript/TypeScript and React, and collaborating effectively across frontend and backend boundaries.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="20">Demonstrated ability to design scalable, reliable, and observable systems, with experience influencing architecture and improving platform foundations.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="21">Strong problem-solving and communication skills, with a track record of working effectively with cross-functional partners and driving projects through ambiguous problem spaces.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="22">Experience mentoring engineers, leading by example in code and design, and contributing to a culture of technical excellence.</span></li> <li class="rnc2Gd"><strong><span class="rnc2Gd" data-ast-node-id="23">Full-stack development experience is a plus.</span></strong></li> </ul><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>What Makes Cloudflare Special?</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">We’re not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We’re a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.</span></p> <p><a href="https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/"><strong>Project Galileo</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: Since 2014, we've equipped more than 2,400 journalism and civil society organizations in 111 countries with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare’s enterprise customers--at no cost.</span></p> <p><strong><a href="https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/">Athenian Project</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">: In 2017, we created the Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration. Since the project, we've provided services to more than 425 local government election websites in 33 states.</span></p> <p><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"><strong>1.1.1.1</strong></a><span style="font-weight: 400;">: We released</span><a href="https://1.1.1.1/"> <span style="font-weight: 400;">1.1.1.1</span></a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here’s the deal - we don’t store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our</span><a href="https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/privacy/public-dns-resolver"> privacy commitment</a><span style="font-weight: 400;"> and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Sound like something you’d like to be a part of? We’d love to hear from you!</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. &nbsp;We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. &nbsp;All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual</span> <span style="font-weight: 400;">race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. &nbsp;Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. &nbsp;If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at </span><span style="font-weight: 400;">hr@cloudflare.com</span><span style="font-weight: 400;"> or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.</span></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates strong full-stack and AI/ML technical skills that partially align with Cloudflare's stack, particularly in React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, Docker, and vector databases — all relevant to the role. However, this is a Senior-level position requiring 6+ years of professional experience, and the candidate is a mid-level engineer still completing their Master's degree with only ~4 months of relevant internship experience, creating a significant seniority gap. Additionally, the role is strictly in-office in Bengaluru, India, which is incompatible with the candidate's preferred remote/hybrid work in the US or Canada.
strengths: Strong full-stack development skills with React/TypeScript, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, and Docker — directly matching the job's core tech requirements
Hands-on experience with vector databases (ChromaDB, Milvus) and AI/ML infrastructure (RAG, LangChain, LangGraph) aligns well with the role's AI-enabled components
Production-grade RAG system deployment at Disanji Technology demonstrates real-world backend and data pipeline experience
Excellent academic credentials: M.Eng from University of Waterloo (GPA 3.9) and B.A.Sc from UBC (GPA 3.7) with Dean's Honor List recognition
Experience with Redis caching, WebSocket, REST APIs, and Docker Compose shows solid backend systems knowledge

matches.title: Full Stack Engineer, Enterprise & Ecosystem
matches.description: <h2>Who we are</h2> <h3>About Stripe</h3> <p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.</span></p> <h3>About the team</h3> <p>Stripe's Enterprise and Ecosystem team is focused on enhancing migration, activation, and cross-product experiences for enterprises. This position is based in Toronto, Canada, and will be integral to a growing team, collaborating closely with product and customer-facing teams.</p> <p>Team Matching: exact team matching for one of the subteams will begin during final stages. Please note we may also consider you for different orgs based on your experience, location, etc. More information on our team matching process can be found <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zvJkO2c7GzukHG-_oqc5wbOLajpuh5FjbmZPcZPU1o0/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.ahb3b6nrktv1">here</a>.&nbsp;</p> <h2>What you’ll do</h2> <p>As a Full-Stack Engineer on the Enterprise and Ecosystem team, you will be a key contributor in building and scaling the next generation of Stripe's connectivity with global commerce systems. This role is crucial to building and managing integrations with leading Ecommerce, CRM, and ERP systems to help our users activate faster and realize greater value from Stripe. You will focus on developing the infrastructure that powers unified connectors for various partners, ensuring seamless and rapid integration of Stripe's products.</p> <h3>Responsibilities</h3> <ul> <li>Developing and maintaining a set of connectors and integrations for partners like Shopify, and Salesforce.</li> <li>Build out Stripe services and infrastructure to facilitate transactional flows and data migration.</li> <li>Launching specific, high-impact projects in the first six months, such as a new payments-agnostic billing connector.</li> <li>Acting as a self-starter and driving technical ownership for projects, given the nature of the role requires a highly self-sufficient contributor.</li> <li>Collaborating with other engineering teams, particularly those focused on underlying infrastructure, to ensure cohesion and scale.</li> </ul> <h2><strong>Who you are</strong></h2> <p>We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.</p> <h3>Minimum requirements</h3> <ul> <li>4-12+ years of industry software engineering experience (does not include internships nor includes co-ops)</li> <li>Strong full-stack capabilities; comfortable writing code on core Stripe systems while also understanding external partner systems.</li> <li>Proficient in a modern web stack and have shipped production level code.</li> <li>Foundational understanding and ability to read the code/interfaces of partner systems (e.g., Salesforce, Oracle, Netsuite) to facilitate complex integrations.</li> <li>Adaptable, intuitive, and capable of quickly solving complex, multi-system problems.</li> <li>Self-motivating and thrive in an environment where you are expected to take full ownership of your projects and deliverables.</li> </ul> <h3><strong>Preferred qualifications</strong></h3> <ul> <li>Prior experience building connectors, or deep integrations with major Ecommerce, CRM, or ERP platforms.</li> <li>Experience with payments or subscriptions systems.</li> <li>A background that demonstrates an ability to rapidly learn new systems and navigate unfamiliar technical domains effectively.</li> </ul> <p>If you are passionate about building cutting-edge solutions that empower businesses worldwide, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your application detailing your experience and why you believe you would be a great fit for the team.</p>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian demonstrates solid full-stack technical capabilities (FastAPI, React/TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Docker, WebSocket) and strong academic credentials, which align well with Stripe's modern web stack requirements. However, the most critical gap is the experience requirement: Stripe mandates 4–12+ years of industry software engineering experience (excluding internships and co-ops), while Ruiqi has only ~4 months of internship experience and is still completing their Master's degree — effectively 0 qualifying years by Stripe's definition. Additionally, the candidate has no demonstrated experience with enterprise integration platforms (Salesforce, Shopify, Oracle, NetSuite, ERP/CRM connectors) or payments/subscriptions systems, which are central to this specific role.
strengths: Strong full-stack development skills: FastAPI (backend), React/TypeScript (frontend), PostgreSQL, Redis, Docker — all relevant to Stripe's modern web stack
Demonstrated ability to ship production-grade systems (RAG pipeline with FastAPI + SSE streaming, Redis caching, Docker Compose deployment)
High academic achievement: 3.9 GPA at University of Waterloo MEng + 3.7 GPA at UBC BASc with Dean's Honor List recognition
Experience with REST APIs and WebSocket communication, relevant to building connectors and integrations
Located in Canada (Waterloo/Vancouver), which aligns with the Toronto-based role and candidate's preference for Canada/remote work
AI/ML depth (LangChain, LangGraph, RAG, YOLO) shows ability to rapidly learn and apply complex technical domains
80%+ test coverage on personal projects demonstrates engineering discipline and quality mindset
Published research at ACM MM '23 demonstrates ability to tackle complex, novel technical problems
missing_skills: 4+ years of full-time industry software engineering experience (Stripe explicitly excludes internships/co-ops — candidate has ~0 qualifying years)
Experience building connectors or deep integrations with enterprise platforms (Salesforce, Shopify, Oracle, NetSuite, SAP, or similar ERP/CRM systems)
Payments or subscriptions systems experience (Stripe's core domain)
Familiarity with financial infrastructure, transactional data flows, or billing systems
Experience navigating and reading large-scale partner system APIs/interfaces (e.g., Salesforce APEX, Shopify APIs, Oracle APIs)
Enterprise-scale system design and cross-team infrastructure collaboration experience
Ruby (Stripe's primary backend language) — not listed in candidate's skill set
interview_talking_points: Emphasize the production-grade RAG system built at Disanji: highlight end-to-end ownership, architectural decisions (hybrid retrieval, reranking, streaming), and measurable outcomes (35% precision improvement, 0.84 context recall) to demonstrate self-starter ownership mentality

Highlight the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a full-stack showcase: 4-agent LangGraph pipeline, FastAPI + React/TypeScript + PostgreSQL + Docker + WebSocket, and 80%+ test coverage — this is the closest analog to building a multi-system integration pipeline

Address the experience gap proactively: frame the combination of MEng specialization in full-stack/DevOps, two internships, and multiple end-to-end projects as equivalent practical depth, and express eagerness to grow into the enterprise integration domain

Connect rapid learning ability to Stripe's preferred qualifications: the ACM MM '23 publication, pivot from CV/ML to full-stack, and self-directed project work all demonstrate ability to quickly navigate unfamiliar technical domains

Research and mention Stripe's public APIs and connector ecosystem (e.g., Stripe's Shopify integration, Stripe Billing) to show genuine interest in the enterprise/ecosystem domain and bridge the payments knowledge gap

matches.title: Staff Software Engineer - Fullstack (NYC)
matches.description:
Title: Staff Software Engineer - Fullstack (NYC)
Company: Databricks
Location: New York City, New York
Description: <p>P-1980<br><br>At Databricks, we are passionate about enabling data teams to solve the world's toughest problems — from making the next mode of transportation a reality to accelerating the development of medical breakthroughs. We do this by building and running the world's best Data Intelligence Platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business. Founded by engineers — and customer obsessed — we leap at every opportunity to tackle technical challenges, from designing next-gen UI/UX for interfacing with data to scaling our services and infrastructure across millions of virtual machines. And we're only getting started.</p> <p>As a founding engineer in the NYC Engineering office, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a small, nimble team that’s innovating to build new products from the ground up. Our goal is to leverage the power of Databricks in data &amp; AI to deliver vertical AI applications for both technical and business users. This will be a true 0-to-1 environment, combining the excitement of a startup with the resources of a tech leader like Databricks.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> <p>The key challenge you’ll be dealing with is leveraging the latest UX/UI technologies to create simple but powerful interfaces of very complex data and workflows. Your team is taking a UI-first and GenAI-first approach to building products. For example, you may be working in challenges such as:</p> <ul> <li>Create interfaces for GenAI agents that generate complex workflows while keeping the human in the loop through inspectability and transparency</li> <li>Create complex visualizations such as data pipelines, data mappings, customer journey flows, identity graphs, etc</li> <li>Enable mechanisms that can drive product-led growth, through seamless onboarding and sharing capabilities</li> <li>An interactive environment for<strong>&nbsp;</strong>collaborative data projects at massive scale with an easy path to production</li> </ul> <p><strong>What we look for:</strong></p> <ul> <li>10+ years of experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li> <li>Passion for user experience and design and a deep understanding of front-end architecture</li> <li>High velocity focus, able to ship high quality code frequently and with speed&nbsp;</li> <li>Experience building complex workflows and complex analytics visualizations</li> <li>Motivated by delivering customer value</li> <li>Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, or VueJs/Ember)</li> <li>10+ years of experience with server-side web technologies (eg: Node.js, Java, Python, Scala, C#, C++,Go)</li> <li>Good knowledge of SQL</li> </ul> <div class="content-pay-transparency">&nbsp;</div><div class="content-pay-transparency"><div class="pay-input"><div class="description"><p>&nbsp;</p> <p><strong>Pay Range Transparency</strong></p> <p><span style="font-weight: 400; font-size: 14px;">Databricks is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The pay range(s) for this role is listed below and represents the expected salary range for non-commissionable roles or on-target earnings for commissionable roles.&nbsp; Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to job-related skills, depth of experience, relevant certifications and training, and specific work location. Based on the factors above, Databricks anticipates utilizing the full width of the range. The total compensation package for this position may also include eligibility for annual performance bonus, equity, and the benefits listed above. For more information regarding which range your location is in visit our page <a href="https://www.databricks.com/sites/default/files/2024-08/us-pay-zone-mapping.pdf">here</a>.<br></span></p> <p>&nbsp;</p></div><div class="title">Local Pay Range</div><div class="pay-range"><span>$190,900</span><span class="divider">&mdash;</span><span>$253,750 USD</span></div></div></div><div class="content-conclusion"><p><strong>About Databricks</strong></p> <p><span style="font-family: arial, sans-serif;">Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);"><a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://twitter.com/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://twitter.com/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw03FL8fJvOD97ytN02f5G2C">Twitter</a>,&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.linkedin.com/company/databricks&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw15dLk3q8VxTfHEgCUg7NSt">LinkedIn</a>&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">and</span>&nbsp;<a style="color: rgb(255, 54, 33);" href="https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc" target="_blank" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.facebook.com/databricksinc&amp;source=gmail&amp;ust=1700237575733000&amp;usg=AOvVaw39EcncitnlqV72EG2-RqXJ">Facebook</a></span>.<br><br><strong>Benefits<br><br></strong></span>At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit&nbsp;<a href="https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks">https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks</a>.&nbsp;<br><br></p> <p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion</strong></p> <p>At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.</p> <p><strong>Compliance</strong></p> <p><strong><span style="font-weight: 400;">If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.</span></strong></p></div>
matches.reasoning: Ruiqi Tian has a solid technical foundation in full-stack development with relevant skills in React, Node.js, Python, FastAPI, PostgreSQL, and modern AI/ML tooling that partially aligns with Databricks' requirements. However, the role is a Staff-level position demanding 10+ years of experience in both frontend and backend technologies, whereas the candidate is a mid-level engineer still completing their Master's degree with roughly 1–2 years of hands-on professional experience. The job is also NYC on-site/hybrid, while the candidate prefers remote or Canadian locations, creating a significant location mismatch.
strengths: Proficient in React and modern JavaScript frameworks (React, Vue) directly matching the job's frontend requirements
Strong full-stack project experience with FastAPI, Node.js, PostgreSQL, Docker, and WebSocket
Demonstrated AI/GenAI expertise (LangChain, LangGraph, RAG pipelines, LLM agents) aligning with Databricks' GenAI-first product vision
Experience building agent-powered interfaces with quality-gated routing, relevant to the GenAI agent UI challenge
High academic pedigree — University of Waterloo MEng (GPA 3.9) and UBC BASc (GPA 3.7) with Dean's Honor List
Proficiency in SQL, Python, JavaScript, C++, and Java covering multiple server-side languages listed in requirements
Published research (ACM MM '23) demonstrating depth in AI/ML and data understanding
Experience with complex data pipelines and visualization-adjacent work (drone footage detection, RAG pipelines)
missing_skills: 10+ years of professional experience in HTML/CSS/JavaScript (candidate has ~1-2 years)
10+ years of server-side web development experience (far below Staff-level bar)
Deep front-end architecture expertise and UI/UX design sensibility at scale
Experience building complex analytics visualizations (data pipelines, identity graphs, customer journey flows)
Experience with large-scale distributed systems or millions of virtual machines
Familiarity with Scala, Go, Angular, or Ember (mentioned in JD as examples)
Product-led growth (PLG) mechanisms — onboarding flows, sharing capabilities
Enterprise-scale collaborative data platform experience
interview_talking_points: Highlight the AI Agent Resume Generator project as a direct parallel to Databricks' GenAI agent UI challenge — emphasize the 4-agent LangGraph pipeline with human-in-the-loop quality gating and the full-stack React/FastAPI/WebSocket implementation
Emphasize RAG pipeline expertise (ChromaDB, BGE-M3, Milvus, LangChain LCEL, hybrid retrieval) to demonstrate alignment with Databricks' Data Intelligence Platform and GenAI-first approach
Discuss the ACM MM '23 publication on multimodal video understanding to showcase research depth and ability to work on cutting-edge AI problems relevant to Databricks' mission
Frame the 0-to-1 startup-like environment at Databricks against your experience building production systems from scratch (RAG system at Disanji, full-stack agent pipeline project)
Address the experience gap proactively by emphasizing rapid skill acquisition, high GPA, and the breadth of technologies mastered across both degrees and internships
Mention willingness to relocate to NYC or work hybrid if the role requires it, to mitigate the location concern
